— I —	 90.43075128797952
[ 1 ]	 463.94842625767166
Stately, plump Buck Mulligan came from the stairhead, bearing a bowl of	 33.72476058004817
lather on which a mirror and a razor lay crossed. A yellow	 135.2444493817363
dressinggown, ungirdled, was sustained gently behind him on the mild	 63.98702140173414
morning air. He held the bowl aloft and intoned:	 65.21836523269472
—_Introibo ad altare Dei_.	 19.152685023280444
Halted, he peered down the dark winding stairs and called out coarsely:	 106.35114527985742
—Come up, Kinch! Come up, you fearful jesuit!	 106.78098881882323
Solemnly he came forward and mounted the round gunrest. He faced about	 53.36086510931316
and blessed gravely thrice the tower, the surrounding land and the	 61.77027904940795
awaking mountains. Then, catching sight of Stephen Dedalus, he bent	 158.06012337077334
towards him and made rapid crosses in the air, gurgling in his throat	 35.081356677700846
and shaking his head. Stephen Dedalus, displeased and sleepy, leaned	 142.7277919612907
his arms on the top of the staircase and looked coldly at the shaking	 50.929810424185824
gurgling face that blessed him, equine in its length, and at the light	 57.165855440735
untonsured hair, grained and hued like pale oak.	 34.051731322642404
Buck Mulligan peeped an instant under the mirror and then covered the	 34.61805136343272
bowl smartly.	 219.71847567252402
—Back to barracks! he said sternly.	 70.8141443795022
He added in a preacher’s tone:	 43.198782589978165
—For this, O dearly beloved, is the genuine Christine: body and soul	 67.72899236164861
and blood and ouns. Slow music, please. Shut your eyes, gents. One	 138.6130081192449
moment. A little trouble about those white corpuscles. Silence, all.	 209.80212974958025
He peered sideways up and gave a long slow whistle of call, then paused	 78.12942122290474
awhile in rapt attention, his even white teeth glistening here and	 183.494004504424
there with gold points. Chrysostomos. Two strong shrill whistles	 84.12626618174468
answered through the calm.	 405.6995565905686
—Thanks, old chap, he cried briskly. That will do nicely. Switch off	 39.68710631788616
the current, will you?	 27.026910603444037
He skipped off the gunrest and looked gravely at his watcher, gathering	 37.38150415904931
about his legs the loose folds of his gown. The plump shadowed face and	 67.45092342104901
sullen oval jowl recalled a prelate, patron of arts in the middle ages.	 26.833457904376942
A pleasant smile broke quietly over his lips.	 72.41301637202909
—The mockery of it! he said gaily. Your absurd name, an ancient Greek!	 67.6046432440981
He pointed his finger in friendly jest and went over to the parapet,	 45.77849878777121
laughing to himself. Stephen Dedalus stepped up, followed him wearily	 94.69628836406137
halfway and sat down on the edge of the gunrest, watching him still as	 26.964022404666192
he propped his mirror on the parapet, dipped the brush in the bowl and	 55.475404746035665
lathered cheeks and neck.	 134.75403669966155
Buck Mulligan’s gay voice went on.	 38.72799419849144
—My name is absurd too: Malachi Mulligan, two dactyls. But it has a	 49.89693535886565
Hellenic ring, hasn’t it? Tripping and sunny like the buck himself. We	 125.94986637010128
must go to Athens. Will you come if I can get the aunt to fork out	 64.77925972189405
twenty quid?	 275.9865207680744
He laid the brush aside and, laughing with delight, cried:	 78.90870773125792
—Will he come? The jejune jesuit!	 133.9247811071541
Ceasing, he began to shave with care.	 21.22125245240435
—Tell me, Mulligan, Stephen said quietly.	 73.48217933977843
—Yes, my love?	 160.30009823849238
—How long is Haines going to stay in this tower?	 163.2047120345713
Buck Mulligan showed a shaven cheek over his right shoulder.	 51.477794338639384
—God, isn’t he dreadful? he said frankly. A ponderous Saxon. He thinks	 81.62422657929217
you’re not a gentleman. God, these bloody English! Bursting with money	 96.04784740523966
and indigestion. Because he comes from Oxford. You know, Dedalus, you	 150.78580325099037
have the real Oxford manner. He can’t make you out. O, my name for you	 84.9411974790191
is the best: Kinch, the knife-blade.	 32.79635631257703
He shaved warily over his chin.	 46.992042019295724
—He was raving all night about a black panther, Stephen said. Where is	 37.113069007493166
his guncase?	 21.605641423575047
—A woful lunatic! Mulligan said. Were you in a funk?	 42.40902951692929
—I was, Stephen said with energy and growing fear. Out here in the dark	 55.30523674311501
with a man I don’t know raving and moaning to himself about shooting a	 39.02647054743095
black panther. You saved men from drowning. I’m not a hero, however. If	 100.91452533794796
he stays on here I am off.	 167.0059094484239
Buck Mulligan frowned at the lather on his razorblade. He hopped down	 16.715220830897383
from his perch and began to search his trouser pockets hastily.	 28.14410583521098
—Scutter! he cried thickly.	 25.847607130079137
He came over to the gunrest and, thrusting a hand into Stephen’s upper	 25.450347410557317
pocket, said:	 2505.957090619599
—Lend us a loan of your noserag to wipe my razor.	 32.66291734250577
Stephen suffered him to pull out and hold up on show by its corner a	 76.92553751903554
dirty crumpled handkerchief. Buck Mulligan wiped the razorblade neatly.	 60.42886333668008
Then, gazing over the handkerchief, he said:	 60.67742279139995
—The bard’s noserag! A new art colour for our Irish poets: snotgreen.	 50.00690933560197
You can almost taste it, can’t you?	 22.110420190970412
He mounted to the parapet again and gazed out over Dublin bay, his fair	 62.12513962470387
oakpale hair stirring slightly.	 139.49093230112115
—God! he said quietly. Isn’t the sea what Algy calls it: a great sweet	 82.17104651275524
mother? The snotgreen sea. The scrotumtightening sea. _Epi oinopa	 48.89219441672124
ponton_. Ah, Dedalus, the Greeks! I must teach you. You must read them	 87.71164902351184
in the original. _Thalatta! Thalatta!_ She is our great sweet mother.	 45.36978347200577
Come and look.	 279.33250665384935
Stephen stood up and went over to the parapet. Leaning on it he looked	 34.34565832161755
down on the water and on the mailboat clearing the harbourmouth of	 18.283340978750015
Kingstown.	 7921.454895547122
—Our mighty mother! Buck Mulligan said.	 26.805847144731793
He turned abruptly his grey searching eyes from the sea to Stephen’s	 51.87680065723041
face.	 2013.3117700297628
—The aunt thinks you killed your mother, he said. That’s why she won’t	 26.033321609565117
let me have anything to do with you.	 49.6308605868147
—Someone killed her, Stephen said gloomily.	 69.40113528723951
—You could have knelt down, damn it, Kinch, when your dying mother	 101.4947670736244
asked you, Buck Mulligan said. I’m hyperborean as much as you. But to	 50.49209846846858
think of your mother begging you with her last breath to kneel down and	 75.86481145370595
pray for her. And you refused. There is something sinister in you....	 73.91844855685552
He broke off and lathered again lightly his farther cheek. A tolerant	 44.693695661941206
smile curled his lips.	 130.6104620076929
—But a lovely mummer! he murmured to himself. Kinch, the loveliest	 69.6408250545487
mummer of them all!	 21.63706280776068
He shaved evenly and with care, in silence, seriously.	 67.55396434823889
Stephen, an elbow rested on the jagged granite, leaned his palm against	 42.679033612522424
his brow and gazed at the fraying edge of his shiny black coat-sleeve.	 33.951599216446155
Pain, that was not yet the pain of love, fretted his heart. Silently,	 91.65686906048272
in a dream she had come to him after her death, her wasted body within	 56.066125950793435
its loose brown graveclothes giving off an odour of wax and rosewood,	 63.04030851519602
her breath, that had bent upon him, mute, reproachful, a faint odour of	 35.09357445075821
wetted ashes. Across the threadbare cuffedge he saw the sea hailed as a	 28.83672652219148
great sweet mother by the wellfed voice beside him. The ring of bay and	 75.5265517074923
skyline held a dull green mass of liquid. A bowl of white china had	 76.45433396751598
stood beside her deathbed holding the green sluggish bile which she had	 37.09013456191491
torn up from her rotting liver by fits of loud groaning vomiting.	 48.61346294510017
Buck Mulligan wiped again his razorblade.	 25.752393429406254
—Ah, poor dogsbody! he said in a kind voice. I must give you a shirt	 68.33093251665834
and a few noserags. How are the secondhand breeks?	 33.774277093982185
—They fit well enough, Stephen answered.	 88.37600409328091
Buck Mulligan attacked the hollow beneath his underlip.	 25.345640778731713
—The mockery of it, he said contentedly. Secondleg they should be. God	 39.70484236717816
knows what poxy bowsy left them off. I have a lovely pair with a hair	 89.18272937654535
stripe, grey. You’ll look spiffing in them. I’m not joking, Kinch. You	 122.37910935639667
look damn well when you’re dressed.	 153.36048185053235
—Thanks, Stephen said. I can’t wear them if they are grey.	 51.104362874749796
—He can’t wear them, Buck Mulligan told his face in the mirror.	 33.28875666749331
Etiquette is etiquette. He kills his mother but he can’t wear grey	 65.70783200523535
trousers.	 4091.603844469761
He folded his razor neatly and with stroking palps of fingers felt the	 73.48710746194745
smooth skin.	 1441.0929666770787
Stephen turned his gaze from the sea and to the plump face with its	 58.32641027863868
smokeblue mobile eyes.	 24.88703675184071
—That fellow I was with in the Ship last night, said Buck Mulligan,	 72.04345826062156
says you have g. p. i. He’s up in Dottyville with Connolly Norman.	 135.54227582814826
General paralysis of the insane!	 19.854379492240483
He swept the mirror a half circle in the air to flash the tidings	 54.33781189555966
abroad in sunlight now radiant on the sea. His curling shaven lips	 73.44020970412548
laughed and the edges of his white glittering teeth. Laughter seized	 42.271707257229814
all his strong wellknit trunk.	 184.79168577596903
—Look at yourself, he said, you dreadful bard!	 93.23704037180603
Stephen bent forward and peered at the mirror held out to him, cleft by	 41.833548227464334
a crooked crack. Hair on end. As he and others see me. Who chose this	 126.24721376717122
face for me? This dogsbody to rid of vermin. It asks me too.	 58.15776912976522
—I pinched it out of the skivvy’s room, Buck Mulligan said. It does her	 30.34894353277096
all right. The aunt always keeps plainlooking servants for Malachi.	 177.4447978198119
Lead him not into temptation. And her name is Ursula.	 87.51563743166697
Laughing again, he brought the mirror away from Stephen’s peering eyes.	 167.9756451480369
—The rage of Caliban at not seeing his face in a mirror, he said. If	 43.48721038867027
Wilde were only alive to see you!	 126.38174608603629
Drawing back and pointing, Stephen said with bitterness:	 83.0679861179171
—It is a symbol of Irish art. The cracked lookingglass of a servant.	 29.089566275661785
Buck Mulligan suddenly linked his arm in Stephen’s and walked with him	 64.81357439852341
round the tower, his razor and mirror clacking in the pocket where he	 57.92923559959445
had thrust them.	 125.67367493428893
—It’s not fair to tease you like that, Kinch, is it? he said kindly.	 60.92811214270025
God knows you have more spirit than any of them.	 146.39656323451354
Parried again. He fears the lancet of my art as I fear that of his. The	 42.49212395782795
cold steel pen.	 193.29750847367274
—Cracked lookingglass of a servant! Tell that to the oxy chap	 92.41989962909884
downstairs and touch him for a guinea. He’s stinking with money and	 85.25298796285234
thinks you’re not a gentleman. His old fellow made his tin by selling	 155.14855559871404
jalap to Zulus or some bloody swindle or other. God, Kinch, if you and	 47.25457790032491
I could only work together we might do something for the island.	 73.5936147949281
Hellenise it.	 31.839927380285154
Cranly’s arm. His arm.	 166.29817831368808
—And to think of your having to beg from these swine. I’m the only one	 103.09651420012487
that knows what you are. Why don’t you trust me more? What have you up	 51.537469918654025
your nose against me? Is it Haines? If he makes any noise here I’ll	 133.16085589054816
bring down Seymour and we’ll give him a ragging worse than they gave	 87.51987348031491
Clive Kempthorpe.	 4.411654744205047
Young shouts of moneyed voices in Clive Kempthorpe’s rooms. Palefaces:	 64.02850697777961
they hold their ribs with laughter, one clasping another. O, I shall	 186.0469583294512
expire! Break the news to her gently, Aubrey! I shall die! With slit	 67.27749243332092
ribbons of his shirt whipping the air he hops and hobbles round the	 22.849057785003343
table, with trousers down at heels, chased by Ades of Magdalen with the	 60.352202914306396
tailor’s shears. A scared calf’s face gilded with marmalade. I don’t	 71.45723804848537
want to be debagged! Don’t you play the giddy ox with me!	 40.03869094516534
Shouts from the open window startling evening in the quadrangle. A deaf	 96.73335473365395
gardener, aproned, masked with Matthew Arnold’s face, pushes his mower	 10.703391181489366
on the sombre lawn watching narrowly the dancing motes of grasshalms.	 39.34268871420338
To ourselves... new paganism... omphalos.	 91.14589345489976
—Let him stay, Stephen said. There’s nothing wrong with him except at	 40.911456692142195
night.	 1392.3265998404243
—Then what is it? Buck Mulligan asked impatiently. Cough it up. I’m	 51.842538242295014
quite frank with you. What have you against me now?	 123.19869176240977
They halted, looking towards the blunt cape of Bray Head that lay on	 39.23692750305285
the water like the snout of a sleeping whale. Stephen freed his arm	 74.37991765478539
quietly.	 7850.71517635226
—Do you wish me to tell you? he asked.	 34.35580474081385
—Yes, what is it? Buck Mulligan answered. I don’t remember anything.	 22.137300813701593
He looked in Stephen’s face as he spoke. A light wind passed his brow,	 94.6492744480578
fanning softly his fair uncombed hair and stirring silver points of	 112.91987830721075
anxiety in his eyes.	 16.142058525495454
Stephen, depressed by his own voice, said:	 44.1436928159223
—Do you remember the first day I went to your house after my mother’s	 54.45206953350046
death?	 2559.1007722123036
Buck Mulligan frowned quickly and said:	 31.309253011426897
—What? Where? I can’t remember anything. I remember only ideas and	 55.66219297368607
sensations. Why? What happened in the name of God?	 36.86732046496072
—You were making tea, Stephen said, and went across the landing to get	 66.40137196203344
more hot water. Your mother and some visitor came out of the	 54.3157324764747
drawingroom. She asked you who was in your room.	 57.14298043217148
—Yes? Buck Mulligan said. What did I say? I forget.	 37.14309113439052
—You said, Stephen answered, _O, it’s only Dedalus whose mother is	 157.31794931416775
beastly dead._	 1864.5785629016668
A flush which made him seem younger and more engaging rose to Buck	 121.5058393472739
Mulligan’s cheek.	 1598.017722727577
—Did I say that? he asked. Well? What harm is that?	 44.61252793148717
He shook his constraint from him nervously.	 44.128218281641026
—And what is death, he asked, your mother’s or yours or my own? You saw	 106.4451074749297
only your mother die. I see them pop off every day in the Mater and	 91.34055052514712
Richmond and cut up into tripes in the dissectingroom. It’s a beastly	 75.58570726199282
thing and nothing else. It simply doesn’t matter. You wouldn’t kneel	 96.6502963633759
down to pray for your mother on her deathbed when she asked you. Why?	 57.50118221463131
Because you have the cursed jesuit strain in you, only it’s injected	 112.30687614533805
the wrong way. To me it’s all a mockery and beastly. Her cerebral lobes	 77.26639213817063
are not functioning. She calls the doctor sir Peter Teazle and picks	 56.84953764285223
buttercups off the quilt. Humour her till it’s over. You crossed her	 133.15157498881777
last wish in death and yet you sulk with me because I don’t whinge like	 95.6022952280198
some hired mute from Lalouette’s. Absurd! I suppose I did say it. I	 111.96249783159236
didn’t mean to offend the memory of your mother.	 49.85296080258986
He had spoken himself into boldness. Stephen, shielding the gaping	 90.39143857636218
wounds which the words had left in his heart, said very coldly:	 83.84404157483388
—I am not thinking of the offence to my mother.	 47.66116507157137
—Of what then? Buck Mulligan asked.	 88.41123610373108
—Of the offence to me, Stephen answered.	 59.740584486758
Buck Mulligan swung round on his heel.	 60.50073162115621
—O, an impossible person! he exclaimed.	 118.55936267891761
He walked off quickly round the parapet. Stephen stood at his post,	 101.20624491155907
gazing over the calm sea towards the headland. Sea and headland now	 48.15120856120553
grew dim. Pulses were beating in his eyes, veiling their sight, and he	 74.2809887459965
felt the fever of his cheeks.	 204.619931224706
A voice within the tower called loudly:	 136.6565177130208
—Are you up there, Mulligan?	 193.26431888115323
—I’m coming, Buck Mulligan answered.	 49.426783536596865
He turned towards Stephen and said:	 77.76640552936794
—Look at the sea. What does it care about offences? Chuck Loyola,	 29.187713161273685
Kinch, and come on down. The Sassenach wants his morning rashers.	 120.73264626148543
His head halted again for a moment at the top of the staircase, level	 34.18568172974988
with the roof:	 14.636642629548161
—Don’t mope over it all day, he said. I’m inconsequent. Give up the	 87.17306960858255
moody brooding.	 4.411654744205047
His head vanished but the drone of his descending voice boomed out of	 24.780937896257175
the stairhead:	 7.77559996992721
And no more turn aside and brood	 16.053608400204098
Upon love’s bitter mystery	 41.12965362134884
For Fergus rules the brazen cars.	 24.66073298916119
Woodshadows floated silently by through the morning peace from the	 88.17639704526802
stairhead seaward where he gazed. Inshore and farther out the mirror of	 35.14690574064994
water whitened, spurned by lightshod hurrying feet. White breast of the	 95.95228474846863
dim sea. The twining stresses, two by two. A hand plucking the	 80.13405429387765
harpstrings, merging their twining chords. Wavewhite wedded words	 31.65707236839448
shimmering on the dim tide.	 48.800747092478126
A cloud began to cover the sun slowly, wholly, shadowing the bay in	 24.960859566514774
deeper green. It lay beneath him, a bowl of bitter waters. Fergus’	 49.22125431762588
song: I sang it alone in the house, holding down the long dark chords.	 70.52083210042015
Her door was open: she wanted to hear my music. Silent with awe and	 124.68405006491575
pity I went to her bedside. She was crying in her wretched bed. For	 48.41290464936738
those words, Stephen: love’s bitter mystery.	 70.10047074427843
Where now?	 898.8980735779204
Her secrets: old featherfans, tasselled dancecards, powdered with musk,	 24.48285562849706
a gaud of amber beads in her locked drawer. A birdcage hung in the	 16.017026050619005
sunny window of her house when she was a girl. She heard old Royce sing	 90.93388583753801
in the pantomime of Turko the Terrible and laughed with others when he	 47.915988368963774
sang:	 15318.024569656527
I am the boy	 50.2385609395833
That can enjoy	 204.7007360283341
Invisibility.	 4.608171674364364
Phantasmal mirth, folded away: muskperfumed.	 35.779441219914915
And no more turn aside and brood.	 16.053608400204098
Folded away in the memory of nature with her toys. Memories beset his	 35.69658383861426
brooding brain. Her glass of water from the kitchen tap when she had	 92.19922612130395
approached the sacrament. A cored apple, filled with brown sugar,	 218.92127668467026
roasting for her at the hob on a dark autumn evening. Her shapely	 52.88090676298146
fingernails reddened by the blood of squashed lice from the children’s	 11.235295905336482
shirts.	 5939.610053333298
In a dream, silently, she had come to him, her wasted body within its	 47.14688560437477
loose graveclothes giving off an odour of wax and rosewood, her breath,	 63.64476185167361
bent over him with mute secret words, a faint odour of wetted ashes.	 75.2620824875226
Her glazing eyes, staring out of death, to shake and bend my soul. On	 66.6655234480607
me alone. The ghostcandle to light her agony. Ghostly light on the	 75.02094270817261
tortured face. Her hoarse loud breath rattling in horror, while all	 191.12241722070706
prayed on their knees. Her eyes on me to strike me down. _Liliata	 79.32973906392303
rutilantium te confessorum turma circumdet: iubilantium te virginum	 12.746066717511425
chorus excipiat._	 4.411654744205047
Ghoul! Chewer of corpses!	 6.098250790305123
No, mother! Let me be and let me live.	 95.9344922375769
—Kinch ahoy!	 129.86935985977308
Buck Mulligan’s voice sang from within the tower. It came nearer up the	 53.61115731615866
staircase, calling again. Stephen, still trembling at his soul’s cry,	 291.7162107272387
heard warm running sunlight and in the air behind him friendly words.	 151.65230319167097
—Dedalus, come down, like a good mosey. Breakfast is ready. Haines is	 133.05480121706148
apologising for waking us last night. It’s all right.	 50.3628635446641
—I’m coming, Stephen said, turning.	 55.380179509148846
—Do, for Jesus’ sake, Buck Mulligan said. For my sake and for all our	 54.83587552175172
sakes.	 4.608171674364364
His head disappeared and reappeared.	 17.322049804942218
—I told him your symbol of Irish art. He says it’s very clever. Touch	 67.4783634643512
him for a quid, will you? A guinea, I mean.	 75.54869937994386
—I get paid this morning, Stephen said.	 59.391396526951745
—The school kip? Buck Mulligan said. How much? Four quid? Lend us one.	 39.65726849229174
—If you want it, Stephen said.	 26.525453694018125
—Four shining sovereigns, Buck Mulligan cried with delight. We’ll have	 59.53993691203779
a glorious drunk to astonish the druidy druids. Four omnipotent	 45.58136286098849
sovereigns.	 15248.021145030376
He flung up his hands and tramped down the stone stairs, singing out of	 28.43520382388261
tune with a Cockney accent:	 54.677766845601816
O, won’t we have a merry time,	 55.44558382735622
Drinking whisky, beer and wine!	 349.01538607726405
On coronation,	 59.73674875755915
Coronation day!	 74.9216955639911
O, won’t we have a merry time	 55.44558382735622
On coronation day!	 141.7429953989341
Warm sunshine merrying over the sea. The nickel shavingbowl shone,	 48.646219850590185
forgotten, on the parapet. Why should I bring it down? Or leave it	 89.9590370983832
there all day, forgotten friendship?	 92.68346534851118
He went over to it, held it in his hands awhile, feeling its coolness,	 38.875663639191934
smelling the clammy slaver of the lather in which the brush was stuck.	 36.71087683535386
So I carried the boat of incense then at Clongowes. I am another now	 115.84056783042601
and yet the same. A servant too. A server of a servant.	 79.99187143122754
In the gloomy domed livingroom of the tower Buck Mulligan’s gowned form	 36.67900432607732
moved briskly to and fro about the hearth, hiding and revealing its	 53.183954803979134
yellow glow. Two shafts of soft daylight fell across the flagged floor	 83.1826559312869
from the high barbacans: and at the meeting of their rays a cloud of	 69.53611407099551
coalsmoke and fumes of fried grease floated, turning.	 69.40549568321212
—We’ll be choked, Buck Mulligan said. Haines, open that door, will you?	 88.86265112867142
Stephen laid the shavingbowl on the locker. A tall figure rose from the	 38.77315828505902
hammock where it had been sitting, went to the doorway and pulled open	 72.26599311866487
the inner doors.	 33.73024896110326
—Have you the key? a voice asked.	 76.00376100430402
—Dedalus has it, Buck Mulligan said. Janey Mack, I’m choked!	 82.7984935535172
He howled, without looking up from the fire:	 30.49185613943419
—Kinch!	 3952.7300467290793
—It’s in the lock, Stephen said, coming forward.	 81.8298478305108
The key scraped round harshly twice and, when the heavy door had been	 76.11972063921499
set ajar, welcome light and bright air entered. Haines stood at the	 113.05862744151922
doorway, looking out. Stephen haled his upended valise to the table and	 64.95622191381813
sat down to wait. Buck Mulligan tossed the fry on to the dish beside	 51.27978856260439
him. Then he carried the dish and a large teapot over to the table, set	 62.50056206260146
them down heavily and sighed with relief.	 122.2298037713679
—I’m melting, he said, as the candle remarked when... But, hush! Not a	 92.67286907577306
word more on that subject! Kinch, wake up! Bread, butter, honey.	 422.9277572819908
Haines, come in. The grub is ready. Bless us, O Lord, and these thy	 111.56266147691485
gifts. Where’s the sugar? O, jay, there’s no milk.	 151.3419045518393
Stephen fetched the loaf and the pot of honey and the buttercooler from	 39.23552941516347
the locker. Buck Mulligan sat down in a sudden pet.	 36.59345708252338
—What sort of a kip is this? he said. I told her to come after eight.	 44.75074834577619
—We can drink it black, Stephen said thirstily. There’s a lemon in the	 44.11847980603584
locker.	 17235.812321843623
—O, damn you and your Paris fads! Buck Mulligan said. I want Sandycove	 63.14847433147549
milk.	 3359.969314915033
Haines came in from the doorway and said quietly:	 75.84613963177485
—That woman is coming up with the milk.	 71.54522652596405
—The blessings of God on you! Buck Mulligan cried, jumping up from his	 23.746464266825846
chair. Sit down. Pour out the tea there. The sugar is in the bag. Here,	 145.1653596438209
I can’t go fumbling at the damned eggs.	 125.45819924629528
He hacked through the fry on the dish and slapped it out on three	 28.89685191203472
plates, saying:	 1605.5222629246432
—_In nomine Patris et Filii et Spiritus Sancti._	 14.02951076558796
Haines sat down to pour out the tea.	 45.18015436165939
—I’m giving you two lumps each, he said. But, I say, Mulligan, you do	 78.13687243674728
make strong tea, don’t you?	 213.8701258252564
Buck Mulligan, hewing thick slices from the loaf, said in an old	 51.953765868751574
woman’s wheedling voice:	 385.49126489069323
—When I makes tea I makes tea, as old mother Grogan said. And when I	 45.37656129331388
makes water I makes water.	 98.89046101056755
—By Jove, it is tea, Haines said.	 55.803021442587415
Buck Mulligan went on hewing and wheedling:	 20.246413916245096
—_So I do, Mrs Cahill,_ says she. _Begob, ma’am,_ says Mrs Cahill, _God	 93.27170778240765
send you don’t make them in the one pot._	 60.94247370853237
He lunged towards his messmates in turn a thick slice of bread, impaled	 33.64088101424271
on his knife.	 136.1837043025002
—That’s folk, he said very earnestly, for your book, Haines. Five lines	 97.54909367778365
of text and ten pages of notes about the folk and the fishgods of	 50.86235655707655
Dundrum. Printed by the weird sisters in the year of the big wind.	 35.97610473481067
He turned to Stephen and asked in a fine puzzled voice, lifting his	 35.488625664562576
brows:	 14950.359454455664
—Can you recall, brother, is mother Grogan’s tea and water pot spoken	 209.98848107752735
of in the Mabinogion or is it in the Upanishads?	 25.154030684550932
—I doubt it, said Stephen gravely.	 178.60593767627665
—Do you now? Buck Mulligan said in the same tone. Your reasons, pray?	 54.21385264932927
—I fancy, Stephen said as he ate, it did not exist in or out of the	 45.946178760734185
Mabinogion. Mother Grogan was, one imagines, a kinswoman of Mary Ann.	 29.96689388015522
Buck Mulligan’s face smiled with delight.	 37.90250360130546
—Charming! he said in a finical sweet voice, showing his white teeth	 66.06245664352309
and blinking his eyes pleasantly. Do you think she was? Quite charming!	 64.05510018160463
Then, suddenly overclouding all his features, he growled in a hoarsened	 65.12352790796665
rasping voice as he hewed again vigorously at the loaf:	 47.575552913468684
_—For old Mary Ann	 80.33808662896672
She doesn’t care a damn.	 217.63437215317632
But, hising up her petticoats..._	 162.69448888214166
He crammed his mouth with fry and munched and droned.	 12.263691844139135
The doorway was darkened by an entering form.	 140.10175982315192
—The milk, sir!	 206.84556995761903
—Come in, ma’am, Mulligan said. Kinch, get the jug.	 153.352512389295
An old woman came forward and stood by Stephen’s elbow.	 40.30901457128684
—That’s a lovely morning, sir, she said. Glory be to God.	 58.14595799203141
—To whom? Mulligan said, glancing at her. Ah, to be sure!	 54.40085919244296
Stephen reached back and took the milkjug from the locker.	 44.88012950841406
—The islanders, Mulligan said to Haines casually, speak frequently of	 68.38277351556654
the collector of prepuces.	 6.165730712213736
—How much, sir? asked the old woman.	 53.32752065342606
—A quart, Stephen said.	 42.676346504661694
He watched her pour into the measure and thence into the jug rich white	 52.01825650570469
milk, not hers. Old shrunken paps. She poured again a measureful and a	 56.608543847514035
tilly. Old and secret she had entered from a morning world, maybe a	 146.83548149794504
messenger. She praised the goodness of the milk, pouring it out.	 64.8032659707623
Crouching by a patient cow at daybreak in the lush field, a witch on	 45.6929127674952
her toadstool, her wrinkled fingers quick at the squirting dugs. They	 36.84982075639452
lowed about her whom they knew, dewsilky cattle. Silk of the kine and	 56.65696360596172
poor old woman, names given her in old times. A wandering crone, lowly	 81.29535804893766
form of an immortal serving her conqueror and her gay betrayer, their	 69.20661925916805
common cuckquean, a messenger from the secret morning. To serve or to	 151.73063606997303
upbraid, whether he could not tell: but scorned to beg her favour.	 83.62654342560023
—It is indeed, ma’am, Buck Mulligan said, pouring milk into their cups.	 57.20580555555299
—Taste it, sir, she said.	 167.55151823863903
He drank at her bidding.	 68.63699014852477
—If we could live on good food like that, he said to her somewhat	 63.48429893811846
loudly, we wouldn’t have the country full of rotten teeth and rotten	 87.37925891525761
guts. Living in a bogswamp, eating cheap food and the streets paved	 111.807571864448
with dust, horsedung and consumptives’ spits.	 20.16893268685571
—Are you a medical student, sir? the old woman asked.	 43.66951601525647
—I am, ma’am, Buck Mulligan answered.	 16.348798528441172
—Look at that now, she said.	 55.89459945637255
Stephen listened in scornful silence. She bows her old head to a voice	 96.19517604278224
that speaks to her loudly, her bonesetter, her medicineman: me she	 73.9448306680303
slights. To the voice that will shrive and oil for the grave all there	 65.8041519075245
is of her but her woman’s unclean loins, of man’s flesh made not in	 144.63461890336768
God’s likeness, the serpent’s prey. And to the loud voice that now bids	 96.53416574986353
her be silent with wondering unsteady eyes.	 91.25077640580255
—Do you understand what he says? Stephen asked her.	 54.08593221543106
—Is it French you are talking, sir? the old woman said to Haines.	 60.39633413346038
Haines spoke to her again a longer speech, confidently.	 52.581805543383034
—Irish, Buck Mulligan said. Is there Gaelic on you?	 56.10337861509884
—I thought it was Irish, she said, by the sound of it. Are you from the	 43.2918241463993
west, sir?	 1864.654133439502
—I am an Englishman, Haines answered.	 48.52615559977519
—He’s English, Buck Mulligan said, and he thinks we ought to speak	 30.709540786223766
Irish in Ireland.	 505.31913192232525
—Sure we ought to, the old woman said, and I’m ashamed I don’t speak	 58.71845829692014
the language myself. I’m told it’s a grand language by them that knows.	 128.1004829573764
—Grand is no name for it, said Buck Mulligan. Wonderful entirely. Fill	 131.85387824185133
us out some more tea, Kinch. Would you like a cup, ma’am?	 65.76556019102499
—No, thank you, sir, the old woman said, slipping the ring of the	 22.729467350645162
milkcan on her forearm and about to go.	 44.60820548785517
Haines said to her:	 54.19144699751108
—Have you your bill? We had better pay her, Mulligan, hadn’t we?	 97.41159196117349
Stephen filled again the three cups.	 40.5203518596325
—Bill, sir? she said, halting. Well, it’s seven mornings a pint at	 71.50502751628757
twopence is seven twos is a shilling and twopence over and these three	 142.20331607298127
mornings a quart at fourpence is three quarts is a shilling. That’s a	 76.4917130791884
shilling and one and two is two and two, sir.	 218.99408630302472
Buck Mulligan sighed and, having filled his mouth with a crust thickly	 19.95093585190632
buttered on both sides, stretched forth his legs and began to search	 53.39806037449229
his trouser pockets.	 61.757871697861695
—Pay up and look pleasant, Haines said to him, smiling.	 144.41410807481196
Stephen filled a third cup, a spoonful of tea colouring faintly the	 85.07640036004996
thick rich milk. Buck Mulligan brought up a florin, twisted it round in	 89.18464769964025
his fingers and cried:	 124.87682653329526
—A miracle!	 13.400948507362273
He passed it along the table towards the old woman, saying:	 45.26373912623737
—Ask nothing more of me, sweet. All I can give you I give.	 104.62227863209161
Stephen laid the coin in her uneager hand.	 90.17143699550599
—We’ll owe twopence, he said.	 20.986249618077164
—Time enough, sir, she said, taking the coin. Time enough. Good	 75.30685971500694
morning, sir.	 69.80850839457214
She curtseyed and went out, followed by Buck Mulligan’s tender chant:	 76.69772265718741
_—Heart of my heart, were it more,	 165.092717212064
More would be laid at your feet._	 110.73946738865891
He turned to Stephen and said:	 36.38957211446847
—Seriously, Dedalus. I’m stony. Hurry out to your school kip and bring	 157.65785737302403
us back some money. Today the bards must drink and junket. Ireland	 103.83686141809693
expects that every man this day will do his duty.	 89.51032439182389
—That reminds me, Haines said, rising, that I have to visit your	 46.43888798332819
national library today.	 137.42855671737985
—Our swim first, Buck Mulligan said.	 36.35996407063967
He turned to Stephen and asked blandly:	 46.164085692983804
—Is this the day for your monthly wash, Kinch?	 155.2654454384257
Then he said to Haines:	 52.557582868272036
—The unclean bard makes a point of washing once a month.	 133.50681349226616
—All Ireland is washed by the gulfstream, Stephen said as he let honey	 35.454209748890044
trickle over a slice of the loaf.	 30.265731339890387
Haines from the corner where he was knotting easily a scarf about the	 98.2253774081883
loose collar of his tennis shirt spoke:	 74.48722843803408
—I intend to make a collection of your sayings if you will let me.	 23.017843317915485
Speaking to me. They wash and tub and scrub. Agenbite of inwit.	 51.546456440911854
Conscience. Yet here’s a spot.	 249.39251889504501
—That one about the cracked lookingglass of a servant being the symbol	 78.65131427293417
of Irish art is deuced good.	 65.03814453942832
Buck Mulligan kicked Stephen’s foot under the table and said with	 22.48008559042999
warmth of tone:	 278.1301891320506
—Wait till you hear him on Hamlet, Haines.	 45.14725884586318
—Well, I mean it, Haines said, still speaking to Stephen. I was just	 67.11283989249507
thinking of it when that poor old creature came in.	 106.52381601710381
—Would I make any money by it? Stephen asked.	 110.58020347390284
Haines laughed and, as he took his soft grey hat from the holdfast of	 32.45384500645877
the hammock, said:	 39.87459998411135
—I don’t know, I’m sure.	 26.187939657975477
He strolled out to the doorway. Buck Mulligan bent across to Stephen	 26.1137411106622
and said with coarse vigour:	 29.401030543409373
—You put your hoof in it now. What did you say that for?	 53.095534874228385
—Well? Stephen said. The problem is to get money. From whom? From the	 75.28981539814443
milkwoman or from him. It’s a toss up, I think.	 56.65295401007157
—I blow him out about you, Buck Mulligan said, and then you come along	 61.02145798223657
with your lousy leer and your gloomy jesuit jibes.	 43.60828839872556
—I see little hope, Stephen said, from her or from him.	 130.17701917197022
Buck Mulligan sighed tragically and laid his hand on Stephen’s arm.	 38.23811390878085
—From me, Kinch, he said.	 59.34863945327707
In a suddenly changed tone he added:	 339.4636773314094
—To tell you the God’s truth I think you’re right. Damn all else they	 58.980510477105014
are good for. Why don’t you play them as I do? To hell with them all.	 74.4206486953047
Let us get out of the kip.	 41.448162287243626
He stood up, gravely ungirdled and disrobed himself of his gown, saying	 30.907434926935867
resignedly:	 4.608171674364364
—Mulligan is stripped of his garments.	 75.49716690488619
He emptied his pockets on to the table.	 23.272414517066355
—There’s your snotrag, he said.	 42.650577926436796
And putting on his stiff collar and rebellious tie he spoke to them,	 66.7400019608284
chiding them, and to his dangling watchchain. His hands plunged and	 42.23125167291338
rummaged in his trunk while he called for a clean handkerchief. God,	 75.71795864831107
we’ll simply have to dress the character. I want puce gloves and green	 161.7356610313461
boots. Contradiction. Do I contradict myself? Very well then, I	 129.33912245834654
contradict myself. Mercurial Malachi. A limp black missile flew out of	 107.10203394622349
his talking hands.	 338.7117774433214
—And there’s your Latin quarter hat, he said.	 30.936170743357376
Stephen picked it up and put it on. Haines called to them from the	 40.41536270581396
doorway:	 4130.1771016838475
—Are you coming, you fellows?	 205.35589538204022
—I’m ready, Buck Mulligan answered, going towards the door. Come out,	 62.045288832315165
Kinch. You have eaten all we left, I suppose. Resigned he passed out	 81.25911934503874
with grave words and gait, saying, wellnigh with sorrow:	 145.53035171397673
—And going forth he met Butterly.	 103.90257647793648
Stephen, taking his ashplant from its leaningplace, followed them out	 91.39260306548192
and, as they went down the ladder, pulled to the slow iron door and	 41.57620111214867
locked it. He put the huge key in his inner pocket.	 100.20866788199721
At the foot of the ladder Buck Mulligan asked:	 22.283771854857516
—Did you bring the key?	 84.2418438342199
—I have it, Stephen said, preceding them.	 28.484887877637384
He walked on. Behind him he heard Buck Mulligan club with his heavy	 43.79936980947317
bathtowel the leader shoots of ferns or grasses.	 8.63303864104494
—Down, sir! How dare you, sir!	 111.54936040719687
Haines asked:	 206.4341761930296
—Do you pay rent for this tower?	 64.45850093950276
—Twelve quid, Buck Mulligan said.	 34.274570250950646
—To the secretary of state for war, Stephen added over his shoulder.	 47.04378799982723
They halted while Haines surveyed the tower and said at last:	 123.56791762095408
—Rather bleak in wintertime, I should say. Martello you call it?	 33.62237800384523
—Billy Pitt had them built, Buck Mulligan said, when the French were on	 46.8627121015613
the sea. But ours is the _omphalos_.	 33.90535430475625
—What is your idea of Hamlet? Haines asked Stephen.	 56.73051149129419
—No, no, Buck Mulligan shouted in pain. I’m not equal to Thomas Aquinas	 47.14999060281598
and the fiftyfive reasons he has made out to prop it up. Wait till I	 42.12476141037756
have a few pints in me first.	 79.28593724427726
He turned to Stephen, saying, as he pulled down neatly the peaks of his	 46.10870189052622
primrose waistcoat:	 114.90986398798026
—You couldn’t manage it under three pints, Kinch, could you?	 81.88529201048081
—It has waited so long, Stephen said listlessly, it can wait longer.	 61.123722352901076
—You pique my curiosity, Haines said amiably. Is it some paradox?	 43.49431357326969
—Pooh! Buck Mulligan said. We have grown out of Wilde and paradoxes.	 19.615774900419627
It’s quite simple. He proves by algebra that Hamlet’s grandson is	 85.09249153344668
Shakespeare’s grandfather and that he himself is the ghost of his own	 71.24503736551645
father.	 438.4362250098381
—What? Haines said, beginning to point at Stephen. He himself?	 89.97048533947292
Buck Mulligan slung his towel stolewise round his neck and, bending in	 28.414939008606872
loose laughter, said to Stephen’s ear:	 162.8653511350442
—O, shade of Kinch the elder! Japhet in search of a father!	 93.63451891172825
—We’re always tired in the morning, Stephen said to Haines. And it is	 55.55014394427651
rather long to tell.	 185.78162588320194
Buck Mulligan, walking forward again, raised his hands.	 37.74962173690556
—The sacred pint alone can unbind the tongue of Dedalus, he said.	 76.39388773532453
—I mean to say, Haines explained to Stephen as they followed, this	 59.406162241770296
tower and these cliffs here remind me somehow of Elsinore. _That	 76.16677820829632
beetles o’er his base into the sea,_ isn’t it?	 70.8287847994433
Buck Mulligan turned suddenly for an instant towards Stephen but did	 76.23832359194988
not speak. In the bright silent instant Stephen saw his own image in	 70.81292102592467
cheap dusty mourning between their gay attires.	 108.39799440239048
—It’s a wonderful tale, Haines said, bringing them to halt again.	 59.61477823031571
Eyes, pale as the sea the wind had freshened, paler, firm and prudent.	 144.86706566446958
The seas’ ruler, he gazed southward over the bay, empty save for the	 32.36354443179536
smokeplume of the mailboat vague on the bright skyline and a sail	 16.34310189451177
tacking by the Muglins.	 8.193309680792458
—I read a theological interpretation of it somewhere, he said bemused.	 30.00760155436364
The Father and the Son idea. The Son striving to be atoned with the	 40.9045312855023
Father.	 438.4362250098381
Buck Mulligan at once put on a blithe broadly smiling face. He looked	 60.815786437129965
at them, his wellshaped mouth open happily, his eyes, from which he had	 80.11615484876913
suddenly withdrawn all shrewd sense, blinking with mad gaiety. He moved	 100.32895830120826
a doll’s head to and fro, the brims of his Panama hat quivering, and	 21.13023838293114
began to chant in a quiet happy foolish voice:	 62.55642959911691
_—I’m the queerest young fellow that ever you heard.	 128.83676360402538
My mother’s a jew, my father’s a bird.	 163.5013852786727
With Joseph the joiner I cannot agree.	 42.161561667387005
So here’s to disciples and Calvary._	 36.045210239205666
He held up a forefinger of warning.	 57.45030824250905
_—If anyone thinks that I amn’t divine	 155.16348507057032
He’ll get no free drinks when I’m making the wine	 206.8233131356832
But have to drink water and wish it were plain	 109.58280677319588
That I make when the wine becomes water again._	 200.2943803370633
He tugged swiftly at Stephen’s ashplant in farewell and, running	 59.72167857054844
forward to a brow of the cliff, fluttered his hands at his sides like	 60.48235946399875
fins or wings of one about to rise in the air, and chanted:	 31.359093274389785
_—Goodbye, now, goodbye! Write down all I said	 76.33593850968754
And tell Tom, Dick and Harry I rose from the dead.	 144.2638783459097
What’s bred in the bone cannot fail me to fly	 61.081280589099265
And Olivet’s breezy... Goodbye, now, goodbye!_	 51.124395003405525
He capered before them down towards the fortyfoot hole, fluttering his	 36.75963192537815
winglike hands, leaping nimbly, Mercury’s hat quivering in the fresh	 74.58749460290997
wind that bore back to them his brief birdsweet cries.	 186.61797883545572
Haines, who had been laughing guardedly, walked on beside Stephen and	 150.1959017922373
said:	 674.7359038427248
—We oughtn’t to laugh, I suppose. He’s rather blasphemous. I’m not a	 58.09784572664548
believer myself, that is to say. Still his gaiety takes the harm out of	 62.66675907760545
it somehow, doesn’t it? What did he call it? Joseph the Joiner?	 67.35549727559246
—The ballad of joking Jesus, Stephen answered.	 92.1284724422445
—O, Haines said, you have heard it before?	 74.44343520695547
—Three times a day, after meals, Stephen said drily.	 34.275142255831796
—You’re not a believer, are you? Haines asked. I mean, a believer in	 37.366622070068104
the narrow sense of the word. Creation from nothing and miracles and a	 21.16144314798039
personal God.	 225.05373251226086
—There’s only one sense of the word, it seems to me, Stephen said.	 39.02879850421387
Haines stopped to take out a smooth silver case in which twinkled a	 109.37985383030646
green stone. He sprang it open with his thumb and offered it.	 112.76880201319018
—Thank you, Stephen said, taking a cigarette.	 54.362072415688
Haines helped himself and snapped the case to. He put it back in his	 41.63569067054512
sidepocket and took from his waistcoatpocket a nickel tinderbox, sprang	 63.13943289600106
it open too, and, having lit his cigarette, held the flaming spunk	 119.13801072863689
towards Stephen in the shell of his hands.	 90.9293261420915
—Yes, of course, he said, as they went on again. Either you believe or	 57.73507842004155
you don’t, isn’t it? Personally I couldn’t stomach that idea of a	 45.037228423591586
personal God. You don’t stand for that, I suppose?	 55.5564403496772
—You behold in me, Stephen said with grim displeasure, a horrible	 64.69741492546437
example of free thought.	 790.3992851847366
He walked on, waiting to be spoken to, trailing his ashplant by his	 53.72195784222025
side. Its ferrule followed lightly on the path, squealing at his heels.	 94.0454671359825
My familiar, after me, calling, Steeeeeeeeeeeephen! A wavering line	 89.46890947470183
along the path. They will walk on it tonight, coming here in the dark.	 86.51293193749686
He wants that key. It is mine. I paid the rent. Now I eat his salt	 89.24692344252395
bread. Give him the key too. All. He will ask for it. That was in his	 123.73884204309282
eyes.	 1072.0948183353323
—After all, Haines began...	 149.74495520606683
Stephen turned and saw that the cold gaze which had measured him was	 114.32991001034809
not all unkind.	 84.79200132013821
—After all, I should think you are able to free yourself. You are your	 79.65056393998158
own master, it seems to me.	 196.46512927934566
—I am a servant of two masters, Stephen said, an English and an	 48.472766196272495
Italian.	 5683.555916376987
—Italian? Haines said.	 78.68970234771791
A crazy queen, old and jealous. Kneel down before me.	 110.46689878814554
—And a third, Stephen said, there is who wants me for odd jobs.	 60.8247887802014
—Italian? Haines said again. What do you mean?	 35.13351152722295
—The imperial British state, Stephen answered, his colour rising, and	 71.37284026347207
the holy Roman catholic and apostolic church.	 50.941280004648426
Haines detached from his underlip some fibres of tobacco before he	 53.44622232061686
spoke.	 7544.66136882191
—I can quite understand that, he said calmly. An Irishman must think	 100.02897607225098
like that, I daresay. We feel in England that we have treated you	 50.84591540092041
rather unfairly. It seems history is to blame.	 45.607165544004644
The proud potent titles clanged over Stephen’s memory the triumph of	 29.04456700166202
their brazen bells: _et unam sanctam catholicam et apostolicam	 21.155885965202913
ecclesiam:_ the slow growth and change of rite and dogma like his own	 28.636883162308884
rare thoughts, a chemistry of stars. Symbol of the apostles in the mass	 38.31912259944215
for pope Marcellus, the voices blended, singing alone loud in	 73.9393605142066
affirmation: and behind their chant the vigilant angel of the church	 28.358068063836424
militant disarmed and menaced her heresiarchs. A horde of heresies	 9.018128458459824
fleeing with mitres awry: Photius and the brood of mockers of whom	 21.389964949370786
Mulligan was one, and Arius, warring his life long upon the	 44.31728800783935
consubstantiality of the Son with the Father, and Valentine, spurning	 20.139278134528492
Christ’s terrene body, and the subtle African heresiarch Sabellius who	 36.07368581385062
held that the Father was Himself His own Son. Words Mulligan had spoken	 112.7686542767395
a moment since in mockery to the stranger. Idle mockery. The void	 74.48533654728918
awaits surely all them that weave the wind: a menace, a disarming and a	 60.029865730913336
worsting from those embattled angels of the church, Michael’s host, who	 82.60413746969797
defend her ever in the hour of conflict with their lances and their	 40.58181933271761
shields.	 4.608171674364364
Hear, hear! Prolonged applause. _Zut! Nom de Dieu!_	 63.48468708645254
—Of course I’m a Britisher, Haines’s voice said, and I feel as one. I	 63.0993596909688
don’t want to see my country fall into the hands of German jews either.	 55.80467593553061
That’s our national problem, I’m afraid, just now.	 245.24807324345397
Two men stood at the verge of the cliff, watching: businessman,	 27.342517691641547
boatman.	 20952.70010419261
—She’s making for Bullock harbour.	 140.85083352645987
The boatman nodded towards the north of the bay with some disdain.	 51.2861547207499
—There’s five fathoms out there, he said. It’ll be swept up that way	 107.21248769432782
when the tide comes in about one. It’s nine days today.	 158.87331749816866
The man that was drowned. A sail veering about the blank bay waiting	 78.7121584850198
for a swollen bundle to bob up, roll over to the sun a puffy face,	 92.03499438000266
saltwhite. Here I am.	 50.27559606732708
They followed the winding path down to the creek. Buck Mulligan stood	 33.52062424687051
on a stone, in shirtsleeves, his unclipped tie rippling over his	 92.06477054142883
shoulder. A young man clinging to a spur of rock near him, moved slowly	 48.050612088111656
frogwise his green legs in the deep jelly of the water.	 41.223163174602554
—Is the brother with you, Malachi?	 197.5129579233494
—Down in Westmeath. With the Bannons.	 24.770835437632254
—Still there? I got a card from Bannon. Says he found a sweet young	 73.16899252003238
thing down there. Photo girl he calls her.	 99.86598504392265
—Snapshot, eh? Brief exposure.	 55.54701340460695
Buck Mulligan sat down to unlace his boots. An elderly man shot up near	 33.51618347732269
the spur of rock a blowing red face. He scrambled up by the stones,	 43.10121147231079
water glistening on his pate and on its garland of grey hair, water	 45.64973945281507
rilling over his chest and paunch and spilling jets out of his black	 21.415880501775117
sagging loincloth.	 4.411654744205047
Buck Mulligan made way for him to scramble past and, glancing at Haines	 64.55487814363734
and Stephen, crossed himself piously with his thumbnail at brow and	 54.9278652021775
lips and breastbone.	 60.44760711930902
—Seymour’s back in town, the young man said, grasping again his spur of	 71.62445698169034
rock. Chucked medicine and going in for the army.	 109.74468863161123
—Ah, go to God! Buck Mulligan said.	 39.88678709513584
—Going over next week to stew. You know that red Carlisle girl, Lily?	 102.73090699031482
—Yes.	 220.63927910459736
—Spooning with him last night on the pier. The father is rotto with	 55.74463979969168
money.	 3471.2276245549806
—Is she up the pole?	 83.89976393066372
—Better ask Seymour that.	 334.02943555098994
—Seymour a bleeding officer! Buck Mulligan said.	 109.77013101050844
He nodded to himself as he drew off his trousers and stood up, saying	 73.90802338983116
tritely:	 4.608171674364364
—Redheaded women buck like goats.	 294.6009295032961
He broke off in alarm, feeling his side under his flapping shirt.	 61.18834968390347
—My twelfth rib is gone, he cried. I’m the _Übermensch._ Toothless	 41.95154699857247
Kinch and I, the supermen.	 97.55512367100692
He struggled out of his shirt and flung it behind him to where his	 32.63595866888999
clothes lay.	 2824.043491635293
—Are you going in here, Malachi?	 55.930686896203596
—Yes. Make room in the bed.	 51.07205157046279
The young man shoved himself backward through the water and reached the	 66.7171688895926
middle of the creek in two long clean strokes. Haines sat down on a	 38.116007325241675
stone, smoking.	 1770.089324287722
—Are you not coming in? Buck Mulligan asked.	 54.80430882155305
—Later on, Haines said. Not on my breakfast.	 191.99667999010043
Stephen turned away.	 38.42197458448705
—I’m going, Mulligan, he said.	 84.53138463469497

clothes.	 8381.466564865386
—And twopence, he said, for a pint. Throw it there.	 50.996624607434306
Stephen threw two pennies on the soft heap. Dressing, undressing. Buck	 91.44656884008351
Mulligan erect, with joined hands before him, said solemnly:	 93.28422265651967
—He who stealeth from the poor lendeth to the Lord. Thus spake	 27.004049813782675
Zarathustra.	 4.608171674364364
His plump body plunged.	 88.51463430005711
—We’ll see you again, Haines said, turning as Stephen walked up the	 91.09061088118528
path and smiling at wild Irish.	 297.16258776824463
Horn of a bull, hoof of a horse, smile of a Saxon.	 75.69393691650848
—The Ship, Buck Mulligan cried. Half twelve.	 71.51012995485753
—Good, Stephen said.	 63.45360524132342
He walked along the upwardcurving path.	 25.52688840068742
Liliata rutilantium.	 4.411654744205047
Turma circumdet.	 4.411654744205047
Iubilantium te virginum.	 25.32258179438146
The priest’s grey nimbus in a niche where he dressed discreetly. I will	 42.094905339743974
not sleep here tonight. Home also I cannot go.	 138.78941038795145

seal’s, far out on the water, round.	 95.13481826610001
Usurper.	 4.608171674364364
[ 2 ]	 463.94842625767166
—You, Cochrane, what city sent for him?	 57.75149558335856
—Tarentum, sir.	 71.30110375561071
—Very good. Well?	 129.93346560728727
—There was a battle, sir.	 37.31644621676677
—Very good. Where?	 244.40717290266988
The boy’s blank face asked the blank window.	 90.72302232580248
Fabled by the daughters of memory. And yet it was in some way if not as	 59.07377292456195
memory fabled it. A phrase, then, of impatience, thud of Blake’s wings	 99.1241379327013
of excess. I hear the ruin of all space, shattered glass and toppling	 28.940090723933146
masonry, and time one livid final flame. What’s left us then?	 292.05229336403835
—I forget the place, sir. 279 B. C.	 107.90147354816894
—Asculum, Stephen said, glancing at the name and date in the	 13.912634308631485
gorescarred book.	 129.5599723577961
—Yes, sir. And he said: _Another victory like that and we are done	 66.46939972636615
for._	 197.21616341800117
That phrase the world had remembered. A dull ease of the mind. From a	 45.80326510590341
hill above a corpsestrewn plain a general speaking to his officers,	 152.87396713369802
leaned upon his spear. Any general to any officers. They lend ear.	 436.45591502623824
—You, Armstrong, Stephen said. What was the end of Pyrrhus?	 40.54145033095363
—End of Pyrrhus, sir?	 117.80769455081065
—I know, sir. Ask me, sir, Comyn said.	 50.64156717021522
—Wait. You, Armstrong. Do you know anything about Pyrrhus?	 52.5718878559029
A bag of figrolls lay snugly in Armstrong’s satchel. He curled them	 56.33509430338563
between his palms at whiles and swallowed them softly. Crumbs adhered	 79.16070464206854
to the tissue of his lips. A sweetened boy’s breath. Welloff people,	 84.00022977177274
proud that their eldest son was in the navy. Vico Road, Dalkey.	 114.92170900729992
—Pyrrhus, sir? Pyrrhus, a pier.	 226.97185526926174
All laughed. Mirthless high malicious laughter. Armstrong looked round	 145.82974893544022
at his classmates, silly glee in profile. In a moment they will laugh	 42.3616843062454
more loudly, aware of my lack of rule and of the fees their papas pay.	 57.14111631115205
—Tell me now, Stephen said, poking the boy’s shoulder with the book,	 50.534139880793084
what is a pier.	 45.459799567749656
—A pier, sir, Armstrong said. A thing out in the water. A kind of a	 32.33364987114012
bridge. Kingstown pier, sir.	 48.41761835334251
Some laughed again: mirthless but with meaning. Two in the back bench	 126.79631218688476
whispered. Yes. They knew: had never learned nor ever been innocent.	 195.57067209216922
All. With envy he watched their faces: Edith, Ethel, Gerty, Lily. Their	 60.55610428269613
likes: their breaths, too, sweetened with tea and jam, their bracelets	 50.04312176045621
tittering in the struggle.	 6.2586885757549
—Kingstown pier, Stephen said. Yes, a disappointed bridge.	 102.02538537779886
The words troubled their gaze.	 101.17295941149872
—How, sir? Comyn asked. A bridge is across a river.	 331.7705376882012
For Haines’s chapbook. No-one here to hear. Tonight deftly amid wild	 107.66417048051781
drink and talk, to pierce the polished mail of his mind. What then? A	 54.082326941469034
jester at the court of his master, indulged and disesteemed, winning a	 18.240350533773036
clement master’s praise. Why had they chosen all that part? Not wholly	 91.12516518085505
for the smooth caress. For them too history was a tale like any other	 71.94412797816783
too often heard, their land a pawnshop.	 126.86698848377947
Had Pyrrhus not fallen by a beldam’s hand in Argos or Julius Caesar not	 52.837072351775944
been knifed to death. They are not to be thought away. Time has branded	 102.2724758542105
them and fettered they are lodged in the room of the infinite	 34.45142751172391
possibilities they have ousted. But can those have been possible seeing	 102.35401409964423
that they never were? Or was that only possible which came to pass?	 121.28028552070724
Weave, weaver of the wind.	 80.89600985122445
—Tell us a story, sir.	 47.22717084578644
—O, do, sir. A ghoststory.	 48.23180313252073
—Where do you begin in this? Stephen asked, opening another book.	 117.65688017436959
—_Weep no more,_ Comyn said.	 56.38260451623428
—Go on then, Talbot.	 164.92727113917223
—And the story, sir?	 72.4479923349989
—After, Stephen said. Go on, Talbot.	 77.46101618143975
A swarthy boy opened a book and propped it nimbly under the breastwork	 55.75877770302807
of his satchel. He recited jerks of verse with odd glances at the text:	 51.73777096917082
_—Weep no more, woful shepherds, weep no more	 40.235854267809835
For Lycidas, your sorrow, is not dead,	 93.62614051004132
Sunk though he be beneath the watery floor..._	 72.04855435005032
It must be a movement then, an actuality of the possible as possible.	 44.14849887786799
Aristotle’s phrase formed itself within the gabbled verses and floated	 19.329314696393084
out into the studious silence of the library of Saint Genevieve where	 60.643879908038166
he had read, sheltered from the sin of Paris, night by night. By his	 85.36830704038722
elbow a delicate Siamese conned a handbook of strategy. Fed and feeding	 82.25355087346578
brains about me: under glowlamps, impaled, with faintly beating	 207.98934503884678
feelers: and in my mind’s darkness a sloth of the underworld,	 17.781388634324113
reluctant, shy of brightness, shifting her dragon scaly folds. Thought	 76.63786956992878
is the thought of thought. Tranquil brightness. The soul is in a manner	 125.08140607883956
all that is: the soul is the form of forms. Tranquility sudden, vast,	 75.15833996397922
candescent: form of forms.	 75.43632519507904
Talbot repeated:	 190.56290361389767
_—Through the dear might of Him that walked the waves,	 108.60870645332025
Through the dear might..._	 135.97488660445595
—Turn over, Stephen said quietly. I don’t see anything.	 70.26130995398867
—What, sir? Talbot asked simply, bending forward.	 75.8607463026927
His hand turned the page over. He leaned back and went on again, having	 73.59779234889155
just remembered. Of him that walked the waves. Here also over these	 154.59434765357332
craven hearts his shadow lies and on the scoffer’s heart and lips and	 65.84784600267996
on mine. It lies upon their eager faces who offered him a coin of the	 87.5868949664763
tribute. To Caesar what is Caesar’s, to God what is God’s. A long look	 102.93885236456995
from dark eyes, a riddling sentence to be woven and woven on the	 33.47725325931085
church’s looms. Ay.	 51.38050068937979
Riddle me, riddle me, randy ro.	 73.37843616181954
My father gave me seeds to sow.	 28.698973065724022
Talbot slid his closed book into his satchel.	 213.2875242681119
—Have I heard all? Stephen asked.	 181.0071891601498
—Yes, sir. Hockey at ten, sir.	 107.51222010109765
—Half day, sir. Thursday.	 242.366782470414
—Who can answer a riddle? Stephen asked.	 63.311489442439
They bundled their books away, pencils clacking, pages rustling.	 76.20125250838139
Crowding together they strapped and buckled their satchels, all	 39.56736970585907
gabbling gaily:	 258.6155822725471
—A riddle, sir? Ask me, sir.	 52.72443272755066
—O, ask me, sir.	 37.03215042560366
—A hard one, sir.	 235.87874556939954
—This is the riddle, Stephen said:	 38.314054699176964
The cock crew,	 57.90875263711151
The sky was blue:	 113.8149610435901
The bells in heaven	 159.07675813545103
Were striking eleven.	 454.72080737734603
’Tis time for this poor soul	 188.35947565909254
To go to heaven.	 82.19846569234063
What is that?	 17.745577723176048
—What, sir?	 208.2732062990253

Their eyes grew bigger as the lines were repeated. After a silence	 60.16527169030161
Cochrane said:	 71.17402650638314
—What is it, sir? We give it up.	 46.050221959858966
Stephen, his throat itching, answered:	 203.52015671605758
—The fox burying his grandmother under a hollybush.	 39.05886387046525
He stood up and gave a shout of nervous laughter to which their cries	 69.72411854017663
echoed dismay.	 4.411654744205047
A stick struck the door and a voice in the corridor called:	 61.58396909604449
—Hockey!	 4.608171674364364
They broke asunder, sidling out of their benches, leaping them. Quickly	 72.03809888663687
they were gone and from the lumberroom came the rattle of sticks and	 87.656068253144
