Sargent who alone had lingered came forward slowly, showing an open	 216.14264668198163
copybook. His tangled hair and scraggy neck gave witness of unreadiness	 46.30310107538603
and through his misty glasses weak eyes looked up pleading. On his	 41.973940537463335
cheek, dull and bloodless, a soft stain of ink lay, dateshaped, recent	 106.50101196691607
and damp as a snail’s bed.	 133.66708602007245
He held out his copybook. The word _Sums_ was written on the headline.	 28.19231001064848
Beneath were sloping figures and at the foot a crooked signature with	 187.1758229921015
blind loops and a blot. Cyril Sargent: his name and seal.	 79.2063664070204
—Mr Deasy told me to write them out all again, he said, and show them	 48.239666293069
to you, sir.	 114.76565101515017
Stephen touched the edges of the book. Futility.	 22.34882340436412
—Do you understand how to do them now? he asked.	 45.77359171647502
—Numbers eleven to fifteen, Sargent answered. Mr Deasy said I was to	 55.467368242862435
copy them off the board, sir.	 238.02504565822235
—Can you do them yourself? Stephen asked.	 104.17498085146353
—No, sir.	 90.80290880287114
Ugly and futile: lean neck and tangled hair and a stain of ink, a	 40.20814047850207
snail’s bed. Yet someone had loved him, borne him in her arms and in	 66.24701824181896
her heart. But for her the race of the world would have trampled him	 51.56753224886742
underfoot, a squashed boneless snail. She had loved his weak watery	 19.321078153785816
blood drained from her own. Was that then real? The only true thing in	 110.00703613940182
life? His mother’s prostrate body the fiery Columbanus in holy zeal	 60.12868868854894
bestrode. She was no more: the trembling skeleton of a twig burnt in	 38.66741350825939
the fire, an odour of rosewood and wetted ashes. She had saved him from	 47.716839341954866
being trampled underfoot and had gone, scarcely having been. A poor	 58.050045536499354
soul gone to heaven: and on a heath beneath winking stars a fox, red	 167.41288198605548
reek of rapine in his fur, with merciless bright eyes scraped in the	 32.900801954672886
earth, listened, scraped up the earth, listened, scraped and scraped.	 36.39689934472643
Sitting at his side Stephen solved out the problem. He proves by	 71.02436617766746
algebra that Shakespeare’s ghost is Hamlet’s grandfather. Sargent	 131.44301896210024
peered askance through his slanted glasses. Hockeysticks rattled in the	 89.987416245439
lumberroom: the hollow knock of a ball and calls from the field.	 52.60127315041772
Across the page the symbols moved in grave morrice, in the mummery of	 58.78242264724439
their letters, wearing quaint caps of squares and cubes. Give hands,	 89.25179482969043
traverse, bow to partner: so: imps of fancy of the Moors. Gone too from	 58.28735277149067
the world, Averroes and Moses Maimonides, dark men in mien and	 77.92146374711942
movement, flashing in their mocking mirrors the obscure soul of the	 71.43388239797096
world, a darkness shining in brightness which brightness could not	 194.23073816848245
comprehend.	 4.608171674364364
—Do you understand now? Can you work the second for yourself?	 115.95903815427101
—Yes, sir.	 32.67659391838357
In long shaky strokes Sargent copied the data. Waiting always for a	 84.65587757497592
word of help his hand moved faithfully the unsteady symbols, a faint	 83.45142023180065
hue of shame flickering behind his dull skin. _Amor matris:_ subjective	 73.67043340586137
and objective genitive. With her weak blood and wheysour milk she had	 42.16825651671375
fed him and hid from sight of others his swaddling bands.	 71.15817574843159
Like him was I, these sloping shoulders, this gracelessness. My	 240.859514067568
childhood bends beside me. Too far for me to lay a hand there once or	 93.28989596060622
lightly. Mine is far and his secret as our eyes. Secrets, silent, stony	 238.13942243153372
sit in the dark palaces of both our hearts: secrets weary of their	 54.62955651553676
tyranny: tyrants, willing to be dethroned.	 26.393216674812805
The sum was done.	 139.47180567819032
—It is very simple, Stephen said as he stood up.	 30.845708537133795
—Yes, sir. Thanks, Sargent answered.	 18.813853300251726
He dried the page with a sheet of thin blottingpaper and carried his	 40.743861146567994
copybook back to his bench.	 49.40627014514418
—You had better get your stick and go out to the others, Stephen said	 71.79042938767475
as he followed towards the door the boy’s graceless form.	 63.62694046213823
—Yes, sir.	 32.67659391838357
In the corridor his name was heard, called from the playfield.	 42.806764409143724
—Sargent!	 9044.19630951339
—Run on, Stephen said. Mr Deasy is calling you.	 96.92491906109822
He stood in the porch and watched the laggard hurry towards the scrappy	 32.01515621090724
field where sharp voices were in strife. They were sorted in teams and	 43.38193948198552
Mr Deasy came away stepping over wisps of grass with gaitered feet.	 42.82721891129325
When he had reached the schoolhouse voices again contending called to	 48.04347983585124
him. He turned his angry white moustache.	 127.35425846913945
—What is it now? he cried continually without listening.	 55.98303272128363
—Cochrane and Halliday are on the same side, sir, Stephen said.	 21.157367186198233
—Will you wait in my study for a moment, Mr Deasy said, till I restore	 37.47363918047632
order here.	 2119.390531789682
And as he stepped fussily back across the field his old man’s voice	 85.32594164763448
cried sternly:	 300.6460354808551
—What is the matter? What is it now?	 37.99902695626915
Their sharp voices cried about him on all sides: their many forms	 144.01276937986242
closed round him, the garish sunshine bleaching the honey of his	 27.2369960950667
illdyed head.	 77.85214662983833
Stale smoky air hung in the study with the smell of drab abraded	 45.45870001542836
leather of its chairs. As on the first day he bargained with me here.	 76.98460232823396
As it was in the beginning, is now. On the sideboard the tray of Stuart	 28.776202402503134
coins, base treasure of a bog: and ever shall be. And snug in their	 68.93871305996686
spooncase of purple plush, faded, the twelve apostles having preached	 71.27245079855228
to all the gentiles: world without end.	 71.03685408432969
A hasty step over the stone porch and in the corridor. Blowing out his	 45.56997568732283
rare moustache Mr Deasy halted at the table.	 45.4350484090786
—First, our little financial settlement, he said.	 61.990687875372835
He brought out of his coat a pocketbook bound by a leather thong. It	 65.16822641054596
slapped open and he took from it two notes, one of joined halves, and	 55.937701576019556
laid them carefully on the table.	 116.52769490107349
—Two, he said, strapping and stowing his pocketbook away.	 45.10623203450177
And now his strongroom for the gold. Stephen’s embarrassed hand moved	 113.05488125318753
over the shells heaped in the cold stone mortar: whelks and money	 68.34962958825854
cowries and leopard shells: and this, whorled as an emir’s turban, and	 31.971934033905132
this, the scallop of saint James. An old pilgrim’s hoard, dead	 45.02967229634567
treasure, hollow shells.	 1185.6946044352762
A sovereign fell, bright and new, on the soft pile of the tablecloth.	 66.57550556589915
—Three, Mr Deasy said, turning his little savingsbox about in his hand.	 57.06230811259469
These are handy things to have. See. This is for sovereigns. This is	 142.23170592009282
for shillings. Sixpences, halfcrowns. And here crowns. See.	 85.73753706323454
He shot from it two crowns and two shillings.	 88.98728779902973
—Three twelve, he said. I think you’ll find that’s right.	 56.22963993336537
—Thank you, sir, Stephen said, gathering the money together with shy	 55.75299513851091
haste and putting it all in a pocket of his trousers.	 76.61553590209533
—No thanks at all, Mr Deasy said. You have earned it.	 44.47718225399443
Stephen’s hand, free again, went back to the hollow shells. Symbols too	 70.07590578840926
of beauty and of power. A lump in my pocket: symbols soiled by greed	 60.61458702277332
and misery.	 150.27040961726354
—Don’t carry it like that, Mr Deasy said. You’ll pull it out somewhere	 42.03626477526965
and lose it. You just buy one of these machines. You’ll find them very	 39.22094612998716
handy.	 20141.521272665428
Answer something.	 1289.2669325242337
—Mine would be often empty, Stephen said.	 115.27637275682379
The same room and hour, the same wisdom: and I the same. Three times	 114.3585632736083
now. Three nooses round me here. Well? I can break them in this instant	 92.43429736912434
if I will.	 45.35001461627237
—Because you don’t save, Mr Deasy said, pointing his finger. You don’t	 70.42025153326654
know yet what money is. Money is power. When you have lived as long as	 96.51623711346865
I have. I know, I know. If youth but knew. But what does Shakespeare	 50.89491625485844
say? _Put but money in thy purse._	 363.7162717759403
—Iago, Stephen murmured.	 63.562296749240275
He lifted his gaze from the idle shells to the old man’s stare.	 56.73822674773912
—He knew what money was, Mr Deasy said. He made money. A poet, yes, but	 74.48163100618476
an Englishman too. Do you know what is the pride of the English? Do you	 28.930391520668266
know what is the proudest word you will ever hear from an Englishman’s	 33.193011581254886
mouth?	 1322.9667689470998
The seas’ ruler. His seacold eyes looked on the empty bay: it seems	 26.109390010560002
history is to blame: on me and on my words, unhating.	 96.18284215099048
—That on his empire, Stephen said, the sun never sets.	 70.68836077989668
—Ba! Mr Deasy cried. That’s not English. A French Celt said that. He	 103.69604254630903
tapped his savingsbox against his thumbnail.	 34.585142525783255
—I will tell you, he said solemnly, what is his proudest boast. _I paid	 21.34068938433789
my way._	 162.98057887127953
Good man, good man.	 139.0290594114741
_—I paid my way. I never borrowed a shilling in my life._ Can you feel	 53.96393529766851
that? _I owe nothing._ Can you?	 91.87560780184893
Mulligan, nine pounds, three pairs of socks, one pair brogues, ties.	 140.6555055895713
Curran, ten guineas. McCann, one guinea. Fred Ryan, two shillings.	 55.99526065081487
Temple, two lunches. Russell, one guinea, Cousins, ten shillings, Bob	 188.5073106700361
Reynolds, half a guinea, Koehler, three guineas, Mrs MacKernan, five	 79.50856568272471
weeks’ board. The lump I have is useless.	 225.1230083247003
—For the moment, no, Stephen answered.	 56.357904865610415
Mr Deasy laughed with rich delight, putting back his savingsbox.	 40.95563698399555
—I knew you couldn’t, he said joyously. But one day you must feel it.	 55.77255421328713
We are a generous people but we must also be just.	 167.49600589857766
—I fear those big words, Stephen said, which make us so unhappy.	 129.35784241152726
Mr Deasy stared sternly for some moments over the mantelpiece at the	 33.752441990341055
shapely bulk of a man in tartan fillibegs: Albert Edward, prince of	 47.93544604011443
Wales.	 4.608171674364364
—You think me an old fogey and an old tory, his thoughtful voice said.	 34.70258652882852
I saw three generations since O’Connell’s time. I remember the famine	 55.884690654158724
in ’46. Do you know that the orange lodges agitated for repeal of the	 26.40538586589993
union twenty years before O’Connell did or before the prelates of your	 124.84878907823384
communion denounced him as a demagogue? You fenians forget some things.	 103.73666617959339
Glorious, pious and immortal memory. The lodge of Diamond in Armagh the	 210.22847701788743
splendid behung with corpses of papishes. Hoarse, masked and armed, the	 28.313839689254163
planters’ covenant. The black north and true blue bible. Croppies lie	 86.29584352325072
down.	 1025.5544802207955
Stephen sketched a brief gesture.	 92.56611844126854
—I have rebel blood in me too, Mr Deasy said. On the spindle side. But	 56.50511588343982
I am descended from sir John Blackwood who voted for the union. We are	 51.604825354916436
all Irish, all kings’ sons.	 232.80352668045464
—Alas, Stephen said.	 79.30408577003487
—_Per vias rectas_, Mr Deasy said firmly, was his motto. He voted for	 34.053245893752255
it and put on his topboots to ride to Dublin from the Ards of Down to	 48.209562803684335
do so.	 218.56850360755402
Lal the ral the ra	 24.062844328623
The rocky road to Dublin.	 52.90779207385332
A gruff squire on horseback with shiny topboots. Soft day, sir John!	 57.728501357972895
Soft day, your honour!... Day!... Day!... Two topboots jog dangling on	 114.60677921671518
to Dublin. Lal the ral the ra. Lal the ral the raddy.	 23.05349525428784
—That reminds me, Mr Deasy said. You can do me a favour, Mr Dedalus,	 28.031634315158367
with some of your literary friends. I have a letter here for the press.	 86.70434378817052
Sit down a moment. I have just to copy the end.	 50.689260934373046
He went to the desk near the window, pulled in his chair twice and read	 45.239215021299024
off some words from the sheet on the drum of his typewriter.	 69.71385048969181
—Sit down. Excuse me, he said over his shoulder, _the dictates of	 22.979972718891347
common sense._ Just a moment.	 177.95765938650626
He peered from under his shaggy brows at the manuscript by his elbow	 45.190673695496045
and, muttering, began to prod the stiff buttons of the keyboard slowly,	 30.661994242254277
sometimes blowing as he screwed up the drum to erase an error.	 56.72364388634003
Stephen seated himself noiselessly before the princely presence. Framed	 67.14134553626
around the walls images of vanished horses stood in homage, their meek	 108.66306501924275
heads poised in air: lord Hastings’ _Repulse_, the duke of	 66.5897145745237
Westminster’s _Shotover_, the duke of Beaufort’s _Ceylon_, _prix de	 12.553554572151455
Paris_, 1866. Elfin riders sat them, watchful of a sign. He saw their	 113.54463487371078
speeds, backing king’s colours, and shouted with the shouts of vanished	 85.39746691339587
crowds.	 4.608171674364364
—Full stop, Mr Deasy bade his keys. _But prompt ventilation of this	 67.41235172638697
allimportant question..._	 139.21984507817018
Where Cranly led me to get rich quick, hunting his winners among the	 59.28142071473783
mudsplashed brakes, amid the bawls of bookies on their pitches and reek	 18.568980439436288
of the canteen, over the motley slush. Even money _Fair Rebel._ Ten to	 47.952936681772854
one the field. Dicers and thimbleriggers we hurried by after the hoofs,	 118.0002965180197
the vying caps and jackets and past the meatfaced woman, a butcher’s	 32.04490120321092
dame, nuzzling thirstily her clove of orange.	 50.01688116377875
Shouts rang shrill from the boys’ playfield and a whirring whistle.	 40.695292715715205
Again: a goal. I am among them, among their battling bodies in a	 89.97121895593592
medley, the joust of life. You mean that knockkneed mother’s darling	 51.95865873820164
who seems to be slightly crawsick? Jousts. Time shocked rebounds, shock	 51.635494327293046
by shock. Jousts, slush and uproar of battles, the frozen deathspew of	 39.86678378428254
the slain, a shout of spearspikes baited with men’s bloodied guts.	 37.33574011010491
—Now then, Mr Deasy said, rising.	 75.50158620589282
He came to the table, pinning together his sheets. Stephen stood up.	 65.99991298223807
—I have put the matter into a nutshell, Mr Deasy said. It’s about the	 44.44648605138397
foot and mouth disease. Just look through it. There can be no two	 84.9176648315561
opinions on the matter.	 43.26887609259517
May I trespass on your valuable space. That doctrine of _laissez faire_	 40.62535453485206
which so often in our history. Our cattle trade. The way of all our old	 99.5189593222356
industries. Liverpool ring which jockeyed the Galway harbour scheme.	 84.3138627281902
European conflagration. Grain supplies through the narrow waters of the	 11.24132270055747
channel. The pluterperfect imperturbability of the department of	 5.2759475827997235
agriculture. Pardoned a classical allusion. Cassandra. By a woman who	 12.88805023700312
was no better than she should be. To come to the point at issue.	 42.4575547044859
—I don’t mince words, do I? Mr Deasy asked as Stephen read on.	 98.29395988403718
Foot and mouth disease. Known as Koch’s preparation. Serum and virus.	 18.05753828189453
Percentage of salted horses. Rinderpest. Emperor’s horses at Mürzsteg,	 29.375943996701448
lower Austria. Veterinary surgeons. Mr Henry Blackwood Price. Courteous	 62.17582006337252
offer a fair trial. Dictates of common sense. Allimportant question. In	 84.23814006458915
every sense of the word take the bull by the horns. Thanking you for	 73.73746204485624
the hospitality of your columns.	 12.482612476838865
—I want that to be printed and read, Mr Deasy said. You will see at the	 41.08598751973059
next outbreak they will put an embargo on Irish cattle. And it can be	 98.61985651971727
cured. It is cured. My cousin, Blackwood Price, writes to me it is	 152.4531181557153
regularly treated and cured in Austria by cattledoctors there. They	 78.70873775990626
offer to come over here. I am trying to work up influence with the	 56.36016738845342
department. Now I’m going to try publicity. I am surrounded by	 37.00580951588677
difficulties, by... intrigues by... backstairs influence by...	 46.44718577907622
He raised his forefinger and beat the air oldly before his voice spoke.	 51.624163836206016
—Mark my words, Mr Dedalus, he said. England is in the hands of the	 48.75684821059589
jews. In all the highest places: her finance, her press. And they are	 55.504733034132514
the signs of a nation’s decay. Wherever they gather they eat up the	 31.144521964516795
nation’s vital strength. I have seen it coming these years. As sure as	 98.07826550198718
we are standing here the jew merchants are already at their work of	 96.40536483852297
destruction. Old England is dying.	 85.87416930976948
He stepped swiftly off, his eyes coming to blue life as they passed a	 90.33618549385626
broad sunbeam. He faced about and back again.	 135.5481609634488
—Dying, he said again, if not dead by now.	 124.61497502221786
The harlot’s cry from street to street	 187.8464645377915
Shall weave old England’s windingsheet.	 34.0966398389712
His eyes open wide in vision stared sternly across the sunbeam in which	 56.294720979752306
he halted.	 55.6109274974823
—A merchant, Stephen said, is one who buys cheap and sells dear, jew or	 82.39768391795492
gentile, is he not?	 35.34355215260848
—They sinned against the light, Mr Deasy said gravely. And you can see	 30.12411337653868
the darkness in their eyes. And that is why they are wanderers on the	 48.117415493753995
earth to this day.	 207.42015561528618
On the steps of the Paris stock exchange the goldskinned men quoting	 42.198450815511606
prices on their gemmed fingers. Gabble of geese. They swarmed loud,	 76.5803965106155
uncouth about the temple, their heads thickplotting under maladroit	 50.67420015757391
silk hats. Not theirs: these clothes, this speech, these gestures.	 184.1440977385197
Their full slow eyes belied the words, the gestures eager and	 94.46916838330385
unoffending, but knew the rancours massed about them and knew their	 49.51326664059998
zeal was vain. Vain patience to heap and hoard. Time surely would	 71.443239081176
scatter all. A hoard heaped by the roadside: plundered and passing on.	 18.13305797166284
Their eyes knew their years of wandering and, patient, knew the	 258.1068110920166
dishonours of their flesh.	 38.74688800119503
—Who has not? Stephen said.	 38.00797708013052
—What do you mean? Mr Deasy asked.	 19.10751720657776
He came forward a pace and stood by the table. His underjaw fell	 39.92878185221996
sideways open uncertainly. Is this old wisdom? He waits to hear from	 171.46411031923873
me.	 695.4423238734375
—History, Stephen said, is a nightmare from which I am trying to awake.	 27.58198269628645
From the playfield the boys raised a shout. A whirring whistle: goal.	 51.44343888167176
What if that nightmare gave you a back kick?	 118.41084367199953
—The ways of the Creator are not our ways, Mr Deasy said. All human	 61.96298251589334
history moves towards one great goal, the manifestation of God.	 73.34391085722932
Stephen jerked his thumb towards the window, saying:	 64.59094594759219
—That is God.	 158.07003166363302
Hooray! Ay! Whrrwhee!	 52.71647391569307
—What? Mr Deasy asked.	 36.47450806971089
—A shout in the street, Stephen answered, shrugging his shoulders.	 64.60579141784284
Mr Deasy looked down and held for awhile the wings of his nose tweaked	 55.871907330277836
between his fingers. Looking up again he set them free.	 93.16935462713921
—I am happier than you are, he said. We have committed many errors and	 33.179298131067455
many sins. A woman brought sin into the world. For a woman who was no	 34.998910925524406
better than she should be, Helen, the runaway wife of Menelaus, ten	 51.73207615976537
years the Greeks made war on Troy. A faithless wife first brought the	 166.52559611577732
strangers to our shore here, MacMurrough’s wife and her leman,	 69.68471166883832
O’Rourke, prince of Breffni. A woman too brought Parnell low. Many	 205.47911896288284
errors, many failures but not the one sin. I am a struggler now at the	 69.08431583462624
end of my days. But I will fight for the right till the end.	 46.52474253536056
For Ulster will fight	 162.57420519316412
And Ulster will be right.	 96.42850842595588
Stephen raised the sheets in his hand.	 36.68100229634849
—Well, sir, he began.	 204.1830317098448
—I foresee, Mr Deasy said, that you will not remain here very long at	 71.64811300135727
this work. You were not born to be a teacher, I think. Perhaps I am	 37.242958738049985
wrong.	 5903.169647924619
—A learner rather, Stephen said.	 58.74279646858179
And here what will you learn more?	 110.23362339747122

—Who knows? he said. To learn one must be humble. But life is the great	 50.32730976846144
teacher.	 4.608171674364364
Stephen rustled the sheets again.	 42.32498909836695
—As regards these, he began.	 383.3035378296732

_ Telegraph. Irish Homestead._	 128.8613683191414

—That will do, Mr Deasy said. There is no time to lose. Now I have to	 31.79123562428201

—Good morning, sir, Stephen said, putting the sheets in his pocket.	 20.92137898189066
Thank you.	 42.452717799045026
—Not at all, Mr Deasy said as he searched the papers on his desk. I	 44.069171801104446
like to break a lance with you, old as I am.	 91.55347982444742
—Good morning, sir, Stephen said again, bowing to his bent back.	 38.85970272435732
He went out by the open porch and down the gravel path under the trees,	 26.245909981577487
hearing the cries of voices and crack of sticks from the playfield. The	 76.85044407614049
lions couchant on the pillars as he passed out through the gate:	 27.144375070431213
toothless terrors. Still I will help him in his fight. Mulligan will	 72.01664982454183

—Mr Dedalus!	 27.957436637182774
Running after me. No more letters, I hope.	 115.03783053467498
—Just one moment.	 279.106326320497
—Yes, sir, Stephen said, turning back at the gate.	 20.384659933813783
Mr Deasy halted, breathing hard and swallowing his breath.	 50.01976813671693
—I just wanted to say, he said. Ireland, they say, has the honour of	 34.84760337916697
being the only country which never persecuted the jews. Do you know	 73.45267471815819
that? No. And do you know why?	 67.43103089643029
He frowned sternly on the bright air.	 33.3059197169003
—Why, sir? Stephen asked, beginning to smile.	 66.65372384443205
—Because she never let them in, Mr Deasy said solemnly.	 33.25888755998279
A coughball of laughter leaped from his throat dragging after it a	 32.09998920452322
rattling chain of phlegm. He turned back quickly, coughing, laughing,	 89.39710928852828
his lifted arms waving to the air.	 52.995595774895705
—She never let them in, he cried again through his laughter as he	 80.57863314161047
stamped on gaitered feet over the gravel of the path. That’s why.	 30.407609363871813
On his wise shoulders through the checkerwork of leaves the sun flung	 64.2949761398943
spangles, dancing coins.	 68.59819601920174
[ 3 ]	 463.94842625767166
Ineluctable modality of the visible: at least that if no more, thought	 117.26766539158984
through my eyes. Signatures of all things I am here to read, seaspawn	 52.131086410348715
and seawrack, the nearing tide, that rusty boot. Snotgreen, bluesilver,	 31.773966766451544
rust: coloured signs. Limits of the diaphane. But he adds: in bodies.	 34.93541668792192
Then he was aware of them bodies before of them coloured. How? By	 96.19499301248831
knocking his sconce against them, sure. Go easy. Bald he was and a	 161.99840689511316
millionaire, _maestro di color che sanno_. Limit of the diaphane in.	 16.160422249453145
Why in? Diaphane, adiaphane. If you can put your five fingers through	 80.46487988852503
it it is a gate, if not a door. Shut your eyes and see.	 99.37524776386019
Stephen closed his eyes to hear his boots crush crackling wrack and	 40.62909189466946
shells. You are walking through it howsomever. I am, a stride at a	 73.10451394261658
time. A very short space of time through very short times of space.	 123.91443353158166
Five, six: the _nacheinander_. Exactly: and that is the ineluctable	 124.14948304897813
modality of the audible. Open your eyes. No. Jesus! If I fell over a	 45.38807212743859
cliff that beetles o’er his base, fell through the _nebeneinander_	 40.82045802029801
ineluctably! I am getting on nicely in the dark. My ash sword hangs at	 28.553262133714625
my side. Tap with it: they do. My two feet in his boots are at the ends	 191.29709320760367
of his legs, _nebeneinander_. Sounds solid: made by the mallet of _Los	 34.157131367311294
Demiurgos_. Am I walking into eternity along Sandymount strand? Crush,	 65.45346963194926
crack, crick, crick. Wild sea money. Dominie Deasy kens them a’.	 209.43793627653073
Won’t you come to Sandymount,	 173.8797865946434
Madeline the mare?	 41.73913422340614
Rhythm begins, you see. I hear. A catalectic tetrameter of iambs	 28.88275514597231
marching. No, agallop: _deline the mare_.	 90.63424498625652
Open your eyes now. I will. One moment. Has all vanished since? If I	 162.1392330003004
open and am for ever in the black adiaphane. _Basta!_ I will see if I	 65.18561339865462
can see.	 143.04831814223286
See now. There all the time without you: and ever shall be, world	 104.50591224453122
without end.	 686.2599393817492
They came down the steps from Leahy’s terrace prudently,	 46.802498553944375
_Frauenzimmer_: and down the shelving shore flabbily, their splayed	 32.758029790341816
feet sinking in the silted sand. Like me, like Algy, coming down to our	 64.8415809614452
mighty mother. Number one swung lourdily her midwife’s bag, the other’s	 70.40250802074912
gamp poked in the beach. From the liberties, out for the day. Mrs	 36.02704637050903
Florence MacCabe, relict of the late Patk MacCabe, deeply lamented, of	 16.45971630011303
Bride Street. One of her sisterhood lugged me squealing into life.	 65.89909859671685
Creation from nothing. What has she in the bag? A misbirth with a	 87.88785344764158
trailing navelcord, hushed in ruddy wool. The cords of all link back,	 36.186959613380445
strandentwining cable of all flesh. That is why mystic monks. Will you	 47.57359069752713
be as gods? Gaze in your _omphalos_. Hello. Kinch here. Put me on to	 177.00694229261373
Edenville. Aleph, alpha: nought, nought, one.	 37.16617289198586
Spouse and helpmate of Adam Kadmon: Heva, naked Eve. She had no navel.	 60.457676461109564
Gaze. Belly without blemish, bulging big, a buckler of taut vellum, no,	 74.32579365478428
whiteheaped corn, orient and immortal, standing from everlasting to	 42.50940933781268
everlasting. Womb of sin.	 133.55563956711958
Wombed in sin darkness I was too, made not begotten. By them, the man	 75.25319556283789
with my voice and my eyes and a ghostwoman with ashes on her breath.	 63.89471124290142
They clasped and sundered, did the coupler’s will. From before the ages	 107.85723857591667
He willed me and now may not will me away or ever. A _lex eterna_ stays	 167.0059755143095
about Him. Is that then the divine substance wherein Father and Son are	 119.10812298904146
consubstantial? Where is poor dear Arius to try conclusions? Warring	 42.25163663043051
his life long upon the contransmagnificandjewbangtantiality. Illstarred	 19.305519725010345
heresiarch! In a Greek watercloset he breathed his last: _euthanasia_.	 41.45663581303396
With beaded mitre and with crozier, stalled upon his throne, widower of	 31.82909777264612
a widowed see, with upstiffed _omophorion_, with clotted hinderparts.	 20.435664958280427
Airs romped round him, nipping and eager airs. They are coming, waves.	 40.26242121848711
The whitemaned seahorses, champing, brightwindbridled, the steeds of	 6.2483439850691145
Mananaan.	 4.608171674364364
I mustn’t forget his letter for the press. And after? The Ship, half	 76.74827321659508
twelve. By the way go easy with that money like a good young imbecile.	 96.82024407319281
Yes, I must.	 82.82984666997145
His pace slackened. Here. Am I going to aunt Sara’s or not? My	 80.43244009201211
consubstantial father’s voice. Did you see anything of your artist	 77.51643259848201
brother Stephen lately? No? Sure he’s not down in Strasburg terrace	 116.64832550145712
with his aunt Sally? Couldn’t he fly a bit higher than that, eh? And	 111.61642638266721
and and and tell us, Stephen, how is uncle Si? O, weeping God, the	 196.15529872921516
things I married into! De boys up in de hayloft. The drunken little	 283.1011293846714
costdrawer and his brother, the cornet player. Highly respectable	 61.32347271203448
gondoliers! And skeweyed Walter sirring his father, no less! Sir. Yes,	 56.28549561356875
sir. No, sir. Jesus wept: and no wonder, by Christ!	 284.140035647277
I pull the wheezy bell of their shuttered cottage: and wait. They take	 56.008048674282186
me for a dun, peer out from a coign of vantage.	 22.573636245188837
—It’s Stephen, sir.	 1843.0568093485383
—Let him in. Let Stephen in.	 327.7454958786847
A bolt drawn back and Walter welcomes me.	 48.3139523149987
—We thought you were someone else.	 76.67269014564324
In his broad bed nuncle Richie, pillowed and blanketed, extends over	 51.78725726909941
the hillock of his knees a sturdy forearm. Cleanchested. He has washed	 32.16517948571409
the upper moiety.	 108.72713505515567
—Morrow, nephew.	 4.411654744205047
He lays aside the lapboard whereon he drafts his bills of costs for the	 21.58139875685091

Walter squints vainly for a chair.	 54.61602247069569
—He has nothing to sit down on, sir.	 52.786754770292035

Stephen, in the whole opera. Listen.	 43.71584008018294

air, his fists bigdrumming on his padded knees.	 43.974947975476134
This wind is sweeter.	 196.06285767326065
Houses of decay, mine, his and all. You told the Clongowes gentry you	 246.81672415050716
had an uncle a judge and an uncle a general in the army. Come out of	 87.01136965056762
them, Stephen. Beauty is not there. Nor in the stagnant bay of Marsh’s	 99.81066381139168
library where you read the fading prophecies of Joachim Abbas. For	 35.43352149531858

kind ran from them to the wood of madness, his mane foaming in the	 29.409580742606817

furious dean, what offence laid fire to their brains? Paff! _Descende,	 54.906807759520454
calve, ut ne nimium decalveris_. A garland of grey hair on his	 17.18319714670194
comminated head see him me clambering down to the footpace	 55.95158372824127

baldpoll! A choir gives back menace and echo, assisting about the	 67.12373339705562

wheat.	 4.608171674364364
And at the same instant perhaps a priest round the corner is elevating	 66.83152027430994
it. Dringdring! And two streets off another locking it into a pyx.	 66.48861382719619
Dringadring! And in a ladychapel another taking housel all to his own	 55.01655897528506
cheek. Dringdring! Down, up, forward, back. Dan Occam thought of that,	 129.4233238900053
invincible doctor. A misty English morning the imp hypostasis tickled	 65.98320442083995
his brain. Bringing his host down and kneeling he heard twine with his	 45.137237708866266

in diphthong.	 25.877283914292452
Cousin Stephen, you will never be a saint. Isle of saints. You were	 66.14567088147354
awfully holy, weren’t you? You prayed to the Blessed Virgin that you	 93.63296107676943
might not have a red nose. You prayed to the devil in Serpentine avenue	 67.41316338038774
that the fubsy widow in front might lift her clothes still more from	 109.05176550471364
the wet street. _O si, certo!_ Sell your soul for that, do, dyed rags	 82.31424108493013
pinned round a squaw. More tell me, more still! On the top of the Howth	 73.18986658151755
tram alone crying to the rain: _Naked women! Naked women!_ What about	 153.06788153891802
that, eh?	 192.06451417969132
What about what? What else were they invented for?	 69.94334458612911
Reading two pages apiece of seven books every night, eh? I was young.	 128.65530028722776
You bowed to yourself in the mirror, stepping forward to applause	 51.79007657383896
earnestly, striking face. Hurray for the Goddamned idiot! Hray! No-one	 127.32169471790066
saw: tell no-one. Books you were going to write with letters for	 168.73135736584692
titles. Have you read his F? O yes, but I prefer Q. Yes, but W is	 63.4070311579242
wonderful. O yes, W. Remember your epiphanies written on green oval	 196.73967115707632
leaves, deeply deep, copies to be sent if you died to all the great	 145.38530776714518
libraries of the world, including Alexandria? Someone was to read them	 41.18946343702303
there after a few thousand years, a mahamanvantara. Pico della	 28.950964525066293
Mirandola like. Ay, very like a whale. When one reads these strange	 112.05154563087049
pages of one long gone one feels that one is at one with one who	 138.72643400333996
once...	 4132.683032344385
The grainy sand had gone from under his feet. His boots trod again a	 49.844935308372
damp crackling mast, razorshells, squeaking pebbles, that on the	 86.97469613094975
unnumbered pebbles beats, wood sieved by the shipworm, lost Armada.	 61.83774748539102
Unwholesome sandflats waited to suck his treading soles, breathing	 48.005661555790766
upward sewage breath, a pocket of seaweed smouldered in seafire under a	 77.16448351423068
midden of man’s ashes. He coasted them, walking warily. A porterbottle	 30.372981439471722
stood up, stogged to its waist, in the cakey sand dough. A sentinel:	 26.7375120853719
isle of dreadful thirst. Broken hoops on the shore; at the land a maze	 49.19092497505185
of dark cunning nets; farther away chalkscrawled backdoors and on the	 35.69419204630376
higher beach a dryingline with two crucified shirts. Ringsend: wigwams	 43.95733430866386
of brown steersmen and master mariners. Human shells.	 100.51751928077968
He halted. I have passed the way to aunt Sara’s. Am I not going there?	 69.61143900201517
Seems not. No-one about. He turned northeast and crossed the firmer	 89.31266715545408
sand towards the Pigeonhouse.	 110.08131190023322
_—Qui vous a mis dans cette fichue position?_	 22.420667862602734
_—C’est le pigeon, Joseph._	 290.1879869365701
Patrice, home on furlough, lapped warm milk with me in the bar	 86.1164506552513
MacMahon. Son of the wild goose, Kevin Egan of Paris. My father’s a	 36.82185953101082

_Schluss_. He laps.	 11.356195732365899
My Latin quarter hat. God, we simply must dress the character. I want	 63.60417571784916
puce gloves. You were a student, weren’t you? Of what in the other	 89.73760597061462
devil’s name? Paysayenn. P. C. N., you know: _physiques, chimiques et	 46.32306273047467

of Egypt, elbowed by belching cabmen. Just say in the most natural	 43.39802963910677
tone: when I was in Paris; _boul’ Mich’_, I used to. Yes, used to carry	 65.05309873572523
punched tickets to prove an alibi if they arrested you for murder	 81.32113052492464
somewhere. Justice. On the night of the seventeenth of February 1904	 34.369133325291266
the prisoner was seen by two witnesses. Other fellow did it: other me.	 116.21652860561777
Hat, tie, overcoat, nose. _Lui, c’est moi_. You seem to have enjoyed	 67.1231497642379
yourself.	 3727.054157568163
Proudly walking. Whom were you trying to walk like? Forget: a	 86.0428931758678
dispossessed. With mother’s money order, eight shillings, the banging	 89.09320755729918
door of the post office slammed in your face by the usher. Hunger	 34.95876992460095
toothache. _Encore deux minutes_. Look clock. Must get. _Fermé_. Hired	 73.53692388723344
dog! Shoot him to bloody bits with a bang shotgun, bits man spattered	 117.22621012195643
walls all brass buttons. Bits all khrrrrklak in place clack back. Not	 358.64457362509734
hurt? O, that’s all right. Shake hands. See what I meant, see? O,	 72.23981057241564
that’s all right. Shake a shake. O, that’s all only all right.	 49.863539812903

—Mother dying come home father.	 681.0496059532248
