—It’s a kind of a tour, don’t you see, Mr Bloom said thoughtfully.	 40.005271577171825
_Sweeeet song_. There’s a committee formed. Part shares and part	 83.88168318111842
profits.	 4.608171674364364
M’Coy nodded, picking at his moustache stubble.	 42.56097328846571
—O, well, he said. That’s good news.	 81.74671251278484
He moved to go.	 71.35971172126052
—Well, glad to see you looking fit, he said. Meet you knocking around.	 54.83675292043572
—Yes, Mr Bloom said.	 7.834275240214537
—Tell you what, M’Coy said. You might put down my name at the funeral,	 58.02252375793969
will you? I’d like to go but I mightn’t be able, you see. There’s a	 51.486114252015746
drowning case at Sandycove may turn up and then the coroner and myself	 85.14078919752225
would have to go down if the body is found. You just shove in my name	 64.50680177383322
if I’m not there, will you?	 84.52981787892041
—I’ll do that, Mr Bloom said, moving to get off. That’ll be all right.	 44.70321753360457
—Right, M’Coy said brightly. Thanks, old man. I’d go if I possibly	 103.52955928858445
could. Well, tolloll. Just C. P. M’Coy will do.	 201.91773360892438
—That will be done, Mr Bloom answered firmly.	 37.386687812786185
Didn’t catch me napping that wheeze. The quick touch. Soft mark. I’d	 134.66840712650358
like my job. Valise I have a particular fancy for. Leather. Capped	 64.44857021819742
corners, rivetted edges, double action lever lock. Bob Cowley lent him	 93.6716289722071
his for the Wicklow regatta concert last year and never heard tidings	 63.22332438114621
of it from that good day to this.	 94.89706666793674
Mr Bloom, strolling towards Brunswick street, smiled. My missus has	 51.06659726114173
just got an. Reedy freckled soprano. Cheeseparing nose. Nice enough in	 57.774624497394
its way: for a little ballad. No guts in it. You and me, don’t you	 79.90000495119905
know: in the same boat. Softsoaping. Give you the needle that would.	 38.31865345223509
Can’t he hear the difference? Think he’s that way inclined a bit.	 179.68231787471092
Against my grain somehow. Thought that Belfast would fetch him. I hope	 119.60622973326015
that smallpox up there doesn’t get worse. Suppose she wouldn’t let	 89.04487905167075
herself be vaccinated again. Your wife and my wife.	 125.04357577138074
Wonder is he pimping after me?	 67.07332094592667
Mr Bloom stood at the corner, his eyes wandering over the multicoloured	 22.20689617592508
hoardings. Cantrell and Cochrane’s Ginger Ale (Aromatic). Clery’s	 11.156249786009766
Summer Sale. No, he’s going on straight. Hello. _Leah_ tonight. Mrs	 197.7695470041883
Bandmann Palmer. Like to see her again in that. _Hamlet_ she played	 90.09328040406767
last night. Male impersonator. Perhaps he was a woman. Why Ophelia	 55.65661870115452
committed suicide. Poor papa! How he used to talk of Kate Bateman in	 31.418993611694194
that. Outside the Adelphi in London waited all the afternoon to get in.	 103.67687315574902
Year before I was born that was: sixtyfive. And Ristori in Vienna. What	 36.900295057387645
is this the right name is? By Mosenthal it is. Rachel, is it? No. The	 56.89827860438664
scene he was always talking about where the old blind Abraham	 61.21341775241486
recognises the voice and puts his fingers on his face.	 34.9051652427899
Nathan’s voice! His son’s voice! I hear the voice of Nathan who left	 45.95558681790884
his father to die of grief and misery in my arms, who left the house of	 59.90325460355501
his father and left the God of his father.	 52.941564579296006
Every word is so deep, Leopold.	 232.093413786789
Poor papa! Poor man! I’m glad I didn’t go into the room to look at his	 57.22327835369509
face. That day! O, dear! O, dear! Ffoo! Well, perhaps it was best for	 98.80422136206069
him.	 330.5397417229756
Mr Bloom went round the corner and passed the drooping nags of the	 36.28366451467209
hazard. No use thinking of it any more. Nosebag time. Wish I hadn’t met	 49.39809509535277
that M’Coy fellow.	 302.37818286617846
He came nearer and heard a crunching of gilded oats, the gently	 29.33425022789242
champing teeth. Their full buck eyes regarded him as he went by, amid	 228.26303611364818
the sweet oaten reek of horsepiss. Their Eldorado. Poor jugginses! Damn	 74.14903806719386
all they know or care about anything with their long noses stuck in	 139.75249018856258
nosebags. Too full for words. Still they get their feed all right and	 59.699141043477276
their doss. Gelded too: a stump of black guttapercha wagging limp	 41.07124908968432
between their haunches. Might be happy all the same that way. Good poor	 102.85822602822117
brutes they look. Still their neigh can be very irritating.	 178.5183445865009
He drew the letter from his pocket and folded it into the newspaper he	 50.763516533205085
carried. Might just walk into her here. The lane is safer.	 215.08631610682818
He passed the cabman’s shelter. Curious the life of drifting cabbies.	 29.616305088359315
All weathers, all places, time or setdown, no will of their own.	 162.99453106274484
_Voglio e non_. Like to give them an odd cigarette. Sociable. Shout a	 58.22481054492911
few flying syllables as they pass. He hummed:	 65.10011623815991
Là ci darem la mano	 27.93623643125543
La la lala la la.	 79.03175654333099
He turned into Cumberland street and, going on some paces, halted in	 57.899039807409196
the lee of the station wall. No-one. Meade’s timberyard. Piled balks.	 44.63845728855595
Ruins and tenements. With careful tread he passed over a hopscotch	 23.287721397876982
court with its forgotten pickeystone. Not a sinner. Near the timberyard	 67.80570777297918
a squatted child at marbles, alone, shooting the taw with a cunnythumb.	 22.22989604862766
A wise tabby, a blinking sphinx, watched from her warm sill. Pity to	 142.78969998502527
disturb them. Mohammed cut a piece out of his mantle not to wake her.	 119.54744722183383
Open it. And once I played marbles when I went to that old dame’s	 96.67821145697873
school. She liked mignonette. Mrs Ellis’s. And Mr? He opened the letter	 132.62406549659147
within the newspaper.	 600.3284881979114
A flower. I think it’s a. A yellow flower with flattened petals. Not	 87.86526014500419
annoyed then? What does she say?	 64.79943344427423
Dear Henry	 129.76144602484013
I got your last letter to me and thank you very much for it. I am sorry	 48.35915906236386
you did not like my last letter. Why did you enclose the stamps? I am	 48.4836054953598
awfully angry with you. I do wish I could punish you for that. I called	 64.90853471144337
you naughty boy because I do not like that other world. Please tell me	 18.828285353981922
what is the real meaning of that word? Are you not happy in your home	 29.200106815874882
you poor little naughty boy? I do wish I could do something for you.	 27.57596411429386
Please tell me what you think of poor me. I often think of the	 57.40133097322063
beautiful name you have. Dear Henry, when will we meet? I think of you	 121.76465538401358
so often you have no idea. I have never felt myself so much drawn to a	 55.94661320267767
man as you. I feel so bad about. Please write me a long letter and tell	 96.40939358810282
me more. Remember if you do not I will punish you. So now you know what	 50.110381459645694
I will do to you, you naughty boy, if you do not wrote. O how I long to	 59.94435760028663
meet you. Henry dear, do not deny my request before my patience are	 122.87417844196905
exhausted. Then I will tell you all. Goodbye now, naughty darling, I	 41.79006361224752
have such a bad headache. today. and write _by return_ to your longing	 86.37356822771207
Martha	 2514.9532064360455
P. S. Do tell me what kind of perfume does your wife use. I want to	 24.344204626403013
know.	 826.5144975499287
He tore the flower gravely from its pinhold smelt its almost no smell	 172.75230217308348
and placed it in his heart pocket. Language of flowers. They like it	 63.9380089182433
because no-one can hear. Or a poison bouquet to strike him down. Then	 101.81495924133966
walking slowly forward he read the letter again, murmuring here and	 85.46411240338931

perfume. Having read it all he took it from the newspaper and put it	 51.84528941121715

Weak joy opened his lips. Changed since the first letter. Wonder did	 142.8900431669513
she wrote it herself. Doing the indignant: a girl of good family like	 47.11698048869004
me, respectable character. Could meet one Sunday after the rosary.	 74.23672281623762
Thank you: not having any. Usual love scrimmage. Then running round	 146.02505793895912
corners. Bad as a row with Molly. Cigar has a cooling effect. Narcotic.	 112.70638949573276
Go further next time. Naughty boy: punish: afraid of words, of course.	 63.160301393717496
Brutal, why not? Try it anyhow. A bit at a time.	 82.42634600626894
Fingering still the letter in his pocket he drew the pin out of it.	 46.69925315346359

pinned together. Queer the number of pins they always have. No roses	 170.24313583784541
without thorns.	 101.69939096606987
Flat Dublin voices bawled in his head. Those two sluts that night in	 87.21079016645298

O, Mairy lost the pin of her drawers.	 47.9338941270917

To keep it up.	 23.125683331525757

To keep it up.	 23.125683331525757
Nice kind of evening feeling. No more wandering about. Just loll there:	 137.4787700228301

Going under the railway arch he took out the envelope, tore it swiftly	 64.73679848541366
in shreds and scattered them towards the road. The shreds fluttered	 21.50965231572729
away, sank in the dank air: a white flutter, then all sank.	 72.5460381502556
Henry Flower. You could tear up a cheque for a hundred pounds in the	 31.634945773906338
same way. Simple bit of paper. Lord Iveagh once cashed a sevenfigure	 104.03403815956044
cheque for a million in the bank of Ireland. Shows you the money to be	 70.69480143989021
made out of porter. Still the other brother lord Ardilaun has to change	 163.4652979386155
his shirt four times a day, they say. Skin breeds lice or vermin. A	 66.16446859400854
million pounds, wait a moment. Twopence a pint, fourpence a quart,	 109.70965009650727
eightpence a gallon of porter, no, one and fourpence a gallon of	 52.606597231946324
porter. One and four into twenty: fifteen about. Yes, exactly. Fifteen	 291.7841126744341
millions of barrels of porter.	 252.828684050601
What am I saying barrels? Gallons. About a million barrels all the	 65.72029695286152
same.	 1466.138987791441
An incoming train clanked heavily above his head, coach after coach.	 113.41672560287356
Barrels bumped in his head: dull porter slopped and churned inside. The	 48.48341852255752
bungholes sprang open and a huge dull flood leaked out, flowing	 89.64653678491928
together, winding through mudflats all over the level land, a lazy	 81.51697725825626
pooling swirl of liquor bearing along wideleaved flowers of its froth.	 39.028073358414105
He had reached the open backdoor of All Hallows. Stepping into the	 35.14372973120292
porch he doffed his hat, took the card from his pocket and tucked it	 49.54322852369478
again behind the leather headband. Damn it. I might have tried to work	 60.22273037904867
M’Coy for a pass to Mullingar.	 291.8623104136994
Same notice on the door. Sermon by the very reverend John Conmee S. J.	 19.70834304623946
on saint Peter Claver S. J. and the African Mission. Prayers for the	 28.613237519877153
conversion of Gladstone they had too when he was almost unconscious.	 34.84132063672683
The protestants are the same. Convert Dr William J. Walsh D.D. to the	 44.58706682390769
true religion. Save China’s millions. Wonder how they explain it to the	 111.27942241221936
heathen Chinee. Prefer an ounce of opium. Celestials. Rank heresy for	 18.153795196586646
them. Buddha their god lying on his side in the museum. Taking it easy	 126.04892326243068
with hand under his cheek. Josssticks burning. Not like Ecce Homo.	 70.36665813716387
Crown of thorns and cross. Clever idea Saint Patrick the shamrock.	 80.14140444584409
Chopsticks? Conmee: Martin Cunningham knows him: distinguishedlooking.	 79.82154941417242
Sorry I didn’t work him about getting Molly into the choir instead of	 97.88894331849525
that Father Farley who looked a fool but wasn’t. They’re taught that.	 130.84163188037226
He’s not going out in bluey specs with the sweat rolling off him to	 44.30029165808015
baptise blacks, is he? The glasses would take their fancy, flashing.	 83.23797421338672
Like to see them sitting round in a ring with blub lips, entranced,	 69.83435342571359
listening. Still life. Lap it up like milk, I suppose.	 175.23322958980282
The cold smell of sacred stone called him. He trod the worn steps,	 65.13894074109999
pushed the swingdoor and entered softly by the rere.	 40.023970730992914
Something going on: some sodality. Pity so empty. Nice discreet place	 205.2313408500591
to be next some girl. Who is my neighbour? Jammed by the hour to slow	 77.5744262457708
music. That woman at midnight mass. Seventh heaven. Women knelt in the	 118.24923418921514
benches with crimson halters round their necks, heads bowed. A batch	 66.9914253123666
knelt at the altarrails. The priest went along by them, murmuring,	 73.43010595426844
holding the thing in his hands. He stopped at each, took out a	 85.56900912320931
communion, shook a drop or two (are they in water?) off it and put it	 150.03794979474435
neatly into her mouth. Her hat and head sank. Then the next one. Her	 154.46154226420174
hat sank at once. Then the next one: a small old woman. The priest bent	 135.70649065056315
down to put it into her mouth, murmuring all the time. Latin. The next	 46.858624354289304
one. Shut your eyes and open your mouth. What? _Corpus:_ body. Corpse.	 196.7324891275061
Good idea the Latin. Stupefies them first. Hospice for the dying. They	 119.673867533768
don’t seem to chew it: only swallow it down. Rum idea: eating bits of a	 53.432147321694806
corpse. Why the cannibals cotton to it.	 78.16200294834724
He stood aside watching their blind masks pass down the aisle, one by	 52.4257279622711
one, and seek their places. He approached a bench and seated himself in	 116.62963709566277
its corner, nursing his hat and newspaper. These pots we have to wear.	 89.80516086281904
We ought to have hats modelled on our heads. They were about him here	 87.83357684940127
and there, with heads still bowed in their crimson halters, waiting for	 70.43213878695009
it to melt in their stomachs. Something like those mazzoth: it’s that	 71.00868473144749
sort of bread: unleavened shewbread. Look at them. Now I bet it makes	 50.050275894153565
them feel happy. Lollipop. It does. Yes, bread of angels it’s called.	 150.33842795196594
There’s a big idea behind it, kind of kingdom of God is within you	 91.91993376317689
feel. First communicants. Hokypoky penny a lump. Then feel all like one	 223.35964963438042
family party, same in the theatre, all in the same swim. They do. I’m	 178.28637659571424
sure of that. Not so lonely. In our confraternity. Then come out a bit	 86.69736630662759
spreeish. Let off steam. Thing is if you really believe in it. Lourdes	 93.07145968076641
cure, waters of oblivion, and the Knock apparition, statues bleeding.	 204.92034601518677
Old fellow asleep near that confessionbox. Hence those snores. Blind	 107.62141556696562
faith. Safe in the arms of kingdom come. Lulls all pain. Wake this time	 124.66968963081291
next year.	 245.7092045958096
He saw the priest stow the communion cup away, well in, and kneel an	 135.0476079246058
instant before it, showing a large grey bootsole from under the lace	 87.3609360128962
affair he had on. Suppose he lost the pin of his. He wouldn’t know what	 86.25933432147225
to do to. Bald spot behind. Letters on his back: I.N.R.I? No: I.H.S.	 117.74725414835557
Molly told me one time I asked her. I have sinned: or no: I have	 48.476000247044475
suffered, it is. And the other one? Iron nails ran in.	 73.28952595230605

crawthumpers, now that’s a good name for them, there’s always something	 111.08230814029298

The priest was rinsing out the chalice: then he tossed off the dregs	 43.92018628837491
smartly. Wine. Makes it more aristocratic than for example if he drank	 132.32818463759432
what they are used to Guinness’s porter or some temperance beverage	 46.068419805217445
Wheatley’s Dublin hop bitters or Cantrell and Cochrane’s ginger ale	 25.126462600478508
(aromatic). Doesn’t give them any of it: shew wine: only the other.	 114.6613270276631
Cold comfort. Pious fraud but quite right: otherwise they’d have one	 113.43324806079235
old booser worse than another coming along, cadging for a drink. Queer	 70.09381372518173
the whole atmosphere of the. Quite right. Perfectly right that is.	 53.02183444767302
Mr Bloom looked back towards the choir. Not going to be any music.	 44.50479957753569
Pity. Who has the organ here I wonder? Old Glynn he knew how to make	 97.4872922731104
that instrument talk, the _vibrato_: fifty pounds a year they say he	 97.8375826454263
had in Gardiner street. Molly was in fine voice that day, the _Stabat	 66.28338956210779
Mater_ of Rossini. Father Bernard Vaughan’s sermon first. Christ or	 113.76544362451686
Pilate? Christ, but don’t keep us all night over it. Music they wanted.	 139.95719633233128
Footdrill stopped. Could hear a pin drop. I told her to pitch her voice	 49.23435310644557
against that corner. I could feel the thrill in the air, the full, the	 50.72902930901923
people looking up:	 240.02572734857645
_Quis est homo._	 31.339720347449166
Some of that old sacred music splendid. Mercadante: seven last words.	 136.14707538627331
Mozart’s twelfth mass: _Gloria_ in that. Those old popes keen on music,	 113.05885270702858
on art and statues and pictures of all kinds. Palestrina for example	 131.59958367149738
too. They had a gay old time while it lasted. Healthy too, chanting,	 110.49356512749866
regular hours, then brew liqueurs. Benedictine. Green Chartreuse.	 105.3938473708489
Still, having eunuchs in their choir that was coming it a bit thick.	 117.49973605475512
What kind of voice is it? Must be curious to hear after their own	 60.04394190922731
strong basses. Connoisseurs. Suppose they wouldn’t feel anything after.	 175.5764493983975
Kind of a placid. No worry. Fall into flesh, don’t they? Gluttons,	 85.33042988485875
tall, long legs. Who knows? Eunuch. One way out of it.	 69.46869597543093
He saw the priest bend down and kiss the altar and then face about and	 93.62066485088084
bless all the people. All crossed themselves and stood up. Mr Bloom	 108.69968943257959
glanced about him and then stood up, looking over the risen hats. Stand	 75.7631232657969
up at the gospel of course. Then all settled down on their knees again	 56.488091802416555
and he sat back quietly in his bench. The priest came down from the	 44.544098546486104
altar, holding the thing out from him, and he and the massboy answered	 87.23747048920204
each other in Latin. Then the priest knelt down and began to read off a	 64.44235640146807
card:	 25645.966616138776
—O God, our refuge and our strength...	 84.56727707843237
Mr Bloom put his face forward to catch the words. English. Throw them	 59.486772626420105
the bone. I remember slightly. How long since your last mass? Glorious	 196.56110870524742
and immaculate virgin. Joseph, her spouse. Peter and Paul. More	 142.78044109689444
interesting if you understood what it was all about. Wonderful	 99.01591387741131
organisation certainly, goes like clockwork. Confession. Everyone wants	 202.75122060340254
to. Then I will tell you all. Penance. Punish me, please. Great weapon	 102.89598110741258
in their hands. More than doctor or solicitor. Woman dying to. And I	 104.7701818336409
schschschschschsch. And did you chachachachacha? And why did you? Look	 33.65429649797623
down at her ring to find an excuse. Whispering gallery walls have ears.	 119.27766855962284
Husband learn to his surprise. God’s little joke. Then out she comes.	 141.52975568401123
Repentance skindeep. Lovely shame. Pray at an altar. Hail Mary and Holy	 91.82515722785077
Mary. Flowers, incense, candles melting. Hide her blushes. Salvation	 131.27304174280735
army blatant imitation. Reformed prostitute will address the meeting.	 52.70501034088386
How I found the Lord. Squareheaded chaps those must be in Rome: they	 130.18773008116642
work the whole show. And don’t they rake in the money too? Bequests	 117.77000366910444
also: to the P.P. for the time being in his absolute discretion. Masses	 21.234172763100492
for the repose of my soul to be said publicly with open doors.	 56.687806244516686
Monasteries and convents. The priest in that Fermanagh will case in the	 39.687285662334304
witnessbox. No browbeating him. He had his answer pat for everything.	 117.47340196673342
Liberty and exaltation of our holy mother the church. The doctors of	 69.87751397658974
the church: they mapped out the whole theology of it.	 38.48455021177548
The priest prayed:	 47.376850792402514
—Blessed Michael, archangel, defend us in the hour of conflict. Be our	 64.39821914942925
safeguard against the wickedness and snares of the devil (may God	 26.177011728099032
restrain him, we humbly pray!): and do thou, O prince of the heavenly	 86.39415041519148
host, by the power of God thrust Satan down to hell and with him those	 90.62610164191702
other wicked spirits who wander through the world for the ruin of	 18.62489893931071
souls.	 5062.657996430475
The priest and the massboy stood up and walked off. All over. The women	 46.32704426708552
remained behind: thanksgiving.	 61.57660790600946
Better be shoving along. Brother Buzz. Come around with the plate	 97.50617457250458
perhaps. Pay your Easter duty.	 104.09873037672801
He stood up. Hello. Were those two buttons of my waistcoat open all the	 71.07597550797658
time? Women enjoy it. Never tell you. But we. Excuse, miss, there’s a	 125.51411738639925
(whh!) just a (whh!) fluff. Or their skirt behind, placket unhooked.	 41.7938121831611
Glimpses of the moon. Annoyed if you don’t. Why didn’t you tell me	 42.303996444954976
before. Still like you better untidy. Good job it wasn’t farther south.	 127.84803073832387
He passed, discreetly buttoning, down the aisle and out through the	 29.104548080388135
main door into the light. He stood a moment unseeing by the cold black	 120.1043960089904
marble bowl while before him and behind two worshippers dipped furtive	 52.94668294556211
hands in the low tide of holy water. Trams: a car of Prescott’s	 61.95051310377167
dyeworks: a widow in her weeds. Notice because I’m in mourning myself.	 82.82244010131386
He covered himself. How goes the time? Quarter past. Time enough yet.	 81.15409473454206
Better get that lotion made up. Where is this? Ah yes, the last time.	 96.37655834357615
Sweny’s in Lincoln place. Chemists rarely move. Their green and gold	 69.14954003766661
beaconjars too heavy to stir. Hamilton Long’s, founded in the year of	 42.67392383945106
the flood. Huguenot churchyard near there. Visit some day.	 105.56656638619523
He walked southward along Westland row. But the recipe is in the other	 36.62893664478916
trousers. O, and I forgot that latchkey too. Bore this funeral affair.	 112.28560289199733
O well, poor fellow, it’s not his fault. When was it I got it made up	 106.09378402142856
last? Wait. I changed a sovereign I remember. First of the month it	 197.97418813464296
must have been or the second. O, he can look it up in the prescriptions	 44.76303708003785
book.	 13817.199736964518
The chemist turned back page after page. Sandy shrivelled smell he	 154.42255004855087
seems to have. Shrunken skull. And old. Quest for the philosopher’s	 40.32308237246712
stone. The alchemists. Drugs age you after mental excitement. Lethargy	 230.18981678275205
then. Why? Reaction. A lifetime in a night. Gradually changes your	 52.4737871798955
character. Living all the day among herbs, ointments, disinfectants.	 90.03677697538501
All his alabaster lilypots. Mortar and pestle. Aq. Dist. Fol. Laur. Te	 13.488474152990907
Virid. Smell almost cure you like the dentist’s doorbell. Doctor Whack.	 64.30904901057595
He ought to physic himself a bit. Electuary or emulsion. The first	 32.96337315417991
fellow that picked an herb to cure himself had a bit of pluck. Simples.	 117.7011245756986
Want to be careful. Enough stuff here to chloroform you. Test: turns	 73.61005330553992
blue litmus paper red. Chloroform. Overdose of laudanum. Sleeping	 83.75677717380997
draughts. Lovephiltres. Paragoric poppysyrup bad for cough. Clogs the	 26.492126317221693
pores or the phlegm. Poisons the only cures. Remedy where you least	 66.38879453356587
expect it. Clever of nature.	 442.1170089245767
—About a fortnight ago, sir?	 197.93558895345888
—Yes, Mr Bloom said.	 7.834275240214537
He waited by the counter, inhaling slowly the keen reek of drugs, the	 71.10478964083427
dusty dry smell of sponges and loofahs. Lot of time taken up telling	 96.86453699035984
your aches and pains.	 113.61204112032753
—Sweet almond oil and tincture of benzoin, Mr Bloom said, and then	 31.25805190141313
orangeflower water...	 138.94872699428072
It certainly did make her skin so delicate white like wax.	 148.29086787934932
—And white wax also, he said.	 46.712621010264435
Brings out the darkness of her eyes. Looking at me, the sheet up to her	 101.25988211391713
eyes, Spanish, smelling herself, when I was fixing the links in my	 68.64112276866457
cuffs. Those homely recipes are often the best: strawberries for the	 36.12835018949992
teeth: nettles and rainwater: oatmeal they say steeped in buttermilk.	 28.492310865292982
Skinfood. One of the old queen’s sons, duke of Albany was it? had only	 50.29593242572539
one skin. Leopold, yes. Three we have. Warts, bunions and pimples to	 75.54704263087922
make it worse. But you want a perfume too. What perfume does your?	 62.45352522136591
_Peau d’Espagne_. That orangeflower water is so fresh. Nice smell these	 67.92842938488421
soaps have. Pure curd soap. Time to get a bath round the corner.	 96.10936659357338
Hammam. Turkish. Massage. Dirt gets rolled up in your navel. Nicer if a	 47.03380715579062
nice girl did it. Also I think I. Yes I. Do it in the bath. Curious	 72.41925184149459
longing I. Water to water. Combine business with pleasure. Pity no time	 195.56070493240188
for massage. Feel fresh then all the day. Funeral be rather glum.	 92.03101209000984
—Yes, sir, the chemist said. That was two and nine. Have you brought a	 54.470789172324956
bottle?	 6023.504533177474
—No, Mr Bloom said. Make it up, please. I’ll call later in the day and	 49.2286811527367
I’ll take one of these soaps. How much are they?	 51.273627818155255
—Fourpence, sir.	 1061.2140171015092
Mr Bloom raised a cake to his nostrils. Sweet lemony wax.	 64.92530635122327
—I’ll take this one, he said. That makes three and a penny.	 89.35899684779426
—Yes, sir, the chemist said. You can pay all together, sir, when you	 55.35365848971293
come back.	 101.01289039765865
—Good, Mr Bloom said.	 24.433275087978753
He strolled out of the shop, the newspaper baton under his armpit, the	 27.044008032620003
coolwrappered soap in his left hand.	 37.97522618930409
At his armpit Bantam Lyons’ voice and hand said:	 186.91952881975246
—Hello, Bloom. What’s the best news? Is that today’s? Show us a minute.	 42.11422017436459
Shaved off his moustache again, by Jove! Long cold upper lip. To look	 161.75271451235844
younger. He does look balmy. Younger than I am.	 94.18288515529653
Bantam Lyons’s yellow blacknailed fingers unrolled the baton. Wants a	 191.7383187578913
wash too. Take off the rough dirt. Good morning, have you used Pears’	 213.04364277006923
soap? Dandruff on his shoulders. Scalp wants oiling.	 82.93419525075812
—I want to see about that French horse that’s running today, Bantam	 71.95196705609321
Lyons said. Where the bugger is it?	 93.51100616890257
He rustled the pleated pages, jerking his chin on his high collar.	 31.04032602559011
Barber’s itch. Tight collar he’ll lose his hair. Better leave him the	 63.277544676080666
paper and get shut of him.	 142.26502209641214
—You can keep it, Mr Bloom said.	 22.84256642454455
—Ascot. Gold cup. Wait, Bantam Lyons muttered. Half a mo. Maximum the	 79.95833771906914
second.	 1264.8812746743
—I was just going to throw it away, Mr Bloom said.	 15.23352503441351
Bantam Lyons raised his eyes suddenly and leered weakly.	 30.443541406287252
—What’s that? his sharp voice said.	 108.30375461892919
—I say you can keep it, Mr Bloom answered. I was going to throw it away	 23.750736465436912
that moment.	 198.44364469527187
Bantam Lyons doubted an instant, leering: then thrust the outspread	 30.29830526330584
sheets back on Mr Bloom’s arms.	 119.86040425145235
—I’ll risk it, he said. Here, thanks.	 79.01326295912008
He sped off towards Conway’s corner. God speed scut.	 69.36441863785912
Mr Bloom folded the sheets again to a neat square and lodged the soap	 46.89901904365247
in it, smiling. Silly lips of that chap. Betting. Regular hotbed of it	 84.21552568412342
lately. Messenger boys stealing to put on sixpence. Raffle for large	 125.71477279697542
tender turkey. Your Christmas dinner for threepence. Jack Fleming	 150.762327903038
embezzling to gamble then smuggled off to America. Keeps a hotel now.	 134.46650140265947
They never come back. Fleshpots of Egypt.	 87.324372750445
He walked cheerfully towards the mosque of the baths. Remind you of a	 18.79949774064631
mosque, redbaked bricks, the minarets. College sports today I see. He	 29.719852515899074
eyed the horseshoe poster over the gate of college park: cyclist	 47.34080910865318
doubled up like a cod in a pot. Damn bad ad. Now if they had made it	 53.07095612726318
round like a wheel. Then the spokes: sports, sports, sports: and the	 42.94569085320917
hub big: college. Something to catch the eye.	 192.38668881716762
There’s Hornblower standing at the porter’s lodge. Keep him on hands:	 69.92863251850744
might take a turn in there on the nod. How do you do, Mr Hornblower?	 59.014408415936025
How do you do, sir?	 20.287721620105867
Heavenly weather really. If life was always like that. Cricket weather.	 168.1365696301083
Sit around under sunshades. Over after over. Out. They can’t play it	 286.65313850649034
here. Duck for six wickets. Still Captain Culler broke a window in the	 102.25930264586896
Kildare street club with a slog to square leg. Donnybrook fair more in	 81.71472278694347
their line. And the skulls we were acracking when M’Carthy took the	 96.76501352048315
floor. Heatwave. Won’t last. Always passing, the stream of life, which	 192.78582770169896
in the stream of life we trace is dearer than them all.	 35.361644504083905
Enjoy a bath now: clean trough of water, cool enamel, the gentle tepid	 149.8344873352874
stream. This is my body.	 235.6114433591367
He foresaw his pale body reclined in it at full, naked, in a womb of	 52.99690994897618
warmth, oiled by scented melting soap, softly laved. He saw his trunk	 111.23312069138733
and limbs riprippled over and sustained, buoyed lightly upward,	 100.60638133046336
lemonyellow: his navel, bud of flesh: and saw the dark tangled curls of	 21.697632200158687
his bush floating, floating hair of the stream around the limp father	 165.21896884892138
of thousands, a languid floating flower.	 175.16718551619007
[ 6 ]	 463.94842625767166
Martin Cunningham, first, poked his silkhatted head into the creaking	 81.10966613415866
carriage and, entering deftly, seated himself. Mr Power stepped in	 78.05380865018621
after him, curving his height with care.	 90.0801007843722
—Come on, Simon.	 100.73605184820055
—After you, Mr Bloom said.	 36.18782793715306
Mr Dedalus covered himself quickly and got in, saying:	 78.92590171339052
—Yes, yes.	 51.775750238693824
—Are we all here now? Martin Cunningham asked. Come along, Bloom.	 58.49324898713873
Mr Bloom entered and sat in the vacant place. He pulled the door to	 59.61390334119442
after him and slammed it twice till it shut tight. He passed an arm	 84.68360823505085
through the armstrap and looked seriously from the open carriagewindow	 31.9606892101215
at the lowered blinds of the avenue. One dragged aside: an old woman	 42.02476316476001
peeping. Nose whiteflattened against the pane. Thanking her stars she	 66.23560952857258
was passed over. Extraordinary the interest they take in a corpse. Glad	 139.58939178170297
to see us go we give them such trouble coming. Job seems to suit them.	 85.37876154330925
Huggermugger in corners. Slop about in slipperslappers for fear he’d	 47.18776618120171
wake. Then getting it ready. Laying it out. Molly and Mrs Fleming	 94.15252769631637
making the bed. Pull it more to your side. Our windingsheet. Never know	 143.13390237109797
who will touch you dead. Wash and shampoo. I believe they clip the	 65.01611081445827
nails and the hair. Keep a bit in an envelope. Grows all the same	 109.91691648010843
after. Unclean job.	 434.2829988469279
All waited. Nothing was said. Stowing in the wreaths probably. I am	 84.61607553431284
sitting on something hard. Ah, that soap: in my hip pocket. Better	 94.26368850020985
shift it out of that. Wait for an opportunity.	 78.94029131433952
All waited. Then wheels were heard from in front, turning: then nearer:	 263.660557464123
then horses’ hoofs. A jolt. Their carriage began to move, creaking and	 73.6725298615059
swaying. Other hoofs and creaking wheels started behind. The blinds of	 66.09659123265422
the avenue passed and number nine with its craped knocker, door ajar.	 89.64553839586947
At walking pace.	 236.86443945181352
They waited still, their knees jogging, till they had turned and were	 127.13557633243899
passing along the tramtracks. Tritonville road. Quicker. The wheels	 60.34508855666467
rattled rolling over the cobbled causeway and the crazy glasses shook	 56.32908716963908
rattling in the doorframes.	 58.71561609708912
—What way is he taking us? Mr Power asked through both windows.	 118.23149550309208
—Irishtown, Martin Cunningham said. Ringsend. Brunswick street.	 10.169715111163478
Mr Dedalus nodded, looking out.	 30.48152219290139
—That’s a fine old custom, he said. I am glad to see it has not died	 52.64092593653901
out.	 536.8554774050247
All watched awhile through their windows caps and hats lifted by	 219.35566922522915
passers. Respect. The carriage swerved from the tramtrack to the	 30.387312575911615
smoother road past Watery lane. Mr Bloom at gaze saw a lithe young man,	 99.12986911262166
clad in mourning, a wide hat.	 67.9999749965903
—There’s a friend of yours gone by, Dedalus, he said.	 106.67775436835512
—Who is that?	 32.8634908728029
—Your son and heir.	 119.60738526786753
—Where is he? Mr Dedalus said, stretching over across.	 40.48869626183207
The carriage, passing the open drains and mounds of rippedup roadway	 25.458087349229377
before the tenement houses, lurched round the corner and, swerving back	 48.73540434711919
to the tramtrack, rolled on noisily with chattering wheels. Mr Dedalus	 54.19663996805759
fell back, saying:	 783.6121325243339
—Was that Mulligan cad with him? His _fidus Achates_!	 34.55963149174642
—No, Mr Bloom said. He was alone.	 32.522789618109385
—Down with his aunt Sally, I suppose, Mr Dedalus said, the Goulding	 59.0165696422739
faction, the drunken little costdrawer and Crissie, papa’s little lump	 46.01710270523084
of dung, the wise child that knows her own father.	 120.8810592373051
Mr Bloom smiled joylessly on Ringsend road. Wallace Bros: the	 36.90361638631576
bottleworks: Dodder bridge.	 35.532872428625566
Richie Goulding and the legal bag. Goulding, Collis and Ward he calls	 39.21805190108611
the firm. His jokes are getting a bit damp. Great card he was. Waltzing	 105.47999695568521
in Stamer street with Ignatius Gallaher on a Sunday morning, the	 49.51355614967636
landlady’s two hats pinned on his head. Out on the rampage all night.	 20.41825916009894
Beginning to tell on him now: that backache of his, I fear. Wife	 118.31073267472615
ironing his back. Thinks he’ll cure it with pills. All breadcrumbs they	 48.87301503921348
are. About six hundred per cent profit.	 95.60323869482627
—He’s in with a lowdown crowd, Mr Dedalus snarled. That Mulligan is a	 81.83566722692763
contaminated bloody doubledyed ruffian by all accounts. His name stinks	 64.30226590055669
all over Dublin. But with the help of God and His blessed mother I’ll	 74.69949519809933
make it my business to write a letter one of those days to his mother	 70.9804126630447
or his aunt or whatever she is that will open her eye as wide as a	 68.35724125220221
gate. I’ll tickle his catastrophe, believe you me.	 219.38627287382423
He cried above the clatter of the wheels:	 28.8333367286832
—I won’t have her bastard of a nephew ruin my son. A counterjumper’s	 42.88707607061846
son. Selling tapes in my cousin, Peter Paul M’Swiney’s. Not likely.	 68.89053235194504
He ceased. Mr Bloom glanced from his angry moustache to Mr Power’s mild	 40.1491933945533
face and Martin Cunningham’s eyes and beard, gravely shaking. Noisy	 198.11149539920498
selfwilled man. Full of his son. He is right. Something to hand on. If	 135.9480403252416
little Rudy had lived. See him grow up. Hear his voice in the house.	 77.99468618861559
Walking beside Molly in an Eton suit. My son. Me in his eyes. Strange	 99.61024895131523
feeling it would be. From me. Just a chance. Must have been that	 81.82105301142226
morning in Raymond terrace she was at the window watching the two dogs	 50.75169701436442
at it by the wall of the cease to do evil. And the sergeant grinning	 42.19099868056359
up. She had that cream gown on with the rip she never stitched. Give us	 169.84170604941644
a touch, Poldy. God, I’m dying for it. How life begins.	 209.8551376053374
Got big then. Had to refuse the Greystones concert. My son inside her.	 140.26631379628745
I could have helped him on in life. I could. Make him independent.	 49.33030620605832
Learn German too.	 374.2290100574793
—Are we late? Mr Power asked.	 35.270610029470774
—Ten minutes, Martin Cunningham said, looking at his watch.	 47.3853881078781
Molly. Milly. Same thing watered down. Her tomboy oaths. O jumping	 136.27927540930568
Jupiter! Ye gods and little fishes! Still, she’s a dear girl. Soon be a	 64.66796095647197
woman. Mullingar. Dearest Papli. Young student. Yes, yes: a woman too.	 86.35421089390088
Life, life.	 566.0038542126824
The carriage heeled over and back, their four trunks swaying.	 126.86014303501207
—Corny might have given us a more commodious yoke, Mr Power said.	 51.83383410877196
—He might, Mr Dedalus said, if he hadn’t that squint troubling him. Do	 43.64200088203214
you follow me?	 91.1808627358194
He closed his left eye. Martin Cunningham began to brush away	 23.478652060982782
crustcrumbs from under his thighs.	 32.74381392031642
—What is this, he said, in the name of God? Crumbs?	 22.03219835913569

All raised their thighs and eyed with disfavour the mildewed buttonless	 42.23179461738649

and said:	 122.77428401338109
—Unless I’m greatly mistaken. What do you think, Martin?	 48.847350475962415
—It struck me too, Martin Cunningham said.	 44.89196224370947
Mr Bloom set his thigh down. Glad I took that bath. Feel my feet quite	 105.83303426208838
clean. But I wish Mrs Fleming had darned these socks better.	 227.97831710001162
Mr Dedalus sighed resignedly.	 18.426080005215642

The carriage halted short.	 56.74296452339673
—What’s wrong?	 56.02246855667077
—We’re stopped.	 925.6139641182432
—Where are we?	 75.40370135900108
Mr Bloom put his head out of the window.	 19.82431250137446
—The grand canal, he said.	 29.205611695058266
Gasworks. Whooping cough they say it cures. Good job Milly never got	 78.61402826419793
it. Poor children! Doubles them up black and blue in convulsions. Shame	 142.5329035882953
really. Got off lightly with illnesses compared. Only measles. Flaxseed	 90.97760407781722
tea. Scarlatina, influenza epidemics. Canvassing for death. Don’t miss	 73.44352372632795
this chance. Dogs’ home over there. Poor old Athos! Be good to Athos,	 103.05765681368842
Leopold, is my last wish. Thy will be done. We obey them in the grave.	 60.03440291489002
A dying scrawl. He took it to heart, pined away. Quiet brute. Old men’s	 93.88743115939857
dogs usually are.	 316.07319933208566
A raindrop spat on his hat. He drew back and saw an instant of shower	 18.311890746325442
spray dots over the grey flags. Apart. Curious. Like through a	 57.157457963463436
colander. I thought it would. My boots were creaking I remember now.	 97.24203788296997
—The weather is changing, he said quietly.	 53.72128017691377
—A pity it did not keep up fine, Martin Cunningham said.	 73.01584560475996
—Wanted for the country, Mr Power said. There’s the sun again coming	 64.08011827356928
out.	 536.8554774050247
Mr Dedalus, peering through his glasses towards the veiled sun, hurled	 51.77615108422652
a mute curse at the sky.	 124.34839900038834
—It’s as uncertain as a child’s bottom, he said.	 42.80666876444528
—We’re off again.	 499.7080069184414
The carriage turned again its stiff wheels and their trunks swayed	 70.11401287022576
gently. Martin Cunningham twirled more quickly the peak of his beard.	 119.61752927382169
—Tom Kernan was immense last night, he said. And Paddy Leonard taking	 42.248615917786935
him off to his face.	 94.65934862653718

—Immense, Martin Cunningham said pompously. _His singing of that simple	 59.85305491715577

whole course of my experience._	 153.95721035842843
—Trenchant, Mr Power said laughing. He’s dead nuts on that. And the	 15.224119489312226
retrospective arrangement.	 133.72607750086735
—Did you read Dan Dawson’s speech? Martin Cunningham asked.	 68.1303627442674
—I did not then, Mr Dedalus said. Where is it?	 41.14093832064566
—In the paper this morning.	 57.63667186863937
Mr Bloom took the paper from his inside pocket. That book I must change	 48.86102210884048
for her.	 85.90148447531894
—No, no, Mr Dedalus said quickly. Later on please.	 41.643231184722396
Mr Bloom’s glance travelled down the edge of the paper, scanning the	 34.466686957576535

Peake is that? is it the chap was in Crosbie and Alleyne’s? no, Sexton,	 30.009235280097272
Urbright. Inked characters fast fading on the frayed breaking paper.	 35.24545660370804
Thanks to the Little Flower. Sadly missed. To the inexpressible grief	 82.34431882356729
of his. Aged 88 after a long and tedious illness. Month’s mind:	 53.6062888154529
Quinlan. On whose soul Sweet Jesus have mercy.	 224.5275692216899
It is now a month since dear Henry fled	 156.78707558427743
To his home up above in the sky	 196.3338910956926
While his family weeps and mourns his loss	 76.74744956058464
Hoping some day to meet him on high.	 145.91155175559726
I tore up the envelope? Yes. Where did I put her letter after I read it	 87.47609233370358
in the bath? He patted his waistcoatpocket. There all right. Dear Henry	 36.2957066337072
fled. Before my patience are exhausted.	 60.61574629827457
National school. Meade’s yard. The hazard. Only two there now. Nodding.	 137.8733210459736
Full as a tick. Too much bone in their skulls. The other trotting round	 64.80346491576994

hats.	 15957.18943640877
A pointsman’s back straightened itself upright suddenly against a	 94.04553174075906
tramway standard by Mr Bloom’s window. Couldn’t they invent something	 173.68559367519987
automatic so that the wheel itself much handier? Well but that fellow	 90.88235059094433
would lose his job then? Well but then another fellow would get a job	 147.05053673080246
making the new invention?	 123.31814760377544
Antient concert rooms. Nothing on there. A man in a buff suit with a	 49.364074933603035

perhaps.	 3260.0337285126466
They went past the bleak pulpit of saint Mark’s, under the railway	 21.78035606015799

Stratton, Mrs Bandmann Palmer. Could I go to see _Leah_ tonight, I	 75.08199069061666
