—I mean, for Willie Hughes, Mr Best said, amending his gloss easily. Of	 49.436999100535445
course it’s all paradox, don’t you know, Hughes and hews and hues, the	 37.9925709600571
colour, but it’s so typical the way he works it out. It’s the very	 59.052804585248836
essence of Wilde, don’t you know. The light touch.	 35.56369066468271
His glance touched their faces lightly as he smiled, a blond ephebe.	 85.40908072965117
Tame essence of Wilde.	 19.00059505508119
You’re darned witty. Three drams of usquebaugh you drank with Dan	 145.27949727863341
Deasy’s ducats.	 4.411654744205047
How much did I spend? O, a few shillings.	 73.58272568069403
For a plump of pressmen. Humour wet and dry.	 133.66571161886696
Wit. You would give your five wits for youth’s proud livery he pranks	 56.63337633023106
in. Lineaments of gratified desire.	 48.53633896475087
There be many mo. Take her for me. In pairing time. Jove, a cool	 78.36745432214427
ruttime send them. Yea, turtledove her.	 37.28328691263916
Eve. Naked wheatbellied sin. A snake coils her, fang in’s kiss.	 66.61095591382477
—Do you think it is only a paradox? the quaker librarian was asking.	 29.03943996382707
The mocker is never taken seriously when he is most serious.	 42.05226836123796
They talked seriously of mocker’s seriousness.	 22.702646148708435
Buck Mulligan’s again heavy face eyed Stephen awhile. Then, his head	 130.8103109193377
wagging, he came near, drew a folded telegram from his pocket. His	 87.19653720486754
mobile lips read, smiling with new delight.	 103.62366344725746
—Telegram! he said. Wonderful inspiration! Telegram! A papal bull!	 159.45002135999547
He sat on a corner of the unlit desk, reading aloud joyfully:	 28.21164765407144
—_The sentimentalist is he who would enjoy without incurring the	 34.50493056934183
immense debtorship for a thing done._ Signed: Dedalus. Where did you	 52.92222298069213
launch it from? The kips? No. College Green. Have you drunk the four	 63.95349320804631
quid? The aunt is going to call on your unsubstantial father. Telegram!	 102.65325847418093
Malachi Mulligan, The Ship, lower Abbey street. O, you peerless mummer!	 82.21704763887884
O, you priestified Kinchite!	 45.21812051072249
Joyfully he thrust message and envelope into a pocket but keened in a	 53.37804942055678
querulous brogue:	 4.411654744205047
—It’s what I’m telling you, mister honey, it’s queer and sick we were,	 78.98248014550629
Haines and myself, the time himself brought it in. ’Twas murmur we did	 224.85255210193426
for a gallus potion would rouse a friar, I’m thinking, and he limp with	 48.214631513516075
leching. And we one hour and two hours and three hours in Connery’s	 95.34306644518213
sitting civil waiting for pints apiece.	 89.84681471955622
He wailed:	 17.715973535144567
—And we to be there, mavrone, and you to be unbeknownst sending us your	 69.32316408274211
conglomerations the way we to have our tongues out a yard long like the	 56.947924751724905
drouthy clerics do be fainting for a pussful.	 19.87376181745498
Stephen laughed.	 227.29204307722688
Quickly, warningfully Buck Mulligan bent down.	 74.39196343106421
—The tramper Synge is looking for you, he said, to murder you. He heard	 30.4894389238306
you pissed on his halldoor in Glasthule. He’s out in pampooties to	 38.282427014788674
murder you.	 219.038221457243
—Me! Stephen exclaimed. That was your contribution to literature.	 100.02126963033852
Buck Mulligan gleefully bent back, laughing to the dark eavesdropping	 57.71151605187762
ceiling.	 4.608171674364364
—Murder you! he laughed.	 215.97686814852327
Harsh gargoyle face that warred against me over our mess of hash of	 46.17453149700468
lights in rue Saint-André-des-Arts. In words of words for words,	 89.36807554485969
palabras. Oisin with Patrick. Faunman he met in Clamart woods,	 27.24848852319764
brandishing a winebottle. _C’est vendredi saint!_ Murthering Irish. His	 66.6698175912549
image, wandering, he met. I mine. I met a fool i’the forest.	 260.5566734490354
—Mr Lyster, an attendant said from the door ajar.	 59.25030125638508
—... in which everyone can find his own. So Mr Justice Madden in his	 71.02825959966998

What is it?	 17.251153159601138
—There’s a gentleman here, sir, the attendant said, coming forward and	 61.933530592713716
offering a card. From the _Freeman._ He wants to see the files of the	 30.518861910989504
_Kilkenny People_ for last year.	 93.01648841627507
—Certainly, certainly, certainly. Is the gentleman?...	 25.24156143860184
He took the eager card, glanced, not saw, laid down unglanced, looked,	 207.77245596861505
asked, creaked, asked:	 458.5007104144637
—Is he?... O, there!	 235.7428598396415
Brisk in a galliard he was off, out. In the daylit corridor he talked	 51.46339869245631
with voluble pains of zeal, in duty bound, most fair, most kind, most	 129.13154688037386
honest broadbrim.	 248.22175442202897
—This gentleman? _Freeman’s Journal? Kilkenny People?_ To be sure. Good	 46.913444581266866
day, sir. _Kilkenny_... We have certainly...	 57.4209926777035
A patient silhouette waited, listening.	 235.8221637359624
—All the leading provincial... _Northern Whig, Cork Examiner,	 55.79966409977242
Enniscorthy Guardian,_ 1903... Will you please?... Evans, conduct this	 56.22960415140606
gentleman... If you just follow the atten... Or, please allow me...	 45.5554203158599
This way... Please, sir...	 200.94075540797425
Voluble, dutiful, he led the way to all the provincial papers, a bowing	 71.71457270226213
dark figure following his hasty heels.	 261.47392957523044
The door closed.	 30.077678358296076
—The sheeny! Buck Mulligan cried.	 13.061380342026828
He jumped up and snatched the card.	 27.900625674987666
—What’s his name? Ikey Moses? Bloom.	 166.05322154157247
He rattled on:	 82.98837169173285
—Jehovah, collector of prepuces, is no more. I found him over in the	 34.01392252680755
museum where I went to hail the foamborn Aphrodite. The Greek mouth	 83.62001763273965
that has never been twisted in prayer. Every day we must do homage to	 59.04792044149411
her. _Life of life, thy lips enkindle._	 77.00695455785413
Suddenly he turned to Stephen:	 117.26409294236028
—He knows you. He knows your old fellow. O, I fear me, he is Greeker	 92.85082038377226
than the Greeks. His pale Galilean eyes were upon her mesial groove.	 53.444350782681255
Venus Kallipyge. O, the thunder of those loins! _The god pursuing the	 92.84270803852586
maiden hid_.	 243.73473277769304
—We want to hear more, John Eglinton decided with Mr Best’s approval.	 46.34609683064891
We begin to be interested in Mrs S. Till now we had thought of her, if	 102.3339056970301
at all, as a patient Griselda, a Penelope stayathome.	 92.9834391329282
—Antisthenes, pupil of Gorgias, Stephen said, took the palm of beauty	 28.140216024715144
from Kyrios Menelaus’ brooddam, Argive Helen, the wooden mare of Troy	 49.535827359465934
in whom a score of heroes slept, and handed it to poor Penelope. Twenty	 67.33848793402909
years he lived in London and, during part of that time, he drew a	 101.3450230394138
salary equal to that of the lord chancellor of Ireland. His life was	 49.387574022673945
rich. His art, more than the art of feudalism as Walt Whitman called	 97.25621933874116
it, is the art of surfeit. Hot herringpies, green mugs of sack,	 52.30009957492492
honeysauces, sugar of roses, marchpane, gooseberried pigeons,	 35.42189662958113
ringocandies. Sir Walter Raleigh, when they arrested him, had half a	 52.260201794062326
million francs on his back including a pair of fancy stays. The	 45.18185641767621
gombeenwoman Eliza Tudor had underlinen enough to vie with her of	 33.43658496802694
Sheba. Twenty years he dallied there between conjugial love and its	 110.20708285867718
chaste delights and scortatory love and its foul pleasures. You know	 46.5728203651735
Manningham’s story of the burgher’s wife who bade Dick Burbage to her	 54.1905617709099
bed after she had seen him in _Richard III_ and how Shakespeare,	 90.52710821290961
overhearing, without more ado about nothing, took the cow by the horns	 103.74007000939048
and, when Burbage came knocking at the gate, answered from the capon’s	 37.16302804368005
blankets: _William the conqueror came before Richard III_. And the gay	 100.4165883807298
lakin, mistress Fitton, mount and cry O, and his dainty birdsnies, lady	 159.09020490957033
Penelope Rich, a clean quality woman is suited for a player, and the	 87.79287121188173
punks of the bankside, a penny a time.	 26.23438891481201
Cours la Reine. _Encore vingt sous. Nous ferons de petites	 15.016823683053012
cochonneries. Minette? Tu veux?_	 4.045570071155129
—The height of fine society. And sir William Davenant of Oxford’s	 51.12458525602318
mother with her cup of canary for any cockcanary.	 87.51008543095223
Buck Mulligan, his pious eyes upturned, prayed:	 93.19119313243343
—Blessed Margaret Mary Anycock!	 160.12790135390026
—And Harry of six wives’ daughter. And other lady friends from	 136.76136482909945
neighbour seats as Lawn Tennyson, gentleman poet, sings. But all those	 124.5988837155811
twenty years what do you suppose poor Penelope in Stratford was doing	 71.60937342954824
behind the diamond panes?	 107.58834946229798
Do and do. Thing done. In a rosery of Fetter lane of Gerard, herbalist,	 37.83825766156334
he walks, greyedauburn. An azured harebell like her veins. Lids of	 41.893664708848085
Juno’s eyes, violets. He walks. One life is all. One body. Do. But do.	 130.10392470041066
Afar, in a reek of lust and squalor, hands are laid on whiteness.	 76.13554038480154
Buck Mulligan rapped John Eglinton’s desk sharply.	 20.075580979066583
—Whom do you suspect? he challenged.	 58.967967618156386
—Say that he is the spurned lover in the sonnets. Once spurned twice	 52.507219730333624
spurned. But the court wanton spurned him for a lord, his dearmylove.	 119.41092925508298
Love that dare not speak its name.	 83.55429438010486
—As an Englishman, you mean, John sturdy Eglinton put in, he loved a	 144.22192003142607
lord.	 1934.5542720362105
Old wall where sudden lizards flash. At Charenton I watched them.	 117.22631290475827
—It seems so, Stephen said, when he wants to do for him, and for all	 53.84809133774054
other and singular uneared wombs, the holy office an ostler does for	 92.26860683946681
the stallion. Maybe, like Socrates, he had a midwife to mother as he	 54.455479892902574
had a shrew to wife. But she, the giglot wanton, did not break a	 66.54063496019927
bedvow. Two deeds are rank in that ghost’s mind: a broken vow and the	 39.709911137076254
dullbrained yokel on whom her favour has declined, deceased husband’s	 34.45430017695486
brother. Sweet Ann, I take it, was hot in the blood. Once a wooer,	 90.0632384994115
twice a wooer.	 75.75600408293656
Stephen turned boldly in his chair.	 48.191843999927194
—The burden of proof is with you not with me, he said frowning. If you	 60.47220367029311
deny that in the fifth scene of _Hamlet_ he has branded her with infamy	 87.39244563487362
tell me why there is no mention of her during the thirtyfour years	 84.62442234816908
between the day she married him and the day she buried him. All those	 73.29242585110859
women saw their men down and under: Mary, her goodman John, Ann, her	 258.0706563719596
poor dear Willun, when he went and died on her, raging that he was the	 46.98663365104452
first to go, Joan, her four brothers, Judith, her husband and all her	 112.26720301925297
sons, Susan, her husband too, while Susan’s daughter, Elizabeth, to use	 225.94149177704986
granddaddy’s words, wed her second, having killed her first.	 110.8653963523111
O, yes, mention there is. In the years when he was living richly in	 36.18214585728954
royal London to pay a debt she had to borrow forty shillings from her	 83.08085774451872
father’s shepherd. Explain you then. Explain the swansong too wherein	 107.81641270498673
he has commended her to posterity.	 28.37857580126012
He faced their silence.	 50.59210845858695
To whom thus Eglinton: You mean the will.	 214.85309429878785
But that has been explained, I believe, by jurists.	 60.09089022568331
She was entitled to her widow’s dower	 18.54814816895895
At common law. His legal knowledge was great	 168.30495713865832
Our judges tell us.	 73.43297905468597
Him Satan fleers,	 27.46528477615132
Mocker:	 4.608171674364364
And therefore he left out her name	 122.7771608944329
From the first draft but he did not leave out	 37.995255523105506

—Pretty countryfolk had few chattels then, John Eglinton observed, as	 146.67006262827348
they have still if our peasant plays are true to type.	 77.75116400673372

shareholder, a bill promoter, a tithefarmer. Why did he not leave her	 34.5728192443004
his best bed if he wished her to snore away the rest of her nights in	 56.85266903360686
peace?	 14448.063627469233
—It is clear that there were two beds, a best and a secondbest, Mr	 112.9823959473622

smiled on.	 606.4493289281994

Let me think.	 52.62567989983264
—Antiquity mentions that Stagyrite schoolurchin and bald heathen sage,	 47.356808755505135
Stephen said, who when dying in exile frees and endows his slaves, pays	 55.234505072580724

dead wife and bids his friends be kind to an old mistress (don’t forget	 158.71072906978358
Nell Gwynn Herpyllis) and let her live in his villa.	 20.083240414644973

a king. O, I must tell you what Dowden said!	 57.086519739874404

William Shakespeare and company, limited. The people’s William. For	 151.66733784346033

Catamite.	 4.608171674364364

ugling Eglinton.	 175.88802230952453
Steadfast John replied severe:	 51.41664414710778
—The doctor can tell us what those words mean. You cannot eat your cake	 102.93184473086922
and have it.	 85.74739836823164
Sayest thou so? Will they wrest from us, from me, the palm of beauty?	 79.89935429195064
—And the sense of property, Stephen said. He drew Shylock out of his	 41.375533746859126
own long pocket. The son of a maltjobber and moneylender he was himself	 49.1858909255852
a cornjobber and moneylender, with ten tods of corn hoarded in the	 15.64961840500251
famine riots. His borrowers are no doubt those divers of worship	 65.6812705426752
mentioned by Chettle Falstaff who reported his uprightness of dealing.	 22.85231547804788
He sued a fellowplayer for the price of a few bags of malt and exacted	 16.532543523995667
his pound of flesh in interest for every money lent. How else could	 107.11243754270933
Aubrey’s ostler and callboy get rich quick? All events brought grist to	 44.648222777568
his mill. Shylock chimes with the jewbaiting that followed the hanging	 32.01337071847651
and quartering of the queen’s leech Lopez, his jew’s heart being	 47.03921194279026
plucked forth while the sheeny was yet alive: _Hamlet_ and _Macbeth_	 83.73186262678671
with the coming to the throne of a Scotch philosophaster with a turn	 82.02711429683454
for witchroasting. The lost armada is his jeer in _Love’s Labour Lost_.	 66.4831651525894
His pageants, the histories, sail fullbellied on a tide of Mafeking	 31.069460433148148
enthusiasm. Warwickshire jesuits are tried and we have a porter’s	 24.716488067000302
theory of equivocation. The _Sea Venture_ comes home from Bermudas and	 51.99953353114254
the play Renan admired is written with Patsy Caliban, our American	 81.27523307343748
cousin. The sugared sonnets follow Sidney’s. As for fay Elizabeth,	 62.17738471551634
otherwise carrotty Bess, the gross virgin who inspired _The Merry Wives	 57.78393572253249
of Windsor_, let some meinherr from Almany grope his life long for	 39.25669160291265
deephid meanings in the depths of the buckbasket.	 4.8738781086507625
I think you’re getting on very nicely. Just mix up a mixture of	 38.05499195368611
theolologicophilolological. _Mingo, minxi, mictum, mingere._	 3.933542382544028
—Prove that he was a jew, John Eglinton dared, expectantly. Your dean	 40.59833192054218
of studies holds he was a holy Roman.	 77.34565750801374
_Sufflaminandus sum._	 252.39441725579402
—He was made in Germany, Stephen replied, as the champion French	 72.15918689061577
polisher of Italian scandals.	 21.69603683665332
—A myriadminded man, Mr Best reminded. Coleridge called him	 43.37804636963517
myriadminded.	 4.608171674364364
_Amplius. In societate humana hoc est maxime necessarium ut sit	 25.272787840404494
amicitia inter multos._	 4.206040932916629
—Saint Thomas, Stephen began...	 132.19209559133293
—_Ora pro nobis_, Monk Mulligan groaned, sinking to a chair.	 81.58794550348449
There he keened a wailing rune.	 15.486720477450765
—_Pogue mahone! Acushla machree!_ It’s destroyed we are from this day!	 28.967276650190634
It’s destroyed we are surely!	 59.37182979631085
All smiled their smiles.	 280.0969478616258
—Saint Thomas, Stephen smiling said, whose gorbellied works I enjoy	 213.6625054816591
reading in the original, writing of incest from a standpoint different	 55.85291158337229
from that of the new Viennese school Mr Magee spoke of, likens it in	 81.44083300001205
his wise and curious way to an avarice of the emotions. He means that	 78.55407948478505
the love so given to one near in blood is covetously withheld from some	 142.05720981277733
stranger who, it may be, hungers for it. Jews, whom christians tax with	 87.72448506897358
avarice, are of all races the most given to intermarriage. Accusations	 38.48044469529705
are made in anger. The christian laws which built up the hoards of the	 34.64200942153549
jews (for whom, as for the lollards, storm was shelter) bound their	 141.6384475282248
affections too with hoops of steel. Whether these be sins or virtues	 89.66428433659563
old Nobodaddy will tell us at doomsday leet. But a man who holds so	 75.12008956549614
tightly to what he calls his rights over what he calls his debts will	 38.60110909746565
hold tightly also to what he calls his rights over her whom he calls	 74.78839187817461
his wife. No sir smile neighbour shall covet his ox or his wife or his	 77.8515653949959
manservant or his maidservant or his jackass.	 23.092974066769923
—Or his jennyass, Buck Mulligan antiphoned.	 39.134270688615366
—Gentle Will is being roughly handled, gentle Mr Best said gently.	 219.41505799009508
—Which will? gagged sweetly Buck Mulligan. We are getting mixed.	 106.20570448244897
—The will to live, John Eglinton philosophised, for poor Ann, Will’s	 82.69176090149466
widow, is the will to die.	 164.7918863224346
_—Requiescat!_ Stephen prayed.	 87.88801234720678
What of all the will to do?	 98.92040132296572
It has vanished long ago...	 57.71426396931559
—She lies laid out in stark stiffness in that secondbest bed, the	 38.21183408664174
mobled queen, even though you prove that a bed in those days was as	 111.80815224939735
rare as a motorcar is now and that its carvings were the wonder of	 98.75522518836668
seven parishes. In old age she takes up with gospellers (one stayed	 74.80340506201661
with her at New Place and drank a quart of sack the town council paid	 79.73851829524155
for but in which bed he slept it skills not to ask) and heard she had a	 110.2747959606914
soul. She read or had read to her his chapbooks preferring them to the	 83.38989052427213
_Merry Wives_ and, loosing her nightly waters on the jordan, she	 40.397932161239424
thought over _Hooks and Eyes for Believers’ Breeches_ and _The most	 133.2621296378044
Spiritual Snuffbox to Make the Most Devout Souls Sneeze_. Venus has	 135.95426701141284
twisted her lips in prayer. Agenbite of inwit: remorse of conscience.	 57.38265632069908
It is an age of exhausted whoredom groping for its god.	 63.592000577490474
—History shows that to be true, _inquit Eglintonus Chronolologos_. The	 53.24261562506009
ages succeed one another. But we have it on high authority that a man’s	 75.53690766930752
worst enemies shall be those of his own house and family. I feel that	 72.90438154618647
Russell is right. What do we care for his wife or father? I should say	 70.85572547737287
that only family poets have family lives. Falstaff was not a family	 160.6808135165372
man. I feel that the fat knight is his supreme creation.	 61.99779020465634
Lean, he lay back. Shy, deny thy kindred, the unco guid. Shy, supping	 94.9425518686896
with the godless, he sneaks the cup. A sire in Ultonian Antrim bade it	 30.82039783139422
him. Visits him here on quarter days. Mr Magee, sir, there’s a	 101.20789640634275
gentleman to see you. Me? Says he’s your father, sir. Give me my	 114.29322012429576
Wordsworth. Enter Magee Mor Matthew, a rugged rough rugheaded kern, in	 27.32466202247003
strossers with a buttoned codpiece, his nether stocks bemired with	 19.64283102332854
clauber of ten forests, a wand of wilding in his hand.	 29.220147417389562
Your own? He knows your old fellow. The widower.	 148.1280353475639
Hurrying to her squalid deathlair from gay Paris on the quayside I	 30.851124552592413
touched his hand. The voice, new warmth, speaking. Dr Bob Kenny is	 165.62001339747803
attending her. The eyes that wish me well. But do not know me.	 107.3477087972999
—A father, Stephen said, battling against hopelessness, is a necessary	 49.56437709258442
evil. He wrote the play in the months that followed his father’s death.	 132.28193199476544
If you hold that he, a greying man with two marriageable daughters,	 62.815416540303076
with thirtyfive years of life, _nel mezzo del cammin di nostra vita_,	 20.948522591786638
with fifty of experience, is the beardless undergraduate from	 47.65550745382464
Wittenberg then you must hold that his seventyyear old mother is the	 72.11899061227665
lustful queen. No. The corpse of John Shakespeare does not walk the	 173.3909765748043
night. From hour to hour it rots and rots. He rests, disarmed of	 69.07893163664627
fatherhood, having devised that mystical estate upon his son.	 84.15495172038813
Boccaccio’s Calandrino was the first and last man who felt himself with	 56.80598037387535
child. Fatherhood, in the sense of conscious begetting, is unknown to	 54.54669210979392
man. It is a mystical estate, an apostolic succession, from only	 86.23691868067036
begetter to only begotten. On that mystery and not on the madonna which	 64.43005350194794
the cunning Italian intellect flung to the mob of Europe the church is	 110.87333164393708
founded and founded irremovably because founded, like the world, macro	 91.58152470451921
and microcosm, upon the void. Upon incertitude, upon unlikelihood.	 46.078484381920596
_Amor matris_, subjective and objective genitive, may be the only true	 29.833931035020726
thing in life. Paternity may be a legal fiction. Who is the father of	 51.578068595216244
any son that any son should love him or he any son?	 167.93438915603494
What the hell are you driving at?	 108.45027584632815
I know. Shut up. Blast you. I have reasons.	 57.32505371393637
_Amplius. Adhuc. Iterum. Postea._	 4.045570071155129
Are you condemned to do this?	 41.62963779235799
—They are sundered by a bodily shame so steadfast that the criminal	 32.9365447560485
annals of the world, stained with all other incests and bestialities,	 17.797486785541203
hardly record its breach. Sons with mothers, sires with daughters,	 52.06618426281102
lesbic sisters, loves that dare not speak their name, nephews with	 97.3087535694837
grandmothers, jailbirds with keyholes, queens with prize bulls. The son	 24.972505462904365
unborn mars beauty: born, he brings pain, divides affection, increases	 45.752269149165194
care. He is a new male: his growth is his father’s decline, his youth	 107.75849886868335
his father’s envy, his friend his father’s enemy.	 78.03333080641693
In rue Monsieur-le-Prince I thought it.	 24.4983852876338
—What links them in nature? An instant of blind rut.	 69.32061707917407
Am I a father? If I were?	 125.27286862915102
Shrunken uncertain hand.	 30.945392427615115
—Sabellius, the African, subtlest heresiarch of all the beasts of the	 29.744267576898757
field, held that the Father was Himself His Own Son. The bulldog of	 58.45261644883566
Aquin, with whom no word shall be impossible, refutes him. Well: if the	 64.55703124096713
father who has not a son be not a father can the son who has not a	 108.56087625398526
father be a son? When Rutlandbaconsouthamptonshakespeare or another	 238.7444963575429
poet of the same name in the comedy of errors wrote _Hamlet_ he was not	 38.33567420517796
the father of his own son merely but, being no more a son, he was and	 46.39373565461211
felt himself the father of all his race, the father of his own	 60.84048121121744
grandfather, the father of his unborn grandson who, by the same token,	 58.984939398938515
never was born, for nature, as Mr Magee understands her, abhors	 78.14065451807167
perfection.	 4.608171674364364
Eglintoneyes, quick with pleasure, looked up shybrightly. Gladly	 222.12378278388087
glancing, a merry puritan, through the twisted eglantine.	 131.81305089091538
Flatter. Rarely. But flatter.	 15.707047647395271
—Himself his own father, Sonmulligan told himself. Wait. I am big with	 115.69110414537626
child. I have an unborn child in my brain. Pallas Athena! A play! The	 69.00419250238177
play’s the thing! Let me parturiate!	 62.94330620227676
He clasped his paunchbrow with both birthaiding hands.	 37.934000104919456
—As for his family, Stephen said, his mother’s name lives in the forest	 75.51952910255328
of Arden. Her death brought from him the scene with Volumnia in	 59.72874349830749
_Coriolanus._ His boyson’s death is the deathscene of young Arthur in	 37.8399323608744
_King John._ Hamlet, the black prince, is Hamnet Shakespeare. Who the	 205.32493451326397
girls in _The Tempest_, in _Pericles,_ in _Winter’s Tale_ are we know.	 70.24711363653567
Who Cleopatra, fleshpot of Egypt, and Cressid and Venus are we may	 46.346746293136725
guess. But there is another member of his family who is recorded.	 24.753939424401953
—The plot thickens, John Eglinton said.	 14.204153718448765
The quaker librarian, quaking, tiptoed in, quake, his mask, quake, with	 12.949725951709636
haste, quake, quack.	 76.34857751529675
Door closed. Cell. Day.	 152.58383882727668
They list. Three. They.	 346.2818724290939
I you he they.	 566.7560091897276
Come, mess.	 106.56698729013979
STEPHEN: He had three brothers, Gilbert, Edmund, Richard. Gilbert in	 108.78826161128741
his old age told some cavaliers he got a pass for nowt from Maister	 57.85588449298871
Gatherer one time mass he did and he seen his brud Maister Wull the	 38.62145702405948
playwriter up in Lunnon in a wrastling play wud a man on’s back. The	 40.46905221625815
playhouse sausage filled Gilbert’s soul. He is nowhere: but an Edmund	 82.64441621558949
and a Richard are recorded in the works of sweet William.	 78.61435784084325
MAGEEGLINJOHN: Names! What’s in a name?	 123.9737976333655
BEST: That is my name, Richard, don’t you know. I hope you are going to	 42.93112985045245
say a good word for Richard, don’t you know, for my sake. _(Laughter)_	 57.30660708909099
BUCKMULLIGAN: (_Piano, diminuendo_)	 57.71887509994948
Then outspoke medical Dick	 72.00688770498432
To his comrade medical Davy...	 72.2532286220634
STEPHEN: In his trinity of black Wills, the villain shakebags, Iago,	 30.690969170190304
Richard Crookback, Edmund in _King Lear_, two bear the wicked uncles’	 151.60612916003828
names. Nay, that last play was written or being written while his	 212.379969717133
brother Edmund lay dying in Southwark.	 113.59455403820539
BEST: I hope Edmund is going to catch it. I don’t want Richard, my name	 56.43310988314384
_(Laughter)_	 6551.2658316472025
QUAKERLYSTER: (_A tempo_) But he that filches from me my good name...	 60.31222111773233
STEPHEN: _(Stringendo)_ He has hidden his own name, a fair name,	 59.35658048116252
William, in the plays, a super here, a clown there, as a painter of old	 58.7267011788553
Italy set his face in a dark corner of his canvas. He has revealed it	 29.848865900842735
in the sonnets where there is Will in overplus. Like John o’Gaunt his	 92.40076987671482
name is dear to him, as dear as the coat and crest he toadied for, on a	 59.04239172057508
bend sable a spear or steeled argent, honorificabilitudinitatibus,	 58.240115023511756
dearer than his glory of greatest shakescene in the country. What’s in	 90.48963067367356
a name? That is what we ask ourselves in childhood when we write the	 86.6716218398264
name that we are told is ours. A star, a daystar, a firedrake, rose at	 114.51033147961653
his birth. It shone by day in the heavens alone, brighter than Venus in	 97.64351460889934
the night, and by night it shone over delta in Cassiopeia, the	 55.39421174456209
recumbent constellation which is the signature of his initial among the	 14.314887764834339
stars. His eyes watched it, lowlying on the horizon, eastward of the	 29.9888482406616
bear, as he walked by the slumberous summer fields at midnight	 78.68045246059357
returning from Shottery and from her arms.	 113.89910089915496
Both satisfied. I too.	 267.99635776977027
Don’t tell them he was nine years old when it was quenched.	 49.74711143279897
And from her arms.	 93.47999098335704

Lapwing.	 11117.55165057748

On.	 231.53714644224158
—You will say those names were already in the chronicles from which he	 62.88724841164541
took the stuff of his plays. Why did he take them rather than others?	 126.03708706841695
Richard, a whoreson crookback, misbegotten, makes love to a widowed Ann	 116.95284047427846
(what’s in a name?), woos and wins her, a whoreson merry widow. Richard	 85.78269828770675
the conqueror, third brother, came after William the conquered. The	 40.09067626340623
other four acts of that play hang limply from that first. Of all his	 91.80049157318705
kings Richard is the only king unshielded by Shakespeare’s reverence,	 93.86033030081391
the angel of the world. Why is the underplot of _King Lear_ in which	 23.774371384985656
Edmund figures lifted out of Sidney’s _Arcadia_ and spatchcocked on to	 42.315772694342044
a Celtic legend older than history?	 50.860995335081554
—That was Will’s way, John Eglinton defended. We should not now combine	 76.44541444042709
a Norse saga with an excerpt from a novel by George Meredith. _Que	 17.896884369487186
voulez-vous?_ Moore would say. He puts Bohemia on the seacoast and	 48.2507817912298
makes Ulysses quote Aristotle.	 29.92350315618314
—Why? Stephen answered himself. Because the theme of the false or the	 86.86611889468787
usurping or the adulterous brother or all three in one is to	 94.28690116289394
Shakespeare, what the poor are not, always with him. The note of	 152.97267711711123
banishment, banishment from the heart, banishment from home, sounds	 40.624555377651035
uninterruptedly from _The Two Gentlemen of Verona_ onward till Prospero	 31.11093191339887
breaks his staff, buries it certain fathoms in the earth and drowns his	 20.077016092440626
book. It doubles itself in the middle of his life, reflects itself in	 51.225132098084586
another, repeats itself, protasis, epitasis, catastasis, catastrophe.	 51.48007266474151
It repeats itself again when he is near the grave, when his married	 112.87929703852373
daughter Susan, chip of the old block, is accused of adultery. But it	 33.57855057155
was the original sin that darkened his understanding, weakened his will	 97.47453889551468
and left in him a strong inclination to evil. The words are those of my	 125.21058601486465
lords bishops of Maynooth. An original sin and, like original sin,	 40.469800790527636
committed by another in whose sin he too has sinned. It is between the	 160.41427526213783
lines of his last written words, it is petrified on his tombstone under	 62.20396667793461
which her four bones are not to be laid. Age has not withered it.	 133.07331138561932
Beauty and peace have not done it away. It is in infinite variety	 131.72369617105
everywhere in the world he has created, in _Much Ado about Nothing_,	 88.83700512918746
twice in _As you like It_, in _The Tempest_, in _Hamlet,_ in _Measure	 84.67171009671564
for Measure_—and in all the other plays which I have not read.	 66.04817286490673
He laughed to free his mind from his mind’s bondage.	 113.8796507846658
Judge Eglinton summed up.	 243.0228582125099
—The truth is midway, he affirmed. He is the ghost and the prince. He	 50.22882770986354
is all in all.	 137.43652985371358
—He is, Stephen said. The boy of act one is the mature man of act five.	 54.054698610431366
All in all. In _Cymbeline,_ in _Othello_ he is bawd and cuckold. He	 33.74707071697624
acts and is acted on. Lover of an ideal or a perversion, like José he	 47.078543552410366
kills the real Carmen. His unremitting intellect is the hornmad Iago	 45.9764814698825
ceaselessly willing that the moor in him shall suffer.	 77.92880929934617
—Cuckoo! Cuckoo! Cuck Mulligan clucked lewdly. O word of fear!	 132.9398617944829
Dark dome received, reverbed.	 148.89256444309999
—And what a character is Iago! undaunted John Eglinton exclaimed. When	 44.353082767515374
all is said Dumas _fils_ (or is it Dumas _père?)_ is right. After God	 54.638536240306735
Shakespeare has created most.	 122.99242389956532
—Man delights him not nor woman neither, Stephen said. He returns after	 176.7354083207369
a life of absence to that spot of earth where he was born, where he has	 94.33560097999307
always been, man and boy, a silent witness and there, his journey of	 140.1449454349322
life ended, he plants his mulberrytree in the earth. Then dies. The	 42.61303423882219
motion is ended. Gravediggers bury Hamlet _père_ and Hamlet _fils._ A	 85.89261495290147
king and a prince at last in death, with incidental music. And, what	 172.59421721964983
though murdered and betrayed, bewept by all frail tender hearts for,	 65.4792980784891
Dane or Dubliner, sorrow for the dead is the only husband from whom	 57.575526095557116
they refuse to be divorced. If you like the epilogue look long on it:	 53.44174339389336
prosperous Prospero, the good man rewarded, Lizzie, grandpa’s lump of	 22.217191418641058
love, and nuncle Richie, the bad man taken off by poetic justice to the	 129.4070551033797
place where the bad niggers go. Strong curtain. He found in the world	 85.21794122038374
without as actual what was in his world within as possible. Maeterlinck	 145.87878589658627
says: _If Socrates leave his house today he will find the sage seated	 132.5788289025575
on his doorstep. If Judas go forth tonight it is to Judas his steps	 78.05967888622664
will tend._ Every life is many days, day after day. We walk through	 111.0075001369737
ourselves, meeting robbers, ghosts, giants, old men, young men, wives,	 343.43665472625287
widows, brothers-in-love, but always meeting ourselves. The playwright	 66.02385171095065
who wrote the folio of this world and wrote it badly (He gave us light	 66.19725700830918
first and the sun two days later), the lord of things as they are whom	 100.59640376473538
the most Roman of catholics call _dio boia_, hangman god, is doubtless	 39.595857714795706
all in all in all of us, ostler and butcher, and would be bawd and	 64.56058463167777
cuckold too but that in the economy of heaven, foretold by Hamlet,	 36.151287927528855
there are no more marriages, glorified man, an androgynous angel, being	 53.72984510308026
a wife unto himself.	 142.40699533443387

from wide earth an altar.	 259.7291524702018
Laud we the gods	 218.5278009280604
And let our crooked smokes climb to their nostrils	 62.29908671419724
From our bless’d altars.	 25.407418056855512
[ 10 ]	 463.94842625767166
The superior, the very reverend John Conmee S. J. reset his smooth	 15.476137147776262
watch in his interior pocket as he came down the presbytery steps. Five	 59.419320717821925
to three. Just nice time to walk to Artane. What was that boy’s name	 96.04351269802258
again? Dignam. Yes. _Vere dignum et iustum est._ Brother Swan was the	 105.30454877815549
person to see. Mr Cunningham’s letter. Yes. Oblige him, if possible.	 209.10101098013632
Good practical catholic: useful at mission time.	 203.36460394906305
A onelegged sailor, swinging himself onward by lazy jerks of his	 51.98562020271101
crutches, growled some notes. He jerked short before the convent of the	 110.2713872301355
sisters of charity and held out a peaked cap for alms towards the very	 43.39874208688628
reverend John Conmee S. J. Father Conmee blessed him in the sun for his	 19.11579234558349
purse held, he knew, one silver crown.	 326.66755180971717
Father Conmee crossed to Mountjoy square. He thought, but not for long,	 88.9173092529575
of soldiers and sailors, whose legs had been shot off by cannonballs,	 47.30912463471244
ending their days in some pauper ward, and of cardinal Wolsey’s words:	 131.44902663640747
_If I had served my God as I have served my king He would not have	 64.23860428199811
abandoned me in my old days._ He walked by the treeshade of	 40.03005888913257
sunnywinking leaves: and towards him came the wife of Mr David Sheehy	 76.85892958729708
M.P.	 4.608171674364364
—Very well, indeed, father. And you, father?	 179.58670875078454
Father Conmee was wonderfully well indeed. He would go to Buxton	 26.550352201611005
probably for the waters. And her boys, were they getting on well at	 146.50665810306174
Belvedere? Was that so? Father Conmee was very glad indeed to hear	 48.57628468148013
that. And Mr Sheehy himself? Still in London. The house was still	 136.93736203212248
sitting, to be sure it was. Beautiful weather it was, delightful	 39.12728822271497
indeed. Yes, it was very probable that Father Bernard Vaughan would	 90.63655411759346
come again to preach. O, yes: a very great success. A wonderful man	 63.67452356845658
really.	 6192.944003626397
Father Conmee was very glad to see the wife of Mr David Sheehy M.P.	 14.535584201864713
Iooking so well and he begged to be remembered to Mr David Sheehy M.P.	 45.5784431619739
Yes, he would certainly call.	 120.44814272213145
—Good afternoon, Mrs Sheehy.	 32.71777502932684
Father Conmee doffed his silk hat and smiled, as he took leave, at the	 36.38265354791952
jet beads of her mantilla inkshining in the sun. And smiled yet again,	 72.17167675492212
in going. He had cleaned his teeth, he knew, with arecanut paste.	 45.49886723485483
Father Conmee walked and, walking, smiled for he thought on Father	 108.04228184818668
Bernard Vaughan’s droll eyes and cockney voice.	 65.48983658241472
—Pilate! Wy don’t you old back that owlin mob?	 83.6597923431303
A zealous man, however. Really he was. And really did great good in his	 64.2009907054143
way. Beyond a doubt. He loved Ireland, he said, and he loved the Irish.	 75.6377019244949
Of good family too would one think it? Welsh, were they not?	 198.04892296458576
O, lest he forget. That letter to father provincial.	 78.24760194700957
Father Conmee stopped three little schoolboys at the corner of Mountjoy	 44.41518573639192
square. Yes: they were from Belvedere. The little house. Aha. And were	 142.27891602048578
they good boys at school? O. That was very good now. And what was his	 81.45876513707528
name? Jack Sohan. And his name? Ger. Gallaher. And the other little	 88.37632951144178
man? His name was Brunny Lynam. O, that was a very nice name to have.	 44.677979340233655
Father Conmee gave a letter from his breast to Master Brunny Lynam and	 36.20001786559405
pointed to the red pillarbox at the corner of Fitzgibbon street.	 48.56821183378203
—But mind you don’t post yourself into the box, little man, he said.	 63.13199797348886
The boys sixeyed Father Conmee and laughed:	 90.34486838384755
—O, sir.	 236.93975563845925
—Well, let me see if you can post a letter, Father Conmee said.	 36.99735507538418
Master Brunny Lynam ran across the road and put Father Conmee’s letter	 144.50942075987572
to father provincial into the mouth of the bright red letterbox. Father	 68.56272994246581
Conmee smiled and nodded and smiled and walked along Mountjoy square	 35.00509598352189
east.	 11392.218010782903
Mr Denis J Maginni, professor of dancing &c, in silk hat, slate	 54.5036120082938
frockcoat with silk facings, white kerchief tie, tight lavender	 130.14889805942548
trousers, canary gloves and pointed patent boots, walking with grave	 100.96899679297701
deportment most respectfully took the curbstone as he passed lady	 94.10422970735006
Maxwell at the corner of Dignam’s court.	 39.87995056309699
Was that not Mrs M’Guinness?	 120.9866425220975
Mrs M’Guinness, stately, silverhaired, bowed to Father Conmee from the	 35.291397275306785
farther footpath along which she sailed. And Father Conmee smiled and	 86.4440014432224
saluted. How did she do?	 154.34444468637182
A fine carriage she had. Like Mary, queen of Scots, something. And to	 99.14347269287342
think that she was a pawnbroker! Well, now! Such a... what should he	 99.2310359099882
say?... such a queenly mien.	 184.707908148865
Father Conmee walked down Great Charles street and glanced at the	 49.1655826112815
shutup free church on his left. The reverend T. R. Greene B.A. will	 115.91520427958464
(D.V.) speak. The incumbent they called him. He felt it incumbent on	 47.15103989840793
him to say a few words. But one should be charitable. Invincible	 37.60993853670217
ignorance. They acted according to their lights.	 42.015051715921246
Father Conmee turned the corner and walked along the North Circular	 40.08882601546166
road. It was a wonder that there was not a tramline in such an	 62.349084326105476
important thoroughfare. Surely, there ought to be.	 93.56367784402178
A band of satchelled schoolboys crossed from Richmond street. All	 99.38785120278519
raised untidy caps. Father Conmee greeted them more than once benignly.	 114.76938464739642
Christian brother boys.	 320.2297547663494
Father Conmee smelt incense on his right hand as he walked. Saint	 35.447121632614696
Joseph’s church, Portland row. For aged and virtuous females. Father	 162.76329094091182
Conmee raised his hat to the Blessed Sacrament. Virtuous: but	 41.10343578491664
occasionally they were also badtempered.	 30.195185566459283
Near Aldborough house Father Conmee thought of that spendthrift	 62.15638650609335
nobleman. And now it was an office or something.	 170.50333974583825
Father Conmee began to walk along the North Strand road and was saluted	 43.906747003462826
by Mr William Gallagher who stood in the doorway of his shop. Father	 56.8836619356678
Conmee saluted Mr William Gallagher and perceived the odours that came	 27.319953793855124
from baconflitches and ample cools of butter. He passed Grogan’s the	 61.37798002530869
Tobacconist against which newsboards leaned and told of a dreadful	 181.05821682795084
catastrophe in New York. In America those things were continually	 72.51680080290576
happening. Unfortunate people to die like that, unprepared. Still, an	 72.24100868029588
act of perfect contrition.	 77.5964567911413
Father Conmee went by Daniel Bergin’s publichouse against the window of	 19.18487715189653
which two unlabouring men lounged. They saluted him and were saluted.	 91.53582270768055
Father Conmee passed H. J. O’Neill’s funeral establishment where Corny	 99.14067617418121
Kelleher totted figures in the daybook while he chewed a blade of hay.	 62.39277437701213
A constable on his beat saluted Father Conmee and Father Conmee saluted	 50.017915724501385
the constable. In Youkstetter’s, the porkbutcher’s, Father Conmee	 33.033743399741276
observed pig’s puddings, white and black and red, lie neatly curled in	 136.22473022765408
tubes.	 4.608171674364364
Moored under the trees of Charleville Mall Father Conmee saw a	 20.764611418690407
turfbarge, a towhorse with pendent head, a bargeman with a hat of dirty	 42.61655040412111
straw seated amidships, smoking and staring at a branch of poplar above	 67.81161241531997
him. It was idyllic: and Father Conmee reflected on the providence of	 21.362228653185603
the Creator who had made turf to be in bogs whence men might dig it out	 44.68216474223215
and bring it to town and hamlet to make fires in the houses of poor	 79.5392974063595
people.	 3088.746527313636
On Newcomen bridge the very reverend John Conmee S. J. of saint Francis	 15.528742543826246
Xavier’s church, upper Gardiner street, stepped on to an outward bound	 63.19683854133444
tram.	 6524.107075918893
Off an inward bound tram stepped the reverend Nicholas Dudley C. C. of	 30.966705032910838
saint Agatha’s church, north William street, on to Newcomen bridge.	 133.03939167077377
At Newcomen bridge Father Conmee stepped into an outward bound tram for	 34.90724860101232
he disliked to traverse on foot the dingy way past Mud Island.	 71.26934850618638
Father Conmee sat in a corner of the tramcar, a blue ticket tucked with	 20.331648047435447
care in the eye of one plump kid glove, while four shillings, a	 74.39946833073661
sixpence and five pennies chuted from his other plump glovepalm into	 90.08558025888672
his purse. Passing the ivy church he reflected that the ticket	 70.22842935926748
inspector usually made his visit when one had carelessly thrown away	 88.53854912156
the ticket. The solemnity of the occupants of the car seemed to Father	 20.814539224399542
Conmee excessive for a journey so short and cheap. Father Conmee liked	 59.93800464108756
cheerful decorum.	 4.411654744205047
It was a peaceful day. The gentleman with the glasses opposite Father	 49.64494158781081
Conmee had finished explaining and looked down. His wife, Father Conmee	 81.69382262048624
supposed. A tiny yawn opened the mouth of the wife of the gentleman	 42.895448136584235
with the glasses. She raised her small gloved fist, yawned ever so	 71.8328946328256
gently, tiptapping her small gloved fist on her opening mouth and	 86.34209690248484
smiled tinily, sweetly.	 60.305841523424775
Father Conmee perceived her perfume in the car. He perceived also that	 54.3056399069094
the awkward man at the other side of her was sitting on the edge of the	 32.36705541083024
seat.	 5805.074776893193
Father Conmee at the altarrails placed the host with difficulty in the	 33.35064529712137
mouth of the awkward old man who had the shaky head.	 101.3882681627927
At Annesley bridge the tram halted and, when it was about to go, an old	 71.39618496128888
woman rose suddenly from her place to alight. The conductor pulled the	 78.8001836163037
bellstrap to stay the car for her. She passed out with her basket and a	 55.889451098569005
marketnet: and Father Conmee saw the conductor help her and net and	 24.781886413668637
basket down: and Father Conmee thought that, as she had nearly passed	 68.86778625647062
the end of the penny fare, she was one of those good souls who had	 50.70630459822693
always to be told twice _bless you, my child,_ that they have been	 92.4304981234677
absolved, _pray for me._ But they had so many worries in life, so many	 37.97047243333431
cares, poor creatures.	 42.372897844008854
From the hoardings Mr Eugene Stratton grimaced with thick niggerlips at	 22.725279605899267
Father Conmee.	 24.438202572624977
Father Conmee thought of the souls of black and brown and yellow men	 51.96167461842081
and of his sermon on saint Peter Claver S. J. and the African mission	 30.622541997587067
and of the propagation of the faith and of the millions of black and	 27.004102455973957
brown and yellow souls that had not received the baptism of water when	 79.24336573600375
their last hour came like a thief in the night. That book by the	 69.44735458381052
Belgian jesuit, _Le Nombre des Élus,_ seemed to Father Conmee a	 28.42688322316512
reasonable plea. Those were millions of human souls created by God in	 31.827141562818355
His Own likeness to whom the faith had not (D.V.) been brought. But	 133.935807461581
they were God’s souls, created by God. It seemed to Father Conmee a	 39.27565336907811
pity that they should all be lost, a waste, if one might say.	 152.17577778525794
At the Howth road stop Father Conmee alighted, was saluted by the	 62.589569324387156
conductor and saluted in his turn.	 56.90632736898197
The Malahide road was quiet. It pleased Father Conmee, road and name.	 198.77579629211587
The joybells were ringing in gay Malahide. Lord Talbot de Malahide,	 32.71400198743621
immediate hereditary lord admiral of Malahide and the seas adjoining.	 218.33122745044702
Then came the call to arms and she was maid, wife and widow in one day.	 130.87522216328108
Those were old worldish days, loyal times in joyous townlands, old	 103.41001752114889
times in the barony.	 27.69400456869693
Father Conmee, walking, thought of his little book _Old Times in the	 46.168058297449114
Barony_ and of the book that might be written about jesuit houses and	 57.64177979886692
of Mary Rochfort, daughter of lord Molesworth, first countess of	 76.36572630471176
Belvedere.	 9173.218261784712
A listless lady, no more young, walked alone the shore of lough Ennel,	 67.9309630242953
Mary, first countess of Belvedere, listlessly walking in the evening,	 130.65839372704517
not startled when an otter plunged. Who could know the truth? Not the	 119.06053749951418
jealous lord Belvedere and not her confessor if she had not committed	 47.915356017985594
adultery fully, _eiaculatio seminis inter vas naturale mulieris,_ with	 4.972698259615729
her husband’s brother? She would half confess if she had not all sinned	 86.763467923769
as women did. Only God knew and she and he, her husband’s brother.	 320.85110592948473
Father Conmee thought of that tyrannous incontinence, needed however	 45.20938562607456
for man’s race on earth, and of the ways of God which were not our	 82.62575033565778
ways.	 10879.180764854025
Don John Conmee walked and moved in times of yore. He was humane and	 77.13574343804844
honoured there. He bore in mind secrets confessed and he smiled at	 80.77779833316276
smiling noble faces in a beeswaxed drawingroom, ceiled with full fruit	 62.076957330110424
clusters. And the hands of a bride and of a bridegroom, noble to noble,	 57.70936677704493
were impalmed by Don John Conmee.	 131.53954382716734
It was a charming day.	 102.680867320309
The lychgate of a field showed Father Conmee breadths of cabbages,	 23.365142151855004
curtseying to him with ample underleaves. The sky showed him a flock of	 30.677915348715167
small white clouds going slowly down the wind. _Moutonner,_ the French	 154.1489667136239
said. A just and homely word.	 452.90911174419836
Father Conmee, reading his office, watched a flock of muttoning clouds	 56.2935383003089
over Rathcoffey. His thinsocked ankles were tickled by the stubble of	 21.118023259442143
Clongowes field. He walked there, reading in the evening, and heard the	 120.52586017604794
cries of the boys’ lines at their play, young cries in the quiet	 103.00624705017606
evening. He was their rector: his reign was mild.	 105.0010527559482
Father Conmee drew off his gloves and took his rededged breviary out.	 36.9579228553681
An ivory bookmark told him the page.	 110.71162526685858
Nones. He should have read that before lunch. But lady Maxwell had	 128.72495228701865
come.	 382.81606238906494
Father Conmee read in secret _Pater_ and _Ave_ and crossed his breast.	 41.83393395877692
_Deus in adiutorium._	 121.45187994305914
He walked calmly and read mutely the nones, walking and reading till he	 63.89082520445448
came to _Res_ in _Beati immaculati: Principium verborum tuorum veritas:	 9.172501545189713
in eternum omnia iudicia iustitiæ tuæ._	 6.947106330169723
A flushed young man came from a gap of a hedge and after him came a	 60.08025716425269
young woman with wild nodding daisies in her hand. The young man raised	 123.88318728705386
his cap abruptly: the young woman abruptly bent and with slow care	 38.85881657925984
detached from her light skirt a clinging twig.	 31.327440208191124
Father Conmee blessed both gravely and turned a thin page of his	 67.7995613237038
breviary. _Sin: Principes persecuti sunt me gratis: et a verbis tuis	 32.98266490256704
formidavit cor meum._	 4.206040932916629
Corny Kelleher closed his long daybook and glanced with his drooping	 47.390214896317715
eye at a pine coffinlid sentried in a corner. He pulled himself erect,	 34.15109822450885
went to it and, spinning it on its axle, viewed its shape and brass	 69.42894913547057
furnishings. Chewing his blade of hay he laid the coffinlid by and came	 60.44665654467294
to the doorway. There he tilted his hatbrim to give shade to his eyes	 51.98433007365269
and leaned against the doorcase, looking idly out.	 61.91271004570609
Father John Conmee stepped into the Dollymount tram on Newcomen bridge.	 38.2551948150723
Corny Kelleher locked his largefooted boots and gazed, his hat	 54.41200521541532
downtilted, chewing his blade of hay.	 46.30814613990225
Constable 57C, on his beat, stood to pass the time of day.	 94.72795692913846
—That’s a fine day, Mr Kelleher.	 77.05248090344273
—Ay, Corny Kelleher said.	 26.8137139356613
—It’s very close, the constable said.	 86.91890665756384
Corny Kelleher sped a silent jet of hayjuice arching from his mouth	 19.284250419322316
while a generous white arm from a window in Eccles street flung forth a	 103.09225845360476
coin.	 10953.063523789304
—What’s the best news? he asked.	 36.34827418161731
—I seen that particular party last evening, the constable said with	 122.49570143502385
bated breath.	 126.96932568446691
A onelegged sailor crutched himself round MacConnell’s corner, skirting	 90.62015939113597
Rabaiotti’s icecream car, and jerked himself up Eccles street. Towards	 57.53213209921682
Larry O’Rourke, in shirtsleeves in his doorway, he growled unamiably:	 60.3768317809633
—_For England_...	 146.1370039518697
He swung himself violently forward past Katey and Boody Dedalus, halted	 49.77335296723099
and growled:	 214.89164458114357
—_home and beauty._	 262.13797336051874
J. J. O’Molloy’s white careworn face was told that Mr Lambert was in	 112.06133456511508
the warehouse with a visitor.	 9.559839755174034
A stout lady stopped, took a copper coin from her purse and dropped it	 81.19917524472973
into the cap held out to her. The sailor grumbled thanks, glanced	 110.0876942938547
sourly at the unheeding windows, sank his head and swung himself	 29.28136281703295
forward four strides.	 361.5517927983719
He halted and growled angrily:	 44.15233746284717
—_For England_...	 146.1370039518697
Two barefoot urchins, sucking long liquorice laces, halted near him,	 117.0304354105691
gaping at his stump with their yellowslobbered mouths.	 87.39687854838044
He swung himself forward in vigorous jerks, halted, lifted his head	 91.04460679854967
towards a window and bayed deeply:	 225.36809613935438
—_home and beauty._	 262.13797336051874
The gay sweet chirping whistling within went on a bar or two, ceased.	 107.69691009026229
The blind of the window was drawn aside. A card _Unfurnished	 75.03990167459406
Apartments_ slipped from the sash and fell. A plump bare generous arm	 66.33605730176716
shone, was seen, held forth from a white petticoatbodice and taut	 85.09361943712132
shiftstraps. A woman’s hand flung forth a coin over the area railings.	 60.51198143536098
It fell on the path.	 120.01607167148262
One of the urchins ran to it, picked it up and dropped it into the	 34.389144385129136
minstrel’s cap, saying:	 140.5665643168613
—There, sir.	 729.5860545600094
Katey and Boody Dedalus shoved in the door of the closesteaming	 30.209769022241257
kitchen.	 9085.467337416889
—Did you put in the books? Boody asked.	 38.038532602890506
Maggy at the range rammed down a greyish mass beneath bubbling suds	 44.052542951329315
twice with her potstick and wiped her brow.	 62.95559821417848
—They wouldn’t give anything on them, she said.	 51.303856077165186
Father Conmee walked through Clongowes fields, his thinsocked ankles	 28.296832706515655
tickled by stubble.	 109.62707536297782
—Where did you try? Boody asked.	 27.64548347329876
—M’Guinness’s.	 4.608171674364364
Boody stamped her foot and threw her satchel on the table.	 43.11779641394253
—Bad cess to her big face! she cried.	 108.05523380803132
Katey went to the range and peered with squinting eyes.	 47.79469926805068
—What’s in the pot? she asked.	 79.97854072218182
—Shirts, Maggy said.	 64.23447264561008
Boody cried angrily:	 159.3327615073464
—Crickey, is there nothing for us to eat?	 79.49299865172482
Katey, lifting the kettlelid in a pad of her stained skirt, asked:	 66.30454216766698
—And what’s in this?	 119.26318186237616
A heavy fume gushed in answer.	 51.22368570046673
—Peasoup, Maggy said.	 70.45780949957312
—Where did you get it? Katey asked.	 44.028026088720935
—Sister Mary Patrick, Maggy said.	 87.78067490628122
The lacquey rang his bell.	 21.95730307226378
—Barang!	 4.608171674364364
Boody sat down at the table and said hungrily:	 24.361284780632015
—Give us it here.	 97.97220142932979
Maggy poured yellow thick soup from the kettle into a bowl. Katey,	 106.53047580459102
sitting opposite Boody, said quietly, as her fingertip lifted to her	 109.17132846382833
mouth random crumbs:	 54.30801528205169
—A good job we have that much. Where’s Dilly?	 67.81054913504437
—Gone to meet father, Maggy said.	 92.08367826492504
Boody, breaking big chunks of bread into the yellow soup, added:	 68.50955062948668
—Our father who art not in heaven.	 136.29151004583278
Maggy, pouring yellow soup in Katey’s bowl, exclaimed:	 140.26634669313447
—Boody! For shame!	 874.2474391281121
A skiff, a crumpled throwaway, Elijah is coming, rode lightly down the	 29.021393860132335
Liffey, under Loopline bridge, shooting the rapids where water chafed	 102.45798858644595
around the bridgepiers, sailing eastward past hulls and anchorchains,	 19.866284275165462
between the Customhouse old dock and George’s quay.	 60.689978948625175
The blond girl in Thornton’s bedded the wicker basket with rustling	 32.638477866727484
fibre. Blazes Boylan handed her the bottle swathed in pink tissue paper	 57.973630966430356
and a small jar.	 57.50341472067426
—Put these in first, will you? he said.	 173.34215696270218
—Yes, sir, the blond girl said. And the fruit on top.	 67.12146745917458
—That’ll do, game ball, Blazes Boylan said.	 107.29036118482303
She bestowed fat pears neatly, head by tail, and among them ripe	 108.19438383111113
shamefaced peaches.	 4.411654744205047
Blazes Boylan walked here and there in new tan shoes about the	 52.484642531207236
fruitsmelling shop, lifting fruits, young juicy crinkled and plump red	 89.96080241984593
tomatoes, sniffing smells.	 91.13910552664088
H. E. L. Y.’S filed before him, tallwhitehatted, past Tangier lane,	 51.52319729245925
plodding towards their goal.	 90.81982660858343
He turned suddenly from a chip of strawberries, drew a gold watch from	 47.433203015880196
his fob and held it at its chain’s length.	 54.691893248978545
—Can you send them by tram? Now?	 78.86351606604572
A darkbacked figure under Merchants’ arch scanned books on the hawker’s	 42.859313739873215
cart.	 6254.4763702863875
—Certainly, sir. Is it in the city?	 58.60972444668053
—O, yes, Blazes Boylan said. Ten minutes.	 35.16394886322793
The blond girl handed him a docket and pencil.	 25.302224867026222
—Will you write the address, sir?	 117.77724541179272
Blazes Boylan at the counter wrote and pushed the docket to her.	 73.96081808796401
—Send it at once, will you? he said. It’s for an invalid.	 54.53091184679416
—Yes, sir. I will, sir.	 46.72527609485801
Blazes Boylan rattled merry money in his trousers’ pocket.	 33.581764082822204
—What’s the damage? he asked.	 55.50921321499005
The blond girl’s slim fingers reckoned the fruits.	 96.84385442210638
Blazes Boylan looked into the cut of her blouse. A young pullet. He	 47.25483451622473
took a red carnation from the tall stemglass.	 56.4459783677873
—This for me? he asked gallantly.	 67.86915264636183
The blond girl glanced sideways at him, got up regardless, with his tie	 40.99678064073274
a bit crooked, blushing.	 160.8634594114435
—Yes, sir, she said.	 22.608735763835902
Bending archly she reckoned again fat pears and blushing peaches.	 68.4663720822883
Blazes Boylan looked in her blouse with more favour, the stalk of the	 21.314905786365344
red flower between his smiling teeth.	 115.94000630685058
—May I say a word to your telephone, missy? he asked roguishly.	 49.54783123084435
_—Ma!_ Almidano Artifoni said.	 39.12694983476041
He gazed over Stephen’s shoulder at Goldsmith’s knobby poll.	 49.30381240546184
Two carfuls of tourists passed slowly, their women sitting fore,	 106.8378737284726
gripping the handrests. Palefaces. Men’s arms frankly round their	 35.22350228896633
stunted forms. They looked from Trinity to the blind columned porch of	 151.2634938991058
the bank of Ireland where pigeons roocoocooed.	 29.772675520353513
—_Anch’io ho avuto di queste idee_, Almidano Artifoni said, _quand’ ero	 17.885775531588926
giovine come Lei. Eppoi mi sono convinto che il mondo è una bestia. È	 10.379247104014265
peccato. Perchè la sua voce... sarebbe un cespite di rendita, via.	 11.666414371667962
Invece, Lei si sacrifica._	 29.598191836908686
—_Sacrifizio incruento,_ Stephen said smiling, swaying his ashplant in	 23.879451930138924
slow swingswong from its midpoint, lightly.	 119.81044842229431
_—Speriamo,_ the round mustachioed face said pleasantly. _Ma, dia retta	 63.76856978643843
a me. Ci rifletta_.	 93.81162881488379
By the stern stone hand of Grattan, bidding halt, an Inchicore tram	 127.0280456211137
unloaded straggling Highland soldiers of a band.	 32.77447131999212
—_Ci rifletterò,_ Stephen said, glancing down the solid trouserleg.	 22.07319030015052
—_Ma, sul serio, eh?_ Almidano Artifoni said.	 38.74196442816035
His heavy hand took Stephen’s firmly. Human eyes. They gazed curiously	 111.52590280143312
an instant and turned quickly towards a Dalkey tram.	 85.57218360373881
_—Eccolo,_ Almidano Artifoni said in friendly haste. _Venga a trovarmi	 18.23980890228124
e ci pensi. Addio, caro._	 25.2868968839971
—_Arrivederla, maestro,_ Stephen said, raising his hat when his hand	 24.06651920785583
was freed. _E grazie._	 98.61108502991503
—_Di che?_ Almidano Artifoni said. _Scusi, eh? Tante belle cose!_	 53.065249564011
Almidano Artifoni, holding up a baton of rolled music as a signal,	 93.99664590278853
trotted on stout trousers after the Dalkey tram. In vain he trotted,	 110.83855696817278
signalling in vain among the rout of barekneed gillies smuggling	 9.57736054129302
implements of music through Trinity gates.	 158.26939167056335
Miss Dunne hid the Capel street library copy of _The Woman in White_	 135.7826176738381
far back in her drawer and rolled a sheet of gaudy notepaper into her	 46.79505627172164
typewriter.	 4.608171674364364
Too much mystery business in it. Is he in love with that one, Marion?	 86.4521220936053
Change it and get another by Mary Cecil Haye.	 113.37548576878201
The disk shot down the groove, wobbled a while, ceased and ogled them:	 19.302810631139916
six.	 4180.5722083761
Miss Dunne clicked on the keyboard:	 21.278494657782268
—16 June 1904.	 39.62445553383712
Five tallwhitehatted sandwichmen between Monypeny’s corner and the slab	 56.71080616427034
where Wolfe Tone’s statue was not, eeled themselves turning H. E. L.	 54.09539047934862
Y.’S and plodded back as they had come.	 31.312211843425256
Then she stared at the large poster of Marie Kendall, charming	 43.03269130862229
soubrette, and, listlessly lolling, scribbled on the jotter sixteens	 31.04120901124283
and capital esses. Mustard hair and dauby cheeks. She’s not	 95.30922738054197
nicelooking, is she? The way she’s holding up her bit of a skirt.	 74.26181993168316
Wonder will that fellow be at the band tonight. If I could get that	 105.41998457812946
dressmaker to make a concertina skirt like Susy Nagle’s. They kick out	 46.97864953288563
grand. Shannon and all the boatclub swells never took his eyes off her.	 51.630857334034026
Hope to goodness he won’t keep me here till seven.	 167.9692311500866
The telephone rang rudely by her ear.	 76.06804576736636
—Hello. Yes, sir. No, sir. Yes, sir. I’ll ring them up after five. Only	 51.18491557451786
those two, sir, for Belfast and Liverpool. All right, sir. Then I can	 140.49248205448205
go after six if you’re not back. A quarter after. Yes, sir. Twentyseven	 171.69482597177674
and six. I’ll tell him. Yes: one, seven, six.	 89.28566139069775
She scribbled three figures on an envelope.	 105.13292302933576
—Mr Boylan! Hello! That gentleman from _Sport_ was in looking for you.	 112.90602673730888
Mr Lenehan, yes. He said he’ll be in the Ormond at four. No, sir. Yes,	 74.9484286020222
sir. I’ll ring them up after five.	 83.35653943076956
Two pink faces turned in the flare of the tiny torch.	 28.23285518100886
—Who’s that? Ned Lambert asked. Is that Crotty?	 41.37485837920184
—Ringabella and Crosshaven, a voice replied groping for foothold.	 19.16219710019821
—Hello, Jack, is that yourself? Ned Lambert said, raising in salute his	 52.164421654295616
pliant lath among the flickering arches. Come on. Mind your steps	 74.54932231814921
there.	 325.19338902170557
The vesta in the clergyman’s uplifted hand consumed itself in a long	 24.490779337716713
soft flame and was let fall. At their feet its red speck died: and	 96.97145910706408
mouldy air closed round them.	 103.24303203489171
—How interesting! a refined accent said in the gloom.	 47.644175661717846
—Yes, sir, Ned Lambert said heartily. We are standing in the historic	 11.891598301559094
council chamber of saint Mary’s abbey where silken Thomas proclaimed	 74.01820993653584
himself a rebel in 1534. This is the most historic spot in all Dublin.	 96.11558809539996
O’Madden Burke is going to write something about it one of these days.	 42.068638412612316
The old bank of Ireland was over the way till the time of the union and	 64.00116380379723
the original jews’ temple was here too before they built their	 190.37929609848297
synagogue over in Adelaide road. You were never here before, Jack, were	 103.1193935153728
you?	 149.54238275787918
—No, Ned.	 169.2274171435875
—He rode down through Dame walk, the refined accent said, if my memory	 115.23701695479674
serves me. The mansion of the Kildares was in Thomas court.	 30.257154507161005
—That’s right, Ned Lambert said. That’s quite right, sir.	 20.241168379186483
—If you will be so kind then, the clergyman said, the next time to	 36.48905970369197
allow me perhaps...	 153.60721289989556
—Certainly, Ned Lambert said. Bring the camera whenever you like. I’ll	 54.766862155203825
get those bags cleared away from the windows. You can take it from here	 89.90340055817762
or from here.	 491.7871123213244
In the still faint light he moved about, tapping with his lath the	 72.38872635305967
piled seedbags and points of vantage on the floor.	 49.39023084080453
From a long face a beard and gaze hung on a chessboard.	 49.70092694839531

on your valuable time...	 115.31484710702685
—You’re welcome, sir, Ned Lambert said. Drop in whenever you like. Next	 55.64861044142244
week, say. Can you see?	 192.56177900646662
—Yes, yes. Good afternoon, Mr Lambert. Very pleased to have met you.	 43.2311205072387
—Pleasure is mine, sir, Ned Lambert answered.	 83.26623441390763
He followed his guest to the outlet and then whirled his lath away	 27.57745478120304
among the pillars. With J. J. O’Molloy he came forth slowly into Mary’s	 53.65340953546789
abbey where draymen were loading floats with sacks of carob and palmnut	 41.55458682695918
meal, O’Connor, Wexford.	 1388.4136473935941
He stood to read the card in his hand.	 44.04678731625057
—The reverend Hugh C. Love, Rathcoffey. Present address: Saint	 59.03926685245803
Michael’s, Sallins. Nice young chap he is. He’s writing a book about	 118.87557551819711
the Fitzgeralds he told me. He’s well up in history, faith.	 41.98115803805134
The young woman with slow care detached from her light skirt a clinging	 47.612493105841565
twig.	 17510.742321107085
—I thought you were at a new gunpowder plot, J. J. O’Molloy said.	 24.45354762154503
Ned Lambert cracked his fingers in the air.	 20.70637483989585
—God! he cried. I forgot to tell him that one about the earl of Kildare	 71.68047002724155
after he set fire to Cashel cathedral. You know that one? _I’m bloody	 117.3589832977659
sorry I did it,_ says he, _but I declare to God I thought the	 69.15530595732436
archbishop was inside._ He mightn’t like it, though. What? God, I’ll	 235.05192282947885
tell him anyhow. That was the great earl, the Fitzgerald Mor. Hot	 61.59533277020115
members they were all of them, the Geraldines.	 77.00489486341897
The horses he passed started nervously under their slack harness. He	 76.7476239964409
slapped a piebald haunch quivering near him and cried:	 53.95730072727325
—Woa, sonny!	 4.411654744205047
He turned to J. J. O’Molloy and asked:	 28.05992632890314
—Well, Jack. What is it? What’s the trouble? Wait awhile. Hold hard.	 65.11986311645464

instant, sneezed loudly.	 633.5909951126094
—Chow! he said. Blast you!	 34.19999914310901

draught...	 24847.062305513628
He held his handkerchief ready for the coming...	 43.78319604564931

Tom Rochford took the top disk from the pile he clasped against his	 46.065990475837374
claret waistcoat.	 380.77770917740185

Lawyers of the past, haughty, pleading, beheld pass from the	 40.173927050678245

The impact. Leverage, see?	 27.936446700603494
He showed them the rising column of disks on the right.	 35.554208175187526
—Smart idea, Nosey Flynn said, snuffling. So a fellow coming in late	 58.34380195347516
can see what turn is on and what turns are over.	 185.85558004395054
—See? Tom Rochford said.	 35.786315317281016

—I’ll see him now in the Ormond, Lenehan said, and sound him. One good	 85.33352703591136

—Goodnight, M’Coy said abruptly. When you two begin...	 62.53597910695788
Nosey Flynn stooped towards the lever, snuffling at it.	 51.24340756437032
—But how does it work here, Tommy? he asked.	 150.15646389617356
