He followed M’Coy out across the tiny square of Crampton court.	 119.02701009140365
—He’s a hero, he said simply.	 89.40635042675642
—I know, M’Coy said. The drain, you mean.	 24.76790181975525
—Drain? Lenehan said. It was down a manhole.	 29.20475192902509
They passed Dan Lowry’s musichall where Marie Kendall, charming	 62.22810055041853
soubrette, smiled on them from a poster a dauby smile.	 161.9427363171676
Going down the path of Sycamore street beside the Empire musichall	 71.5795287820364
Lenehan showed M’Coy how the whole thing was. One of those manholes	 84.48237625852168
like a bloody gaspipe and there was the poor devil stuck down in it,	 33.76937629897938
half choked with sewer gas. Down went Tom Rochford anyhow, booky’s vest	 86.3187830965444
and all, with the rope round him. And be damned but he got the rope	 62.93802426283253
round the poor devil and the two were hauled up.	 65.54591973838673
—The act of a hero, he said.	 42.300488192530686
At the Dolphin they halted to allow the ambulance car to gallop past	 83.31124677646594
them for Jervis street.	 78.8098943883454
—This way, he said, walking to the right. I want to pop into Lynam’s to	 53.094524332626264
see Sceptre’s starting price. What’s the time by your gold watch and	 77.32706603595624
chain?	 8915.076341241416
M’Coy peered into Marcus Tertius Moses’ sombre office, then at	 52.65439721620664
O’Neill’s clock.	 157.6532020140861
—After three, he said. Who’s riding her?	 213.95776971427276
—O. Madden, Lenehan said. And a game filly she is.	 73.70999133282253
While he waited in Temple bar M’Coy dodged a banana peel with gentle	 73.557080924726
pushes of his toe from the path to the gutter. Fellow might damn easy	 39.96600952097519
get a nasty fall there coming along tight in the dark.	 113.50617432041122
The gates of the drive opened wide to give egress to the viceregal	 76.10938030683025
cavalcade.	 19820.747128735104
—Even money, Lenehan said returning. I knocked against Bantam Lyons in	 69.97221791055128
there going to back a bloody horse someone gave him that hasn’t an	 103.25126861153878
earthly. Through here.	 215.76336384333223
They went up the steps and under Merchants’ arch. A darkbacked figure	 62.272869543303216
scanned books on the hawker’s cart.	 51.85810950653118
—There he is, Lenehan said.	 49.795730722684084
—Wonder what he’s buying, M’Coy said, glancing behind.	 95.14014783390664
—_Leopoldo or the Bloom is on the Rye,_ Lenehan said.	 35.72736285865067
—He’s dead nuts on sales, M’Coy said. I was with him one day and he	 34.361489069811256
bought a book from an old one in Liffey street for two bob. There were	 139.91187644457892
fine plates in it worth double the money, the stars and the moon and	 94.82703658350424
comets with long tails. Astronomy it was about.	 32.419825372477895
Lenehan laughed.	 360.6494160018914
—I’ll tell you a damn good one about comets’ tails, he said. Come over	 63.72429924499621
in the sun.	 34.33465709746614
They crossed to the metal bridge and went along Wellington quay by the	 38.72726080014334
riverwall.	 4.608171674364364
Master Patrick Aloysius Dignam came out of Mangan’s, late Fehrenbach’s,	 21.748604104940046
carrying a pound and a half of porksteaks.	 65.54358993670368
—There was a long spread out at Glencree reformatory, Lenehan said	 50.1425736368125
eagerly. The annual dinner, you know. Boiled shirt affair. The lord	 90.1108672606982
mayor was there, Val Dillon it was, and sir Charles Cameron and Dan	 131.84240869753103
Dawson spoke and there was music. Bartell d’Arcy sang and Benjamin	 69.64387048190467
Dollard...	 3453.3844196903106
—I know, M’Coy broke in. My missus sang there once.	 69.31693894480155
—Did she? Lenehan said.	 158.27353387908175
A card _Unfurnished Apartments_ reappeared on the windowsash of number	 21.98941162105742
7 Eccles street.	 45.83086342418729
He checked his tale a moment but broke out in a wheezy laugh.	 62.036467222346104
—But wait till I tell you, he said. Delahunt of Camden street had the	 21.94696760634847
catering and yours truly was chief bottlewasher. Bloom and the wife	 50.892291708921775
were there. Lashings of stuff we put up: port wine and sherry and	 66.28793429044404
curacoa to which we did ample justice. Fast and furious it was. After	 51.476044925129855
liquids came solids. Cold joints galore and mince pies...	 19.984938094400807
—I know, M’Coy said. The year the missus was there...	 34.89928190773993
Lenehan linked his arm warmly.	 37.409002985350305
—But wait till I tell you, he said. We had a midnight lunch too after	 24.034640108852773
all the jollification and when we sallied forth it was blue o’clock the	 46.6325159641532
morning after the night before. Coming home it was a gorgeous winter’s	 57.83425593218113
night on the Featherbed Mountain. Bloom and Chris Callinan were on one	 105.57922164810549
side of the car and I was with the wife on the other. We started	 57.14085511252539
singing glees and duets: _Lo, the early beam of morning_. She was well	 104.97198237467096
primed with a good load of Delahunt’s port under her bellyband. Every	 31.934123346542457
jolt the bloody car gave I had her bumping up against me. Hell’s	 47.11777286217133
delights! She has a fine pair, God bless her. Like that.	 64.68849484138165
He held his caved hands a cubit from him, frowning:	 58.64977595234121
—I was tucking the rug under her and settling her boa all the time.	 29.16667090640517
Know what I mean?	 31.960035009376558
His hands moulded ample curves of air. He shut his eyes tight in	 71.13454556016414
delight, his body shrinking, and blew a sweet chirp from his lips.	 80.83625463628286
—The lad stood to attention anyhow, he said with a sigh. She’s a gamey	 59.43438119108554
mare and no mistake. Bloom was pointing out all the stars and the	 92.65069885439581
comets in the heavens to Chris Callinan and the jarvey: the great bear	 61.69747625250269
and Hercules and the dragon, and the whole jingbang lot. But, by God, I	 38.921877140330395
was lost, so to speak, in the milky way. He knows them all, faith. At	 56.35054873854188
last she spotted a weeny weeshy one miles away. _And what star is that,	 59.59960832760244
Poldy?_ says she. By God, she had Bloom cornered. _That one, is it?_	 80.1171934407334
says Chris Callinan, _sure that’s only what you might call a pinprick._	 61.771702447373706
By God, he wasn’t far wide of the mark.	 92.10761411421458
Lenehan stopped and leaned on the riverwall, panting with soft	 70.55820198667132
laughter.	 6551.2658316472025
—I’m weak, he gasped.	 94.52360321278323
M’Coy’s white face smiled about it at instants and grew grave. Lenehan	 104.4497184746203
walked on again. He lifted his yachtingcap and scratched his hindhead	 25.07564516497976
rapidly. He glanced sideways in the sunlight at M’Coy.	 104.52855439384791
—He’s a cultured allroundman, Bloom is, he said seriously. He’s not one	 59.326485624061505
of your common or garden... you know... There’s a touch of the artist	 79.46233862197303
about old Bloom.	 335.9396107171752
Mr Bloom turned over idly pages of _The Awful Disclosures of Maria	 33.00428617473317
Monk_, then of Aristotle’s _Masterpiece._ Crooked botched print.	 89.67011637251402
Plates: infants cuddled in a ball in bloodred wombs like livers of	 33.529494349612925
slaughtered cows. Lots of them like that at this moment all over the	 51.05691190614999
world. All butting with their skulls to get out of it. Child born every	 53.523790617564124
minute somewhere. Mrs Purefoy.	 184.44697646496525
He laid both books aside and glanced at the third: _Tales of the	 39.61272357237913
Ghetto_ by Leopold von Sacher Masoch.	 21.089896379994208
—That I had, he said, pushing it by.	 44.709091180201234
The shopman let two volumes fall on the counter.	 73.05757184564332
—Them are two good ones, he said.	 77.69819969289325
Onions of his breath came across the counter out of his ruined mouth.	 57.7120372946806
He bent to make a bundle of the other books, hugged them against his	 55.612287576881755
unbuttoned waistcoat and bore them off behind the dingy curtain.	 60.63489557700217
On O’Connell bridge many persons observed the grave deportment and gay	 93.38192583376558
apparel of Mr Denis J Maginni, professor of dancing &c.	 27.878299412376155
Mr Bloom, alone, looked at the titles. _Fair Tyrants_ by James	 51.613392348245995
Lovebirch. Know the kind that is. Had it? Yes.	 184.6264634723727
He opened it. Thought so.	 149.77002845703237
A woman’s voice behind the dingy curtain. Listen: the man.	 53.15913076615841
No: she wouldn’t like that much. Got her it once.	 121.11355953860928
He read the other title: _Sweets of Sin_. More in her line. Let us see.	 67.99881414250744
He read where his finger opened.	 109.06039018954662
_—All the dollarbills her husband gave her were spent in the stores on	 69.82021986564985
wondrous gowns and costliest frillies. For him! For Raoul!_	 30.369153063557278
Yes. This. Here. Try.	 346.9765638012561
—_Her mouth glued on his in a luscious voluptuous kiss while his hands	 46.93582281329753
felt for the opulent curves inside her déshabillé._	 11.922788580488508
Yes. Take this. The end.	 150.68516970391426
—You are late, he spoke hoarsely, eying her with a suspicious glare.	 33.35342244783145
The beautiful woman threw off her sabletrimmed wrap, displaying her	 33.15280736340616
queenly shoulders and heaving embonpoint. An imperceptible smile played	 96.77275316547912
round her perfect lips as she turned to him calmly.	 82.29592178844307
Mr Bloom read again: _The beautiful woman._	 46.604162156133604
Warmth showered gently over him, cowing his flesh. Flesh yielded amply	 70.45676008079154
amid rumpled clothes: whites of eyes swooning up. His nostrils arched	 100.3236579283854
themselves for prey. Melting breast ointments (_for him! For Raoul!_).	 129.67545779843462
Armpits’ oniony sweat. Fishgluey slime (_her heaving embonpoint!_).	 25.58100244790985
Feel! Press! Crished! Sulphur dung of lions!	 68.37802495193192
Young! Young!	 498.45011462051576
An elderly female, no more young, left the building of the courts of	 30.370307805010334
chancery, king’s bench, exchequer and common pleas, having heard in the	 49.25342290580406
lord chancellor’s court the case in lunacy of Potterton, in the	 57.30946920498029
admiralty division the summons, exparte motion, of the owners of the	 4.903057066861723
Lady Cairns versus the owners of the barque Mona, in the court of	 20.422538517230915
appeal reservation of judgment in the case of Harvey versus the Ocean	 49.13134258464548
Accident and Guarantee Corporation.	 211.3228198025298
Phlegmy coughs shook the air of the bookshop, bulging out the dingy	 50.636567896587316
curtains. The shopman’s uncombed grey head came out and his unshaven	 48.0092886766856
reddened face, coughing. He raked his throat rudely, puked phlegm on	 33.23500082968655
the floor. He put his boot on what he had spat, wiping his sole along	 93.9902555049322
it, and bent, showing a rawskinned crown, scantily haired.	 56.4787764087251
Mr Bloom beheld it.	 36.16229887853767
Mastering his troubled breath, he said:	 41.85433829086147
—I’ll take this one.	 79.99270952840794
The shopman lifted eyes bleared with old rheum.	 56.37559483494365
—_Sweets of Sin,_ he said, tapping on it. That’s a good one.	 56.92483445929622
The lacquey by the door of Dillon’s auctionrooms shook his handbell	 55.49241576794655
twice again and viewed himself in the chalked mirror of the cabinet.	 33.16046543783565
Dilly Dedalus, loitering by the curbstone, heard the beats of the bell,	 45.80303304882045
the cries of the auctioneer within. Four and nine. Those lovely	 62.389604880856695
curtains. Five shillings. Cosy curtains. Selling new at two guineas.	 258.4481999023039
Any advance on five shillings? Going for five shillings.	 93.10220787080623
The lacquey lifted his handbell and shook it:	 43.28394682630008
—Barang!	 4.608171674364364
Bang of the lastlap bell spurred the halfmile wheelmen to their sprint.	 24.02717316358173
J. A. Jackson, W. E. Wylie, A. Munro and H. T. Gahan, their stretched	 70.9746583677387
necks wagging, negotiated the curve by the College library.	 69.65195273006736
Mr Dedalus, tugging a long moustache, came round from Williams’s row.	 82.68577872744319
He halted near his daughter.	 65.03576276909114
—It’s time for you, she said.	 182.974738084297
—Stand up straight for the love of the lord Jesus, Mr Dedalus said. Are	 37.510965826999794
you trying to imitate your uncle John, the cornetplayer, head upon	 96.42038239540416
shoulder? Melancholy God!	 403.36875115381287
Dilly shrugged her shoulders. Mr Dedalus placed his hands on them and	 61.019953921242504
held them back.	 379.6565746412315
—Stand up straight, girl, he said. You’ll get curvature of the spine.	 43.33452565638112
Do you know what you look like?	 17.66245838697232
He let his head sink suddenly down and forward, hunching his shoulders	 91.34337840738333
and dropping his underjaw.	 52.6768019285736
—Give it up, father, Dilly said. All the people are looking at you.	 59.27463603732159
Mr Dedalus drew himself upright and tugged again at his moustache.	 62.85056328866797
—Did you get any money? Dilly asked.	 61.330188207555224
—Where would I get money? Mr Dedalus said. There is no-one in Dublin	 55.26874593122815
would lend me fourpence.	 104.95356848315147
—You got some, Dilly said, looking in his eyes.	 35.15953971446605
—How do you know that? Mr Dedalus asked, his tongue in his cheek.	 22.571128054969627
Mr Kernan, pleased with the order he had booked, walked boldly along	 39.205628717205386
James’s street.	 51.821296290482664
—I know you did, Dilly answered. Were you in the Scotch house now?	 66.72554710029144
—I was not, then, Mr Dedalus said, smiling. Was it the little nuns	 59.17133758198896
taught you to be so saucy? Here.	 79.36188995860778
He handed her a shilling.	 91.06410824998564
—See if you can do anything with that, he said.	 28.002660106605113
—I suppose you got five, Dilly said. Give me more than that.	 44.11936379334246
—Wait awhile, Mr Dedalus said threateningly. You’re like the rest of	 27.117887689632088
them, are you? An insolent pack of little bitches since your poor	 89.5987275846325
mother died. But wait awhile. You’ll all get a short shrift and a long	 122.21045036236625
day from me. Low blackguardism! I’m going to get rid of you. Wouldn’t	 44.31011152226357
care if I was stretched out stiff. He’s dead. The man upstairs is dead.	 89.7597596334361
He left her and walked on. Dilly followed quickly and pulled his coat.	 84.10643868665952
—Well, what is it? he said, stopping.	 32.72452921449794
The lacquey rang his bell behind their backs.	 29.718315418587224
—Barang!	 4.608171674364364
—Curse your bloody blatant soul, Mr Dedalus cried, turning on him.	 49.71595975140844
The lacquey, aware of comment, shook the lolling clapper of his bell	 46.50022755508123
but feebly:	 64.59126249669593
—Bang!	 7730.261836041158
Mr Dedalus stared at him.	 23.933168654974615
—Watch him, he said. It’s instructive. I wonder will he allow us to	 63.94773221619174
talk.	 8314.750644029045
—You got more than that, father, Dilly said.	 46.71073683707136
—I’m going to show you a little trick, Mr Dedalus said. I’ll leave you	 24.08535765850034
all where Jesus left the jews. Look, there’s all I have. I got two	 192.22568195433067
shillings from Jack Power and I spent twopence for a shave for the	 43.85541346043548
funeral.	 10026.711604730363
He drew forth a handful of copper coins, nervously.	 36.52965829093123
—Can’t you look for some money somewhere? Dilly said.	 67.50592855170945
Mr Dedalus thought and nodded.	 105.17234078272557
—I will, he said gravely. I looked all along the gutter in O’Connell	 100.25398098197785
street. I’ll try this one now.	 245.8665488174907
—You’re very funny, Dilly said, grinning.	 62.33277135194093
—Here, Mr Dedalus said, handing her two pennies. Get a glass of milk	 62.057445009972945
for yourself and a bun or a something. I’ll be home shortly.	 92.58830855080073
He put the other coins in his pocket and started to walk on.	 46.44352236713874
The viceregal cavalcade passed, greeted by obsequious policemen, out of	 22.337317823471853
Parkgate.	 4.608171674364364
—I’m sure you have another shilling, Dilly said.	 56.05507604135129
The lacquey banged loudly.	 121.02109325376149
Mr Dedalus amid the din walked off, murmuring to himself with a pursing	 38.16274762917424
mincing mouth gently:	 168.87227625001358
—The little nuns! Nice little things! O, sure they wouldn’t do	 68.42571259958433
anything! O, sure they wouldn’t really! Is it little sister Monica!	 123.34169431191746
From the sundial towards James’s gate walked Mr Kernan, pleased with	 86.57602998843056
the order he had booked for Pulbrook Robertson, boldly along James’s	 41.910508608434824
street, past Shackleton’s offices. Got round him all right. How do you	 73.11048136852159
do, Mr Crimmins? First rate, sir. I was afraid you might be up in your	 65.45819556465432
other establishment in Pimlico. How are things going? Just keeping	 81.83386810113456
alive. Lovely weather we’re having. Yes, indeed. Good for the country.	 162.2816714776472
Those farmers are always grumbling. I’ll just take a thimbleful of your	 65.21396192369075
best gin, Mr Crimmins. A small gin, sir. Yes, sir. Terrible affair that	 80.30436829314245
_General Slocum_ explosion. Terrible, terrible! A thousand casualties.	 108.48729119403414
And heartrending scenes. Men trampling down women and children. Most	 100.44603954059289
brutal thing. What do they say was the cause? Spontaneous combustion.	 46.07542544196445
Most scandalous revelation. Not a single lifeboat would float and the	 36.773872691261225
firehose all burst. What I can’t understand is how the inspectors ever	 84.92286245720078
allowed a boat like that... Now, you’re talking straight, Mr Crimmins.	 104.53261364406391
You know why? Palm oil. Is that a fact? Without a doubt. Well now, look	 79.8249137256061
at that. And America they say is the land of the free. I thought we	 83.42231403503159
were bad here.	 470.8335490633552
I smiled at him. _America,_ I said quietly, just like that. _What is	 44.15987196484568
it? The sweepings of every country including our own. Isn’t that true?_	 76.28723774843952
That’s a fact.	 90.69333412501709
Graft, my dear sir. Well, of course, where there’s money going there’s	 109.99142350579885
always someone to pick it up.	 72.31913544037572
Saw him looking at my frockcoat. Dress does it. Nothing like a dressy	 146.63667804591498
appearance. Bowls them over.	 319.62281349646526
—Hello, Simon, Father Cowley said. How are things?	 17.143831095191036
—Hello, Bob, old man, Mr Dedalus answered, stopping.	 21.842467707515784
Mr Kernan halted and preened himself before the sloping mirror of Peter	 64.54980320879278
Kennedy, hairdresser. Stylish coat, beyond a doubt. Scott of Dawson	 113.01986037020207
street. Well worth the half sovereign I gave Neary for it. Never built	 101.38277479694105
under three guineas. Fits me down to the ground. Some Kildare street	 42.797280690009536
club toff had it probably. John Mulligan, the manager of the Hibernian	 62.17566200137444
bank, gave me a very sharp eye yesterday on Carlisle bridge as if he	 66.1745216717641
remembered me.	 602.1623617110344
Aham! Must dress the character for those fellows. Knight of the road.	 85.95590751880688
Gentleman. And now, Mr Crimmins, may we have the honour of your custom	 82.53988275053814
again, sir. The cup that cheers but not inebriates, as the old saying	 112.43499316509275
has it.	 255.2242708429211
North wall and sir John Rogerson’s quay, with hulls and anchorchains,	 45.61596306254904
sailing westward, sailed by a skiff, a crumpled throwaway, rocked on	 30.895265449527624
the ferrywash, Elijah is coming.	 34.018605828507255
Mr Kernan glanced in farewell at his image. High colour, of course.	 60.488137635446684
Grizzled moustache. Returned Indian officer. Bravely he bore his stumpy	 64.1561338569987
body forward on spatted feet, squaring his shoulders. Is that Ned	 153.20137716833017
Lambert’s brother over the way, Sam? What? Yes. He’s as like it as damn	 183.76850604472557
it. No. The windscreen of that motorcar in the sun there. Just a flash	 63.461603319813584
like that. Damn like him.	 148.3663371758676
Aham! Hot spirit of juniper juice warmed his vitals and his breath.	 21.64696592862219
Good drop of gin, that was. His frocktails winked in bright sunshine to	 45.92644118164415
his fat strut.	 57.96398199600395
Down there Emmet was hanged, drawn and quartered. Greasy black rope.	 96.38498072666552
Dogs licking the blood off the street when the lord lieutenant’s wife	 128.56076874051433
drove by in her noddy.	 126.28323585851724
Bad times those were. Well, well. Over and done with. Great topers too.	 155.24522512064547
Fourbottle men.	 78.80846740904828
Let me see. Is he buried in saint Michan’s? Or no, there was a midnight	 70.69352724010868
burial in Glasnevin. Corpse brought in through a secret door in the	 118.11578001360668
wall. Dignam is there now. Went out in a puff. Well, well. Better turn	 105.10989982961772
down here. Make a detour.	 81.5336326300918
Mr Kernan turned and walked down the slope of Watling street by the	 18.837039276004173
corner of Guinness’s visitors’ waitingroom. Outside the Dublin	 85.11750223092396
Distillers Company’s stores an outside car without fare or jarvey	 193.9562079649394
stood, the reins knotted to the wheel. Damn dangerous thing. Some	 96.57710774510298
Tipperary bosthoon endangering the lives of the citizens. Runaway	 13.807457858649789
horse.	 3587.0084130394384
Denis Breen with his tomes, weary of having waited an hour in John	 149.4271657124941
Henry Menton’s office, led his wife over O’Connell bridge, bound for	 47.699076415097586
the office of Messrs Collis and Ward.	 34.5440084593656
Mr Kernan approached Island street.	 37.00345869246027
Times of the troubles. Must ask Ned Lambert to lend me those	 169.89918891471012
reminiscences of sir Jonah Barrington. When you look back on it all now	 61.07861322847842
in a kind of retrospective arrangement. Gaming at Daly’s. No	 35.026961954055054
cardsharping then. One of those fellows got his hand nailed to the	 37.707948008369414
table by a dagger. Somewhere here lord Edward Fitzgerald escaped from	 113.78452218049951
major Sirr. Stables behind Moira house.	 618.4406091681616
Damn good gin that was.	 92.00429894056823
Fine dashing young nobleman. Good stock, of course. That ruffian, that	 76.24042529690684
sham squire, with his violet gloves gave him away. Course they were on	 53.706679751836624
the wrong side. They rose in dark and evil days. Fine poem that is:	 62.74127288565826
Ingram. They were gentlemen. Ben Dollard does sing that ballad	 40.43208075794517
touchingly. Masterly rendition.	 4.206040932916629
_At the siege of Ross did my father fall._	 53.133255760066284
A cavalcade in easy trot along Pembroke quay passed, outriders leaping,	 166.13309445167846
leaping in their, in their saddles. Frockcoats. Cream sunshades.	 107.84212123170934
Mr Kernan hurried forward, blowing pursily.	 61.556844399193174
His Excellency! Too bad! Just missed that by a hair. Damn it! What a	 116.7543808046441
pity!	 3099.723852556669
Stephen Dedalus watched through the webbed window the lapidary’s	 30.214412749765877
fingers prove a timedulled chain. Dust webbed the window and the	 60.43879098751726
showtrays. Dust darkened the toiling fingers with their vulture nails.	 93.60006187722286
Dust slept on dull coils of bronze and silver, lozenges of cinnabar, on	 70.33292155095428
rubies, leprous and winedark stones.	 18.456964964744007
Born all in the dark wormy earth, cold specks of fire, evil, lights	 91.27954344569306
shining in the darkness. Where fallen archangels flung the stars of	 130.79689706020304
their brows. Muddy swinesnouts, hands, root and root, gripe and wrest	 15.388608004045686
them.	 436.51515115481243
She dances in a foul gloom where gum bums with garlic. A sailorman,	 34.45216699949809
rustbearded, sips from a beaker rum and eyes her. A long and seafed	 51.48383395738845
silent rut. She dances, capers, wagging her sowish haunches and her	 80.72183240714031
hips, on her gross belly flapping a ruby egg.	 99.1624416383006
Old Russell with a smeared shammy rag burnished again his gem, turned	 58.757442815475734
it and held it at the point of his Moses’ beard. Grandfather ape	 63.83924541972956
gloating on a stolen hoard.	 9.740013295094453
And you who wrest old images from the burial earth? The brainsick words	 143.31905267689228
of sophists: Antisthenes. A lore of drugs. Orient and immortal wheat	 21.82034734630087
standing from everlasting to everlasting.	 153.54513202891178
Two old women fresh from their whiff of the briny trudged through	 54.83847835840728
Irishtown along London bridge road, one with a sanded tired umbrella,	 43.45662525781401
one with a midwife’s bag in which eleven cockles rolled.	 29.345220324419273
The whirr of flapping leathern bands and hum of dynamos from the	 11.077336292949308
powerhouse urged Stephen to be on. Beingless beings. Stop! Throb always	 73.3848842846577
without you and the throb always within. Your heart you sing of. I	 169.96765770194773
between them. Where? Between two roaring worlds where they swirl, I.	 107.11179589990752
Shatter them, one and both. But stun myself too in the blow. Shatter me	 113.67407016213326
you who can. Bawd and butcher were the words. I say! Not yet awhile. A	 62.823403304805936
look around.	 183.2932913266824
Yes, quite true. Very large and wonderful and keeps famous time. You	 169.82652173849334
say right, sir. A Monday morning, ’twas so, indeed.	 198.06677101174185
Stephen went down Bedford row, the handle of the ash clacking against	 84.7935522001529
his shoulderblade. In Clohissey’s window a faded 1860 print of Heenan	 50.71794431084712
boxing Sayers held his eye. Staring backers with square hats stood	 74.70491199736477
round the roped prizering. The heavyweights in tight loincloths	 22.894084356744724
proposed gently each to other his bulbous fists. And they are	 69.08135431636931
throbbing: heroes’ hearts.	 38.71440343040397
He turned and halted by the slanted bookcart.	 30.35018942316305
—Twopence each, the huckster said. Four for sixpence.	 202.17111045757335
Tattered pages. _The Irish Beekeeper. Life and Miracles of the Curé of	 26.591068241170696
Ars. Pocket Guide to Killarney._	 158.15241167007704
I might find here one of my pawned schoolprizes. _Stephano Dedalo,	 31.995770362367196
alumno optimo, palmam ferenti._	 4.045570071155129
Father Conmee, having read his little hours, walked through the hamlet	 48.39437665499066
of Donnycarney, murmuring vespers.	 58.27221974296791
Binding too good probably. What is this? Eighth and ninth book of	 47.215081475322854
Moses. Secret of all secrets. Seal of King David. Thumbed pages: read	 156.75317012653719
and read. Who has passed here before me? How to soften chapped hands.	 82.27180137464879
Recipe for white wine vinegar. How to win a woman’s love. For me this.	 78.90923295740023
Say the following talisman three times with hands folded:	 163.36693428792216
—_Se el yilo nebrakada femininum! Amor me solo! Sanktus! Amen._	 38.23994331692054
Who wrote this? Charms and invocations of the most blessed abbot Peter	 51.4978636383413
Salanka to all true believers divulged. As good as any other abbot’s	 32.899062687551364
charms, as mumbling Joachim’s. Down, baldynoddle, or we’ll wool your	 26.96613446133123
wool.	 15307.932872242944
—What are you doing here, Stephen?	 43.192523150755314
Dilly’s high shoulders and shabby dress.	 88.41582191817467
Shut the book quick. Don’t let see.	 267.9178234714613
—What are you doing? Stephen said.	 21.333163124222562
A Stuart face of nonesuch Charles, lank locks falling at its sides. It	 87.58871936939308
glowed as she crouched feeding the fire with broken boots. I told her	 74.30955132541753
of Paris. Late lieabed under a quilt of old overcoats, fingering a	 33.17944808255625
pinchbeck bracelet, Dan Kelly’s token. _Nebrakada femininum._	 11.198983896835388
—What have you there? Stephen asked.	 60.97451439280031
—I bought it from the other cart for a penny, Dilly said, laughing	 36.62887453016725
nervously. Is it any good?	 135.18729978758716
My eyes they say she has. Do others see me so? Quick, far and daring.	 58.43627965525847
Shadow of my mind.	 99.17496144299307
He took the coverless book from her hand. Chardenal’s French primer.	 33.9966809913657
—What did you buy that for? he asked. To learn French?	 54.236876994066236
She nodded, reddening and closing tight her lips.	 176.98763095436996
Show no surprise. Quite natural.	 856.9138449832585
—Here, Stephen said. It’s all right. Mind Maggy doesn’t pawn it on you.	 61.30363280611287
I suppose all my books are gone.	 109.42495401149633
—Some, Dilly said. We had to.	 32.72563297794696
She is drowning. Agenbite. Save her. Agenbite. All against us. She will	 151.49365253343709
drown me with her, eyes and hair. Lank coils of seaweed hair around me,	 57.16014272248532
my heart, my soul. Salt green death.	 297.80915049284016
We.	 392.587246987247
Agenbite of inwit. Inwit’s agenbite.	 88.61040389809018
Misery! Misery!	 1184.9346754198655
—Hello, Simon, Father Cowley said. How are things?	 17.143831095191036
—Hello, Bob, old man, Mr Dedalus answered, stopping.	 21.842467707515784
They clasped hands loudly outside Reddy and Daughter’s. Father Cowley	 68.99183900225142
brushed his moustache often downward with a scooping hand.	 48.52174769286763
—What’s the best news? Mr Dedalus said.	 22.691320922804337
—Why then not much, Father Cowley said. I’m barricaded up, Simon, with	 96.10774057344884
two men prowling around the house trying to effect an entrance.	 81.77411682071748
—Jolly, Mr Dedalus said. Who is it?	 40.25161736048529
—O, Father Cowley said. A certain gombeen man of our acquaintance.	 28.53336580274061
—With a broken back, is it? Mr Dedalus asked.	 55.743690109296075
—The same, Simon, Father Cowley answered. Reuben of that ilk. I’m just	 51.30176668751345
waiting for Ben Dollard. He’s going to say a word to long John to get	 51.13180471444072
him to take those two men off. All I want is a little time.	 108.47228748713017
He looked with vague hope up and down the quay, a big apple bulging in	 74.39405877651534
his neck.	 168.3299823508688
—I know, Mr Dedalus said, nodding. Poor old bockedy Ben! He’s always	 37.05238604880351
doing a good turn for someone. Hold hard!	 161.21561961019418
He put on his glasses and gazed towards the metal bridge an instant.	 39.31677174907984
—There he is, by God, he said, arse and pockets.	 63.48071968672965
Ben Dollard’s loose blue cutaway and square hat above large slops	 122.80077951166223
crossed the quay in full gait from the metal bridge. He came towards	 73.64189830146067
them at an amble, scratching actively behind his coattails.	 30.360563814352908
As he came near Mr Dedalus greeted:	 43.106135855426785
—Hold that fellow with the bad trousers.	 65.43282122191924
—Hold him now, Ben Dollard said.	 30.72301621189399
Mr Dedalus eyed with cold wandering scorn various points of Ben	 98.3312079490606
Dollard’s figure. Then, turning to Father Cowley with a nod, he	 116.76175433122175
muttered sneeringly:	 4.411654744205047
—That’s a pretty garment, isn’t it, for a summer’s day?	 41.318100831647726
—Why, God eternally curse your soul, Ben Dollard growled furiously, I	 95.01407622693054
threw out more clothes in my time than you ever saw.	 245.09858952619047
He stood beside them beaming, on them first and on his roomy clothes	 53.99023782862293
from points of which Mr Dedalus flicked fluff, saying:	 88.35485555920667
—They were made for a man in his health, Ben, anyhow.	 92.67603119755427
—Bad luck to the jewman that made them, Ben Dollard said. Thanks be to	 36.32630369696033
God he’s not paid yet.	 183.67069112838007
—And how is that _basso profondo_, Benjamin? Father Cowley asked.	 21.31432326805873
Cashel Boyle O’Connor Fitzmaurice Tisdall Farrell, murmuring,	 5.430940074915271
glassyeyed, strode past the Kildare street club.	 32.577232128734515
Ben Dollard frowned and, making suddenly a chanter’s mouth, gave forth	 112.91624935085215
a deep note.	 94.03525602017969
—Aw! he said.	 19.165321086926493
—That’s the style, Mr Dedalus said, nodding to its drone.	 47.27582088737422
—What about that? Ben Dollard said. Not too dusty? What?	 39.794934691136746
He turned to both.	 86.41641154187698
—That’ll do, Father Cowley said, nodding also.	 61.05315344484081
The reverend Hugh C. Love walked from the old chapterhouse of saint	 19.24594724049448
Mary’s abbey past James and Charles Kennedy’s, rectifiers, attended by	 122.34735962032518
Geraldines tall and personable, towards the Tholsel beyond the ford of	 20.11403129704436
hurdles.	 4.608171674364364
Ben Dollard with a heavy list towards the shopfronts led them forward,	 75.48337379328996
his joyful fingers in the air.	 25.67868310292075
—Come along with me to the subsheriff’s office, he said. I want to show	 30.009158237736685
you the new beauty Rock has for a bailiff. He’s a cross between	 172.23821205736573
Lobengula and Lynchehaun. He’s well worth seeing, mind you. Come along.	 35.702524356527846
I saw John Henry Menton casually in the Bodega just now and it will	 42.096745530886864
cost me a fall if I don’t... Wait awhile... We’re on the right lay,	 105.07542899319236
Bob, believe you me.	 572.0082094454011
—For a few days tell him, Father Cowley said anxiously.	 36.763690391955485
Ben Dollard halted and stared, his loud orifice open, a dangling button	 75.6731278788213
of his coat wagging brightbacked from its thread as he wiped away the	 35.56963910791158
heavy shraums that clogged his eyes to hear aright.	 67.24504229466599
—What few days? he boomed. Hasn’t your landlord distrained for rent?	 104.4396526984396
—He has, Father Cowley said.	 27.917154308324406
—Then our friend’s writ is not worth the paper it’s printed on, Ben	 146.191767459831
Dollard said. The landlord has the prior claim. I gave him all the	 48.34451448085683
particulars. 29 Windsor avenue. Love is the name?	 130.75543430861183
—That’s right, Father Cowley said. The reverend Mr Love. He’s a	 79.04880440967126
minister in the country somewhere. But are you sure of that?	 60.494476508012184
—You can tell Barabbas from me, Ben Dollard said, that he can put that	 43.54342044434342
writ where Jacko put the nuts.	 488.24930392685116
He led Father Cowley boldly forward, linked to his bulk.	 50.969583360360964
—Filberts I believe they were, Mr Dedalus said, as he dropped his	 24.559374394887413
glasses on his coatfront, following them.	 141.11972690637705
—The youngster will be all right, Martin Cunningham said, as they	 14.435848782588625
passed out of the Castleyard gate.	 40.624743523083154
The policeman touched his forehead.	 111.27660945333619
—God bless you, Martin Cunningham said, cheerily.	 21.460402846838466
He signed to the waiting jarvey who chucked at the reins and set on	 49.01809399405155
towards Lord Edward street.	 381.1292157534748
Bronze by gold, Miss Kennedy’s head by Miss Douce’s head, appeared	 12.332455315932092
above the crossblind of the Ormond hotel.	 39.378369304267096
—Yes, Martin Cunningham said, fingering his beard. I wrote to Father	 57.993336581207785
Conmee and laid the whole case before him.	 85.15295201082368
—You could try our friend, Mr Power suggested backward.	 90.15592611449577
—Boyd? Martin Cunningham said shortly. Touch me not.	 30.593006577000065
John Wyse Nolan, lagging behind, reading the list, came after them	 75.89683780842218
quickly down Cork hill.	 515.4315022938574
On the steps of the City hall Councillor Nannetti, descending, hailed	 26.777744454217732
Alderman Cowley and Councillor Abraham Lyon ascending.	 102.60675713709004
The castle car wheeled empty into upper Exchange street.	 57.48065908139186
—Look here, Martin, John Wyse Nolan said, overtaking them at the _Mail_	 68.85118324945607
office. I see Bloom put his name down for five shillings.	 156.1522931644613
—Quite right, Martin Cunningham said, taking the list. And put down the	 24.203911345933708
five shillings too.	 48.709038402255906
—Without a second word either, Mr Power said.	 92.82768315579855
—Strange but true, Martin Cunningham added.	 121.77648345089659
John Wyse Nolan opened wide eyes.	 28.967824355277408
—I’ll say there is much kindness in the jew, he quoted, elegantly.	 78.39274872081855
They went down Parliament street.	 24.049489342215406
—There’s Jimmy Henry, Mr Power said, just heading for Kavanagh’s.	 46.58522441695533
—Righto, Martin Cunningham said. Here goes.	 27.469011443599527
Outside _la Maison Claire_ Blazes Boylan waylaid Jack Mooney’s	 81.48030453882818
brother-in-law, humpy, tight, making for the liberties.	 71.32323654960038
John Wyse Nolan fell back with Mr Power, while Martin Cunningham took	 54.898746255417244
the elbow of a dapper little man in a shower of hail suit, who walked	 47.828069996901405
uncertainly, with hasty steps past Micky Anderson’s watches.	 109.71371240374866
—The assistant town clerk’s corns are giving him some trouble, John	 97.48247706973162
Wyse Nolan told Mr Power.	 61.021653220537296
They followed round the corner towards James Kavanagh’s winerooms. The	 60.16539262281887
empty castle car fronted them at rest in Essex gate. Martin Cunningham,	 84.60677272503561
speaking always, showed often the list at which Jimmy Henry did not	 371.17261311658154
glance.	 6584.8527050564335
—And long John Fanning is here too, John Wyse Nolan said, as large as	 25.053188948455343
life.	 1040.235324093293
The tall form of long John Fanning filled the doorway where he stood.	 43.11027052972342
—Good day, Mr Subsheriff, Martin Cunningham said, as all halted and	 29.817416487785287
greeted.	 22234.838907737576
Long John Fanning made no way for them. He removed his large Henry Clay	 118.04865055773917
decisively and his large fierce eyes scowled intelligently over all	 32.282455595375495
their faces.	 141.2757120318731
—Are the conscript fathers pursuing their peaceful deliberations? he	 36.40162265667689
said with rich acrid utterance to the assistant town clerk.	 29.928002914083184
Hell open to christians they were having, Jimmy Henry said pettishly,	 93.92188586455839
about their damned Irish language. Where was the marshal, he wanted to	 73.23700955076261
know, to keep order in the council chamber. And old Barlow the	 74.25526427068463
macebearer laid up with asthma, no mace on the table, nothing in order,	 67.28672070049944
no quorum even, and Hutchinson, the lord mayor, in Llandudno and little	 48.49142922407877
Lorcan Sherlock doing _locum tenens_ for him. Damned Irish language,	 48.598515769921036
language of our forefathers.	 43.11910561759042
Long John Fanning blew a plume of smoke from his lips.	 47.9139192862785
Martin Cunningham spoke by turns, twirling the peak of his beard, to	 46.33268094271407
the assistant town clerk and the subsheriff, while John Wyse Nolan held	 36.04275391020791
his peace.	 146.28047872939618
—What Dignam was that? long John Fanning asked.	 31.40911848373328
Jimmy Henry made a grimace and lifted his left foot.	 57.38675600618102
—O, my corns! he said plaintively. Come upstairs for goodness’ sake	 31.346706763267587
till I sit down somewhere. Uff! Ooo! Mind!	 92.89293648471882
Testily he made room for himself beside long John Fanning’s flank and	 51.35704529631842
passed in and up the stairs.	 249.6883196933454
—Come on up, Martin Cunningham said to the subsheriff. I don’t think	 27.42375306095
you knew him or perhaps you did, though.	 232.47595252032872
With John Wyse Nolan Mr Power followed them in.	 31.077201860805612
—Decent little soul he was, Mr Power said to the stalwart back of long	 52.091494317370085
John Fanning ascending towards long John Fanning in the mirror.	 37.63884619787469
—Rather lowsized. Dignam of Menton’s office that was, Martin Cunningham	 87.73834446408446
said.	 674.7359038427248
Long John Fanning could not remember him.	 24.301819499317418
Clatter of horsehoofs sounded from the air.	 12.444117955086814
—What’s that? Martin Cunningham said.	 18.43122624440793
All turned where they stood. John Wyse Nolan came down again. From the	 75.60180848498682
cool shadow of the doorway he saw the horses pass Parliament street,	 56.32352743438107
harness and glossy pasterns in sunlight shimmering. Gaily they went	 35.935455311441316
past before his cool unfriendly eyes, not quickly. In saddles of the	 117.59252843335388
leaders, leaping leaders, rode outriders.	 75.20264342502533
—What was it? Martin Cunningham asked, as they went on up the	 29.457115010662932
staircase.	 6667.29052386655
—The lord lieutenantgeneral and general governor of Ireland, John Wyse	 33.3576124966176
Nolan answered from the stairfoot.	 44.336657709000875
As they trod across the thick carpet Buck Mulligan whispered behind his	 40.66206181723893
Panama to Haines:	 375.8322340349585
—Parnell’s brother. There in the corner.	 82.43327775004006
They chose a small table near the window, opposite a longfaced man	 74.13101247906307
whose beard and gaze hung intently down on a chessboard.	 44.13999453238332
—Is that he? Haines asked, twisting round in his seat.	 88.30034361491482
—Yes, Mulligan said. That’s John Howard, his brother, our city marshal.	 149.33915608422848
John Howard Parnell translated a white bishop quietly and his grey claw	 36.38622523735871
went up again to his forehead whereat it rested. An instant after,	 65.32778947415599
under its screen, his eyes looked quickly, ghostbright, at his foe and	 55.80523803175492
fell once more upon a working corner.	 332.65859959706836
—I’ll take a _mélange,_ Haines said to the waitress.	 22.244685448752143
—Two _mélanges,_ Buck Mulligan said. And bring us some scones and	 46.4071804889401
butter and some cakes as well.	 193.7621252438269
When she had gone he said, laughing:	 43.37334363324521
—We call it D.B.C. because they have damn bad cakes. O, but you missed	 97.14935048654874
Dedalus on _Hamlet._	 502.31023986729844
Haines opened his newbought book.	 63.50278967090224
—I’m sorry, he said. Shakespeare is the happy huntingground of all	 38.55321029597502
minds that have lost their balance.	 191.80803549934646
The onelegged sailor growled at the area of 14 Nelson street:	 62.04147060232839
—_England expects_...	 166.21218047991277
Buck Mulligan’s primrose waistcoat shook gaily to his laughter.	 49.297339520074814
—You should see him, he said, when his body loses its balance.	 78.26342808000041
Wandering Ængus I call him.	 98.39028460078708
—I am sure he has an _idée fixe,_ Haines said, pinching his chin	 40.670129183885365
thoughtfully with thumb and forefinger. Now I am speculating what it	 91.5875738704933
would be likely to be. Such persons always have.	 102.0493427326104
Buck Mulligan bent across the table gravely.	 16.50865680134664
—They drove his wits astray, he said, by visions of hell. He will never	 64.68324841056798
capture the Attic note. The note of Swinburne, of all poets, the white	 47.15388086822703
death and the ruddy birth. That is his tragedy. He can never be a poet.	 63.2709756348348
The joy of creation...	 116.82231766530538
—Eternal punishment, Haines said, nodding curtly. I see. I tackled him	 54.03757348667719
this morning on belief. There was something on his mind, I saw. It’s	 74.74188796161536
rather interesting because professor Pokorny of Vienna makes an	 140.00724428969338
interesting point out of that.	 85.87697484364364
Buck Mulligan’s watchful eyes saw the waitress come. He helped her to	 53.144528794509114
unload her tray.	 55.31316176831047
—He can find no trace of hell in ancient Irish myth, Haines said, amid	 53.12142236977198
the cheerful cups. The moral idea seems lacking, the sense of destiny,	 63.28499206276245
of retribution. Rather strange he should have just that fixed idea.	 103.56004927263058
Does he write anything for your movement?	 139.4908989017544
He sank two lumps of sugar deftly longwise through the whipped cream.	 42.56011835963091
Buck Mulligan slit a steaming scone in two and plastered butter over	 40.747953218666105
its smoking pith. He bit off a soft piece hungrily.	 97.95893463765394
—Ten years, he said, chewing and laughing. He is going to write	 53.604996705737065
something in ten years.	 137.54872555147765
—Seems a long way off, Haines said, thoughtfully lifting his spoon.	 89.56272525941372
Still, I shouldn’t wonder if he did after all.	 72.28739683886822
He tasted a spoonful from the creamy cone of his cup.	 22.264029825314644
—This is real Irish cream I take it, he said with forbearance. I don’t	 76.2441610375959
want to be imposed on.	 20.82711128740798
Elijah, skiff, light crumpled throwaway, sailed eastward by flanks of	 36.359472156631725
ships and trawlers, amid an archipelago of corks, beyond new Wapping	 32.34551276124026
street past Benson’s ferry, and by the threemasted schooner _Rosevean_	 13.162689392441267
from Bridgwater with bricks.	 34.25117714855206
Almidano Artifoni walked past Holles street, past Sewell’s yard. Behind	 79.78848567730547
him Cashel Boyle O’Connor Fitzmaurice Tisdall Farrell, with	 6.243470837500749
stickumbrelladustcoat dangling, shunned the lamp before Mr Law Smith’s	 64.773599172715
house and, crossing, walked along Merrion square. Distantly behind him	 59.134841144429565
a blind stripling tapped his way by the wall of College park.	 24.362672810100058
Cashel Boyle O’Connor Fitzmaurice Tisdall Farrell walked as far as Mr	 15.647621378429678
Lewis Werner’s cheerful windows, then turned and strode back along	 82.2164477315642
Merrion square, his stickumbrelladustcoat dangling.	 73.89931160099827
At the corner of Wilde’s house he halted, frowned at Elijah’s name	 70.75281815635208
announced on the Metropolitan hall, frowned at the distant pleasance of	 38.075533961039746
duke’s lawn. His eyeglass flashed frowning in the sun. With ratsteeth	 45.36183406665307
bared he muttered:	 211.31500141673956
—_Coactus volui._	 4.411654744205047
He strode on for Clare street, grinding his fierce word.	 77.29941587433812
As he strode past Mr Bloom’s dental windows the sway of his dustcoat	 31.213367369693806
brushed rudely from its angle a slender tapping cane and swept onwards,	 62.35551815295873
having buffeted a thewless body. The blind stripling turned his sickly	 50.31205083006368
face after the striding form.	 118.02301211801588
—God’s curse on you, he said sourly, whoever you are! You’re blinder	 32.157929244520545
nor I am, you bitch’s bastard!	 161.0678025647419
Opposite Ruggy O’Donohoe’s Master Patrick Aloysius Dignam, pawing the	 20.868893205282447
pound and a half of Mangan’s, late Fehrenbach’s, porksteaks he had been	 37.46929700888809
sent for, went along warm Wicklow street dawdling. It was too blooming	 131.52863777715984
dull sitting in the parlour with Mrs Stoer and Mrs Quigley and Mrs	 58.77039752782126
MacDowell and the blind down and they all at their sniffles and sipping	 65.20129886161435
sups of the superior tawny sherry uncle Barney brought from Tunney’s.	 44.73194203692534
And they eating crumbs of the cottage fruitcake, jawing the whole	 23.66692341314878
blooming time and sighing.	 478.07651881000885
After Wicklow lane the window of Madame Doyle, courtdress milliner,	 36.814248662152536
stopped him. He stood looking in at the two puckers stripped to their	 74.89267375662654
pelts and putting up their props. From the sidemirrors two mourning	 26.994281844282987
Masters Dignam gaped silently. Myler Keogh, Dublin’s pet lamb, will	 53.20913982579764
meet sergeantmajor Bennett, the Portobello bruiser, for a purse of	 44.73560435334478
fifty sovereigns. Gob, that’d be a good pucking match to see. Myler	 87.02283624833014
Keogh, that’s the chap sparring out to him with the green sash. Two bar	 64.73746892114207
entrance, soldiers half price. I could easy do a bunk on ma. Master	 141.17322166501884
Dignam on his left turned as he turned. That’s me in mourning. When is	 134.7400081742862
it? May the twentysecond. Sure, the blooming thing is all over. He	 106.82985352464459
turned to the right and on his right Master Dignam turned, his cap	 56.966280401551465
awry, his collar sticking up. Buttoning it down, his chin lifted, he	 40.680446328383574
saw the image of Marie Kendall, charming soubrette, beside the two	 42.36310994292784
puckers. One of them mots that do be in the packets of fags Stoer	 19.630243194291072
smokes that his old fellow welted hell out of him for one time he found	 82.8352355533818
out.	 536.8554774050247
Master Dignam got his collar down and dawdled on. The best pucker going	 72.54943557657052
for strength was Fitzsimons. One puck in the wind from that fellow	 53.54076346323438
would knock you into the middle of next week, man. But the best pucker	 82.8522015090568
for science was Jem Corbet before Fitzsimons knocked the stuffings out	 73.4661809802139
of him, dodging and all.	 44.084168080045266
In Grafton street Master Dignam saw a red flower in a toff’s mouth and	 42.94627165128602
a swell pair of kicks on him and he listening to what the drunk was	 55.44999951443844
telling him and grinning all the time.	 49.13297091550241
No Sandymount tram.	 122.5020468908656
Master Dignam walked along Nassau street, shifted the porksteaks to his	 29.641183826531808
other hand. His collar sprang up again and he tugged it down. The	 56.6587873198747
blooming stud was too small for the buttonhole of the shirt, blooming	 47.01251101832353
end to it. He met schoolboys with satchels. I’m not going tomorrow	 82.33352791287233
either, stay away till Monday. He met other schoolboys. Do they notice	 140.52670926673693
I’m in mourning? Uncle Barney said he’d get it into the paper tonight.	 36.3183513269009
Then they’ll all see it in the paper and read my name printed and pa’s	 54.89228836852286
name.	 1099.0983667900869
His face got all grey instead of being red like it was and there was a	 95.48197884438909
fly walking over it up to his eye. The scrunch that was when they were	 44.44860956700437
screwing the screws into the coffin: and the bumps when they were	 20.773810272655297
bringing it downstairs.	 206.6052054245158
Pa was inside it and ma crying in the parlour and uncle Barney telling	 131.709816898062
the men how to get it round the bend. A big coffin it was, and high and	 86.75868590108644
heavylooking. How was that? The last night pa was boosed he was	 56.59535330721162
standing on the landing there bawling out for his boots to go out to	 72.0931082559907
Tunney’s for to boose more and he looked butty and short in his shirt.	 78.65763860114883
Never see him again. Death, that is. Pa is dead. My father is dead. He	 124.41731514243486
told me to be a good son to ma. I couldn’t hear the other things he	 41.60339940991744
said but I saw his tongue and his teeth trying to say it better. Poor	 68.539881555183
pa. That was Mr Dignam, my father. I hope he’s in purgatory now because	 106.55289208956906
he went to confession to Father Conroy on Saturday night.	 85.35938556599913
William Humble, earl of Dudley, and lady Dudley, accompanied by	 53.75487818013204
lieutenantcolonel Heseltine, drove out after luncheon from the	 27.612934734480767
viceregal lodge. In the following carriage were the honourable Mrs	 150.65457384864334
Paget, Miss de Courcy and the honourable Gerald Ward A. D. C. in	 38.53742750870057
attendance.	 8047.703469380609
The cavalcade passed out by the lower gate of Phoenix park saluted by	 34.46879695330195
obsequious policemen and proceeded past Kingsbridge along the northern	 15.312583332829975
quays. The viceroy was most cordially greeted on his way through the	 38.01091563450427
metropolis. At Bloody bridge Mr Thomas Kernan beyond the river greeted	 61.353184032489374
him vainly from afar. Between Queen’s and Whitworth bridges lord	 55.281073396794305
Dudley’s viceregal carriages passed and were unsaluted by Mr Dudley	 67.1491595734802
White, B. L., M. A., who stood on Arran quay outside Mrs M. E. White’s,	 128.3569438688369
the pawnbroker’s, at the corner of Arran street west stroking his nose	 22.98220833918767
with his forefinger, undecided whether he should arrive at Phibsborough	 66.80998912066363
more quickly by a triple change of tram or by hailing a car or on foot	 124.72715122891185
through Smithfield, Constitution hill and Broadstone terminus. In the	 20.83870673090107

Patriotic Insurance Company, an elderly female about to enter changed	 200.6714028430047
her plan and retracing her steps by King’s windows smiled credulously	 53.63112721428986
on the representative of His Majesty. From its sluice in Wood quay wall	 27.93715459448801
under Tom Devan’s office Poddle river hung out in fealty a tongue of	 121.20185559403961

hat low. His Excellency graciously returned Mr Dedalus’ greeting. From	 96.99995863628662

unperceived, mindful of lords deputies whose hands benignant had held	 73.71512787068734

Kavanagh’s winerooms John Wyse Nolan smiled with unseen coldness	 14.821083987381666
towards the lord lieutenantgeneral and general governor of Ireland. The	 36.04463879757961

fixed on him, took his thumbs quickly out of the pockets of his claret	 66.60914955422031
waistcoat and doffed his cap to her. A charming _soubrette,_ great	 102.7153021667103
Marie Kendall, with dauby cheeks and lifted skirt smiled daubily from	 41.603090941062796

lieutenantcolonel H. G. Heseltine, and also upon the honourable Gerald	 43.21609000053993
Ward A. D. C. From the window of the D. B. C. Buck Mulligan gaily, and	 33.53061626833429
Haines gravely, gazed down on the viceregal equipage over the shoulders	 62.23488549481564
of eager guests, whose mass of forms darkened the chessboard whereon	 45.13947866037973
John Howard Parnell looked intently. In Fownes’s street Dilly Dedalus,	 28.928067431525538
straining her sight upward from Chardenal’s first French primer, saw	 93.38923963605171

Menton, filling the doorway of Commercial Buildings, stared from	 75.19313165320405
winebig oyster eyes, holding a fat gold hunter watch not looked at in	 211.14838396641787
his fat left hand not feeling it. Where the foreleg of King Billy’s	 105.41767719597036
horse pawed the air Mrs Breen plucked her hastening husband back from	 62.613778392785065
under the hoofs of the outriders. She shouted in his ear the tidings.	 32.35156024289896
Understanding, he shifted his tomes to his left breast and saluted the	 47.199687565259985
second carriage. The honourable Gerald Ward A. D. C., agreeably	 41.99866911556757
surprised, made haste to reply. At Ponsonby’s corner a jaded white	 128.1383767239484
flagon H. halted and four tallhatted white flagons halted behind him,	 80.70168569785295
E.L.Y.’S, while outriders pranced past and carriages. Opposite Pigott’s	 76.36802203376345
music warerooms Mr Denis J Maginni, professor of dancing &c, gaily	 46.67636245767436
apparelled, gravely walked, outpassed by a viceroy and unobserved. By	 39.029395044026955
the provost’s wall came jauntily Blazes Boylan, stepping in tan shoes	 34.02717457420119
and socks with skyblue clocks to the refrain of _My girl’s a Yorkshire	 43.94466546691341
girl._	 11315.223032120857
Blazes Boylan presented to the leaders’ skyblue frontlets and high	 25.34983330978293
action a skyblue tie, a widebrimmed straw hat at a rakish angle and a	 71.33143012859722
suit of indigo serge. His hands in his jacket pockets forgot to salute	 55.315935196453765
but he offered to the three ladies the bold admiration of his eyes and	 33.17752802665533
the red flower between his lips. As they drove along Nassau street His	 36.17633162018305
Excellency drew the attention of his bowing consort to the programme of	 70.05445029342654
music which was being discoursed in College park. Unseen brazen	 53.90267557832836
highland laddies blared and drumthumped after the _cortège_:	 9.098857197805955
But though she’s a factory lass	 52.90755405570168
And wears no fancy clothes.	 218.66822416883852
Baraabum.	 4.608171674364364
Yet I’ve a sort of a	 75.63424324035125
Yorkshire relish for	 139.30788577429092
My little Yorkshire rose.	 181.36487143624439
Baraabum.	 4.608171674364364
Thither of the wall the quartermile flat handicappers, M. C. Green, H.	 75.49241535652163

this morning at poor little Paddy Dignam’s...	 65.37901889519425

—Very, Mr Dedalus said, staring hard at a headless sardine.	 32.17444570673932

Bloom went by Barry’s. Wish I could. Wait. That wonderworker if I had.	 52.47436275977309

But for example the chap that wallops the big drum. His vocation:	 62.707574864615715
Mickey Rooney’s band. Wonder how it first struck him. Sitting at home	 70.98812889346931
after pig’s cheek and cabbage nursing it in the armchair. Rehearsing	 38.903254465496424

what you call yashmak or I mean kismet. Fate.	 82.9498822481219

O, the whore of the lane!	 72.55029609600747
A frowsy whore with black straw sailor hat askew came glazily in the	 49.880510886405645
day along the quay towards Mr Bloom. When first he saw that form	 99.8385378617908
endearing? Yes, it is. I feel so lonely. Wet night in the lane. Horn.	 74.06357687980538
Who had the? Heehaw shesaw. Off her beat here. What is she? Hope she.	 72.99738399260673
Psst! Any chance of your wash. Knew Molly. Had me decked. Stout lady	 177.66253524577002
does be with you in the brown costume. Put you off your stroke, that.	 106.47537692641058
Appointment we made knowing we’d never, well hardly ever. Too dear too	 164.70738929907122
near to home sweet home. Sees me, does she? Looks a fright in the day.	 92.82712879567478
Face like dip. Damn her. O, well, she has to live like the rest. Look	 117.02694733015812
in here.	 385.42096001649946
In Lionel Marks’s antique saleshop window haughty Henry Lionel Leopold	 96.7457834557631

don’t want it. That’s what good salesman is. Make you buy what he wants	 85.83325685413853

charge me for the edge he gave it. She’s passing now. Six bob.	 123.94518910618646

[ 12 ]	 463.94842625767166
I was just passing the time of day with old Troy of the D. M. P. at the	 48.47097020633
corner of Arbour hill there and be damned but a bloody sweep came along	 70.68123654859818
and he near drove his gear into my eye. I turned around to let him have	 64.17585366272102
the weight of my tongue when who should I see dodging along Stony	 112.78498692687076
Batter only Joe Hynes.	 151.1640280506716
—Lo, Joe, says I. How are you blowing? Did you see that bloody	 51.73469178403358
chimneysweep near shove my eye out with his brush?	 78.25428890779638
—Soot’s luck, says Joe. Who’s the old ballocks you were talking to?	 50.930796306573136
—Old Troy, says I, was in the force. I’m on two minds not to give that	 64.96414576152759
fellow in charge for obstructing the thoroughfare with his brooms and	 51.688094213844764
ladders.	 4.608171674364364
—What are you doing round those parts? says Joe.	 46.771789389545326
—Devil a much, says I. There’s a bloody big foxy thief beyond by the	 91.92190930840445
garrison church at the corner of Chicken lane—old Troy was just giving	 59.428743921132515
me a wrinkle about him—lifted any God’s quantity of tea and sugar to	 71.21414104395383
pay three bob a week said he had a farm in the county Down off a	 78.91926493439216
hop-of-my-thumb by the name of Moses Herzog over there near Heytesbury	 36.87304341890517
street.	 1066.902777154171
—Circumcised? says Joe.	 18.016627879067123
—Ay, says I. A bit off the top. An old plumber named Geraghty. I’m	 54.029937272185634
hanging on to his taw now for the past fortnight and I can’t get a	 46.80124931399191
penny out of him.	 113.60028659991005
—That the lay you’re on now? says Joe.	 107.19128566805755
—Ay, says I. How are the mighty fallen! Collector of bad and doubtful	 45.84054216806893
debts. But that’s the most notorious bloody robber you’d meet in a	 82.50810395332906
day’s walk and the face on him all pockmarks would hold a shower of	 54.10922580202375
rain. _Tell him,_ says he, _I dare him,_ says he, _and I doubledare him	 44.491604980017655
to send you round here again or if he does,_ says he, _I’ll have him	 123.6182539870992
summonsed up before the court, so I will, for trading without a	 61.22093349336492
licence._ And he after stuffing himself till he’s fit to burst. Jesus,	 170.7081430812591
I had to laugh at the little jewy getting his shirt out. _He drink me	 74.6084133682717
my teas. He eat me my sugars. Because he no pay me my moneys?_	 102.13685358141606
For nonperishable goods bought of Moses Herzog, of 13 Saint Kevin’s	 80.97560554984484
parade in the city of Dublin, Wood quay ward, merchant, hereinafter	 37.149479426983206
called the vendor, and sold and delivered to Michael E. Geraghty,	 174.2384221192698
esquire, of 29 Arbour hill in the city of Dublin, Arran quay ward,	 27.75907534560627
gentleman, hereinafter called the purchaser, videlicet, five pounds	 202.19741528448282
avoirdupois of first choice tea at three shillings and no pence per	 67.36911801086767
pound avoirdupois and three stone avoirdupois of sugar, crushed	 101.76327576208972
crystal, at threepence per pound avoirdupois, the said purchaser debtor	 88.43341404716833
to the said vendor of one pound five shillings and sixpence sterling	 54.967401669244865
for value received which amount shall be paid by said purchaser to said	 124.53265698407425
vendor in weekly instalments every seven calendar days of three	 241.88061416354702
shillings and no pence sterling: and the said nonperishable goods shall	 167.92507268155777
not be pawned or pledged or sold or otherwise alienated by the said	 46.16283586183052
purchaser but shall be and remain and be held to be the sole and	 130.0235242582302
exclusive property of the said vendor to be disposed of at his good	 54.13612927712231
will and pleasure until the said amount shall have been duly paid by	 97.88983624675298
the said purchaser to the said vendor in the manner herein set forth as	 47.79489105772896
this day hereby agreed between the said vendor, his heirs, successors,	 68.18493124599075
trustees and assigns of the one part and the said purchaser, his heirs,	 22.40933652326984
successors, trustees and assigns of the other part.	 14.391304706699364
—Are you a strict t.t.? says Joe.	 22.48396458470736
—Not taking anything between drinks, says I.	 84.53662024931454
—What about paying our respects to our friend? says Joe.	 40.0601600366895
—Who? says I. Sure, he’s out in John of God’s off his head, poor man.	 153.11260130524846
—Drinking his own stuff? says Joe.	 59.74289586342871
—Ay, says I. Whisky and water on the brain.	 53.59335204602245
—Come around to Barney Kiernan’s, says Joe. I want to see the citizen.	 23.916078185735334
—Barney mavourneen’s be it, says I. Anything strange or wonderful, Joe?	 348.8539738449078
—Not a word, says Joe. I was up at that meeting in the City Arms.	 30.368311468664174
—What was that, Joe? says I.	 35.08551190560441
—Cattle traders, says Joe, about the foot and mouth disease. I want to	 40.1453694157915
give the citizen the hard word about it.	 192.96714945153923
So we went around by the Linenhall barracks and the back of the	 26.026394759273458
courthouse talking of one thing or another. Decent fellow Joe when he	 67.26468447828945
has it but sure like that he never has it. Jesus, I couldn’t get over	 123.57057148797057
that bloody foxy Geraghty, the daylight robber. For trading without a	 40.887266180721525
licence, says he.	 82.70023788419061
In Inisfail the fair there lies a land, the land of holy Michan. There	 126.82481265431524
rises a watchtower beheld of men afar. There sleep the mighty dead as	 129.90365339270892
in life they slept, warriors and princes of high renown. A pleasant	 81.85302154514868
land it is in sooth of murmuring waters, fishful streams where sport	 56.13278901181278
the gurnard, the plaice, the roach, the halibut, the gibbed haddock,	 9.667696021784698
the grilse, the dab, the brill, the flounder, the pollock, the mixed	 19.820779635169288
coarse fish generally and other denizens of the aqueous kingdom too	 35.42825814679702
numerous to be enumerated. In the mild breezes of the west and of the	 16.808905552880766
east the lofty trees wave in different directions their firstclass	 66.59662435467439
foliage, the wafty sycamore, the Lebanonian cedar, the exalted	 6.683510986390727
planetree, the eugenic eucalyptus and other ornaments of the arboreal	 8.95549059710922
world with which that region is thoroughly well supplied. Lovely	 111.3402937934377
maidens sit in close proximity to the roots of the lovely trees singing	 37.98379946929619
the most lovely songs while they play with all kinds of lovely objects	 52.768378970845845
as for example golden ingots, silvery fishes, crans of herrings, drafts	 67.17731490842091
of eels, codlings, creels of fingerlings, purple seagems and playful	 13.568622690031756
insects. And heroes voyage from afar to woo them, from Eblana to	 21.873366890947057
Slievemargy, the peerless princes of unfettered Munster and of Connacht	 18.383163465276034
the just and of smooth sleek Leinster and of Cruachan’s land and of	 74.9875183886256
Armagh the splendid and of the noble district of Boyle, princes, the	 72.76499763518744
sons of kings.	 28.21531977951426
And there rises a shining palace whose crystal glittering roof is seen	 61.73233410898586
by mariners who traverse the extensive sea in barks built expressly for	 46.819536419883384
that purpose, and thither come all herds and fatlings and firstfruits	 52.14190430575233
of that land for O’Connell Fitzsimon takes toll of them, a chieftain	 60.5618306331294
descended from chieftains. Thither the extremely large wains bring	 106.1463260377784
foison of the fields, flaskets of cauliflowers, floats of spinach,	 27.35757815260291
pineapple chunks, Rangoon beans, strikes of tomatoes, drums of figs,	 68.59802578039992
drills of Swedes, spherical potatoes and tallies of iridescent kale,	 5.6411414103007695
York and Savoy, and trays of onions, pearls of the earth, and punnets	 28.509603856022945
of mushrooms and custard marrows and fat vetches and bere and rape and	 11.666374821727445
red green yellow brown russet sweet big bitter ripe pomellated apples	 142.53805600763488
and chips of strawberries and sieves of gooseberries, pulpy and	 25.235085586971376
pelurious, and strawberries fit for princes and raspberries from their	 28.861808238094802
canes.	 4.608171674364364
I dare him, says he, and I doubledare him. Come out here, Geraghty, you	 43.009742856398816
notorious bloody hill and dale robber!	 19.932528798198952
And by that way wend the herds innumerable of bellwethers and flushed	 32.49582783564031
ewes and shearling rams and lambs and stubble geese and medium steers	 9.95125505499918
and roaring mares and polled calves and longwools and storesheep and	 12.840804010708057
Cuffe’s prime springers and culls and sowpigs and baconhogs and the	 12.153420770719382
various different varieties of highly distinguished swine and Angus	 33.73434766570341
heifers and polly bulllocks of immaculate pedigree together with prime	 19.070863569554916
premiated milchcows and beeves: and there is ever heard a trampling,	 15.739357133205734
cackling, roaring, lowing, bleating, bellowing, rumbling, grunting,	 70.366408793726
champing, chewing, of sheep and pigs and heavyhooved kine from	 24.212533448670527
pasturelands of Lusk and Rush and Carrickmines and from the streamy	 13.696695544377679
vales of Thomond, from the M’Gillicuddy’s reeks the inaccessible and	 8.331585845937138
lordly Shannon the unfathomable, and from the gentle declivities of the	 14.479720553093161
place of the race of Kiar, their udders distended with superabundance	 24.871755003442587
of milk and butts of butter and rennets of cheese and farmer’s firkins	 37.12001626948391
and targets of lamb and crannocks of corn and oblong eggs in great	 37.82165571236608
hundreds, various in size, the agate with this dun.	 86.0047753337639
So we turned into Barney Kiernan’s and there, sure enough, was the	 59.99620653131074
citizen up in the corner having a great confab with himself and that	 80.61286981152435
bloody mangy mongrel, Garryowen, and he waiting for what the sky would	 119.69388235217149
drop in the way of drink.	 74.3324348699666
—There he is, says I, in his gloryhole, with his cruiskeen lawn and his	 42.96347072735355
load of papers, working for the cause.	 176.90028948433496
The bloody mongrel let a grouse out of him would give you the creeps.	 30.13868066222098
Be a corporal work of mercy if someone would take the life of that	 95.5437139020796
bloody dog. I’m told for a fact he ate a good part of the breeches off	 74.4872813776378
a constabulary man in Santry that came round one time with a blue paper	 49.51794169472223
about a licence.	 199.1750825325679
—Stand and deliver, says he.	 126.48888508726327
—That’s all right, citizen, says Joe. Friends here.	 24.25381123641403
—Pass, friends, says he.	 270.1866014308941
Then he rubs his hand in his eye and says he:	 39.62482379707686
—What’s your opinion of the times?	 71.23761828917627
Doing the rapparee and Rory of the hill. But, begob, Joe was equal to	 41.01473826138915
the occasion.	 262.03426372411724
—I think the markets are on a rise, says he, sliding his hand down his	 48.51082300199706
fork.	 8890.1493802269
So begob the citizen claps his paw on his knee and he says:	 36.67338734851564
—Foreign wars is the cause of it.	 65.67424840485735
And says Joe, sticking his thumb in his pocket:	 35.97409016128981
—It’s the Russians wish to tyrannise.	 51.49130038683997
—Arrah, give over your bloody codding, Joe, says I. I’ve a thirst on me	 111.73879557167965
I wouldn’t sell for half a crown.	 96.31445060330884
—Give it a name, citizen, says Joe.	 69.12036719247035
—Wine of the country, says he.	 73.41548093589445
—What’s yours? says Joe.	 61.81906077963997
—Ditto MacAnaspey, says I.	 21.771955603702118
—Three pints, Terry, says Joe. And how’s the old heart, citizen? says	 57.965164762408406
he.	 39.122286468479096
—Never better, _a chara_, says he. What Garry? Are we going to win? Eh?	 56.66767164537738
And with that he took the bloody old towser by the scruff of the neck	 30.500170168397894
and, by Jesus, he near throttled him.	 78.47509461489241
The figure seated on a large boulder at the foot of a round tower was	 49.07357113397382
that of a broadshouldered deepchested stronglimbed frankeyed redhaired	 11.398758846869526
freelyfreckled shaggybearded widemouthed largenosed longheaded	 3.933542382544028
deepvoiced barekneed brawnyhanded hairylegged ruddyfaced sinewyarmed	 3.857285642109819
hero. From shoulder to shoulder he measured several ells and his	 107.81802828566434
rocklike mountainous knees were covered, as was likewise the rest of	 47.27219177791773
his body wherever visible, with a strong growth of tawny prickly hair	 67.89595812249405
in hue and toughness similar to the mountain gorse (_Ulex Europeus_).	 44.80596980746627
The widewinged nostrils, from which bristles of the same tawny hue	 32.348266730785156
projected, were of such capaciousness that within their cavernous	 43.03965586964409
obscurity the fieldlark might easily have lodged her nest. The eyes in	 34.9182609468704
which a tear and a smile strove ever for the mastery were of the	 58.72754318115458
dimensions of a goodsized cauliflower. A powerful current of warm	 20.79685404485357
breath issued at regular intervals from the profound cavity of his	 26.9398457908005
mouth while in rhythmic resonance the loud strong hale reverberations	 66.74235114280278
of his formidable heart thundered rumblingly causing the ground, the	 29.383657537292038
summit of the lofty tower and the still loftier walls of the cave to	 37.82887795369255
vibrate and tremble.	 6.065069416742295
He wore a long unsleeved garment of recently flayed oxhide reaching to	 33.22787719342596
the knees in a loose kilt and this was bound about his middle by a	 99.19599674964016
girdle of plaited straw and rushes. Beneath this he wore trews of	 54.41414825474146
deerskin, roughly stitched with gut. His nether extremities were	 13.736881005642998
encased in high Balbriggan buskins dyed in lichen purple, the feet	 39.42692571554254
being shod with brogues of salted cowhide laced with the windpipe of	 19.390382990618335
the same beast. From his girdle hung a row of seastones which jangled	 48.69975714376484
at every movement of his portentous frame and on these were graven with	 49.30923908633315
rude yet striking art the tribal images of many Irish heroes and	 95.57663267048326
heroines of antiquity, Cuchulin, Conn of hundred battles, Niall of nine	 19.434308179161697
hostages, Brian of Kincora, the ardri Malachi, Art MacMurragh, Shane	 39.337043138876915
O’Neill, Father John Murphy, Owen Roe, Patrick Sarsfield, Red Hugh	 100.2008121320523
O’Donnell, Red Jim MacDermott, Soggarth Eoghan O’Growney, Michael	 36.47260979729325
Dwyer, Francy Higgins, Henry Joy M’Cracken, Goliath, Horace Wheatley,	 31.777459443114875
Thomas Conneff, Peg Woffington, the Village Blacksmith, Captain	 26.293274690995947
Moonlight, Captain Boycott, Dante Alighieri, Christopher Columbus, S.	 24.225946031968668
Fursa, S. Brendan, Marshal MacMahon, Charlemagne, Theobald Wolfe Tone,	 39.63404802668628
the Mother of the Maccabees, the Last of the Mohicans, the Rose of	 28.353966047987317
Castile, the Man for Galway, The Man that Broke the Bank at Monte	 113.84530812011705

Soldier Boy, Arrah na Pogue, Dick Turpin, Ludwig Beethoven, the Colleen	 52.868616545716485
Bawn, Waddler Healy, Angus the Culdee, Dolly Mount, Sidney Parade, Ben	 25.534030182498018
Howth, Valentine Greatrakes, Adam and Eve, Arthur Wellesley, Boss	 206.7230265655997
Croker, Herodotus, Jack the Giantkiller, Gautama Buddha, Lady Godiva,	 27.653118371376824
The Lily of Killarney, Balor of the Evil Eye, the Queen of Sheba, Acky	 34.95215383391727
Nagle, Joe Nagle, Alessandro Volta, Jeremiah O’Donovan Rossa, Don	 17.99355570952116
Philip O’Sullivan Beare. A couched spear of acuminated granite rested	 71.23211360797846
by him while at his feet reposed a savage animal of the canine tribe	 64.52405676012138
whose stertorous gasps announced that he was sunk in uneasy slumber, a	 66.81000629117246
supposition confirmed by hoarse growls and spasmodic movements which	 25.342770733746043
his master repressed from time to time by tranquilising blows of a	 82.57533628558734
mighty cudgel rudely fashioned out of paleolithic stone.	 110.25670070394006
So anyhow Terry brought the three pints Joe was standing and begob the	 65.08163804773923
sight nearly left my eyes when I saw him land out a quid. O, as true as	 92.27767825950674
I’m telling you. A goodlooking sovereign.	 84.02862432982647
—And there’s more where that came from, says he.	 120.11806335247144
—Were you robbing the poorbox, Joe? says I.	 37.818776100431855
—Sweat of my brow, says Joe. ’Twas the prudent member gave me the	 82.87051784907403
wheeze.	 4.608171674364364
—I saw him before I met you, says I, sloping around by Pill lane and	 68.19169670151871
Greek street with his cod’s eye counting up all the guts of the fish.	 84.37454524663913
Who comes through Michan’s land, bedight in sable armour? O’Bloom, the	 32.82587169255595
son of Rory: it is he. Impervious to fear is Rory’s son: he of the	 74.7670454667524
prudent soul.	 1971.0202649986359
—For the old woman of Prince’s street, says the citizen, the subsidised	 20.54558356820878
organ. The pledgebound party on the floor of the house. And look at	 39.883262610199104
this blasted rag, says he. Look at this, says he. _The Irish	 72.67870647660467
Independent,_ if you please, founded by Parnell to be the workingman’s	 55.99668845389622
friend. Listen to the births and deaths in the _Irish all for Ireland	 63.53264031566701
Independent,_ and I’ll thank you and the marriages.	 51.464589310197915
And he starts reading them out:	 39.17786985109471

on Sea: the wife of William T Redmayne of a son. How’s that, eh? Wright	 69.52825539545509

Moat house, Chepstow...	 40.00375497270854
—I know that fellow, says Joe, from bitter experience.	 56.69430379183016

Liverpool, Isabella Helen. How’s that for a national press, eh, my	 145.91514339235087
brown son! How’s that for Martin Murphy, the Bantry jobber?	 67.87042389965221
—Ah, well, says Joe, handing round the boose. Thanks be to God they had	 78.08740519542617
the start of us. Drink that, citizen.	 112.60804568687213
—I will, says he, honourable person.	 45.48492602137327
—Health, Joe, says I. And all down the form.	 141.2055905637311
Ah! Ow! Don’t be talking! I was blue mouldy for the want of that pint.	 74.22129285621246
Declare to God I could hear it hit the pit of my stomach with a click.	 37.436571743949074
And lo, as they quaffed their cup of joy, a godlike messenger came	 91.52254580122258
swiftly in, radiant as the eye of heaven, a comely youth and behind him	 83.30686558536105
there passed an elder of noble gait and countenance, bearing the sacred	 98.53391847675714

fairest of her race.	 53.29224947487242
Little Alf Bergan popped in round the door and hid behind Barney’s	 45.55450043944838
snug, squeezed up with the laughing. And who was sitting up there in	 103.35055580776496
the corner that I hadn’t seen snoring drunk blind to the world only Bob	 142.2952776282594
Doran. I didn’t know what was up and Alf kept making signs out of the	 54.62297845493546
door. And begob what was it only that bloody old pantaloon Denis Breen	 70.51371877526348
in his bathslippers with two bloody big books tucked under his oxter	 33.488309701011225

postcard someone sent him with U. p: up on it to take a li...	 39.6937698456665
And he doubled up.	 33.90163219100155
—Take a what? says I.	 115.15974032217072

—O hell! says I.	 83.94852732897529
The bloody mongrel began to growl that’d put the fear of God in you	 47.40950450632826
seeing something was up but the citizen gave him a kick in the ribs.	 112.70362151011356
_—Bi i dho husht,_ says he.	 23.384877595533066
—Who? says Joe.	 38.342261110299134
—Breen, says Alf. He was in John Henry Menton’s and then he went round	 39.10707632399476

to the subsheriff’s for a lark. O God, I’ve a pain laughing. U. p: up.	 45.57822486515976
The long fellow gave him an eye as good as a process and now the bloody	 42.60237013990414
old lunatic is gone round to Green street to look for a G man.	 53.510766626358546
