pony. That bloody old fool! Ten thousand pounds. You should have seen	 40.4029694916513
long John’s eye. U. p ....	 179.2527239516786
And he started laughing.	 125.54562331744374
—Who are you laughing at? says Bob Doran. Is that Bergan?	 41.366826848973105
—Hurry up, Terry boy, says Alf.	 105.00349791585653
Terence O’Ryan heard him and straightway brought him a crystal cup full	 60.71092077727208
of the foamy ebon ale which the noble twin brothers Bungiveagh and	 41.94488834289634
Bungardilaun brew ever in their divine alevats, cunning as the sons of	 100.32987287199408
deathless Leda. For they garner the succulent berries of the hop and	 10.548452549508447
mass and sift and bruise and brew them and they mix therewith sour	 63.30909178962261
juices and bring the must to the sacred fire and cease not night or day	 171.68483641433704
from their toil, those cunning brothers, lords of the vat.	 30.14236647897898
Then did you, chivalrous Terence, hand forth, as to the manner born,	 106.7233171086496
that nectarous beverage and you offered the crystal cup to him that	 49.91961622976885
thirsted, the soul of chivalry, in beauty akin to the immortals.	 25.651813409075082
But he, the young chief of the O’Bergan’s, could ill brook to be	 47.29968839880991
outdone in generous deeds but gave therefor with gracious gesture a	 80.59297580915849
testoon of costliest bronze. Thereon embossed in excellent smithwork	 25.100473341812645
was seen the image of a queen of regal port, scion of the house of	 32.93355950932424
Brunswick, Victoria her name, Her Most Excellent Majesty, by grace of	 110.27248471198122
God of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland and of the	 60.240476531745756
British dominions beyond the sea, queen, defender of the faith, Empress	 63.21541732859264
of India, even she, who bore rule, a victress over many peoples, the	 65.11558041998103
wellbeloved, for they knew and loved her from the rising of the sun to	 62.117207846832436
the going down thereof, the pale, the dark, the ruddy and the ethiop.	 90.40751304530833

down outside?	 715.6597022742804
—What’s that? says Joe.	 35.695106467987806

So he took a bundle of wisps of letters and envelopes out of his	 39.602683037791245

So I saw there was going to be a bit of a dust. Bob’s a queer chap when	 43.4580709568506
the porter’s up in him so says I just to make talk:	 70.79255112207669
—How’s Willy Murray those times, Alf?	 130.02508641295668

—With Dignam, says Alf.	 88.17824676237501
—Is it Paddy? says Joe.	 54.91438656342903
—Yes, says Alf. Why?	 60.370043424868214

—Paddy Dignam dead! says Alf.	 23.42322332481412
—Ay, says Joe.	 24.150064666631376
—Sure I’m after seeing him not five minutes ago, says Alf, as plain as	 84.9455700579817
a pikestaff.	 13.400948507362273
—Who’s dead? says Bob Doran.	 62.06956193503584

anyhow.	 3821.709697339643
—Paddy? says Alf.	 136.88986946776922
—Ay, says Joe. He paid the debt of nature, God be merciful to him.	 53.04536676062024
—Good Christ! says Alf.	 21.48106260652143
Begob he was what you might call flabbergasted.	 65.51813858094678
In the darkness spirit hands were felt to flutter and when prayer by	 85.34405149111275
tantras had been directed to the proper quarter a faint but increasing	 43.3528438312868
luminosity of ruby light became gradually visible, the apparition of	 36.93752536606006
the etheric double being particularly lifelike owing to the discharge	 18.88771568100715
of jivic rays from the crown of the head and face. Communication was	 61.00545081654244
effected through the pituitary body and also by means of the	 38.742966960605166
orangefiery and scarlet rays emanating from the sacral region and solar	 26.545198511921637
plexus. Questioned by his earthname as to his whereabouts in the	 16.902233722008425
heavenworld he stated that he was now on the path of prālāyā or return	 29.900429114672797
but was still submitted to trial at the hands of certain bloodthirsty	 61.909872152145354
entities on the lower astral levels. In reply to a question as to his	 37.29952463087007
first sensations in the great divide beyond he stated that previously	 52.05558403344386
he had seen as in a glass darkly but that those who had passed over had	 54.929125827658254
summit possibilities of atmic development opened up to them.	 29.681482745509015
Interrogated as to whether life there resembled our experience in the	 77.95117349547148
flesh he stated that he had heard from more favoured beings now in the	 46.360298348834434
spirit that their abodes were equipped with every modern home comfort	 139.52938470933273
such as tālāfānā, ālāvātār, hātākāldā, wātāklāsāt and that the highest	 34.514538863808674
adepts were steeped in waves of volupcy of the very purest nature.	 45.45993097987065
Having requested a quart of buttermilk this was brought and evidently	 63.213070889015896
afforded relief. Asked if he had any message for the living he exhorted	 55.08824120202259
all who were still at the wrong side of Māyā to acknowledge the true	 34.404417796243195
path for it was reported in devanic circles that Mars and Jupiter were	 34.50427336687311
out for mischief on the eastern angle where the ram has power. It was	 59.61696598539766
then queried whether there were any special desires on the part of the	 49.461307271984246
defunct and the reply was: _We greet you, friends of earth, who are	 140.19704236803182
still in the body. Mind C. K. doesn’t pile it on._ It was ascertained	 54.835240432109195
that the reference was to Mr Cornelius Kelleher, manager of Messrs H.	 75.26241158781974
J. O’Neill’s popular funeral establishment, a personal friend of the	 102.62097685520733
defunct, who had been responsible for the carrying out of the interment	 18.918663138453784
arrangements. Before departing he requested that it should be told to	 43.84302588354657
his dear son Patsy that the other boot which he had been looking for	 37.21648819010882
was at present under the commode in the return room and that the pair	 56.73209849639017
should be sent to Cullen’s to be soled only as the heels were still	 59.549132415695006
good. He stated that this had greatly perturbed his peace of mind in	 98.18779017184666
the other region and earnestly requested that his desire should be made	 110.91150005621654
known.	 8694.732749247476
Assurances were given that the matter would be attended to and it was	 65.17973793170505
intimated that this had given satisfaction.	 70.27574199713568
He is gone from mortal haunts: O’Dignam, sun of our morning. Fleet was	 91.98936399986881
his foot on the bracken: Patrick of the beamy brow. Wail, Banba, with	 37.843912912262184
your wind: and wail, O ocean, with your whirlwind.	 66.33231566326526
—There he is again, says the citizen, staring out.	 29.151139657383816
—Who? says I.	 54.55936263869861
—Bloom, says he. He’s on point duty up and down there for the last ten	 37.60035309135097
minutes.	 11125.007414326714
And, begob, I saw his physog do a peep in and then slidder off again.	 80.89837803149423
Little Alf was knocked bawways. Faith, he was.	 158.16027084034468
—Good Christ! says he. I could have sworn it was him.	 29.632675233347317
And says Bob Doran, with the hat on the back of his poll, lowest	 44.247086026897314
blackguard in Dublin when he’s under the influence:	 62.70279342210449
—Who said Christ is good?	 149.99736622144016
—I beg your parsnips, says Alf.	 27.149581496813486
—Is that a good Christ, says Bob Doran, to take away poor little Willy	 24.421476230726253
Dignam?	 2394.6913809619887
—Ah, well, says Alf, trying to pass it off. He’s over all his troubles.	 45.41258855967224
But Bob Doran shouts out of him.	 30.752276198202647
—He’s a bloody ruffian, I say, to take away poor little Willy Dignam.	 42.81694683437344
Terry came down and tipped him the wink to keep quiet, that they didn’t	 90.54486355083031
want that kind of talk in a respectable licensed premises. And Bob	 67.13447428542716
Doran starts doing the weeps about Paddy Dignam, true as you’re there.	 66.61962291096513
—The finest man, says he, snivelling, the finest purest character.	 51.41666781271386
The tear is bloody near your eye. Talking through his bloody hat.	 216.24361952976486
Fitter for him go home to the little sleepwalking bitch he married,	 39.706721144780374
Mooney, the bumbailiff’s daughter, mother kept a kip in Hardwicke	 79.84556269445781
street, that used to be stravaging about the landings Bantam Lyons told	 55.83944519579435
me that was stopping there at two in the morning without a stitch on	 74.81594497530118
her, exposing her person, open to all comers, fair field and no favour.	 88.54803217284561
—The noblest, the truest, says he. And he’s gone, poor little Willy,	 25.429773422612293
poor little Paddy Dignam.	 16.254262616586605
And mournful and with a heavy heart he bewept the extinction of that	 31.946328215771306
beam of heaven.	 332.1627199631531

the door.	 61.531707837923165

wight hath done a deed of blood for I will on nowise suffer it even so	 204.89864841064895
saith the Lord.	 296.674158607456
So they started talking about capital punishment and of course Bloom	 52.60881803232987
comes out with the why and the wherefore and all the codology of the	 35.13223051745822
business and the old dog smelling him all the time I’m told those	 64.32533740695214
jewies does have a sort of a queer odour coming off them for dogs about	 85.71944156921406
I don’t know what all deterrent effect and so forth and so on.	 70.78387246547904
—There’s one thing it hasn’t a deterrent effect on, says Alf.	 79.91432627834473
—What’s that? says Joe.	 35.695106467987806
—The poor bugger’s tool that’s being hanged, says Alf.	 52.22162194744884
—That so? says Joe.	 41.89849100388613

a poker.	 13.400948507362273

The distinguished scientist Herr Professor Luitpold Blumenduft tendered	 15.933081303623153
medical evidence to the effect that the instantaneous fracture of the	 36.85868481841238
cervical vertebrae and consequent scission of the spinal cord would,	 9.397870541786007
according to the best approved tradition of medical science, be	 76.9075495308216
calculated to inevitably produce in the human subject a violent	 32.94656559357237

thereby causing the elastic pores of the _corpora cavernosa_ to rapidly	 10.399058312230997
dilate in such a way as to instantaneously facilitate the flow of blood	 49.213316661379466

mortis per diminutionem capitis._	 15.564694731237928
So of course the citizen was only waiting for the wink of the word and	 45.960737014066346
he starts gassing out of him about the invincibles and the old guard	 40.26989302587543
and the men of sixtyseven and who fears to speak of ninetyeight and Joe	 33.15263419261787

that and the other. Talking about new Ireland he ought to go and get a	 58.907678443234694

round the place and scratching his scabs. And round he goes to Bob	 57.385238470168076

here! Give us the paw!	 42.63374531032253
Arrah, bloody end to the paw he’d paw and Alf trying to keep him from	 51.069044572188794

all kinds of drivel about training by kindness and thoroughbred dog and	 34.27222637286975
intelligent dog: give you the bloody pip. Then he starts scraping a few	 41.366329203061355

bring. Gob, he golloped it down like old boots and his tongue hanging	 93.92935974553465
out of him a yard long for more. Near ate the tin and all, hungry	 89.7511077110591
bloody mongrel.	 132.14015411466417
And the citizen and Bloom having an argument about the point, the	 63.503042655517476
brothers Sheares and Wolfe Tone beyond on Arbour Hill and Robert Emmet	 75.04941357611591
and die for your country, the Tommy Moore touch about Sara Curran and	 116.27616830755787
she’s far from the land. And Bloom, of course, with his knockmedown	 76.21660561315146
cigar putting on swank with his lardy face. Phenomenon! The fat heap he	 77.3570059013867
married is a nice old phenomenon with a back on her like a ballalley.	 66.68189226979817
Time they were stopping up in the _City Arms_ pisser Burke told me	 12.22969014399961
there was an old one there with a cracked loodheramaun of a nephew and	 32.00897148753342
Bloom trying to get the soft side of her doing the mollycoddle playing	 42.49456176201407
bézique to come in for a bit of the wampum in her will and not eating	 44.866139363467504
meat of a Friday because the old one was always thumping her craw and	 95.95115285604716
taking the lout out for a walk. And one time he led him the rounds of	 53.193712741531066
Dublin and, by the holy farmer, he never cried crack till he brought	 67.45635435996135
him home as drunk as a boiled owl and he said he did it to teach him	 37.27419105598905
the evils of alcohol and by herrings, if the three women didn’t near	 70.23780035856105
roast him, it’s a queer story, the old one, Bloom’s wife and Mrs O’Dowd	 86.33092218979583
that kept the hotel. Jesus, I had to laugh at pisser Burke taking them	 45.974324771465355
off chewing the fat. And Bloom with his _but don’t you see?_ and _but	 100.0866869095426
on the other hand_. And sure, more be token, the lout I’m told was in	 68.1500734567058
Power’s after, the blender’s, round in Cope street going home footless	 104.08350258286242
in a cab five times in the week after drinking his way through all the	 64.7531670489836
samples in the bloody establishment. Phenomenon!	 34.10179112071084
—The memory of the dead, says the citizen taking up his pintglass and	 20.163963521082405
glaring at Bloom.	 41.00389845073836
—Ay, ay, says Joe.	 15.975993613511077
—You don’t grasp my point, says Bloom. What I mean is...	 60.422984763735
—_Sinn Fein!_ says the citizen. _Sinn Fein amhain!_ The friends we love	 29.376758402447233
are by our side and the foes we hate before us.	 119.07054665668392
The last farewell was affecting in the extreme. From the belfries far	 22.471347682084147
and near the funereal deathbell tolled unceasingly while all around the	 32.185238777854465
gloomy precincts rolled the ominous warning of a hundred muffled drums	 99.6219243869749
punctuated by the hollow booming of pieces of ordnance. The deafening	 20.16092697396502
claps of thunder and the dazzling flashes of lightning which lit up the	 64.70854298331146
ghastly scene testified that the artillery of heaven had lent its	 54.58139290603641
supernatural pomp to the already gruesome spectacle. A torrential rain	 54.65052643124716
poured down from the floodgates of the angry heavens upon the bared	 44.056120446514406
heads of the assembled multitude which numbered at the lowest	 44.2575354916459
computation five hundred thousand persons. A posse of Dublin	 16.09951061498756
Metropolitan police superintended by the Chief Commissioner in person	 55.65977330865725
maintained order in the vast throng for whom the York street brass and	 72.49846705163256
reed band whiled away the intervening time by admirably rendering on	 31.143757546302556
their blackdraped instruments the matchless melody endeared to us from	 16.00405394058632
the cradle by Speranza’s plaintive muse. Special quick excursion trains	 35.75439895800279
and upholstered charabancs had been provided for the comfort of our	 31.492043993570878
country cousins of whom there were large contingents. Considerable	 71.86149607408362
amusement was caused by the favourite Dublin streetsingers L-n-h-n and	 26.192409526407484
M-ll-g-n who sang _The Night before Larry was stretched_ in their usual	 82.09866865535437
mirth-provoking fashion. Our two inimitable drolls did a roaring trade	 117.88233886885749
with their broadsheets among lovers of the comedy element and nobody	 35.76729564040933
who has a corner in his heart for real Irish fun without vulgarity will	 74.91579472781416
grudge them their hardearned pennies. The children of the Male and	 95.531125677267
Female Foundling Hospital who thronged the windows overlooking the	 91.4351294409188
scene were delighted with this unexpected addition to the day’s	 31.534816081412476
entertainment and a word of praise is due to the Little Sisters of the	 26.699883306808378
Poor for their excellent idea of affording the poor fatherless and	 51.60500411644437
motherless children a genuinely instructive treat. The viceregal	 78.61237767804134
houseparty which included many wellknown ladies was chaperoned by Their	 66.35771515556918
Excellencies to the most favourable positions on the grandstand while	 17.013933031485656
the picturesque foreign delegation known as the Friends of the Emerald	 48.248603180032305
Isle was accommodated on a tribune directly opposite. The delegation,	 110.0794570135939
present in full force, consisted of Commendatore Bacibaci Beninobenone	 34.084826563791296
(the semiparalysed _doyen_ of the party who had to be assisted to his	 17.831581827150988
seat by the aid of a powerful steam crane), Monsieur Pierrepaul	 67.23253247298699
Petitépatant, the Grandjoker Vladinmire Pokethankertscheff, the	 7.394726499526912
Archjoker Leopold Rudolph von Schwanzenbad-Hodenthaler, Countess Marha	 12.64083472395144
Virága Kisászony Putrápesthi, Hiram Y. Bomboost, Count Athanatos	 9.108337867396758
Karamelopulos, Ali Baba Backsheesh Rahat Lokum Effendi, Señor Hidalgo	 3.732211892285427
Caballero Don Pecadillo y Palabras y Paternoster de la Malora de la	 59.481720228910255
Malaria, Hokopoko Harakiri, Hi Hung Chang, Olaf Kobberkeddelsen,	 10.65280423065715
Mynheer Trik van Trumps, Pan Poleaxe Paddyrisky, Goosepond Prhklstr	 31.578847642012303
Kratchinabritchisitch, Borus Hupinkoff, Herr Hurhausdirektorpresident	 3.933542382544028
Hans Chuechli-Steuerli,	 4.411654744205047
Nationalgymnasiummuseumsanatoriumandsuspensoriumsordinaryprivatdocentge	 4.608171674364364
neralhistoryspecialprofessordoctor Kriegfried Ueberallgemein. All the	 11.086210473787725
delegates without exception expressed themselves in the strongest	 32.92641445901721
possible heterogeneous terms concerning the nameless barbarity which	 71.89442037116167
they had been called upon to witness. An animated altercation (in which	 48.0071122171789
all took part) ensued among the F. O. T. E. I. as to whether the eighth	 101.6410243646877
or the ninth of March was the correct date of the birth of Ireland’s	 38.134199920450214
patron saint. In the course of the argument cannonballs, scimitars,	 47.6141065732229
boomerangs, blunderbusses, stinkpots, meatchoppers, umbrellas,	 3.933542382544028
catapults, knuckledusters, sandbags, lumps of pig iron were resorted to	 37.33618582318117
and blows were freely exchanged. The baby policeman, Constable	 86.30120094551448
MacFadden, summoned by special courier from Booterstown, quickly	 46.547575319612825
restored order and with lightning promptitude proposed the seventeenth	 31.042393576769303
of the month as a solution equally honourable for both contending	 59.70882599784423
parties. The readywitted ninefooter’s suggestion at once appealed to	 11.90320071062035
all and was unanimously accepted. Constable MacFadden was heartily	 156.2968265520394
congratulated by all the F. O. T. E. I., several of whom were bleeding	 84.12403181647029
profusely. Commendatore Beninobenone having been extricated from	 18.58921188704487
underneath the presidential armchair, it was explained by his legal	 23.367013446415335
adviser Avvocato Pagamimi that the various articles secreted in his	 16.586926919975376
thirtytwo pockets had been abstracted by him during the affray from the	 41.554103171877145
pockets of his junior colleagues in the hope of bringing them to their	 95.8871392857291
senses. The objects (which included several hundred ladies’ and	 53.40134852767591
gentlemen’s gold and silver watches) were promptly restored to their	 52.39273589958634
rightful owners and general harmony reigned supreme.	 9.917226639605412
Quietly, unassumingly Rumbold stepped on to the scaffold in faultless	 39.813035095080444
morning dress and wearing his favourite flower, the _Gladiolus	 93.96855984686324
Cruentus_. He announced his presence by that gentle Rumboldian cough	 109.55012587307999
which so many have tried (unsuccessfully) to imitate—short, painstaking	 46.58180303033559
yet withal so characteristic of the man. The arrival of the	 37.999792706042975
worldrenowned headsman was greeted by a roar of acclamation from the	 24.585766185642974
huge concourse, the viceregal ladies waving their handkerchiefs in	 103.45622048545565
their excitement while the even more excitable foreign delegates	 134.76898984153146
cheered vociferously in a medley of cries, _hoch, banzai, eljen, zivio,	 9.333329573129548
chinchin, polla kronia, hiphip, vive, Allah_, amid which the ringing	 20.47609367392612
_evviva_ of the delegate of the land of song (a high double F recalling	 27.895802709562847
those piercingly lovely notes with which the eunuch Catalani	 134.62610664376416
beglamoured our greatgreatgrandmothers) was easily distinguishable. It	 70.59011993934793
was exactly seventeen o’clock. The signal for prayer was then promptly	 103.35455784660675
given by megaphone and in an instant all heads were bared, the	 76.30817928764465
commendatore’s patriarchal sombrero, which has been in the possession	 11.92399835319233
of his family since the revolution of Rienzi, being removed by his	 33.41075358270849
medical adviser in attendance, Dr Pippi. The learned prelate who	 111.81294841950206
administered the last comforts of holy religion to the hero martyr when	 37.23136844228063
about to pay the death penalty knelt in a most christian spirit in a	 89.88839826479428
pool of rainwater, his cassock above his hoary head, and offered up to	 26.4408643798551
the throne of grace fervent prayers of supplication. Hard by the block	 93.44269422326869
stood the grim figure of the executioner, his visage being concealed in	 39.58049891386163
a tengallon pot with two circular perforated apertures through which	 39.87501975554942
his eyes glowered furiously. As he awaited the fatal signal he tested	 24.367185027555287
the edge of his horrible weapon by honing it upon his brawny forearm or	 44.02983899753156
decapitated in rapid succession a flock of sheep which had been	 23.792479768363815
provided by the admirers of his fell but necessary office. On a	 65.98536979514208
handsome mahogany table near him were neatly arranged the quartering	 88.61807012009389
knife, the various finely tempered disembowelling appliances (specially	 26.778039992888438
supplied by the worldfamous firm of cutlers, Messrs John Round and	 80.04786324128175
Sons, Sheffield), a terra cotta saucepan for the reception of the	 14.629982610290677
duodenum, colon, blind intestine and appendix etc when successfully	 41.54422565406117
extracted and two commodious milkjugs destined to receive the most	 23.622133573885318
precious blood of the most precious victim. The housesteward of the	 12.800533312710517
amalgamated cats’ and dogs’ home was in attendance to convey these	 49.25112454215319
vessels when replenished to that beneficent institution. Quite an	 191.20150521760678
excellent repast consisting of rashers and eggs, fried steak and	 27.96917545918918
onions, done to a nicety, delicious hot breakfast rolls and	 88.40593543786177
invigorating tea had been considerately provided by the authorities for	 45.81679345050091
the consumption of the central figure of the tragedy who was in capital	 19.935959270100046
spirits when prepared for death and evinced the keenest interest in the	 57.28732780506451
proceedings from beginning to end but he, with an abnegation rare in	 68.46983114723017
these our times, rose nobly to the occasion and expressed the dying	 139.30564946928837
wish (immediately acceded to) that the meal should be divided in	 51.1059058958027
aliquot parts among the members of the sick and indigent roomkeepers’	 36.71498178411911
association as a token of his regard and esteem. The _nec_ and _non	 17.794744961457685
plus ultra_ of emotion were reached when the blushing bride elect burst	 83.50485806909282
her way through the serried ranks of the bystanders and flung herself	 33.533819950706246
upon the muscular bosom of him who was about to be launched into	 44.16615835259727
eternity for her sake. The hero folded her willowy form in a loving	 112.4430719603479
embrace murmuring fondly _Sheila, my own_. Encouraged by this use of	 58.47707683047723
her christian name she kissed passionately all the various suitable	 65.94106975321613
areas of his person which the decencies of prison garb permitted her	 35.673949166999975
ardour to reach. She swore to him as they mingled the salt streams of	 32.916906744229955
their tears that she would ever cherish his memory, that she would	 73.43250319180571
never forget her hero boy who went to his death with a song on his lips	 87.7716962870394
as if he were but going to a hurling match in Clonturk park. She	 64.56664707948876
brought back to his recollection the happy days of blissful childhood	 83.99354476282093
together on the banks of Anna Liffey when they had indulged in the	 27.579802654922975
innocent pastimes of the young and, oblivious of the dreadful present,	 74.63912886402639
they both laughed heartily, all the spectators, including the venerable	 30.78097857121021
pastor, joining in the general merriment. That monster audience simply	 24.85762467539876
rocked with delight. But anon they were overcome with grief and clasped	 46.001397685813515
their hands for the last time. A fresh torrent of tears burst from	 75.30955973685688
their lachrymal ducts and the vast concourse of people, touched to the	 38.428571810613235
inmost core, broke into heartrending sobs, not the least affected being	 52.19127671051417
the aged prebendary himself. Big strong men, officers of the peace and	 80.5440686660372
genial giants of the royal Irish constabulary, were making frank use of	 37.265462092453916
their handkerchiefs and it is safe to say that there was not a dry eye	 46.9619883751764
in that record assemblage. A most romantic incident occurred when a	 28.03860523792695
handsome young Oxford graduate, noted for his chivalry towards the fair	 57.061037130747074
sex, stepped forward and, presenting his visiting card, bankbook and	 74.01913367242084
genealogical tree, solicited the hand of the hapless young lady,	 64.98036053729236
requesting her to name the day, and was accepted on the spot. Every	 89.61722528186306
lady in the audience was presented with a tasteful souvenir of the	 20.29201949898951
occasion in the shape of a skull and crossbones brooch, a timely and	 30.47328768984447
generous act which evoked a fresh outburst of emotion: and when the	 91.23649769729329
gallant young Oxonian (the bearer, by the way, of one of the most	 45.94388704685383
timehonoured names in Albion’s history) placed on the finger of his	 67.63233209781868
blushing _fiancée_ an expensive engagement ring with emeralds set in	 91.93516742064632
the form of a fourleaved shamrock the excitement knew no bounds. Nay,	 73.10102266237014
even the stern provostmarshal, lieutenantcolonel Tomkin-Maxwell	 15.739961064370002
ffrenchmullan Tomlinson, who presided on the sad occasion, he who had	 33.15817846148993
blown a considerable number of sepoys from the cannonmouth without	 50.112588806738565
flinching, could not now restrain his natural emotion. With his mailed	 47.19956439025941
gauntlet he brushed away a furtive tear and was overheard, by those	 35.18562132932087
privileged burghers who happened to be in his immediate _entourage,_ to	 20.983376783911694
murmur to himself in a faltering undertone:	 49.65326232808387
—God blimey if she aint a clinker, that there bleeding tart. Blimey it	 52.967578682975095
makes me kind of bleeding cry, straight, it does, when I sees her cause	 127.85649597155465
I thinks of my old mashtub what’s waiting for me down Limehouse way.	 72.71325767865756
So then the citizen begins talking about the Irish language and the	 36.20380668100329
corporation meeting and all to that and the shoneens that can’t speak	 67.19228543559139
their own language and Joe chipping in because he stuck someone for a	 99.89860456650536
quid and Bloom putting in his old goo with his twopenny stump that he	 39.244199440936114
cadged off of Joe and talking about the Gaelic league and the	 44.39351843554624
antitreating league and drink, the curse of Ireland. Antitreating is	 109.71174731363773
about the size of it. Gob, he’d let you pour all manner of drink down	 106.69860638841868
his throat till the Lord would call him before you’d ever see the froth	 114.18119337491838
of his pint. And one night I went in with a fellow into one of their	 82.30015305818405
musical evenings, song and dance about she could get up on a truss of	 49.351545831249275
hay she could my Maureen Lay and there was a fellow with a Ballyhooly	 67.25893046277696
blue ribbon badge spiffing out of him in Irish and a lot of colleen	 39.106953398316215
bawns going about with temperance beverages and selling medals and	 62.17697481167415
oranges and lemonade and a few old dry buns, gob, flahoolagh	 33.41300453933864
entertainment, don’t be talking. Ireland sober is Ireland free. And	 244.38424834332847
then an old fellow starts blowing into his bagpipes and all the gougers	 30.59585474964187
shuffling their feet to the tune the old cow died of. And one or two	 80.1115007195314
sky pilots having an eye around that there was no goings on with the	 113.30581200999771
females, hitting below the belt.	 288.0411920648761
So howandever, as I was saying, the old dog seeing the tin was empty	 56.538728359060045
starts mousing around by Joe and me. I’d train him by kindness, so I	 122.4533106094878
would, if he was my dog. Give him a rousing fine kick now and again	 72.15011492856318
where it wouldn’t blind him.	 170.7032049765522
—Afraid he’ll bite you? says the citizen, jeering.	 37.79719525492009
—No, says I. But he might take my leg for a lamppost.	 38.72245903215962
So he calls the old dog over.	 61.082062229396485
—What’s on you, Garry? says he.	 57.635004846228334
Then he starts hauling and mauling and talking to him in Irish and the	 33.96836414971074
old towser growling, letting on to answer, like a duet in the opera.	 49.951793957945476
Such growling you never heard as they let off between them. Someone	 138.08618240204402
that has nothing better to do ought to write a letter _pro bono	 40.310108911511364
publico_ to the papers about the muzzling order for a dog the like of	 51.91797143620681
that. Growling and grousing and his eye all bloodshot from the drouth	 70.90016373464897
is in it and the hydrophobia dropping out of his jaws.	 46.868708356189
All those who are interested in the spread of human culture among the	 37.49034792195597
lower animals (and their name is legion) should make a point of not	 109.84479162438878
missing the really marvellous exhibition of cynanthropy given by the	 28.75150697701458
famous old Irish red setter wolfdog formerly known by the _sobriquet_	 56.61019665724525
of Garryowen and recently rechristened by his large circle of friends	 72.60053378613401
and acquaintances Owen Garry. The exhibition, which is the result of	 30.776123406617018
years of training by kindness and a carefully thoughtout dietary	 40.26245879182524
system, comprises, among other achievements, the recitation of verse.	 100.29533647836269
Our greatest living phonetic expert (wild horses shall not drag it from	 116.96532158473569
us!) has left no stone unturned in his efforts to delucidate and	 53.91127639505005
compare the verse recited and has found it bears a _striking_	 83.77389252387688
resemblance (the italics are ours) to the ranns of ancient Celtic	 18.00115796004638
bards. We are not speaking so much of those delightful lovesongs with	 34.05945191457918
which the writer who conceals his identity under the graceful pseudonym	 28.650789563733984
of the Little Sweet Branch has familiarised the bookloving world but	 53.09325206092967
rather (as a contributor D. O. C. points out in an interesting	 112.83070405739568
communication published by an evening contemporary) of the harsher and	 21.017800008351426
more personal note which is found in the satirical effusions of the	 21.881260711478713
famous Raftery and of Donal MacConsidine to say nothing of a more	 50.500291842223035
modern lyrist at present very much in the public eye. We subjoin a	 106.88019637472208
specimen which has been rendered into English by an eminent scholar	 45.75464325086307
whose name for the moment we are not at liberty to disclose though we	 86.03661662556661
believe that our readers will find the topical allusion rather more	 96.71080962725796
than an indication. The metrical system of the canine original, which	 50.12399772248535
recalls the intricate alliterative and isosyllabic rules of the Welsh	 9.631158864352301
englyn, is infinitely more complicated but we believe our readers will	 64.08362539221076
agree that the spirit has been well caught. Perhaps it should be added	 66.30552848510962
that the effect is greatly increased if Owen’s verse be spoken somewhat	 127.69377109906887
slowly and indistinctly in a tone suggestive of suppressed rancour.	 25.343419704252835
The curse of my curses	 22.806757129099843
Seven days every day	 103.08141078786115
And seven dry Thursdays	 101.01418352826259
On you, Barney Kiernan,	 123.70830410217434
Has no sup of water	 129.9353927007223
To cool my courage,	 162.34039851304922
And my guts red roaring	 111.94010013417396
After Lowry’s lights.	 391.9695045960599
So he told Terry to bring some water for the dog and, gob, you could	 114.40659305450833
hear him lapping it up a mile off. And Joe asked him would he have	 98.71512971832874
another.	 1728.7368959135488
—I will, says he, _a chara_, to show there’s no ill feeling.	 68.67506434939682
Gob, he’s not as green as he’s cabbagelooking. Arsing around from one	 136.0645520301102
pub to another, leaving it to your own honour, with old Giltrap’s dog	 119.48794792972461
and getting fed up by the ratepayers and corporators. Entertainment for	 35.601222657619545
man and beast. And says Joe:	 107.7960296064123
—Could you make a hole in another pint?	 82.07368593671204
—Could a swim duck? says I.	 120.62780808057826
—Same again, Terry, says Joe. Are you sure you won’t have anything in	 43.01082388693764
the way of liquid refreshment? says he.	 45.39079853212992
—Thank you, no, says Bloom. As a matter of fact I just wanted to meet	 27.891160368682076
Martin Cunningham, don’t you see, about this insurance of poor	 73.77472107934244
Dignam’s. Martin asked me to go to the house. You see, he, Dignam, I	 131.3130923473286
mean, didn’t serve any notice of the assignment on the company at the	 56.570584650375125
time and nominally under the act the mortgagee can’t recover on the	 47.06403047246979
policy.	 19463.627878772
—Holy Wars, says Joe, laughing, that’s a good one if old Shylock is	 79.02470693967669
landed. So the wife comes out top dog, what?	 228.28876081349568
—Well, that’s a point, says Bloom, for the wife’s admirers.	 43.754109073473366
—Whose admirers? says Joe.	 67.20417349324497
—The wife’s advisers, I mean, says Bloom.	 22.162822819294995
Then he starts all confused mucking it up about mortgagor under the act	 55.28493726695194
like the lord chancellor giving it out on the bench and for the benefit	 46.88422677000007
of the wife and that a trust is created but on the other hand that	 71.1955184421453
Dignam owed Bridgeman the money and if now the wife or the widow	 104.80399957582578
contested the mortgagee’s right till he near had the head of me addled	 61.84721749564634
with his mortgagor under the act. He was bloody safe he wasn’t run in	 51.37897933352927
himself under the act that time as a rogue and vagabond only he had a	 44.66910614717932
friend in court. Selling bazaar tickets or what do you call it royal	 54.16386751931536
Hungarian privileged lottery. True as you’re there. O, commend me to an	 159.54864425364838
israelite! Royal and privileged Hungarian robbery.	 66.1587727582061
So Bob Doran comes lurching around asking Bloom to tell Mrs Dignam he	 157.4501270773404
was sorry for her trouble and he was very sorry about the funeral and	 48.633333017264306
to tell her that he said and everyone who knew him said that there was	 50.32648325165213
never a truer, a finer than poor little Willy that’s dead to tell her.	 67.16947689710929
Choking with bloody foolery. And shaking Bloom’s hand doing the tragic	 75.07647391579175
to tell her that. Shake hands, brother. You’re a rogue and I’m another.	 70.40829184587207
—Let me, said he, so far presume upon our acquaintance which, however	 108.52670130552644
slight it may appear if judged by the standard of mere time, is	 98.69052485013258
founded, as I hope and believe, on a sentiment of mutual esteem as to	 56.55819188190246
request of you this favour. But, should I have overstepped the limits	 68.5658444004226
of reserve let the sincerity of my feelings be the excuse for my	 69.292162925676
boldness.	 4.608171674364364
—No, rejoined the other, I appreciate to the full the motives which	 55.52672766718488
actuate your conduct and I shall discharge the office you entrust to me	 65.09177443780595
consoled by the reflection that, though the errand be one of sorrow,	 56.3783767386993
this proof of your confidence sweetens in some measure the bitterness	 58.612217463781214
of the cup.	 120.28424769534607
—Then suffer me to take your hand, said he. The goodness of your heart,	 93.22096839702886
I feel sure, will dictate to you better than my inadequate words the	 60.18512344515253
expressions which are most suitable to convey an emotion whose	 42.6762439736631
poignancy, were I to give vent to my feelings, would deprive me even of	 59.90438094197879
speech.	 3407.4500722452353
And off with him and out trying to walk straight. Boosed at five	 69.24916959200335
o’clock. Night he was near being lagged only Paddy Leonard knew the	 101.6768371588314
bobby, 14A. Blind to the world up in a shebeen in Bride street after	 35.876146692110964
closing time, fornicating with two shawls and a bully on guard,	 60.9603901734862
drinking porter out of teacups. And calling himself a Frenchy for the	 51.22467449895387
shawls, Joseph Manuo, and talking against the Catholic religion, and he	 62.6811461653668
serving mass in Adam and Eve’s when he was young with his eyes shut,	 48.48893000943243
who wrote the new testament, and the old testament, and hugging and	 22.93750050082872
smugging. And the two shawls killed with the laughing, picking his	 47.16464317246059
pockets, the bloody fool and he spilling the porter all over the bed	 48.505520315748356
and the two shawls screeching laughing at one another. _How is your	 62.82138193927002
testament? Have you got an old testament?_ Only Paddy was passing	 62.35630096327036
there, I tell you what. Then see him of a Sunday with his little	 99.06110998343077
concubine of a wife, and she wagging her tail up the aisle of the	 26.02663106481454
chapel with her patent boots on her, no less, and her violets, nice as	 117.72540741765965
pie, doing the little lady. Jack Mooney’s sister. And the old	 150.67758444000455
prostitute of a mother procuring rooms to street couples. Gob, Jack	 109.55642111525046
made him toe the line. Told him if he didn’t patch up the pot, Jesus,	 100.73157092801259
he’d kick the shite out of him.	 42.14116899275269
So Terry brought the three pints.	 49.71350889273385
—Here, says Joe, doing the honours. Here, citizen.	 58.61004353535061
—_Slan leat_, says he.	 16.2030734916839
—Fortune, Joe, says I. Good health, citizen.	 53.657621443975074
Gob, he had his mouth half way down the tumbler already. Want a small	 110.07352125433411

—Who is the long fellow running for the mayoralty, Alf? says Joe.	 44.41742399222085
—Friend of yours, says Alf.	 85.05852803010835
—Nannan? says Joe. The mimber?	 15.890750193354338

So Joe starts telling the citizen about the foot and mouth disease and	 32.65772469703839
the cattle traders and taking action in the matter and the citizen	 61.79512950992362
sending them all to the rightabout and Bloom coming out with his	 48.929375415375375
sheepdip for the scab and a hoose drench for coughing calves and the	 14.905213390808989
guaranteed remedy for timber tongue. Because he was up one time in a	 80.35856785024502
knacker’s yard. Walking about with his book and pencil here’s my head	 67.89908560651294
and my heels are coming till Joe Cuffe gave him the order of the boot	 61.83618291592202
for giving lip to a grazier. Mister Knowall. Teach your grandmother how	 130.60203714658743
to milk ducks. Pisser Burke was telling me in the hotel the wife used	 47.40127411936416
to be in rivers of tears some times with Mrs O’Dowd crying her eyes out	 79.77080030884126
with her eight inches of fat all over her. Couldn’t loosen her farting	 60.4941212237
strings but old cod’s eye was waltzing around her showing her how to do	 135.79762842379589
it. What’s your programme today? Ay. Humane methods. Because the poor	 86.0090187166786
animals suffer and experts say and the best known remedy that doesn’t	 156.64695397960148
cause pain to the animal and on the sore spot administer gently. Gob,	 168.67085549087838
he’d have a soft hand under a hen.	 44.39818835334329
Ga Ga Gara. Klook Klook Klook. Black Liz is our hen. She lays eggs for	 59.592019592216566
us. When she lays her egg she is so glad. Gara. Klook Klook Klook. Then	 82.84786307970799
comes good uncle Leo. He puts his hand under black Liz and takes her	 93.13338912728483
fresh egg. Ga ga ga ga Gara. Klook Klook Klook.	 13.145451756164418

—There’s the man, says Joe, that made the Gaelic sports revival. There	 70.75430714522341

So off they started about Irish sports and shoneen games the like of	 163.02460166581812
lawn tennis and about hurley and putting the stone and racy of the soil	 67.36122494070038
and building up a nation once again and all to that. And of course	 80.05861930685562
Bloom had to have his say too about if a fellow had a rower’s heart	 135.5352939815025
violent exercise was bad. I declare to my antimacassar if you took up a	 63.76836809472575

Do you see that straw? That’s a straw_. Declare to my aunt he’d talk	 74.9309267359265
about it for an hour so he would and talk steady.	 97.73622457894389
A most interesting discussion took place in the ancient hall of _Brian	 56.51662501543988
O’Ciarnain’s_ in _Sraid na Bretaine Bheag_, under the auspices of	 14.087571712917478
_Sluagh na h-Eireann_, on the revival of ancient Gaelic sports and the	 14.837325350402818
importance of physical culture, as understood in ancient Greece and	 23.70844632604925
ancient Rome and ancient Ireland, for the development of the race. The	 56.62441618857552
venerable president of the noble order was in the chair and the	 50.31343636219266
attendance was of large dimensions. After an instructive discourse by	 177.27972024183467
the chairman, a magnificent oration eloquently and forcibly expressed,	 16.413101503055945
a most interesting and instructive discussion of the usual high	 63.61519730465028
standard of excellence ensued as to the desirability of the	 18.790347188295627
revivability of the ancient games and sports of our ancient Panceltic	 29.95194565591025
forefathers. The wellknown and highly respected worker in the cause of	 35.43786406221258
our old tongue, Mr Joseph M’Carthy Hynes, made an eloquent appeal for	 121.80104474181414
the resuscitation of the ancient Gaelic sports and pastimes, practised	 10.081656907320765
morning and evening by Finn MacCool, as calculated to revive the best	 56.13333606041934
traditions of manly strength and prowess handed down to us from ancient	 56.545585516489396
ages. L. Bloom, who met with a mixed reception of applause and hisses,	 89.44535825924032
having espoused the negative the vocalist chairman brought the	 25.583141984859864
discussion to a close, in response to repeated requests and hearty	 70.01184973632452
plaudits from all parts of a bumper house, by a remarkably noteworthy	 19.561095003678314
rendering of the immortal Thomas Osborne Davis’ evergreen verses	 12.133728212320928
(happily too familiar to need recalling here) _A nation once again_ in	 80.51617933884322
the execution of which the veteran patriot champion may be said without	 27.478162950701485
fear of contradiction to have fairly excelled himself. The Irish	 60.64654698485676
Caruso-Garibaldi was in superlative form and his stentorian notes were	 63.58862598939636
heard to the greatest advantage in the timehonoured anthem sung as only	 32.59293663955163
our citizen can sing it. His superb highclass vocalism, which by its	 80.34621833031821
superquality greatly enhanced his already international reputation, was	 68.57812068766778
vociferously applauded by the large audience among which were to be	 38.62962062670346
noticed many prominent members of the clergy as well as representatives	 61.17744174758477
of the press and the bar and the other learned professions. The	 29.186229720433566
proceedings then terminated.	 21.535099427554933

—Now, don’t you think, Bergan?	 47.6181544697677

the little kipper not up to his navel and the big fellow swiping. God,	 55.31352039864672

him puke what he never ate.	 88.91029256262122
It was a historic and a hefty battle when Myler and Percy were	 21.64557233154333
scheduled to don the gloves for the purse of fifty sovereigns.	 86.0267412144908
Handicapped as he was by lack of poundage, Dublin’s pet lamb made up	 36.94637465280335
for it by superlative skill in ringcraft. The final bout of fireworks	 41.089128693921246
was a gruelling for both champions. The welterweight sergeantmajor had	 33.037959077138105
tapped some lively claret in the previous mixup during which Keogh had	 81.28550272818543
been receivergeneral of rights and lefts, the artilleryman putting in	 48.27602346702998
some neat work on the pet’s nose, and Myler came on looking groggy. The	 86.07133632744717
soldier got to business, leading off with a powerful left jab to which	 182.42585579680636
the Irish gladiator retaliated by shooting out a stiff one flush to the	 44.69625021215958
point of Bennett’s jaw. The redcoat ducked but the Dubliner lifted him	 43.922513603045445
with a left hook, the body punch being a fine one. The men came to	 111.23968416973973
handigrips. Myler quickly became busy and got his man under, the bout	 94.50553845654389
ending with the bulkier man on the ropes, Myler punishing him. The	 33.12221981378515
Englishman, whose right eye was nearly closed, took his corner where he	 213.39367078484173
was liberally drenched with water and when the bell went came on gamey	 80.50045324653831
and brimful of pluck, confident of knocking out the fistic Eblanite in	 27.931917130670097
jigtime. It was a fight to a finish and the best man for it. The two	 41.60616029483862
fought like tigers and excitement ran fever high. The referee twice	 195.27102158703826
cautioned Pucking Percy for holding but the pet was tricky and his	 51.513695731145035
footwork a treat to watch. After a brisk exchange of courtesies during	 71.41663100908622
which a smart upper cut of the military man brought blood freely from	 80.73561951634295
his opponent’s mouth the lamb suddenly waded in all over his man and	 76.15976895959571
landed a terrific left to Battling Bennett’s stomach, flooring him	 109.37952876938859
flat. It was a knockout clean and clever. Amid tense expectation the	 67.17683775942425
Portobello bruiser was being counted out when Bennett’s second Ole	 64.5873532433031
Pfotts Wettstein threw in the towel and the Santry boy was declared	 23.49535722313475
victor to the frenzied cheers of the public who broke through the	 38.27281697941655
ringropes and fairly mobbed him with delight.	 19.12070574462881
—He knows which side his bread is buttered, says Alf. I hear he’s	 93.3882041767395
running a concert tour now up in the north.	 84.6456772428667
—He is, says Joe. Isn’t he?	 29.175969465326347

the bucko that’ll organise her, take my tip. ’Twixt me and you	 110.63347057487627
Caddareesh.	 4.608171674364364
Pride of Calpe’s rocky mount, the ravenhaired daughter of Tweedy. There	 62.81480150597594
grew she to peerless beauty where loquat and almond scent the air. The	 131.92697170844667
gardens of Alameda knew her step: the garths of olives knew and bowed.	 115.3197792228167
The chaste spouse of Leopold is she: Marion of the bountiful bosoms.	 38.71962817753034

that is.	 51.661156938822074
Begob I saw there was trouble coming. And Bloom explaining he meant on	 93.89245881572313
account of it being cruel for the wife having to go round after the old	 62.70414203930644
stuttering fool. Cruelty to animals so it is to let that bloody	 86.94347125984156
povertystricken Breen out on grass with his beard out tripping him,	 101.4285898718507
bringing down the rain. And she with her nose cockahoop after she	 100.77781180674134
married him because a cousin of his old fellow’s was pewopener to the	 59.444559563502
pope. Picture of him on the wall with his Smashall Sweeney’s	 28.749683667806682
moustaches, the signior Brini from Summerhill, the eyetallyano, papal	 19.80770179596815
Zouave to the Holy Father, has left the quay and gone to Moss street.	 46.19746106554454

shillings a week, and he covered with all kinds of breastplates bidding	 65.97504736201499
defiance to the world.	 24.01479440246768
—And moreover, says J. J., a postcard is publication. It was held to be	 45.16344770332651

opinion an action might lie.	 455.56476856823105
Six and eightpence, please. Who wants your opinion? Let us drink our	 192.11336318342512
