—How did that Canada swindle case go off? says Joe.	 98.04227762748482
—Remanded, says J. J.	 12.713447775112144
One of the bottlenosed fraternity it was went by the name of James	 39.278461116065266
Wought alias Saphiro alias Spark and Spiro, put an ad in the papers	 18.596238511296477
saying he’d give a passage to Canada for twenty bob. What? Do you see	 70.35766195422049
any green in the white of my eye? Course it was a bloody barney. What?	 92.55290288877674
Swindled them all, skivvies and badhachs from the county Meath, ay, and	 31.36294725980405
his own kidney too. J. J. was telling us there was an ancient Hebrew	 63.5939303188332
Zaretsky or something weeping in the witnessbox with his hat on him,	 24.972708313647505
swearing by the holy Moses he was stuck for two quid.	 35.79875618113925
—Who tried the case? says Joe.	 46.59938611336218
—Recorder, says Ned.	 191.06183179764193
—Poor old sir Frederick, says Alf, you can cod him up to the two eyes.	 50.429617712750805
—Heart as big as a lion, says Ned. Tell him a tale of woe about arrears	 39.409445363199396
of rent and a sick wife and a squad of kids and, faith, he’ll dissolve	 84.5251570928236
in tears on the bench.	 114.11639662116065
—Ay, says Alf. Reuben J was bloody lucky he didn’t clap him in the dock	 24.308101882583134
the other day for suing poor little Gumley that’s minding stones, for	 60.87143225845357
the corporation there near Butt bridge.	 53.424383840264
And he starts taking off the old recorder letting on to cry:	 36.490581409127266
—A most scandalous thing! This poor hardworking man! How many children?	 72.05825840188707
Ten, did you say?	 275.89270309849235
—Yes, your worship. And my wife has the typhoid.	 40.03222543701242
—And the wife with typhoid fever! Scandalous! Leave the court	 113.12040686941803
immediately, sir. No, sir, I’ll make no order for payment. How dare	 57.21439000772604
you, sir, come up before me and ask me to make an order! A poor	 83.25562481984115
hardworking industrious man! I dismiss the case.	 41.36371460520675
And whereas on the sixteenth day of the month of the oxeyed goddess and	 16.868637724040365
in the third week after the feastday of the Holy and Undivided Trinity,	 34.193465894814054
the daughter of the skies, the virgin moon being then in her first	 70.92069703074358
quarter, it came to pass that those learned judges repaired them to the	 67.54412712048997
halls of law. There master Courtenay, sitting in his own chamber, gave	 111.42853321260984
his rede and master Justice Andrews, sitting without a jury in the	 63.97213077044405
probate court, weighed well and pondered the claim of the first	 25.629308323265686
chargeant upon the property in the matter of the will propounded and	 37.2025992861958
final testamentary disposition _in re_ the real and personal estate of	 104.69220665906992
the late lamented Jacob Halliday, vintner, deceased, versus	 74.58718016116919
Livingstone, an infant, of unsound mind, and another. And to the solemn	 62.83008356482894
court of Green street there came sir Frederick the Falconer. And he sat	 94.34529956518077
him there about the hour of five o’clock to administer the law of the	 42.184547344917306
brehons at the commission for all that and those parts to be holden in	 31.435543702691533
and for the county of the city of Dublin. And there sat with him the	 39.0029745961766
high sinhedrim of the twelve tribes of Iar, for every tribe one man, of	 50.35400012184497
the tribe of Patrick and of the tribe of Hugh and of the tribe of Owen	 38.72848333723173
and of the tribe of Conn and of the tribe of Oscar and of the tribe of	 11.363884590633573
Fergus and of the tribe of Finn and of the tribe of Dermot and of the	 10.152178804970509
tribe of Cormac and of the tribe of Kevin and of the tribe of Caolte	 21.22151863439903
and of the tribe of Ossian, there being in all twelve good men and	 51.16867129170746
true. And he conjured them by Him who died on rood that they should	 76.31907796172104
well and truly try and true deliverance make in the issue joined	 140.31111326825703
between their sovereign lord the king and the prisoner at the bar and	 49.69177856627406
true verdict give according to the evidence so help them God and kiss	 109.59923181014666
the book. And they rose in their seats, those twelve of Iar, and they	 56.3113066217356
swore by the name of Him Who is from everlasting that they would do His	 67.08862881922794
rightwiseness. And straightway the minions of the law led forth from	 18.398042724356568
their donjon keep one whom the sleuthhounds of justice had apprehended	 84.68521261404865
in consequence of information received. And they shackled him hand and	 65.39081284654077
foot and would take of him ne bail ne mainprise but preferred a charge	 95.24017285929372
against him for he was a malefactor.	 34.51518506995912
—Those are nice things, says the citizen, coming over here to Ireland	 69.61117934015628
filling the country with bugs.	 34.41620708657846
So Bloom lets on he heard nothing and he starts talking with Joe,	 108.94518551385599
telling him he needn’t trouble about that little matter till the first	 66.09968937051698
but if he would just say a word to Mr Crawford. And so Joe swore high	 62.09560668091682
and holy by this and by that he’d do the devil and all.	 138.80559633630486
—Because, you see, says Bloom, for an advertisement you must have	 44.95797302562813
repetition. That’s the whole secret.	 59.13158559043372
—Rely on me, says Joe.	 39.0285341665054
—Swindling the peasants, says the citizen, and the poor of Ireland. We	 26.589576059584093
want no more strangers in our house.	 70.41230048677916
—O, I’m sure that will be all right, Hynes, says Bloom. It’s just that	 52.06234903084962
Keyes, you see.	 112.91021402419388
—Consider that done, says Joe.	 36.38639595907807
—Very kind of you, says Bloom.	 79.44664248063881
—The strangers, says the citizen. Our own fault. We let them come in.	 45.001034791304654
We brought them in. The adulteress and her paramour brought the Saxon	 44.366502522545446
robbers here.	 85.12154925584635
—Decree _nisi,_ says J. J.	 10.515511818406702
And Bloom letting on to be awfully deeply interested in nothing, a	 51.45058051272023
spider’s web in the corner behind the barrel, and the citizen scowling	 23.467639217812334
after him and the old dog at his feet looking up to know who to bite	 55.99220329317955
and when.	 82.9685664972733
—A dishonoured wife, says the citizen, that’s what’s the cause of all	 34.743957639284666
our misfortunes.	 51.573586308667316
—And here she is, says Alf, that was giggling over the _Police Gazette_	 63.06921036631843
with Terry on the counter, in all her warpaint.	 106.1089632177056
—Give us a squint at her, says I.	 44.352920039569874
And what was it only one of the smutty yankee pictures Terry borrows	 40.84738324924594
off of Corny Kelleher. Secrets for enlarging your private parts.	 96.39501337190727
Misconduct of society belle. Norman W. Tupper, wealthy Chicago	 12.948468588618415
contractor, finds pretty but faithless wife in lap of officer Taylor.	 75.308593412715
Belle in her bloomers misconducting herself, and her fancyman feeling	 91.14373609195621
for her tickles and Norman W. Tupper bouncing in with his peashooter	 22.118491209143407
just in time to be late after she doing the trick of the loop with	 66.91251115482817
officer Taylor.	 155.66557456959447
—O jakers, Jenny, says Joe, how short your shirt is!	 79.48667734241072
—There’s hair, Joe, says I. Get a queer old tailend of corned beef off	 57.678615936644775
of that one, what?	 99.31059815403933
So anyhow in came John Wyse Nolan and Lenehan with him with a face on	 82.55179760632716
him as long as a late breakfast.	 65.933630471358
—Well, says the citizen, what’s the latest from the scene of action?	 36.621163999420865
What did those tinkers in the city hall at their caucus meeting decide	 41.20468631766752
about the Irish language?	 43.919956693107345
O’Nolan, clad in shining armour, low bending made obeisance to the	 75.1222605537094
puissant and high and mighty chief of all Erin and did him to wit of	 126.45307763770496
that which had befallen, how that the grave elders of the most obedient	 49.56452353971518
city, second of the realm, had met them in the tholsel, and there,	 73.72675946611434
after due prayers to the gods who dwell in ether supernal, had taken	 62.22291343334033
solemn counsel whereby they might, if so be it might be, bring once	 173.1832861694817
more into honour among mortal men the winged speech of the seadivided	 80.90854539430633
Gael.	 4.608171674364364
—It’s on the march, says the citizen. To hell with the bloody brutal	 50.68219717339968
Sassenachs and their _patois._	 12.99207017921306
So J. J. puts in a word, doing the toff about one story was good till	 56.39543680665049
you heard another and blinking facts and the Nelson policy, putting	 88.5711599681347
your blind eye to the telescope and drawing up a bill of attainder to	 41.940437988179035
impeach a nation, and Bloom trying to back him up moderation and	 57.92157035647296
botheration and their colonies and their civilisation.	 13.663117645101675
—Their syphilisation, you mean, says the citizen. To hell with them!	 34.63302171549334
The curse of a goodfornothing God light sideways on the bloody	 42.43447553402902
thicklugged sons of whores’ gets! No music and no art and no literature	 106.09251167069267
worthy of the name. Any civilisation they have they stole from us.	 94.81754826519887
Tonguetied sons of bastards’ ghosts.	 48.68576738184029
—The European family, says J. J....	 33.304817084261394
—They’re not European, says the citizen. I was in Europe with Kevin	 55.55080860575606
Egan of Paris. You wouldn’t see a trace of them or their language	 125.10721245380262
anywhere in Europe except in a _cabinet d’aisance._	 35.94892093354669
And says John Wyse:	 26.88725818393974
—Full many a flower is born to blush unseen.	 111.20297141315794
And says Lenehan that knows a bit of the lingo:	 29.196628161541476
—_Conspuez les Anglais! Perfide Albion!_	 12.105489264843277
He said and then lifted he in his rude great brawny strengthy hands the	 67.53677405413997
medher of dark strong foamy ale and, uttering his tribal slogan _Lamh	 22.101456257261155
Dearg Abu_, he drank to the undoing of his foes, a race of mighty	 38.89274064784194
valorous heroes, rulers of the waves, who sit on thrones of alabaster	 24.631950622308572
silent as the deathless gods.	 146.15684209003683
—What’s up with you, says I to Lenehan. You look like a fellow that had	 72.9996745845625
lost a bob and found a tanner.	 129.35783718512587
—Gold cup, says he.	 94.08842944747086
—Who won, Mr Lenehan? says Terry.	 198.05397337634292
_—Throwaway,_ says he, at twenty to one. A rank outsider. And the rest	 156.47758178194854
nowhere.	 4.608171674364364
—And Bass’s mare? says Terry.	 120.30749060079845
—Still running, says he. We’re all in a cart. Boylan plunged two quid	 81.74759782110618
on my tip _Sceptre_ for himself and a lady friend.	 69.27841593175474
—I had half a crown myself, says Terry, on _Zinfandel_ that Mr Flynn	 113.5504432073924
gave me. Lord Howard de Walden’s.	 84.98975064469823
—Twenty to one, says Lenehan. Such is life in an outhouse. _Throwaway,_	 263.730160359028
says he. Takes the biscuit, and talking about bunions. Frailty, thy	 55.54137560374261
name is _Sceptre._	 186.41252758679096
So he went over to the biscuit tin Bob Doran left to see if there was	 35.52277292874907
anything he could lift on the nod, the old cur after him backing his	 57.91280118397498
luck with his mangy snout up. Old Mother Hubbard went to the cupboard.	 75.52783178587148
—Not there, my child, says he.	 117.22828626187493
—Keep your pecker up, says Joe. She’d have won the money only for the	 92.60219395137204
other dog.	 1021.4899354913349
And J. J. and the citizen arguing about law and history with Bloom	 88.25835367253707
sticking in an odd word.	 193.8815832086606
—Some people, says Bloom, can see the mote in others’ eyes but they	 36.43474494672569
can’t see the beam in their own.	 87.74187153227828
—_Raimeis_, says the citizen. There’s no-one as blind as the fellow	 33.215914332447326
that won’t see, if you know what that means. Where are our missing	 54.8197321027604
twenty millions of Irish should be here today instead of four, our lost	 124.30986609435361
tribes? And our potteries and textiles, the finest in the whole world!	 25.064912826979256
And our wool that was sold in Rome in the time of Juvenal and our flax	 30.268165130343093
and our damask from the looms of Antrim and our Limerick lace, our	 25.20110271108012
tanneries and our white flint glass down there by Ballybough and our	 61.720480823447524
Huguenot poplin that we have since Jacquard de Lyon and our woven silk	 105.91668867393936
and our Foxford tweeds and ivory raised point from the Carmelite	 27.83546315270342
convent in New Ross, nothing like it in the whole wide world. Where are	 98.7793372883439
the Greek merchants that came through the pillars of Hercules, the	 31.37386717909078
Gibraltar now grabbed by the foe of mankind, with gold and Tyrian	 26.673114784402696
purple to sell in Wexford at the fair of Carmen? Read Tacitus and	 164.9142230744645
Ptolemy, even Giraldus Cambrensis. Wine, peltries, Connemara marble,	 25.358078335987376
silver from Tipperary, second to none, our farfamed horses even today,	 326.5473664099436
the Irish hobbies, with king Philip of Spain offering to pay customs	 91.61367910555539
duties for the right to fish in our waters. What do the yellowjohns of	 45.647438508076284
Anglia owe us for our ruined trade and our ruined hearths? And the beds	 53.27236644551919
of the Barrow and Shannon they won’t deepen with millions of acres of	 42.83587480415091
marsh and bog to make us all die of consumption?	 24.792322770133808
—As treeless as Portugal we’ll be soon, says John Wyse, or Heligoland	 66.61357716711827
with its one tree if something is not done to reafforest the land.	 96.53840894571564
Larches, firs, all the trees of the conifer family are going fast. I	 77.79100100925787
was reading a report of lord Castletown’s...	 100.84285865283042
—Save them, says the citizen, the giant ash of Galway and the chieftain	 55.543738933716256
elm of Kildare with a fortyfoot bole and an acre of foliage. Save the	 28.52076861780435
trees of Ireland for the future men of Ireland on the fair hills of	 69.55001134377663
Eire, O.	 62.41067936669871
—Europe has its eyes on you, says Lenehan.	 138.58214040366465
The fashionable international world attended _en masse_ this afternoon	 51.01432368548488
at the wedding of the chevalier Jean Wyse de Neaulan, grand high chief	 76.59243014372986
ranger of the Irish National Foresters, with Miss Fir Conifer of Pine	 22.94792423505724
Valley. Lady Sylvester Elmshade, Mrs Barbara Lovebirch, Mrs Poll Ash,	 25.6283485886464
Mrs Holly Hazeleyes, Miss Daphne Bays, Miss Dorothy Canebrake, Mrs	 32.31528930258777
Clyde Twelvetrees, Mrs Rowan Greene, Mrs Helen Vinegadding, Miss	 23.525176397002276
Virginia Creeper, Miss Gladys Beech, Miss Olive Garth, Miss Blanche	 17.70074830086592
Maple, Mrs Maud Mahogany, Miss Myra Myrtle, Miss Priscilla Elderflower,	 17.183477051523244
Miss Bee Honeysuckle, Miss Grace Poplar, Miss O Mimosa San, Miss Rachel	 61.100301364988375
Cedarfrond, the Misses Lilian and Viola Lilac, Miss Timidity Aspenall,	 9.650395055296308
Mrs Kitty Dewey-Mosse, Miss May Hawthorne, Mrs Gloriana Palme, Mrs	 104.28340989162982
Liana Forrest, Mrs Arabella Blackwood and Mrs Norma Holyoake of	 17.17828612695813
Oakholme Regis graced the ceremony by their presence. The bride who was	 30.544975400724287
given away by her father, the M’Conifer of the Glands, looked	 51.69905855588659
exquisitely charming in a creation carried out in green mercerised	 71.79048485542131
silk, moulded on an underslip of gloaming grey, sashed with a yoke of	 28.663307672259926
broad emerald and finished with a triple flounce of darkerhued fringe,	 49.27524837199402
the scheme being relieved by bretelles and hip insertions of acorn	 25.36872790735588
bronze. The maids of honour, Miss Larch Conifer and Miss Spruce	 58.33980925875496
Conifer, sisters of the bride, wore very becoming costumes in the same	 68.1027171268567
tone, a dainty _motif_ of plume rose being worked into the pleats in a	 86.9522374408404
pinstripe and repeated capriciously in the jadegreen toques in the form	 18.007893542515628
of heron feathers of paletinted coral. Senhor Enrique Flor presided at	 8.365430529145232
the organ with his wellknown ability and, in addition to the prescribed	 27.882346017416268
numbers of the nuptial mass, played a new and striking arrangement of	 132.43851680455813
_Woodman, spare that tree_ at the conclusion of the service. On leaving	 30.209753304113946
the church of Saint Fiacre _in Horto_ after the papal blessing the	 42.3707987543617
happy pair were subjected to a playful crossfire of hazelnuts,	 34.218782388588146
beechmast, bayleaves, catkins of willow, ivytod, hollyberries,	 4.790717778615041
mistletoe sprigs and quicken shoots. Mr and Mrs Wyse Conifer Neaulan	 33.531600227687704
will spend a quiet honeymoon in the Black Forest.	 41.60631955398845
—And our eyes are on Europe, says the citizen. We had our trade with	 63.24825686952757
Spain and the French and with the Flemings before those mongrels were	 63.64883702837967
pupped, Spanish ale in Galway, the winebark on the winedark waterway.	 25.603130858569454
—And will again, says Joe.	 58.46239683135472
—And with the help of the holy mother of God we will again, says the	 50.156659686379825
citizen, clapping his thigh. Our harbours that are empty will be full	 123.4581322667634
again, Queenstown, Kinsale, Galway, Blacksod Bay, Ventry in the kingdom	 80.70007921332527
of Kerry, Killybegs, the third largest harbour in the wide world with a	 36.06551913464408
fleet of masts of the Galway Lynches and the Cavan O’Reillys and the	 13.021136903204972
O’Kennedys of Dublin when the earl of Desmond could make a treaty with	 33.87841417711425
the emperor Charles the Fifth himself. And will again, says he, when	 90.5754456727686
the first Irish battleship is seen breasting the waves with our own	 66.78672230144605
flag to the fore, none of your Henry Tudor’s harps, no, the oldest flag	 75.3951822588263
afloat, the flag of the province of Desmond and Thomond, three crowns	 16.757611990352036
on a blue field, the three sons of Milesius.	 67.48198742908924
And he took the last swig out of the pint. Moya. All wind and piss like	 41.96982462597677
a tanyard cat. Cows in Connacht have long horns. As much as his bloody	 72.85853811434554
life is worth to go down and address his tall talk to the assembled	 71.85084984915049
multitude in Shanagolden where he daren’t show his nose with the Molly	 70.00683862378546
Maguires looking for him to let daylight through him for grabbing the	 47.94995403047678
holding of an evicted tenant.	 53.42888155934585
—Hear, hear to that, says John Wyse. What will you have?	 49.6441684210886
—An imperial yeomanry, says Lenehan, to celebrate the occasion.	 36.67438613013818
—Half one, Terry, says John Wyse, and a hands up. Terry! Are you	 73.44522938001184
asleep?	 22450.278269757076
—Yes, sir, says Terry. Small whisky and bottle of Allsop. Right, sir.	 58.34457511615
Hanging over the bloody paper with Alf looking for spicy bits instead	 111.2489513460053
of attending to the general public. Picture of a butting match, trying	 32.925983994776146
to crack their bloody skulls, one chap going for the other with his	 84.7102387997
head down like a bull at a gate. And another one: _Black Beast Burned	 163.11421769763646
in Omaha, Ga_. A lot of Deadwood Dicks in slouch hats and they firing	 41.62365943012916
at a Sambo strung up in a tree with his tongue out and a bonfire under	 40.92760443084088
him. Gob, they ought to drown him in the sea after and electrocute and	 40.84174755865071
crucify him to make sure of their job.	 78.60151462508867
—But what about the fighting navy, says Ned, that keeps our foes at	 56.64373725564817
bay?	 13350.671348633037
—I’ll tell you what about it, says the citizen. Hell upon earth it is.	 34.1726406109638
Read the revelations that’s going on in the papers about flogging on	 74.4195400248424
the training ships at Portsmouth. A fellow writes that calls himself	 38.33728371391516
_Disgusted One_.	 46.47610260289422
So he starts telling us about corporal punishment and about the crew of	 44.138102150880776
tars and officers and rearadmirals drawn up in cocked hats and the	 27.740392320314477
parson with his protestant bible to witness punishment and a young lad	 72.78144825647144
brought out, howling for his ma, and they tie him down on the buttend	 49.65242604161393
of a gun.	 75.05458668175882
—A rump and dozen, says the citizen, was what that old ruffian sir John	 50.94221084618869
Beresford called it but the modern God’s Englishman calls it caning on	 73.5896743183807
the breech.	 7.77559996992721
And says John Wyse:	 26.88725818393974
—’Tis a custom more honoured in the breach than in the observance.	 93.90347435951522
Then he was telling us the master at arms comes along with a long cane	 58.87715953231785
and he draws out and he flogs the bloody backside off of the poor lad	 42.46966457479053
till he yells meila murder.	 138.9701686845304
—That’s your glorious British navy, says the citizen, that bosses the	 77.3108588218985
earth. The fellows that never will be slaves, with the only hereditary	 75.05717229665963
chamber on the face of God’s earth and their land in the hands of a	 87.49868318263171
dozen gamehogs and cottonball barons. That’s the great empire they	 73.42355977314938
boast about of drudges and whipped serfs.	 15.870619309371648
—On which the sun never rises, says Joe.	 67.05779429424898
—And the tragedy of it is, says the citizen, they believe it. The	 49.25089352345337
unfortunate yahoos believe it.	 47.66739791283005
They believe in rod, the scourger almighty, creator of hell upon earth,	 68.97324921603017
and in Jacky Tar, the son of a gun, who was conceived of unholy boast,	 39.02238809381117
born of the fighting navy, suffered under rump and dozen, was	 107.77816915467766
scarified, flayed and curried, yelled like bloody hell, the third day	 28.216878807551357
he arose again from the bed, steered into haven, sitteth on his beamend	 20.00074721380868
till further orders whence he shall come to drudge for a living and be	 34.034390667228074
paid.	 20995.86342471813
—But, says Bloom, isn’t discipline the same everywhere. I mean wouldn’t	 78.66127310106836
it be the same here if you put force against force?	 79.98387531251821
Didn’t I tell you? As true as I’m drinking this porter if he was at his	 96.51700617050284
last gasp he’d try to downface you that dying was living.	 165.53694373835614
—We’ll put force against force, says the citizen. We have our greater	 28.57814357280012
Ireland beyond the sea. They were driven out of house and home in the	 44.56578794299328
black 47. Their mudcabins and their shielings by the roadside were laid	 44.4702807029898
low by the batteringram and the _Times_ rubbed its hands and told the	 77.45726351383196
whitelivered Saxons there would soon be as few Irish in Ireland as	 72.85908337726147
redskins in America. Even the Grand Turk sent us his piastres. But the	 74.37768547675851
Sassenach tried to starve the nation at home while the land was full of	 56.23352403604902
crops that the British hyenas bought and sold in Rio de Janeiro. Ay,	 66.27626063197741
they drove out the peasants in hordes. Twenty thousand of them died in	 51.97736633683276
the coffinships. But those that came to the land of the free remember	 47.9887259807316
the land of bondage. And they will come again and with a vengeance, no	 40.822233331161385
cravens, the sons of Granuaile, the champions of Kathleen ni Houlihan.	 7.886788854590277
—Perfectly true, says Bloom. But my point was...	 281.3529650341171
—We are a long time waiting for that day, citizen, says Ned. Since the	 31.149752776528693
poor old woman told us that the French were on the sea and landed at	 69.26131624062178
Killala.	 4.608171674364364
—Ay, says John Wyse. We fought for the royal Stuarts that reneged us	 51.242174822783625
against the Williamites and they betrayed us. Remember Limerick and the	 54.171574463733165
broken treatystone. We gave our best blood to France and Spain, the	 86.69464863760932
wild geese. Fontenoy, eh? And Sarsfield and O’Donnell, duke of Tetuan	 44.978281979826164
in Spain, and Ulysses Browne of Camus that was fieldmarshal to Maria	 27.19739558320639
Teresa. But what did we ever get for it?	 96.75384319126113
—The French! says the citizen. Set of dancing masters! Do you know what	 49.37205151897353
it is? They were never worth a roasted fart to Ireland. Aren’t they	 30.766741929416494
trying to make an _Entente cordiale_ now at Tay Pay’s dinnerparty with	 29.524232845272195
perfidious Albion? Firebrands of Europe and they always were.	 29.324393666212412
—_Conspuez les Français_, says Lenehan, nobbling his beer.	 74.8606127729112
—And as for the Prooshians and the Hanoverians, says Joe, haven’t we	 27.178914110647934
had enough of those sausageeating bastards on the throne from George	 79.3916838058642
the elector down to the German lad and the flatulent old bitch that’s	 31.977839332288063
dead?	 2339.4292884751385
Jesus, I had to laugh at the way he came out with that about the old	 35.64509362604273
one with the winkers on her, blind drunk in her royal palace every	 75.31015754437395
night of God, old Vic, with her jorum of mountain dew and her coachman	 40.79641100186616
carting her up body and bones to roll into bed and she pulling him by	 87.6745300526336
the whiskers and singing him old bits of songs about _Ehren on the	 66.0973258282716
Rhine_ and come where the boose is cheaper.	 65.65424442865522
—Well, says J. J. We have Edward the peacemaker now.	 37.38047559680571
—Tell that to a fool, says the citizen. There’s a bloody sight more pox	 46.29864973978098
than pax about that boyo. Edward Guelph-Wettin!	 95.7679750777388
—And what do you think, says Joe, of the holy boys, the priests and	 40.308047749472784
bishops of Ireland doing up his room in Maynooth in His Satanic	 41.60919749453106
Majesty’s racing colours and sticking up pictures of all the horses his	 72.21059490284875
jockeys rode. The earl of Dublin, no less.	 87.07709276812972
—They ought to have stuck up all the women he rode himself, says little	 66.70384530495386
Alf.	 3963.332935535945
And says J. J.:	 18.279630943463943
—Considerations of space influenced their lordships’ decision.	 19.721243726592448
—Will you try another, citizen? says Joe.	 24.690358094087852
—Yes, sir, says he. I will.	 29.92937168969676
—You? says Joe.	 38.60290500956331
—Beholden to you, Joe, says I. May your shadow never grow less.	 70.2789449048549
—Repeat that dose, says Joe.	 21.112334317749962
Bloom was talking and talking with John Wyse and he quite excited with	 131.6091714931293
his dunducketymudcoloured mug on him and his old plumeyes rolling	 41.93118069749499
about.	 703.7228526602032
—Persecution, says he, all the history of the world is full of it.	 45.4148497502247
Perpetuating national hatred among nations.	 76.06383270869314
—But do you know what a nation means? says John Wyse.	 24.294195751477258
—Yes, says Bloom.	 41.760928040598216
—What is it? says John Wyse.	 15.264400524680637
—A nation? says Bloom. A nation is the same people living in the same	 32.806383725614715
place.	 2996.2721040408474
—By God, then, says Ned, laughing, if that’s so I’m a nation for I’m	 154.16745516857722
living in the same place for the past five years.	 64.98646342997722
So of course everyone had the laugh at Bloom and says he, trying to	 48.58628565104211
muck out of it:	 19.345715888542948
—Or also living in different places.	 89.96663467971858
—That covers my case, says Joe.	 97.23990149299094
—What is your nation if I may ask? says the citizen.	 40.265290724150205
—Ireland, says Bloom. I was born here. Ireland.	 99.10594799120231
The citizen said nothing only cleared the spit out of his gullet and,	 50.186571012770976
gob, he spat a Red bank oyster out of him right in the corner.	 51.13705630738966
—After you with the push, Joe, says he, taking out his handkerchief to	 39.2906322012368
swab himself dry.	 79.95262951980952
—Here you are, citizen, says Joe. Take that in your right hand and	 61.9692575421443
repeat after me the following words.	 154.17960391434224
The muchtreasured and intricately embroidered ancient Irish facecloth	 21.265514937068833
attributed to Solomon of Droma and Manus Tomaltach og MacDonogh,	 7.4440498933492165
authors of the Book of Ballymote, was then carefully produced and	 33.43897645520837
called forth prolonged admiration. No need to dwell on the legendary	 68.54435171375086
beauty of the cornerpieces, the acme of art, wherein one can distinctly	 31.089024970192735
discern each of the four evangelists in turn presenting to each of the	 62.36025864831456
four masters his evangelical symbol, a bogoak sceptre, a North American	 148.97333944810146
puma (a far nobler king of beasts than the British article, be it said	 130.51998383152065
in passing), a Kerry calf and a golden eagle from Carrantuohill. The	 74.62138447596179
scenes depicted on the emunctory field, showing our ancient duns and	 44.74050940630743
raths and cromlechs and grianauns and seats of learning and maledictive	 10.735884572751521
stones, are as wonderfully beautiful and the pigments as delicate as	 78.33641217787178
when the Sligo illuminators gave free rein to their artistic fantasy	 42.79520648744672
long long ago in the time of the Barmecides. Glendalough, the lovely	 24.770465690329907
lakes of Killarney, the ruins of Clonmacnois, Cong Abbey, Glen Inagh	 15.503963089068405
and the Twelve Pins, Ireland’s Eye, the Green Hills of Tallaght, Croagh	 79.95238864764471
Patrick, the brewery of Messrs Arthur Guinness, Son and Company	 136.24619256033117
(Limited), Lough Neagh’s banks, the vale of Ovoca, Isolde’s tower, the	 23.5583930476584
Mapas obelisk, Sir Patrick Dun’s hospital, Cape Clear, the glen of	 42.086974381219676
Aherlow, Lynch’s castle, the Scotch house, Rathdown Union Workhouse at	 72.30608506974195
Loughlinstown, Tullamore jail, Castleconnel rapids,	 3.933542382544028
Kilballymacshonakill, the cross at Monasterboice, Jury’s Hotel, S.	 105.8026101135438
Patrick’s Purgatory, the Salmon Leap, Maynooth college refectory,	 39.9548911290827
Curley’s hole, the three birthplaces of the first duke of Wellington,	 28.191599160586406
the rock of Cashel, the bog of Allen, the Henry Street Warehouse,	 44.22836993353822
Fingal’s Cave—all these moving scenes are still there for us today	 121.34435636162243
rendered more beautiful still by the waters of sorrow which have passed	 205.8110377821488
over them and by the rich incrustations of time.	 79.9538893657632
—Show us over the drink, says I. Which is which?	 154.8649469500918
—That’s mine, says Joe, as the devil said to the dead policeman.	 37.81475085492819
—And I belong to a race too, says Bloom, that is hated and persecuted.	 44.14474798195413
Also now. This very moment. This very instant.	 92.35242112596283
Gob, he near burnt his fingers with the butt of his old cigar.	 64.68358523874443
—Robbed, says he. Plundered. Insulted. Persecuted. Taking what belongs	 33.681286592861596
to us by right. At this very moment, says he, putting up his fist, sold	 77.08622256649039
by auction in Morocco like slaves or cattle.	 64.8361151454181
—Are you talking about the new Jerusalem? says the citizen.	 18.86513167366257
—I’m talking about injustice, says Bloom.	 33.46407344339596
—Right, says John Wyse. Stand up to it then with force like men.	 51.67643299338168
That’s an almanac picture for you. Mark for a softnosed bullet. Old	 68.75597510736281
lardyface standing up to the business end of a gun. Gob, he’d adorn a	 37.51661739145118
sweepingbrush, so he would, if he only had a nurse’s apron on him. And	 46.3482171987103
then he collapses all of a sudden, twisting around all the opposite, as	 62.56451055928392
limp as a wet rag.	 366.24505138676494
—But it’s no use, says he. Force, hatred, history, all that. That’s not	 135.7216115492001
life for men and women, insult and hatred. And everybody knows that	 68.5500153103777
it’s the very opposite of that that is really life.	 74.34707600346213
—What? says Alf.	 39.987232684695634
—Love, says Bloom. I mean the opposite of hatred. I must go now, says	 44.221048211051055
he to John Wyse. Just round to the court a moment to see if Martin is	 91.76109729551108
there. If he comes just say I’ll be back in a second. Just a moment.	 104.22552136128206
Who’s hindering you? And off he pops like greased lightning.	 185.59795265671045
—A new apostle to the gentiles, says the citizen. Universal love.	 24.17955270313193
—Well, says John Wyse. Isn’t that what we’re told. Love your neighbour.	 95.46196087421481
—That chap? says the citizen. Beggar my neighbour is his motto. Love,	 45.70018667164374
moya! He’s a nice pattern of a Romeo and Juliet.	 20.801419656439023
Love loves to love love. Nurse loves the new chemist. Constable 14A	 142.2648667670541
loves Mary Kelly. Gerty MacDowell loves the boy that has the bicycle.	 104.85246763985326
M. B. loves a fair gentleman. Li Chi Han lovey up kissy Cha Pu Chow.	 28.31369906265532
Jumbo, the elephant, loves Alice, the elephant. Old Mr Verschoyle with	 42.37292807661205
the ear trumpet loves old Mrs Verschoyle with the turnedin eye. The man	 78.16129524718176
in the brown macintosh loves a lady who is dead. His Majesty the King	 52.310960544646214
loves Her Majesty the Queen. Mrs Norman W. Tupper loves officer Taylor.	 59.31386653506326
You love a certain person. And this person loves that other person	 79.15722146822198
because everybody loves somebody but God loves everybody.	 126.18437752851207
—Well, Joe, says I, your very good health and song. More power,	 87.32605240312026
citizen.	 5254.670455482157
—Hurrah, there, says Joe.	 53.48475547944934
—The blessing of God and Mary and Patrick on you, says the citizen.	 48.37633008190358
And he ups with his pint to wet his whistle.	 72.423704936012
—We know those canters, says he, preaching and picking your pocket.	 95.11131622463691
What about sanctimonious Cromwell and his ironsides that put the women	 47.132585583584145
and children of Drogheda to the sword with the bible text _God is love_	 58.4870220153756
pasted round the mouth of his cannon? The bible! Did you read that skit	 41.96659759647144
in the _United Irishman_ today about that Zulu chief that’s visiting	 127.43845555266364
England?	 11239.530202378506
—What’s that? says Joe.	 35.695106467987806
So the citizen takes up one of his paraphernalia papers and he starts	 48.69663726161504
reading out:	 519.338169698789
—A delegation of the chief cotton magnates of Manchester was presented	 29.81906383502186
yesterday to His Majesty the Alaki of Abeakuta by Gold Stick in	 29.506707371396303
Waiting, Lord Walkup of Walkup on Eggs, to tender to His Majesty the	 69.7821326480136
heartfelt thanks of British traders for the facilities afforded them in	 44.40043036602448
his dominions. The delegation partook of luncheon at the conclusion of	 21.660260148982353
which the dusky potentate, in the course of a happy speech, freely	 24.50569408416406
translated by the British chaplain, the reverend Ananias Praisegod	 27.758492563448165
Barebones, tendered his best thanks to Massa Walkup and emphasised the	 22.03425804905951
cordial relations existing between Abeakuta and the British empire,	 63.40822082211997
stating that he treasured as one of his dearest possessions an	 43.06404455142797
illuminated bible, the volume of the word of God and the secret of	 27.656937733472308
England’s greatness, graciously presented to him by the white chief	 25.114230858665884
woman, the great squaw Victoria, with a personal dedication from the	 84.04094040416064
august hand of the Royal Donor. The Alaki then drank a lovingcup of	 33.141332788812605
firstshot usquebaugh to the toast _Black and White_ from the skull of	 28.754759903989978
his immediate predecessor in the dynasty Kakachakachak, surnamed Forty	 23.776133481699084
Warts, after which he visited the chief factory of Cottonopolis and	 34.63743126543186
signed his mark in the visitors’ book, subsequently executing a	 57.22210319597477
charming old Abeakutic wardance, in the course of which he swallowed	 44.42229809123631
several knives and forks, amid hilarious applause from the girl hands.	 97.74550253979324
—Widow woman, says Ned. I wouldn’t doubt her. Wonder did he put that	 98.31683917671607
bible to the same use as I would.	 102.837060481787
—Same only more so, says Lenehan. And thereafter in that fruitful land	 114.71078764234797
the broadleaved mango flourished exceedingly.	 5.74716311795317
—Is that by Griffith? says John Wyse.	 36.03741376203734
—No, says the citizen. It’s not signed Shanganagh. It’s only	 62.082746708889836
initialled: P.	 142.4851970108439
—And a very good initial too, says Joe.	 44.22511469000433
—That’s how it’s worked, says the citizen. Trade follows the flag.	 93.81137812564009
—Well, says J. J., if they’re any worse than those Belgians in the	 35.52902073343848
Congo Free State they must be bad. Did you read that report by a man	 88.12849175002573
what’s this his name is?	 68.84621967952187
—Casement, says the citizen. He’s an Irishman.	 27.8523004448363
—Yes, that’s the man, says J. J. Raping the women and girls and	 40.966388919347935
flogging the natives on the belly to squeeze all the red rubber they	 28.272001574411085
can out of them.	 214.2185040351767
—I know where he’s gone, says Lenehan, cracking his fingers.	 21.63569827433308
—Who? says I.	 54.55936263869861
—Bloom, says he. The courthouse is a blind. He had a few bob on	 51.47485905216682
_Throwaway_ and he’s gone to gather in the shekels.	 27.191093180532036
—Is it that whiteeyed kaffir? says the citizen, that never backed a	 26.801382546186105
horse in anger in his life?	 81.0133439763434
—That’s where he’s gone, says Lenehan. I met Bantam Lyons going to back	 40.55885662282418
that horse only I put him off it and he told me Bloom gave him the tip.	 84.21979211593273
Bet you what you like he has a hundred shillings to five on. He’s the	 74.80787416175484
only man in Dublin has it. A dark horse.	 99.34282051119544
—He’s a bloody dark horse himself, says Joe.	 92.91507386366776
—Mind, Joe, says I. Show us the entrance out.	 72.87678124423307
—There you are, says Terry.	 73.7039077009881
Goodbye Ireland I’m going to Gort. So I just went round the back of the	 71.79421908700094
yard to pumpship and begob (hundred shillings to five) while I was	 51.41232254499848
letting off my _(Throwaway_ twenty to) letting off my load gob says I	 135.19766204749124
to myself I knew he was uneasy in his (two pints off of Joe and one in	 68.37339966567588
Slattery’s off) in his mind to get off the mark to (hundred shillings	 62.62353056213471
is five quid) and when they were in the (dark horse) pisser Burke was	 19.079533977946063
telling me card party and letting on the child was sick (gob, must have	 86.62577328962455
done about a gallon) flabbyarse of a wife speaking down the tube _she’s	 37.29326215089727
better_ or _she’s_ (ow!) all a plan so he could vamoose with the pool	 44.76459500673961
if he won or (Jesus, full up I was) trading without a licence (ow!)	 78.8292871972053
Ireland my nation says he (hoik! phthook!) never be up to those bloody	 92.92470682953326
(there’s the last of it) Jerusalem (ah!) cuckoos.	 64.94771493944558
So anyhow when I got back they were at it dingdong, John Wyse saying it	 79.63588660176201
was Bloom gave the ideas for Sinn Fein to Griffith to put in his paper	 80.81225444504281
all kinds of jerrymandering, packed juries and swindling the taxes off	 11.721060442356714
of the government and appointing consuls all over the world to walk	 40.4511995465968
about selling Irish industries. Robbing Peter to pay Paul. Gob, that	 75.20853756230574
puts the bloody kybosh on it if old sloppy eyes is mucking up the show.	 90.13219772280615
Give us a bloody chance. God save Ireland from the likes of that bloody	 52.30093091442616
mouseabout. Mr Bloom with his argol bargol. And his old fellow before	 33.90742646478216
him perpetrating frauds, old Methusalem Bloom, the robbing bagman, that	 36.44314297879844
poisoned himself with the prussic acid after he swamping the country	 71.53923336290416
with his baubles and his penny diamonds. Loans by post on easy terms.	 40.59513597704071
Any amount of money advanced on note of hand. Distance no object. No	 88.0602800594413
security. Gob, he’s like Lanty MacHale’s goat that’d go a piece of the	 37.88235550531764
road with every one.	 474.5020870447637
—Well, it’s a fact, says John Wyse. And there’s the man now that’ll	 40.83241337706446
tell you all about it, Martin Cunningham.	 67.14009426497913
Sure enough the castle car drove up with Martin on it and Jack Power	 99.34012301267543
with him and a fellow named Crofter or Crofton, pensioner out of the	 38.07049588878256
collector general’s, an orangeman Blackburn does have on the	 32.696881952015616
registration and he drawing his pay or Crawford gallivanting around the	 66.31170212974685
country at the king’s expense.	 121.4405061386857
Our travellers reached the rustic hostelry and alighted from their	 30.11505569557663
palfreys.	 4.608171674364364
—Ho, varlet! cried he, who by his mien seemed the leader of the party.	 109.83288024511471
Saucy knave! To us!	 19.3661184558211
So saying he knocked loudly with his swordhilt upon the open lattice.	 108.0916063989091
Mine host came forth at the summons, girding him with his tabard.	 23.698254085999793
—Give you good den, my masters, said he with an obsequious bow.	 92.8937554903449
—Bestir thyself, sirrah! cried he who had knocked. Look to our steeds.	 46.96996148305658
And for ourselves give us of your best for ifaith we need it.	 112.89210137070873
—Lackaday, good masters, said the host, my poor house has but a bare	 163.47106740960584
larder. I know not what to offer your lordships.	 43.933229951758186
—How now, fellow? cried the second of the party, a man of pleasant	 124.34653602874286
countenance, So servest thou the king’s messengers, master Taptun?	 142.66313316611505
An instantaneous change overspread the landlord’s visage.	 82.50797878673136
—Cry you mercy, gentlemen, he said humbly. An you be the king’s	 229.81045140784113
messengers (God shield His Majesty!) you shall not want for aught. The	 79.80425372870805
king’s friends (God bless His Majesty!) shall not go afasting in my	 87.41199678234224
house I warrant me.	 88.06199435598954
—Then about! cried the traveller who had not spoken, a lusty	 135.95553235577327
trencherman by his aspect. Hast aught to give us?	 50.55297092769718
Mine host bowed again as he made answer:	 59.65037880120593
—What say you, good masters, to a squab pigeon pasty, some collops of	 57.016500431192924
venison, a saddle of veal, widgeon with crisp hog’s bacon, a boar’s	 21.13841550186429
head with pistachios, a bason of jolly custard, a medlar tansy and a	 24.64992260536048
flagon of old Rhenish?	 18.55377849962155
—Gadzooks! cried the last speaker. That likes me well. Pistachios!	 98.3607270013485
—Aha! cried he of the pleasant countenance. A poor house and a bare	 173.21215964011375
larder, quotha! ’Tis a merry rogue.	 66.47102750337176
So in comes Martin asking where was Bloom.	 216.1455144996253
—Where is he? says Lenehan. Defrauding widows and orphans.	 26.30043225935542
—Isn’t that a fact, says John Wyse, what I was telling the citizen	 29.78522423367506
about Bloom and the Sinn Fein?	 105.42467828655194
—That’s so, says Martin. Or so they allege.	 54.64101461857034
—Who made those allegations? says Alf.	 96.49179583068987
—I, says Joe. I’m the alligator.	 32.19017131447362
—And after all, says John Wyse, why can’t a jew love his country like	 112.46042480075319
the next fellow?	 58.641538328386325
—Why not? says J. J., when he’s quite sure which country it is.	 79.31092230298144
—Is he a jew or a gentile or a holy Roman or a swaddler or what the	 34.534633652773394
hell is he? says Ned. Or who is he? No offence, Crofton.	 72.10981053999143
—Who is Junius? says J. J.	 25.880566298584274
—We don’t want him, says Crofter the Orangeman or presbyterian.	 37.37209637051181
—He’s a perverted jew, says Martin, from a place in Hungary and it was	 45.487618485377
he drew up all the plans according to the Hungarian system. We know	 49.51758278685681
that in the castle.	 83.25789998340466
—Isn’t he a cousin of Bloom the dentist? says Jack Power.	 80.40072425176983
—Not at all, says Martin. Only namesakes. His name was Virag, the	 79.82400612069954
father’s name that poisoned himself. He changed it by deedpoll, the	 104.69417906143953
father did.	 1899.8511077611859
—That’s the new Messiah for Ireland! says the citizen. Island of saints	 84.58509794370059
and sages!	 15.372472535691111
—Well, they’re still waiting for their redeemer, says Martin. For that	 33.2014281436145
matter so are we.	 498.31156183271025
—Yes, says J. J., and every male that’s born they think it may be their	 77.61295247242164
Messiah. And every jew is in a tall state of excitement, I believe,	 92.10678416054876
till he knows if he’s a father or a mother.	 140.99837457536506
—Expecting every moment will be his next, says Lenehan.	 83.54282660210909
—O, by God, says Ned, you should have seen Bloom before that son of his	 98.61553643217111
that died was born. I met him one day in the south city markets buying	 32.06535586385443
a tin of Neave’s food six weeks before the wife was delivered.	 72.53488074201702
—_En ventre sa mère_, says J. J.	 19.69209286553144
—Do you call that a man? says the citizen.	 31.392193452413675
—I wonder did he ever put it out of sight, says Joe.	 26.676609020421555
—Well, there were two children born anyhow, says Jack Power.	 67.21268536150104
—And who does he suspect? says the citizen.	 43.89704898579907
Gob, there’s many a true word spoken in jest. One of those mixed	 88.12241582811231
middlings he is. Lying up in the hotel Pisser was telling me once a	 35.73241494026709
month with headache like a totty with her courses. Do you know what I’m	 33.10988840078298
telling you? It’d be an act of God to take a hold of a fellow the like	 92.32636990612176
of that and throw him in the bloody sea. Justifiable homicide, so it	 56.374958115020334
would. Then sloping off with his five quid without putting up a pint of	 53.52149772708158
stuff like a man. Give us your blessing. Not as much as would blind	 106.43348226334511
your eye.	 222.92599128043514
—Charity to the neighbour, says Martin. But where is he? We can’t wait.	 92.99554056238402
—A wolf in sheep’s clothing, says the citizen. That’s what he is. Virag	 19.80342929027464
from Hungary! Ahasuerus I call him. Cursed by God.	 48.4893663200402
—Have you time for a brief libation, Martin? says Ned.	 149.30558812378794
—Only one, says Martin. We must be quick. J. J. and S.	 89.53760660446808
—You, Jack? Crofton? Three half ones, Terry.	 183.21879155204186
—Saint Patrick would want to land again at Ballykinlar and convert us,	 104.93438112315242
says the citizen, after allowing things like that to contaminate our	 63.86701856420879
shores.	 4.608171674364364
—Well, says Martin, rapping for his glass. God bless all here is my	 62.57410728849109
prayer.	 19177.630523474185
—Amen, says the citizen.	 49.34824119901355
—And I’m sure He will, says Joe.	 55.12931389094935
And at the sound of the sacring bell, headed by a crucifer with	 25.329166488356414
acolytes, thurifers, boatbearers, readers, ostiarii, deacons and	 4.7090571665870256
subdeacons, the blessed company drew nigh of mitred abbots and priors	 22.413985108117366
and guardians and monks and friars: the monks of Benedict of Spoleto,	 19.961312534538987
Carthusians and Camaldolesi, Cistercians and Olivetans, Oratorians and	 6.257516639456236
Vallombrosans, and the friars of Augustine, Brigittines,	 5.473873787004071
Premonstratensians, Servi, Trinitarians, and the children of Peter	 24.04692696826662
Nolasco: and therewith from Carmel mount the children of Elijah prophet	 39.50782759569141
led by Albert bishop and by Teresa of Avila, calced and other: and	 34.33577265904919
friars, brown and grey, sons of poor Francis, capuchins, cordeliers,	 28.29261846741101

christian brothers led by the reverend brother Edmund Ignatius Rice.	 111.63848556704497

dragons, lilies, buckshot, beards, hogs, lamps, bellows, beehives,	 9.48110654115032
soupladles, stars, snakes, anvils, boxes of vaseline, bells, crutches,	 23.651806793046386
forceps, stags’ horns, watertight boots, hawks, millstones, eyes on a	 34.98051622737075
dish, wax candles, aspergills, unicorns. And as they wended their way	 68.25652371843667
by Nelson’s Pillar, Henry street, Mary street, Capel street, Little	 105.79400359948504
Britain street chanting the introit in _Epiphania Domini_ which	 28.015852841543037
beginneth _Surge, illuminare_ and thereafter most sweetly the gradual	 8.94893255797917
_Omnes_ which saith _de Saba venient_ they did divers wonders such as	 29.986835709641202
casting out devils, raising the dead to life, multiplying fishes,	 126.92460419649616
healing the halt and the blind, discovering various articles which had	 60.3088269815108
been mislaid, interpreting and fulfilling the scriptures, blessing and	 23.10948643801549
prophesying. And last, beneath a canopy of cloth of gold came the	 36.34214961067334
reverend Father O’Flynn attended by Malachi and Patrick. And when the	 178.18182752829344
good fathers had reached the appointed place, the house of Bernard	 69.12945617065029
Kiernan and Co, limited, 8, 9 and 10 little Britain street, wholesale	 26.132732653713816
grocers, wine and brandy shippers, licensed for the sale of beer, wine	 48.43613644880975
and spirits for consumption on the premises, the celebrant blessed the	 54.12111179835562
house and censed the mullioned windows and the groynes and the vaults	 18.532515294422584
and the arrises and the capitals and the pediments and the cornices and	 9.2845097209012
the engrailed arches and the spires and the cupolas and sprinkled the	 14.82464129949656
lintels thereof with blessed water and prayed that God might bless that	 68.69771397973268
house as he had blessed the house of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and	 39.263583241531215
make the angels of His light to inhabit therein. And entering he	 119.76852877048964
blessed the viands and the beverages and the company of all the blessed	 34.26994107565095
answered his prayers.	 886.119961772545
—_Adiutorium nostrum in nomine Domini._	 17.306239851692055
—_Qui fecit cœlum et terram._	 34.965570707297225
—_Dominus vobiscum._	 4.411654744205047
—_Et cum spiritu tuo._	 20.54389886241377
And he laid his hands upon that he blessed and gave thanks and he	 77.99182328934289
prayed and they all with him prayed:	 99.15458513711901
—_Deus, cuius verbo sanctificantur omnia, benedictionem tuam effunde	 8.615656304596937
super creaturas istas: et praesta ut quisquis eis secundum legem et	 13.8453615565996
voluntatem Tuam cum gratiarum actione usus fuerit per invocationem	 6.61341420039719
sanctissimi nominis Tui corporis sanitatem et animæ tutelam Te auctore	 8.951791971243138
percipiat per Christum Dominum nostrum._	 11.544897906197257
—And so say all of us, says Jack.	 174.05027367119786
—Thousand a year, Lambert, says Crofton or Crawford.	 402.6146811609543
—Right, says Ned, taking up his John Jameson. And butter for fish.	 84.44091958319538
I was just looking around to see who the happy thought would strike	 79.03612528018363
when be damned but in he comes again letting on to be in a hell of a	 46.377176262238144
hurry.	 3129.8651959710423
—I was just round at the courthouse, says he, looking for you. I hope	 32.98940214159068
I’m not...	 104.66724225115479
—No, says Martin, we’re ready.	 40.0008438191861
Courthouse my eye and your pockets hanging down with gold and silver.	 86.05217715867416
Mean bloody scut. Stand us a drink itself. Devil a sweet fear! There’s	 235.3147856609543
a jew for you! All for number one. Cute as a shithouse rat. Hundred to	 72.75890540667434
five.	 1470.1643938704804
—Don’t tell anyone, says the citizen.	 16.88598103432802
—Beg your pardon, says he.	 93.1214793746464
—Come on boys, says Martin, seeing it was looking blue. Come along now.	 101.96169503981483
—Don’t tell anyone, says the citizen, letting a bawl out of him. It’s a	 15.59537481307775
secret.	 5700.165742041647
And the bloody dog woke up and let a growl.	 47.92306829702537
—Bye bye all, says Martin.	 88.60825906617248
And he got them out as quick as he could, Jack Power and Crofton or	 43.38393315213433
whatever you call him and him in the middle of them letting on to be	 43.49251944624646
all at sea and up with them on the bloody jaunting car.	 98.58739079452266
—Off with you, says Martin to the jarvey.	 66.2509495127869
The milkwhite dolphin tossed his mane and, rising in the golden poop	 33.220011567548354
the helmsman spread the bellying sail upon the wind and stood off	 48.214182010568855
forward with all sail set, the spinnaker to larboard. A many comely	 63.13456735708193
nymphs drew nigh to starboard and to larboard and, clinging to the	 32.46926442474944
sides of the noble bark, they linked their shining forms as doth the	 90.44588791417321
cunning wheelwright when he fashions about the heart of his wheel the	 51.352199708334986
equidistant rays whereof each one is sister to another and he binds	 90.4642477920031
them all with an outer ring and giveth speed to the feet of men whenas	 28.669132079499313
they ride to a hosting or contend for the smile of ladies fair. Even so	 85.74382281646278
did they come and set them, those willing nymphs, the undying sisters.	 96.76763746547337
And they laughed, sporting in a circle of their foam: and the bark	 42.824184753520285
clave the waves.	 49.879170764713706
But begob I was just lowering the heel of the pint when I saw the	 30.17046319956811
citizen getting up to waddle to the door, puffing and blowing with the	 44.568823551887164
dropsy, and he cursing the curse of Cromwell on him, bell, book and	 30.381510724466036
candle in Irish, spitting and spatting out of him and Joe and little	 79.59401421899173
Alf round him like a leprechaun trying to peacify him.	 69.44306579820048
—Let me alone, says he.	 37.40978828169683
And begob he got as far as the door and they holding him and he bawls	 30.350500868480918
out of him:	 36.085377130386824
—Three cheers for Israel!	 32.43952724343235
Arrah, sit down on the parliamentary side of your arse for Christ’ sake	 26.09998807572879
and don’t be making a public exhibition of yourself. Jesus, there’s	 75.65652096606854
always some bloody clown or other kicking up a bloody murder about	 72.44711782710334
bloody nothing. Gob, it’d turn the porter sour in your guts, so it	 191.82689705408674
would.	 807.7907537064854
And all the ragamuffins and sluts of the nation round the door and	 44.81047307627054
Martin telling the jarvey to drive ahead and the citizen bawling and	 66.24027580587486
Alf and Joe at him to whisht and he on his high horse about the jews	 102.06941577401194
and the loafers calling for a speech and Jack Power trying to get him	 48.24740307356117
to sit down on the car and hold his bloody jaw and a loafer with a	 31.844216886412294
patch over his eye starts singing _If the man in the moon was a jew,	 53.22248711575359
jew, jew_ and a slut shouts out of her:	 92.53831857627564
—Eh, mister! Your fly is open, mister!	 248.37358079549034
And says he:	 42.91269478285161
—Mendelssohn was a jew and Karl Marx and Mercadante and Spinoza. And	 12.993258646731388
the Saviour was a jew and his father was a jew. Your God.	 79.31441706009565
—He had no father, says Martin. That’ll do now. Drive ahead.	 60.401666060626454
—Whose God? says the citizen.	 116.2742793193944
—Well, his uncle was a jew, says he. Your God was a jew. Christ was a	 88.83433565970262
jew like me.	 578.5325372004315
Gob, the citizen made a plunge back into the shop.	 58.29608192604354
—By Jesus, says he, I’ll brain that bloody jewman for using the holy	 40.58053194948788
name. By Jesus, I’ll crucify him so I will. Give us that biscuitbox here.	 53.79157065553765
—Stop! Stop! says Joe.	 55.50546459103498
A large and appreciative gathering of friends and acquaintances from	 69.14145222604162
the metropolis and greater Dublin assembled in their thousands to bid	 24.346183445517187
farewell to Nagyaságos uram Lipóti Virag, late of Messrs Alexander	 99.21417882806033
Thom’s, printers to His Majesty, on the occasion of his departure for	 20.26160867517144
the distant clime of Százharminczbrojúgulyás-Dugulás (Meadow of	 15.326754864776857
Murmuring Waters). The ceremony which went off with great _éclat_ was	 98.4801235415619
characterised by the most affecting cordiality. An illuminated scroll	 15.096257268066342
of ancient Irish vellum, the work of Irish artists, was presented to	 32.09325326875711
the distinguished phenomenologist on behalf of a large section of the	 14.445605273365771
community and was accompanied by the gift of a silver casket,	 28.70139168366892
tastefully executed in the style of ancient Celtic ornament, a work	 34.74130074403459
which reflects every credit on the makers, Messrs Jacob _agus_ Jacob.	 37.42984210948863
The departing guest was the recipient of a hearty ovation, many of	 25.10881327427133
those who were present being visibly moved when the select orchestra of	 53.65885515428178
Irish pipes struck up the wellknown strains of _Come Back to Erin_,	 120.19089636638569
followed immediately by _Rakóczsy’s March_. Tarbarrels and bonfires	 47.78438396391497
were lighted along the coastline of the four seas on the summits of the	 20.901274251644217
Hill of Howth, Three Rock Mountain, Sugarloaf, Bray Head, the mountains	 179.94044129931893
of Mourne, the Galtees, the Ox and Donegal and Sperrin peaks, the	 18.289221233884362
Nagles and the Bograghs, the Connemara hills, the reeks of	 13.547617091248318
M’Gillicuddy, Slieve Aughty, Slieve Bernagh and Slieve Bloom. Amid	 11.78296189574698
cheers that rent the welkin, responded to by answering cheers from a	 100.68345172363226
big muster of henchmen on the distant Cambrian and Caledonian hills,	 43.21622528569096
the mastodontic pleasureship slowly moved away saluted by a final	 51.97962719613608
floral tribute from the representatives of the fair sex who were	 35.89629714585984
present in large numbers while, as it proceeded down the river,	 110.74292530014824
escorted by a flotilla of barges, the flags of the Ballast office and	 9.608137483272232
Custom House were dipped in salute as were also those of the electrical	 144.01158280145285
power station at the Pigeonhouse and the Poolbeg Light.	 39.18187062138567
_Visszontlátásra, kedvés barátom! Visszontlátásra!_ Gone but not	 26.64198705531742
forgotten.	 3024.5303397649104
Gob, the devil wouldn’t stop him till he got hold of the bloody tin	 59.46725948723375
anyhow and out with him and little Alf hanging on to his elbow and he	 55.04793957801761
shouting like a stuck pig, as good as any bloody play in the Queen’s	 119.67008412757993
royal theatre:	 330.1750182728416
—Where is he till I murder him?	 78.58596128913861
And Ned and J. J. paralysed with the laughing.	 120.30603329667225
—Bloody wars, says I, I’ll be in for the last gospel.	 79.81119459690619
But as luck would have it the jarvey got the nag’s head round the other	 75.46468802550645
way and off with him.	 107.67713103488768
—Hold on, citizen, says Joe. Stop!	 131.03823264595002
Begob he drew his hand and made a swipe and let fly. Mercy of God the	 46.5681251264731
sun was in his eyes or he’d have left him for dead. Gob, he near sent	 86.1088332723371
it into the county Longford. The bloody nag took fright and the old	 58.20226584419609
mongrel after the car like bloody hell and all the populace shouting	 115.17558354102616
and laughing and the old tinbox clattering along the street.	 49.01405999253692
The catastrophe was terrific and instantaneous in its effect. The	 83.76773675000676
observatory of Dunsink registered in all eleven shocks, all of the	 22.529541361452292
fifth grade of Mercalli’s scale, and there is no record extant of a	 25.008337232285424
similar seismic disturbance in our island since the earthquake of 1534,	 27.11648965628923
the year of the rebellion of Silken Thomas. The epicentre appears to	 29.70049071000078
have been that part of the metropolis which constitutes the Inn’s Quay	 32.049214576988206
ward and parish of Saint Michan covering a surface of fortyone acres,	 30.436060543723624
two roods and one square pole or perch. All the lordly residences in	 32.47973868133082
the vicinity of the palace of justice were demolished and that noble	 37.47114115517867
edifice itself, in which at the time of the catastrophe important legal	 48.97485637403066
debates were in progress, is literally a mass of ruins beneath which it	 40.222093532830556
is to be feared all the occupants have been buried alive. From the	 35.28618295668957
reports of eyewitnesses it transpires that the seismic waves were	 33.33923553934609
accompanied by a violent atmospheric perturbation of cyclonic	 34.66209557399365
character. An article of headgear since ascertained to belong to the	 36.87425113373274
much respected clerk of the crown and peace Mr George Fottrell and a	 84.94554223891895
silk umbrella with gold handle with the engraved initials, crest, coat	 43.75597785947845
of arms and house number of the erudite and worshipful chairman of	 36.008288070032414
quarter sessions sir Frederick Falkiner, recorder of Dublin, have been	 99.41370626467967
discovered by search parties in remote parts of the island	 60.94146013038185
respectively, the former on the third basaltic ridge of the giant’s	 14.6172956709152
causeway, the latter embedded to the extent of one foot three inches in	 19.28921913811396
the sandy beach of Holeopen bay near the old head of Kinsale. Other	 52.55267179900992
eyewitnesses depose that they observed an incandescent object of	 35.43330446971037
enormous proportions hurtling through the atmosphere at a terrifying	 11.8853573880621
velocity in a trajectory directed southwest by west. Messages of	 14.569842084985673
condolence and sympathy are being hourly received from all parts of the	 29.395462046281068
different continents and the sovereign pontiff has been graciously	 47.17567194649034
pleased to decree that a special _missa pro defunctis_ shall be	 85.51586923466454
celebrated simultaneously by the ordinaries of each and every cathedral	 25.721521432352205
church of all the episcopal dioceses subject to the spiritual authority	 42.24209368414454
of the Holy See in suffrage of the souls of those faithful departed who	 60.037237587556454
have been so unexpectedly called away from our midst. The work of	 95.90262344986084
salvage, removal of _débris,_ human remains etc has been entrusted to	 32.72589559958521
Messrs Michael Meade and Son, 159 Great Brunswick street, and Messrs T.	 85.06211168262428
and C. Martin, 77, 78, 79 and 80 North Wall, assisted by the men and	 46.97017035807631
officers of the Duke of Cornwall’s light infantry under the general	 49.615456934323554
supervision of H. R. H., rear admiral, the right honourable sir	 25.598100556366553
Hercules Hannibal Habeas Corpus Anderson, K. G., K. P., K. T., P. C.,	 21.839532520765403
K. C. B., M. P., J. P., M. B., D. S. O., S. O. D., M. F. H., M. R. I.	 35.66032858796836
A., B. L., Mus. Doc., P. L. G., F. T. C. D., F. R. U. I., F. R. C. P.	 39.054094516698314
I. and F. R. C. S. I.	 125.95520508631411
You never saw the like of it in all your born puff. Gob, if he got that	 65.27190869488689
lottery ticket on the side of his poll he’d remember the gold cup, he	 47.48285255286152
would so, but begob the citizen would have been lagged for assault and	 37.5695159039296
battery and Joe for aiding and abetting. The jarvey saved his life by	 49.09519326044823
furious driving as sure as God made Moses. What? O, Jesus, he did. And	 160.635124142898
he let a volley of oaths after him.	 58.26656495736576
—Did I kill him, says he, or what?	 59.95071800195705
And he shouting to the bloody dog:	 36.32391200967331
—After him, Garry! After him, boy!	 83.65859119457495
And the last we saw was the bloody car rounding the corner and old	 108.53204323138625
sheepsface on it gesticulating and the bloody mongrel after it with his	 35.29357503559165
lugs back for all he was bloody well worth to tear him limb from limb.	 52.73611726280199
Hundred to five! Jesus, he took the value of it out of him, I promise	 94.08488960023325
you.	 149.54238275787918
When, lo, there came about them all a great brightness and they beheld	 135.46896076405832
the chariot wherein He stood ascend to heaven. And they beheld Him in	 42.32097961117738
the chariot, clothed upon in the glory of the brightness, having	 40.93741646900873
raiment as of the sun, fair as the moon and terrible that for awe they	 115.11191968941151
durst not look upon Him. And there came a voice out of heaven, calling:	 106.93375031041656
_Elijah! Elijah!_ And He answered with a main cry: _Abba! Adonai!_ And	 38.18365265664082
they beheld Him even Him, ben Bloom Elijah, amid clouds of angels	 115.69396373863043
ascend to the glory of the brightness at an angle of fortyfive degrees	 22.768159595231648
over Donohoe’s in Little Green street like a shot off a shovel.	 61.84483584704011
[ 13 ]	 463.94842625767166
The summer evening had begun to fold the world in its mysterious	 58.4218796982782
embrace. Far away in the west the sun was setting and the last glow of	 43.46768094921722
all too fleeting day lingered lovingly on sea and strand, on the proud	 100.53653484097534
promontory of dear old Howth guarding as ever the waters of the bay, on	 78.39185685709924
the weedgrown rocks along Sandymount shore and, last but not least, on	 99.11350912299456
the quiet church whence there streamed forth at times upon the	 101.91824542248433
stillness the voice of prayer to her who is in her pure radiance a	 56.957468608516294
beacon ever to the stormtossed heart of man, Mary, star of the sea.	 66.790176545941
The three girl friends were seated on the rocks, enjoying the evening	 62.430785804038685
scene and the air which was fresh but not too chilly. Many a time and	 151.09340496702737
oft were they wont to come there to that favourite nook to have a cosy	 34.989373816931334
chat beside the sparkling waves and discuss matters feminine, Cissy	 68.9229125257619
Caffrey and Edy Boardman with the baby in the pushcar and Tommy and	 66.58441914623108
Jacky Caffrey, two little curlyheaded boys, dressed in sailor suits	 169.90641147337826
with caps to match and the name _H. M. S. Belleisle_ printed on both.	 72.29487913413088
For Tommy and Jacky Caffrey were twins, scarce four years old and very	 61.390841749413255
noisy and spoiled twins sometimes but for all that darling little	 68.55682446219333
fellows with bright merry faces and endearing ways about them. They	 157.23832597874159
were dabbling in the sand with their spades and buckets, building	 61.37964670147522
castles as children do, or playing with their big coloured ball, happy	 188.8193224387529
as the day was long. And Edy Boardman was rocking the chubby baby to	 67.62844966735709
and fro in the pushcar while that young gentleman fairly chuckled with	 45.11839258591077
delight. He was but eleven months and nine days old and, though still a	 108.13430013688534
tiny toddler, was just beginning to lisp his first babyish words. Cissy	 64.6946427462565
Caffrey bent over to him to tease his fat little plucks and the dainty	 67.23244955473972
dimple in his chin.	 26.722218824618345
—Now, baby, Cissy Caffrey said. Say out big, big. I want a drink of	 107.37741787607433
water.	 1912.4591522108665
And baby prattled after her:	 103.57553308187735
—A jink a jink a jawbo.	 13.627550819405567
Cissy Caffrey cuddled the wee chap for she was awfully fond of	 47.60760826564222
children, so patient with little sufferers and Tommy Caffrey could	 61.002252639148466
never be got to take his castor oil unless it was Cissy Caffrey that	 72.93667107105088
held his nose and promised him the scatty heel of the loaf or brown	 85.50322546656312
bread with golden syrup on. What a persuasive power that girl had! But	 112.81605558046225
to be sure baby Boardman was as good as gold, a perfect little dote in	 30.692408242335823
his new fancy bib. None of your spoilt beauties, Flora MacFlimsy sort,	 47.83704449706
was Cissy Caffrey. A truerhearted lass never drew the breath of life,	 55.439647029198575
always with a laugh in her gipsylike eyes and a frolicsome word on her	 55.11033168034023
cherryripe red lips, a girl lovable in the extreme. And Edy Boardman	 29.34248030167281
laughed too at the quaint language of little brother.	 116.38596996653048
But just then there was a slight altercation between Master Tommy and	 76.90368297524967
Master Jacky. Boys will be boys and our two twins were no exception to	 69.1642944108584
this golden rule. The apple of discord was a certain castle of sand	 93.17223892846145
which Master Jacky had built and Master Tommy would have it right go	 82.3676177958476
wrong that it was to be architecturally improved by a frontdoor like	 39.49145446525187
the Martello tower had. But if Master Tommy was headstrong Master Jacky	 85.11237054634046
was selfwilled too and, true to the maxim that every little Irishman’s	 46.214410380360384
house is his castle, he fell upon his hated rival and to such purpose	 67.83656938696939
that the wouldbe assailant came to grief and (alas to relate!) the	 31.521476624852003
coveted castle too. Needless to say the cries of discomfited Master	 58.40359970773252
Tommy drew the attention of the girl friends.	 99.50487195641044
—Come here, Tommy, his sister called imperatively. At once! And you,	 135.32882899525276
Jacky, for shame to throw poor Tommy in the dirty sand. Wait till I	 88.55947221023638
catch you for that.	 157.63646898771444
His eyes misty with unshed tears Master Tommy came at her call for	 86.19185025996228
their big sister’s word was law with the twins. And in a sad plight he	 84.23679237025434
was too after his misadventure. His little man-o’-war top and	 90.7649438208325
unmentionables were full of sand but Cissy was a past mistress in the	 59.67291835373346
art of smoothing over life’s tiny troubles and very quickly not one	 118.86452254133755
speck of sand was to be seen on his smart little suit. Still the blue	 121.86999338936491
eyes were glistening with hot tears that would well up so she kissed	 117.6178049740506
away the hurtness and shook her hand at Master Jacky the culprit and	 55.074713413421904
said if she was near him she wouldn’t be far from him, her eyes dancing	 99.99617920236108
in admonition.	 25.877283914292452
—Nasty bold Jacky! she cried.	 320.3270594168735
She put an arm round the little mariner and coaxed winningly:	 31.92428100868229
—What’s your name? Butter and cream?	 110.39365762096621
—Tell us who is your sweetheart, spoke Edy Boardman. Is Cissy your	 138.3101843782778
sweetheart?	 9224.21279475977
—Nao, tearful Tommy said.	 25.780378271260012
—Is Edy Boardman your sweetheart? Cissy queried.	 183.0986282770941
—Nao, Tommy said.	 43.81966846429954
—I know, Edy Boardman said none too amiably with an arch glance from	 50.133633026823475
her shortsighted eyes. I know who is Tommy’s sweetheart. Gerty is	 68.26261154285837
Tommy’s sweetheart.	 192.2574474684794
—Nao, Tommy said on the verge of tears.	 30.325651341749914
Cissy’s quick motherwit guessed what was amiss and she whispered to Edy	 56.57754535764438
Boardman to take him there behind the pushcar where the gentleman	 142.04421547871945
couldn’t see and to mind he didn’t wet his new tan shoes.	 71.86119372386942
But who was Gerty?	 127.11141253037145
Gerty MacDowell who was seated near her companions, lost in thought,	 120.52036441077216
gazing far away into the distance was, in very truth, as fair a	 55.06975843753613
specimen of winsome Irish girlhood as one could wish to see. She was	 56.26088514643952
pronounced beautiful by all who knew her though, as folks often said,	 197.3468658812687
she was more a Giltrap than a MacDowell. Her figure was slight and	 143.15425508230746
graceful, inclining even to fragility but those iron jelloids she had	 96.98654250259385
been taking of late had done her a world of good much better than the	 272.41140694584726
Widow Welch’s female pills and she was much better of those discharges	 128.1085284733263
she used to get and that tired feeling. The waxen pallor of her face	 26.231107435712683
was almost spiritual in its ivorylike purity though her rosebud mouth	 72.0999730302703
was a genuine Cupid’s bow, Greekly perfect. Her hands were of finely	 73.24070182680082
veined alabaster with tapering fingers and as white as lemonjuice and	 28.25532249723509
queen of ointments could make them though it was not true that she used	 63.512677098057615
to wear kid gloves in bed or take a milk footbath either. Bertha Supple	 87.35069013394663
told that once to Edy Boardman, a deliberate lie, when she was black	 97.95268372523033
out at daggers drawn with Gerty (the girl chums had of course their	 204.08082374056164
little tiffs from time to time like the rest of mortals) and she told	 56.586336870861324
her not to let on whatever she did that it was her that told her or	 111.62565251226803
she’d never speak to her again. No. Honour where honour is due. There	 128.67935833277872
was an innate refinement, a languid queenly _hauteur_ about Gerty which	 40.70212589181949
was unmistakably evidenced in her delicate hands and higharched instep.	 23.883462316341035
Had kind fate but willed her to be born a gentlewoman of high degree in	 62.1140540901666
her own right and had she only received the benefit of a good education	 65.92591794646692
Gerty MacDowell might easily have held her own beside any lady in the	 44.762248025250884
land and have seen herself exquisitely gowned with jewels on her brow	 51.417543901444354
and patrician suitors at her feet vying with one another to pay their	 47.58457536814535
devoirs to her. Mayhap it was this, the love that might have been, that	 44.96085479345656
lent to her softlyfeatured face at whiles a look, tense with suppressed	 98.1870926100372
meaning, that imparted a strange yearning tendency to the beautiful	 67.45214430342781
eyes, a charm few could resist. Why have women such eyes of witchery?	 195.5535749609566
Gerty’s were of the bluest Irish blue, set off by lustrous lashes and	 68.81127146008099
dark expressive brows. Time was when those brows were not so silkily	 138.11673235641916
seductive. It was Madame Vera Verity, directress of the Woman Beautiful	 28.717642917154752
page of the Princess Novelette, who had first advised her to try	 54.04326191031339
eyebrowleine which gave that haunting expression to the eyes, so	 52.026573510130376
becoming in leaders of fashion, and she had never regretted it. Then	 34.304245294128776
there was blushing scientifically cured and how to be tall increase	 81.70359721603558
your height and you have a beautiful face but your nose? That would	 103.24175614817389
suit Mrs Dignam because she had a button one. But Gerty’s crowning	 89.71907583920567
glory was her wealth of wonderful hair. It was dark brown with a	 91.9458070248137
natural wave in it. She had cut it that very morning on account of the	 83.53792756188602
new moon and it nestled about her pretty head in a profusion of	 36.33861807430417
luxuriant clusters and pared her nails too, Thursday for wealth. And	 32.701645739284714
just now at Edy’s words as a telltale flush, delicate as the faintest	 54.15162643054047
rosebloom, crept into her cheeks she looked so lovely in her sweet	 62.64601881501355
girlish shyness that of a surety God’s fair land of Ireland did not	 51.07782936003448
hold her equal.	 307.8931643399133
For an instant she was silent with rather sad downcast eyes. She was	 50.370195678982945
about to retort but something checked the words on her tongue.	 74.53774198131285
Inclination prompted her to speak out: dignity told her to be silent.	 61.02200336522857
The pretty lips pouted awhile but then she glanced up and broke out	 103.55225751226935
into a joyous little laugh which had in it all the freshness of a young	 53.88546376114465
May morning. She knew right well, no-one better, what made squinty Edy	 227.2908696697674
say that because of him cooling in his attentions when it was simply a	 51.98381292362663
lovers’ quarrel. As per usual somebody’s nose was out of joint about	 36.50186180110266
the boy that had the bicycle off the London bridge road always riding	 112.07455805976386
up and down in front of her window. Only now his father kept him in in	 117.9171762038988
the evenings studying hard to get an exhibition in the intermediate	 44.65999501086136
that was on and he was going to go to Trinity college to study for a	 41.17741190451099
doctor when he left the high school like his brother W. E. Wylie who	 79.08487493804887
was racing in the bicycle races in Trinity college university. Little	 67.09896737818825
recked he perhaps for what she felt, that dull aching void in her heart	 70.75990651565942
sometimes, piercing to the core. Yet he was young and perchance he	 51.99578311690107
might learn to love her in time. They were protestants in his family	 68.65869129437611
and of course Gerty knew Who came first and after Him the Blessed	 97.17059424669469
Virgin and then Saint Joseph. But he was undeniably handsome with an	 128.09997051187042
exquisite nose and he was what he looked, every inch a gentleman, the	 135.65382725084427
shape of his head too at the back without his cap on that she would	 95.13664089682848
know anywhere something off the common and the way he turned the	 116.92499514735778
bicycle at the lamp with his hands off the bars and also the nice	 79.33597721104461
perfume of those good cigarettes and besides they were both of a size	 85.39113190755862
too he and she and that was why Edy Boardman thought she was so	 63.44436941892979
frightfully clever because he didn’t go and ride up and down in front	 71.14136839360533
of her bit of a garden.	 84.07522038789304
Gerty was dressed simply but with the instinctive taste of a votary of	 74.45423114639637
Dame Fashion for she felt that there was just a might that he might be	 71.29834356518323
out. A neat blouse of electric blue selftinted by dolly dyes (because	 69.74694336079094
it was expected in the _Lady’s Pictorial_ that electric blue would be	 35.42268970426944
worn) with a smart vee opening down to the division and kerchief pocket	 41.030711002005205
(in which she always kept a piece of cottonwool scented with her	 73.37013420253238
favourite perfume because the handkerchief spoiled the sit) and a navy	 252.07784157965781
threequarter skirt cut to the stride showed off her slim graceful	 92.34055649076731
figure to perfection. She wore a coquettish little love of a hat of	 74.83021818990063
wideleaved nigger straw contrast trimmed with an underbrim of eggblue	 12.128637768656544
chenille and at the side a butterfly bow of silk to tone. All Tuesday	 77.26996953631541
