week afternoon she was hunting to match that chenille but at last she	 85.5450310292514
found what she wanted at Clery’s summer sales, the very it, slightly	 449.04197871313465
shopsoiled but you would never notice, seven fingers two and a penny.	 84.32001186272836
She did it up all by herself and what joy was hers when she tried it on	 62.701846561233246
then, smiling at the lovely reflection which the mirror gave back to	 114.27220135183346
her! And when she put it on the waterjug to keep the shape she knew	 49.36921134601298
that that would take the shine out of some people she knew. Her shoes	 40.38927386190782
were the newest thing in footwear (Edy Boardman prided herself that she	 68.68123525564779
was very _petite_ but she never had a foot like Gerty MacDowell, a	 65.4398060456155
five, and never would ash, oak or elm) with patent toecaps and just one	 103.97392024368672
smart buckle over her higharched instep. Her wellturned ankle displayed	 24.914340848619275
its perfect proportions beneath her skirt and just the proper amount	 88.34823630662771
and no more of her shapely limbs encased in finespun hose with	 34.48112359195211
highspliced heels and wide garter tops. As for undies they were Gerty’s	 74.76689133503803
chief care and who that knows the fluttering hopes and fears of sweet	 107.56822745669574
seventeen (though Gerty would never see seventeen again) can find it in	 113.5652055434299
his heart to blame her? She had four dinky sets with awfully pretty	 70.78912400849742
stitchery, three garments and nighties extra, and each set slotted with	 47.752613139307094
different coloured ribbons, rosepink, pale blue, mauve and peagreen,	 59.41136224903698
and she aired them herself and blued them when they came home from the	 43.86968792699983
wash and ironed them and she had a brickbat to keep the iron on because	 70.83069559659171
she wouldn’t trust those washerwomen as far as she’d see them scorching	 43.34944021901931
the things. She was wearing the blue for luck, hoping against hope, her	 148.08593702322943
own colour and lucky too for a bride to have a bit of blue somewhere on	 126.42841780460583
her because the green she wore that day week brought grief because his	 151.81130480483074
father brought him in to study for the intermediate exhibition and	 56.00607320991222
because she thought perhaps he might be out because when she was	 44.130315620227016
dressing that morning she nearly slipped up the old pair on her inside	 115.90102948575557
out and that was for luck and lovers’ meeting if you put those things	 73.62886495469007
on inside out or if they got untied that he was thinking about you so	 113.06691318391249
long as it wasn’t of a Friday.	 103.77982854214362
And yet and yet! That strained look on her face! A gnawing sorrow is	 57.635934817496235
there all the time. Her very soul is in her eyes and she would give	 51.736315274750844
worlds to be in the privacy of her own familiar chamber where, giving	 43.376555148847
way to tears, she could have a good cry and relieve her pentup feelings	 67.57182945846645
though not too much because she knew how to cry nicely before the	 50.25487454855535
mirror. You are lovely, Gerty, it said. The paly light of evening falls	 219.81718484588026
upon a face infinitely sad and wistful. Gerty MacDowell yearns in vain.	 79.1742449568721
Yes, she had known from the very first that her daydream of a marriage	 112.42018833432653
has been arranged and the weddingbells ringing for Mrs Reggy Wylie T.	 49.30270685960327
C. D. (because the one who married the elder brother would be Mrs	 213.50176724369297
Wylie) and in the fashionable intelligence Mrs Gertrude Wylie was	 61.93990984595128
wearing a sumptuous confection of grey trimmed with expensive blue fox	 43.872742191695025
was not to be. He was too young to understand. He would not believe in	 72.98227262098384
love, a woman’s birthright. The night of the party long ago in Stoer’s	 50.97985675299845
(he was still in short trousers) when they were alone and he stole an	 57.29464612751673
arm round her waist she went white to the very lips. He called her	 121.91011268959755
little one in a strangely husky voice and snatched a half kiss (the	 59.343681970534185
first!) but it was only the end of her nose and then he hastened from	 43.732566452291195
the room with a remark about refreshments. Impetuous fellow! Strength	 93.7743978203328
of character had never been Reggy Wylie’s strong point and he who would	 125.19843151229568
woo and win Gerty MacDowell must be a man among men. But waiting,	 94.62658116730742
always waiting to be asked and it was leap year too and would soon be	 81.74987161739058
over. No prince charming is her beau ideal to lay a rare and wondrous	 194.19537143481364
love at her feet but rather a manly man with a strong quiet face who	 91.37087410185926
had not found his ideal, perhaps his hair slightly flecked with grey,	 150.35395878294403
and who would understand, take her in his sheltering arms, strain her	 54.618216018987575
to him in all the strength of his deep passionate nature and comfort	 94.88196199880531
her with a long long kiss. It would be like heaven. For such a one she	 78.20976436588641
yearns this balmy summer eve. With all the heart of her she longs to be	 36.90560693043616
his only, his affianced bride for riches for poor, in sickness in	 129.61890378572866
health, till death us two part, from this to this day forward.	 425.3957811208013
And while Edy Boardman was with little Tommy behind the pushcar she was	 54.87360168386564
just thinking would the day ever come when she could call herself his	 152.1387980575085
little wife to be. Then they could talk about her till they went blue	 98.83537498323494
in the face, Bertha Supple too, and Edy, little spitfire, because she	 52.212397294152915
would be twentytwo in November. She would care for him with creature	 43.90347413002874
comforts too for Gerty was womanly wise and knew that a mere man liked	 95.45620728678615
that feeling of hominess. Her griddlecakes done to a goldenbrown hue	 75.77200079421137
and queen Ann’s pudding of delightful creaminess had won golden	 48.04892819817071
opinions from all because she had a lucky hand also for lighting a	 45.64750353975724
fire, dredge in the fine selfraising flour and always stir in the same	 42.768314040607166
direction, then cream the milk and sugar and whisk well the white of	 98.04856092309207
eggs though she didn’t like the eating part when there were any people	 124.31620775770486
that made her shy and often she wondered why you couldn’t eat something	 103.23791495820055
poetical like violets or roses and they would have a beautifully	 65.97511578714669
appointed drawingroom with pictures and engravings and the photograph	 13.659853979076095
of grandpapa Giltrap’s lovely dog Garryowen that almost talked it was	 43.98962454925037
so human and chintz covers for the chairs and that silver toastrack in	 85.20959334314489
Clery’s summer jumble sales like they have in rich houses. He would be	 77.02743386005768
tall with broad shoulders (she had always admired tall men for a	 188.04788492701172
husband) with glistening white teeth under his carefully trimmed	 90.73070730798139
sweeping moustache and they would go on the continent for their	 37.304682678378796
honeymoon (three wonderful weeks!) and then, when they settled down in	 58.2187074847252
a nice snug and cosy little homely house, every morning they would both	 94.2902944159998
have brekky, simple but perfectly served, for their own two selves and	 135.91406967117783
before he went out to business he would give his dear little wifey a	 84.02521419667738
good hearty hug and gaze for a moment deep down into her eyes.	 62.16934517775575
Edy Boardman asked Tommy Caffrey was he done and he said yes so then	 59.89838403252253
she buttoned up his little knickerbockers for him and told him to run	 51.09136250084725
off and play with Jacky and to be good now and not to fight. But Tommy	 122.71411652824132
said he wanted the ball and Edy told him no that baby was playing with	 60.63107127583223
the ball and if he took it there’d be wigs on the green but Tommy said	 50.88499099133576
it was his ball and he wanted his ball and he pranced on the ground, if	 40.0647939274517
you please. The temper of him! O, he was a man already was little Tommy	 66.99630001678611
Caffrey since he was out of pinnies. Edy told him no, no and to be off	 78.82275784011235
now with him and she told Cissy Caffrey not to give in to him.	 77.21982209475071
—You’re not my sister, naughty Tommy said. It’s my ball.	 100.86702570939275
But Cissy Caffrey told baby Boardman to look up, look up high at her	 75.40958683919767
finger and she snatched the ball quickly and threw it along the sand	 65.37708800179686
and Tommy after it in full career, having won the day.	 114.8145384367528
—Anything for a quiet life, laughed Ciss.	 238.93195721917706
And she tickled tiny tot’s two cheeks to make him forget and played	 108.36438063983789
here’s the lord mayor, here’s his two horses, here’s his gingerbread	 54.53509278429355
carriage and here he walks in, chinchopper, chinchopper, chinchopper	 49.20634457418545
chin. But Edy got as cross as two sticks about him getting his own way	 117.77683642027642
like that from everyone always petting him.	 86.63452608210694
—I’d like to give him something, she said, so I would, where I won’t	 104.56664886577535
say.	 957.1327818468302
—On the beeoteetom, laughed Cissy merrily.	 80.85560382790045
Gerty MacDowell bent down her head and crimsoned at the idea of Cissy	 59.03235537224311
saying an unladylike thing like that out loud she’d be ashamed of her	 90.76983798411891
life to say, flushing a deep rosy red, and Edy Boardman said she was	 55.365056778803165
sure the gentleman opposite heard what she said. But not a pin cared	 104.16271119199224
Ciss.	 16894.802131706583
—Let him! she said with a pert toss of her head and a piquant tilt of	 23.159392809696723
her nose. Give it to him too on the same place as quick as I’d look at	 39.91127936079007
him.	 330.5397417229756
Madcap Ciss with her golliwog curls. You had to laugh at her sometimes.	 77.22155020656375
For instance when she asked you would you have some more Chinese tea	 47.10271825358244
and jaspberry ram and when she drew the jugs too and the men’s faces on	 34.68209074711896
her nails with red ink make you split your sides or when she wanted to	 89.38233217936299
go where you know she said she wanted to run and pay a visit to the	 65.1444022940276
Miss White. That was just like Cissycums. O, and will you ever forget	 93.29156928222642
her the evening she dressed up in her father’s suit and hat and the	 96.66676832721996
burned cork moustache and walked down Tritonville road, smoking a	 89.04861341321354
cigarette. There was none to come up to her for fun. But she was	 62.04985691947795
sincerity itself, one of the bravest and truest hearts heaven ever	 38.2305651495593
made, not one of your twofaced things, too sweet to be wholesome.	 99.999015454465
And then there came out upon the air the sound of voices and the	 50.52337095528036
pealing anthem of the organ. It was the men’s temperance retreat	 22.051836888370246
conducted by the missioner, the reverend John Hughes S. J., rosary,	 10.067572223955196
sermon and benediction of the Most Blessed Sacrament. They were there	 21.32999447069697
gathered together without distinction of social class (and a most	 67.81361739927912
edifying spectacle it was to see) in that simple fane beside the waves,	 50.730848447583995
after the storms of this weary world, kneeling before the feet of the	 35.458050460041626
immaculate, reciting the litany of Our Lady of Loreto, beseeching her	 12.990656187801553
to intercede for them, the old familiar words, holy Mary, holy virgin	 112.48654279221728
of virgins. How sad to poor Gerty’s ears! Had her father only avoided	 130.27746621344113
the clutches of the demon drink, by taking the pledge or those powders	 28.473802692003456
the drink habit cured in Pearson’s Weekly, she might now be rolling in	 102.46975968269116
her carriage, second to none. Over and over had she told herself that	 151.08562239380157
as she mused by the dying embers in a brown study without the lamp	 96.41113241798254
because she hated two lights or oftentimes gazing out of the window	 55.76020372889593
dreamily by the hour at the rain falling on the rusty bucket, thinking.	 57.95499624349803
But that vile decoction which has ruined so many hearths and homes had	 42.64363185753994
cast its shadow over her childhood days. Nay, she had even witnessed in	 82.43703218153671
the home circle deeds of violence caused by intemperance and had seen	 42.507279927602205
her own father, a prey to the fumes of intoxication, forget himself	 83.34113294333054
completely for if there was one thing of all things that Gerty knew it	 43.1874616260629
was that the man who lifts his hand to a woman save in the way of	 44.574235629579675
kindness, deserves to be branded as the lowest of the low.	 50.26999860124947
And still the voices sang in supplication to the Virgin most powerful,	 103.05239702626446
Virgin most merciful. And Gerty, rapt in thought, scarce saw or heard	 263.2202756169525
her companions or the twins at their boyish gambols or the gentleman	 46.531040645971494
off Sandymount green that Cissy Caffrey called the man that was so like	 42.40440545150675
himself passing along the strand taking a short walk. You never saw him	 71.24959282898074
any way screwed but still and for all that she would not like him for a	 72.90427722242947
father because he was too old or something or on account of his face	 69.55930530291106
(it was a palpable case of Doctor Fell) or his carbuncly nose with the	 48.976204800800986
pimples on it and his sandy moustache a bit white under his nose. Poor	 98.31383240919702
father! With all his faults she loved him still when he sang _Tell me,	 120.60376963327604
Mary, how to woo thee_ or _My love and cottage near Rochelle_ and they	 124.5801121396547
had stewed cockles and lettuce with Lazenby’s salad dressing for supper	 75.78548998852435
and when he sang _The moon hath raised_ with Mr Dignam that died	 93.8220812415798
suddenly and was buried, God have mercy on him, from a stroke. Her	 121.73366482429847
mother’s birthday that was and Charley was home on his holidays and Tom	 106.93795964866267
and Mr Dignam and Mrs and Patsy and Freddy Dignam and they were to have	 63.84925893482599
had a group taken. No-one would have thought the end was so near. Now	 113.23354564209014
he was laid to rest. And her mother said to him to let that be a	 78.33679416891044
warning to him for the rest of his days and he couldn’t even go to the	 41.387257613308755
funeral on account of the gout and she had to go into town to bring him	 42.71966500041742
the letters and samples from his office about Catesby’s cork lino,	 63.88486422959986
artistic, standard designs, fit for a palace, gives tiptop wear and	 76.69355023612778
always bright and cheery in the home.	 76.45040396975737
A sterling good daughter was Gerty just like a second mother in the	 82.12455981382016
house, a ministering angel too with a little heart worth its weight in	 91.69110037419244
gold. And when her mother had those raging splitting headaches who was	 100.57425070272211
it rubbed the menthol cone on her forehead but Gerty though she didn’t	 37.497074739479686
like her mother’s taking pinches of snuff and that was the only single	 64.39542647434665
thing they ever had words about, taking snuff. Everyone thought the	 358.12983344555414
world of her for her gentle ways. It was Gerty who turned off the gas	 147.24936636551885
at the main every night and it was Gerty who tacked up on the wall of	 40.59748081497826
that place where she never forgot every fortnight the chlorate of lime	 58.0184683744417
Mr Tunney the grocer’s christmas almanac, the picture of halcyon days	 21.673895736326926
where a young gentleman in the costume they used to wear then with a	 70.33594612395817
threecornered hat was offering a bunch of flowers to his ladylove with	 41.929737744621534
oldtime chivalry through her lattice window. You could see there was a	 39.81102551386232
story behind it. The colours were done something lovely. She was in a	 152.00686833622072
soft clinging white in a studied attitude and the gentleman was in	 117.67627502589733
chocolate and he looked a thorough aristocrat. She often looked at them	 51.46351365751933
dreamily when she went there for a certain purpose and felt her own	 50.7218225013001
arms that were white and soft just like hers with the sleeves back and	 101.00820833867851
thought about those times because she had found out in Walker’s	 49.996230313522666
pronouncing dictionary that belonged to grandpapa Giltrap about the	 15.409966682808971
halcyon days what they meant.	 77.201592069797
The twins were now playing in the most approved brotherly fashion till	 39.15199362892063
at last Master Jacky who was really as bold as brass there was no	 97.39161190688951
getting behind that deliberately kicked the ball as hard as ever he	 114.2390424214355
could down towards the seaweedy rocks. Needless to say poor Tommy was	 97.52746995282367
not slow to voice his dismay but luckily the gentleman in black who was	 89.25029354722318
sitting there by himself came gallantly to the rescue and intercepted	 68.98195081902111
the ball. Our two champions claimed their plaything with lusty cries	 53.164321964653944
and to avoid trouble Cissy Caffrey called to the gentleman to throw it	 44.036303530858675
to her please. The gentleman aimed the ball once or twice and then	 86.1069112281366
threw it up the strand towards Cissy Caffrey but it rolled down the	 83.0324102766554
slope and stopped right under Gerty’s skirt near the little pool by the	 57.59004376023578
rock. The twins clamoured again for it and Cissy told her to kick it	 101.94085888682517
away and let them fight for it so Gerty drew back her foot but she	 127.15136452073861
wished their stupid ball hadn’t come rolling down to her and she gave a	 92.9425149756253
kick but she missed and Edy and Cissy laughed.	 207.6209193377313
—If you fail try again, Edy Boardman said.	 53.23484490294512
Gerty smiled assent and bit her lip. A delicate pink crept into her	 151.92828291486936
pretty cheek but she was determined to let them see so she just lifted	 69.64583200558971
her skirt a little but just enough and took good aim and gave the ball	 122.97962041118483
a jolly good kick and it went ever so far and the two twins after it	 64.32651487755224
down towards the shingle. Pure jealousy of course it was nothing else	 39.093868569002794
to draw attention on account of the gentleman opposite looking. She	 45.93726851505272
felt the warm flush, a danger signal always with Gerty MacDowell,	 108.62657771688497
surging and flaming into her cheeks. Till then they had only exchanged	 75.93910896665756
glances of the most casual but now under the brim of her new hat she	 46.66710004722222
ventured a look at him and the face that met her gaze there in the	 54.16140931244894
twilight, wan and strangely drawn, seemed to her the saddest she had	 46.85591455375753
ever seen.	 182.31643410494803
Through the open window of the church the fragrant incense was wafted	 53.02211964395807
and with it the fragrant names of her who was conceived without stain	 68.926165928022
of original sin, spiritual vessel, pray for us, honourable vessel, pray	 51.64032915737231
for us, vessel of singular devotion, pray for us, mystical rose. And	 33.326675238047756
careworn hearts were there and toilers for their daily bread and many	 91.65083440018144
who had erred and wandered, their eyes wet with contrition but for all	 65.18687555135403
that bright with hope for the reverend father Father Hughes had told	 122.74404717840828
them what the great saint Bernard said in his famous prayer of Mary,	 117.64431464329945
the most pious Virgin’s intercessory power that it was not recorded in	 40.97981524934662
any age that those who implored her powerful protection were ever	 110.98072717296803
abandoned by her.	 35.4838219342301
The twins were now playing again right merrily for the troubles of	 51.91801938196242
childhood are but as fleeting summer showers. Cissy Caffrey played with	 146.23365366975975
baby Boardman till he crowed with glee, clapping baby hands in air.	 106.29001939074224
Peep she cried behind the hood of the pushcar and Edy asked where was	 57.389823764861326
Cissy gone and then Cissy popped up her head and cried ah! and, my	 194.19696502266768
word, didn’t the little chap enjoy that! And then she told him to say	 103.4012616436172
papa.	 22803.36024805148
—Say papa, baby. Say pa pa pa pa pa pa pa.	 9.249694223702162
And baby did his level best to say it for he was very intelligent for	 57.496171820330524
eleven months everyone said and big for his age and the picture of	 85.18144080105398
health, a perfect little bunch of love, and he would certainly turn out	 49.99818276925968
to be something great, they said.	 163.80993149606073
—Haja ja ja haja.	 4.045570071155129
Cissy wiped his little mouth with the dribbling bib and wanted him to	 71.99182705217615
sit up properly and say pa pa pa but when she undid the strap she cried	 62.00518002120427
out, holy saint Denis, that he was possing wet and to double the half	 127.95665023508981
blanket the other way under him. Of course his infant majesty was most	 111.62786730092047
obstreperous at such toilet formalities and he let everyone know it:	 56.30396099190609
—Habaa baaaahabaaa baaaa.	 4.206040932916629
And two great big lovely big tears coursing down his cheeks. It was all	 104.88073890548925
no use soothering him with no, nono, baby, no and telling him about the	 109.48422034771978
geegee and where was the puffpuff but Ciss, always readywitted, gave	 59.19496590977601
him in his mouth the teat of the suckingbottle and the young heathen	 17.22785423720452
was quickly appeased.	 201.68145779941057
Gerty wished to goodness they would take their squalling baby home out	 133.45508183300706
of that and not get on her nerves, no hour to be out, and the little	 92.6693652297352
brats of twins. She gazed out towards the distant sea. It was like the	 48.20130698479387
paintings that man used to do on the pavement with all the coloured	 31.312942575127437
chalks and such a pity too leaving them there to be all blotted out,	 67.18171154744026
the evening and the clouds coming out and the Bailey light on Howth and	 55.56975035711231
to hear the music like that and the perfume of those incense they	 62.396878829792115
burned in the church like a kind of waft. And while she gazed her heart	 56.53911740393611
went pitapat. Yes, it was her he was looking at, and there was meaning	 114.19384517373122
in his look. His eyes burned into her as though they would search her	 70.70574722393884
through and through, read her very soul. Wonderful eyes they were,	 217.4438289094953
superbly expressive, but could you trust them? People were so queer.	 68.21184002174296
She could see at once by his dark eyes and his pale intellectual face	 63.28590135773724
that he was a foreigner, the image of the photo she had of Martin	 52.63083771831419
Harvey, the matinee idol, only for the moustache which she preferred	 26.809808554257124
because she wasn’t stagestruck like Winny Rippingham that wanted they	 55.880733600444586
two to always dress the same on account of a play but she could not see	 76.09868559384734
whether he had an aquiline nose or a slightly _retroussé_ from where he	 80.29057456801785
was sitting. He was in deep mourning, she could see that, and the story	 76.87577264491914
of a haunting sorrow was written on his face. She would have given	 41.1659580378612
worlds to know what it was. He was looking up so intently, so still,	 58.217779688570666
and he saw her kick the ball and perhaps he could see the bright steel	 65.87772024522319
buckles of her shoes if she swung them like that thoughtfully with the	 42.908945880654215
toes down. She was glad that something told her to put on the	 56.44544035910943
transparent stockings thinking Reggy Wylie might be out but that was	 45.337312361204646
far away. Here was that of which she had so often dreamed. It was he	 75.1870026414738
who mattered and there was joy on her face because she wanted him	 39.71150720263979
because she felt instinctively that he was like no-one else. The very	 61.03545053532583
heart of the girlwoman went out to him, her dreamhusband, because she	 37.07107917852633
knew on the instant it was him. If he had suffered, more sinned against	 71.94397878768858
than sinning, or even, even, if he had been himself a sinner, a wicked	 74.73352082315033
man, she cared not. Even if he was a protestant or methodist she could	 38.8229302064057
convert him easily if he truly loved her. There were wounds that wanted	 78.61545993994186
healing with heartbalm. She was a womanly woman not like other flighty	 38.42829047166588
girls unfeminine he had known, those cyclists showing off what they	 133.92795949113133
hadn’t got and she just yearned to know all, to forgive all if she	 165.0001384884218
could make him fall in love with her, make him forget the memory of the	 67.24094147231183
past. Then mayhap he would embrace her gently, like a real man,	 83.9052182341497
crushing her soft body to him, and love her, his ownest girlie, for	 61.84602693605006
herself alone.	 241.37325392480935
Refuge of sinners. Comfortress of the afflicted. _Ora pro nobis_. Well	 29.451875834797917
has it been said that whosoever prays to her with faith and constancy	 59.889280187599354
can never be lost or cast away: and fitly is she too a haven of refuge	 66.01443183451896
for the afflicted because of the seven dolours which transpierced her	 52.33838197962873
own heart. Gerty could picture the whole scene in the church, the	 52.6957407771212
stained glass windows lighted up, the candles, the flowers and the blue	 196.7382024993512
banners of the blessed Virgin’s sodality and Father Conroy was helping	 22.31964546216851
Canon O’Hanlon at the altar, carrying things in and out with his eyes	 60.37504542334259
cast down. He looked almost a saint and his confessionbox was so quiet	 224.44731134831056
and clean and dark and his hands were just like white wax and if ever	 98.81840502925276
she became a Dominican nun in their white habit perhaps he might come	 60.3391335724293
to the convent for the novena of Saint Dominic. He told her that time	 38.91454161082144
when she told him about that in confession, crimsoning up to the roots	 38.296950777110304
of her hair for fear he could see, not to be troubled because that was	 45.73296945216117
only the voice of nature and we were all subject to nature’s laws, he	 61.92073931141532
said, in this life and that that was no sin because that came from the	 66.40380020296067
nature of woman instituted by God, he said, and that Our Blessed Lady	 85.50146688475495
herself said to the archangel Gabriel be it done unto me according to	 74.5481997625964
Thy Word. He was so kind and holy and often and often she thought and	 121.50249641331595
thought could she work a ruched teacosy with embroidered floral design	 126.15117019810424
for him as a present or a clock but they had a clock she noticed on the	 71.70413912825441
mantelpiece white and gold with a canarybird that came out of a little	 62.82788438398974
house to tell the time the day she went there about the flowers for the	 88.34269243028166
forty hours’ adoration because it was hard to know what sort of a	 32.07545066622927
present to give or perhaps an album of illuminated views of Dublin or	 65.77836881197767
some place.	 478.5462088487664
The exasperating little brats of twins began to quarrel again and Jacky	 43.2148515777635
threw the ball out towards the sea and they both ran after it. Little	 120.05234809136536
monkeys common as ditchwater. Someone ought to take them and give them	 88.31686797078059
a good hiding for themselves to keep them in their places, the both of	 52.68162379853065
them. And Cissy and Edy shouted after them to come back because they	 92.99138748656549
were afraid the tide might come in on them and be drowned.	 158.63024864860148
—Jacky! Tommy!	 1072.1198770973697
Not they! What a great notion they had! So Cissy said it was the very	 100.12063521506242
last time she’d ever bring them out. She jumped up and called them and	 57.52336181653122
she ran down the slope past him, tossing her hair behind her which had	 63.4785781891201
a good enough colour if there had been more of it but with all the	 81.56266493192463
thingamerry she was always rubbing into it she couldn’t get it to grow	 48.118833793969934
long because it wasn’t natural so she could just go and throw her hat	 102.47905666649817
at it. She ran with long gandery strides it was a wonder she didn’t rip	 89.73037198070091
up her skirt at the side that was too tight on her because there was a	 55.04929526977403
lot of the tomboy about Cissy Caffrey and she was a forward piece	 64.72447189312325
whenever she thought she had a good opportunity to show off and just	 78.25831666611877
because she was a good runner she ran like that so that he could see	 35.46881788536343
all the end of her petticoat running and her skinny shanks up as far as	 30.321493148034175
possible. It would have served her just right if she had tripped up	 89.22427638597259
over something accidentally on purpose with her high crooked French	 138.78752461519755
heels on her to make her look tall and got a fine tumble. _Tableau!_	 61.30798082600357
That would have been a very charming exposé for a gentleman like that	 35.26049662217654
to witness.	 311.16091448327444
Queen of angels, queen of patriarchs, queen of prophets, of all saints,	 57.4143487951241
they prayed, queen of the most holy rosary and then Father Conroy	 45.92079539276616
handed the thurible to Canon O’Hanlon and he put in the incense and	 51.32122593290363
censed the Blessed Sacrament and Cissy Caffrey caught the two twins and	 15.624538398308994
she was itching to give them a ringing good clip on the ear but she	 62.823591200451396
didn’t because she thought he might be watching but she never made a	 94.01654214217147
bigger mistake in all her life because Gerty could see without looking	 73.92726863243242
that he never took his eyes off of her and then Canon O’Hanlon handed	 65.60765223824595
the thurible back to Father Conroy and knelt down looking up at the	 24.47645003630104
Blessed Sacrament and the choir began to sing the _Tantum ergo_ and she	 29.163445095697927
just swung her foot in and out in time as the music rose and fell to	 86.64946525780915
the _Tantumer gosa cramen tum_. Three and eleven she paid for those	 78.46364621021206
stockings in Sparrow’s of George’s street on the Tuesday, no the Monday	 159.04020094230629
before Easter and there wasn’t a brack on them and that was what he was	 45.92842396948882
looking at, transparent, and not at her insignificant ones that had	 125.23134715766417
neither shape nor form (the cheek of her!) because he had eyes in his	 118.16068473372292
head to see the difference for himself.	 104.73190780263228
Cissy came up along the strand with the two twins and their ball with	 70.83311543365696
her hat anyhow on her to one side after her run and she did look a	 82.9477343844488
streel tugging the two kids along with the flimsy blouse she bought	 45.6595622525103
only a fortnight before like a rag on her back and a bit of her	 62.48442162715912
petticoat hanging like a caricature. Gerty just took off her hat for a	 74.81878991102124
moment to settle her hair and a prettier, a daintier head of nutbrown	 41.727883354666076
tresses was never seen on a girl’s shoulders—a radiant little vision,	 56.930078160830874
in sooth, almost maddening in its sweetness. You would have to travel	 38.56284822699416
many a long mile before you found a head of hair the like of that. She	 100.91444062675247
could almost see the swift answering flash of admiration in his eyes	 76.9471623668179
that set her tingling in every nerve. She put on her hat so that she	 51.55352050182356
could see from underneath the brim and swung her buckled shoe faster	 43.28602820976616
for her breath caught as she caught the expression in his eyes. He was	 55.69752576510783
eying her as a snake eyes its prey. Her woman’s instinct told her that	 81.01503057789058
she had raised the devil in him and at the thought a burning scarlet	 136.55774043937672
swept from throat to brow till the lovely colour of her face became a	 153.04387489216222
glorious rose.	 586.1178537360807
Edy Boardman was noticing it too because she was squinting at Gerty,	 41.04205942867222
half smiling, with her specs like an old maid, pretending to nurse the	 116.76970814994115
baby. Irritable little gnat she was and always would be and that was	 80.67526264358905
why no-one could get on with her poking her nose into what was no	 121.29125205439692
concern of hers. And she said to Gerty:	 77.7890815817304
—A penny for your thoughts.	 95.98862852247218
—What? replied Gerty with a smile reinforced by the whitest of teeth. I	 76.42929890553582
was only wondering was it late.	 146.67597619596097
Because she wished to goodness they’d take the snottynosed twins and	 51.62494425924809
their babby home to the mischief out of that so that was why she just	 49.431497850121715
gave a gentle hint about its being late. And when Cissy came up Edy	 147.7997231814649
asked her the time and Miss Cissy, as glib as you like, said it was	 127.78066240947881
half past kissing time, time to kiss again. But Edy wanted to know	 92.52692734619595
because they were told to be in early.	 53.7313792238238
—Wait, said Cissy, I’ll run ask my uncle Peter over there what’s the	 189.49535892682434
time by his conundrum.	 79.15339441051961
So over she went and when he saw her coming she could see him take his	 101.83750345850096
hand out of his pocket, getting nervous, and beginning to play with his	 82.38306762476759
watchchain, looking up at the church. Passionate nature though he was	 44.129706254663624
Gerty could see that he had enormous control over himself. One moment	 53.140095089589735
he had been there, fascinated by a loveliness that made him gaze, and	 44.4559285335784
the next moment it was the quiet gravefaced gentleman, selfcontrol	 48.198184754233054
expressed in every line of his distinguishedlooking figure.	 124.41263573644211
Cissy said to excuse her would he mind please telling her what was the	 141.8942655205112
right time and Gerty could see him taking out his watch, listening to	 41.99984447103503
it and looking up and clearing his throat and he said he was very sorry	 36.571794368337464
his watch was stopped but he thought it must be after eight because the	 121.20324891671382
sun was set. His voice had a cultured ring in it and though he spoke in	 102.31823021686942
measured accents there was a suspicion of a quiver in the mellow tones.	 18.862413389365667
Cissy said thanks and came back with her tongue out and said uncle said	 122.45406190600094
his waterworks were out of order.	 108.68535120921358
Then they sang the second verse of the _Tantum ergo_ and Canon O’Hanlon	 27.70080856037943
got up again and censed the Blessed Sacrament and knelt down and he	 27.594902071380037
told Father Conroy that one of the candles was just going to set fire	 76.3636284865619
to the flowers and Father Conroy got up and settled it all right and	 41.03125614261912
she could see the gentleman winding his watch and listening to the	 52.96476695210606
works and she swung her leg more in and out in time. It was getting	 100.15626449572656
darker but he could see and he was looking all the time that he was	 54.79725094610195
winding the watch or whatever he was doing to it and then he put it	 63.52305170222002
back and put his hands back into his pockets. She felt a kind of a	 48.734203409813766
sensation rushing all over her and she knew by the feel of her scalp	 34.347561777056804
and that irritation against her stays that that thing must be coming on	 76.9433105609768
because the last time too was when she clipped her hair on account of	 43.229796536253616
the moon. His dark eyes fixed themselves on her again drinking in her	 55.357409506363226
every contour, literally worshipping at her shrine. If ever there was	 35.488187119921335
undisguised admiration in a man’s passionate gaze it was there plain to	 88.23852197974453
be seen on that man’s face. It is for you, Gertrude MacDowell, and you	 93.97270471097077
know it.	 250.71260652796792
Edy began to get ready to go and it was high time for her and Gerty	 45.16782279871263
noticed that that little hint she gave had had the desired effect	 161.617827955406
because it was a long way along the strand to where there was the place	 36.976367058523685
to push up the pushcar and Cissy took off the twins’ caps and tidied	 30.52466248089718
their hair to make herself attractive of course and Canon O’Hanlon	 67.865229771707
stood up with his cope poking up at his neck and Father Conroy handed	 23.250755973573387
him the card to read off and he read out _Panem de coelo praestitisti	 72.11495655280919
eis_ and Edy and Cissy were talking about the time all the time and	 49.774531840774216
asking her but Gerty could pay them back in their own coin and she just	 114.911499743034
answered with scathing politeness when Edy asked her was she	 129.12402669613817
heartbroken about her best boy throwing her over. Gerty winced sharply.	 185.28817592549063
A brief cold blaze shone from her eyes that spoke volumes of scorn	 98.20665689974106
immeasurable. It hurt—O yes, it cut deep because Edy had her own quiet	 127.9719208841171
way of saying things like that she knew would wound like the confounded	 71.84225955977628
little cat she was. Gerty’s lips parted swiftly to frame the word but	 103.88681826659223
she fought back the sob that rose to her throat, so slim, so flawless,	 93.8173692002721
so beautifully moulded it seemed one an artist might have dreamed of.	 145.9581230651912
She had loved him better than he knew. Lighthearted deceiver and fickle	 27.17768770067852
like all his sex he would never understand what he had meant to her and	 54.644183705551335
for an instant there was in the blue eyes a quick stinging of tears.	 53.42252587671078
Their eyes were probing her mercilessly but with a brave effort she	 35.82135335538621
sparkled back in sympathy as she glanced at her new conquest for them	 37.18873233177554
to see.	 85.99606903615606
—O, responded Gerty, quick as lightning, laughing, and the proud head	 138.59492591912334
flashed up. I can throw my cap at who I like because it’s leap year.	 108.26770545824371
Her words rang out crystalclear, more musical than the cooing of the	 32.65541177337268
ringdove, but they cut the silence icily. There was that in her young	 89.69167673625356
voice that told that she was not a one to be lightly trifled with. As	 114.3325306195256
for Mr Reggy with his swank and his bit of money she could just chuck	 93.98955974157981
him aside as if he was so much filth and never again would she cast as	 81.18261230832115
much as a second thought on him and tear his silly postcard into a	 90.97038235329384
dozen pieces. And if ever after he dared to presume she could give him	 70.66416636101003
one look of measured scorn that would make him shrivel up on the spot.	 103.37855766474742
Miss puny little Edy’s countenance fell to no slight extent and Gerty	 159.06990621421565
could see by her looking as black as thunder that she was simply in a	 71.46712393537798
towering rage though she hid it, the little kinnatt, because that shaft	 59.626823233986556
had struck home for her petty jealousy and they both knew that she was	 48.446917252475096
something aloof, apart, in another sphere, that she was not of them and	 89.38154925245347
never would be and there was somebody else too that knew it and saw it	 60.485782584524905
so they could put that in their pipe and smoke it.	 73.84710839690452
Edy straightened up baby Boardman to get ready to go and Cissy tucked	 55.06853123903399
in the ball and the spades and buckets and it was high time too because	 47.62574628449978
the sandman was on his way for Master Boardman junior. And Cissy told	 50.808490692793676
him too that billy winks was coming and that baby was to go deedaw and	 78.9056558911499
baby looked just too ducky, laughing up out of his gleeful eyes, and	 106.98767344696064
Cissy poked him like that out of fun in his wee fat tummy and baby,	 70.16255197752552
without as much as by your leave, sent up his compliments to all and	 84.00870368169744
sundry on to his brandnew dribbling bib.	 34.62573502324438
—O my! Puddeny pie! protested Ciss. He has his bib destroyed.	 88.63623460081855
The slight _contretemps_ claimed her attention but in two twos she set	 84.77739352018371
that little matter to rights.	 132.07221715691784
Gerty stifled a smothered exclamation and gave a nervous cough and Edy	 76.33578448059954
asked what and she was just going to tell her to catch it while it was	 45.72237155475594
flying but she was ever ladylike in her deportment so she simply passed	 143.37709336921316
it off with consummate tact by saying that that was the benediction	 40.03845919989487
because just then the bell rang out from the steeple over the quiet	 50.43579951790907
seashore because Canon O’Hanlon was up on the altar with the veil that	 39.914301316538584
Father Conroy put round his shoulders giving the benediction with the	 44.503814805402214
Blessed Sacrament in his hands.	 43.64058205782075
How moving the scene there in the gathering twilight, the last glimpse	 60.62321061524705
of Erin, the touching chime of those evening bells and at the same time	 68.08383454624226
a bat flew forth from the ivied belfry through the dusk, hither,	 23.1944486605961
thither, with a tiny lost cry. And she could see far away the lights of	 79.9924318392703
the lighthouses so picturesque she would have loved to do with a box of	 39.70062115614218
paints because it was easier than to make a man and soon the	 48.809996316944016
lamplighter would be going his rounds past the presbyterian church	 66.21676286873824
grounds and along by shady Tritonville avenue where the couples walked	 54.969794800775894
and lighting the lamp near her window where Reggy Wylie used to turn	 44.218473220354845
his freewheel like she read in that book _The Lamplighter_ by Miss	 80.56582914397131
Cummins, author of _Mabel Vaughan_ and other tales. For Gerty had her	 18.211889635031444
dreams that no-one knew of. She loved to read poetry and when she got a	 113.383319515725
keepsake from Bertha Supple of that lovely confession album with the	 42.66162341442822
coralpink cover to write her thoughts in she laid it in the drawer of	 82.78636856535734
her toilettable which, though it did not err on the side of luxury, was	 35.00696515603665
scrupulously neat and clean. It was there she kept her girlish treasure	 124.91522789378658
trove, the tortoiseshell combs, her child of Mary badge, the whiterose	 30.02223406692219
scent, the eyebrowleine, her alabaster pouncetbox and the ribbons to	 25.458828356264444
change when her things came home from the wash and there were some	 99.26313797137958
beautiful thoughts written in it in violet ink that she bought in	 147.73285530989293
Hely’s of Dame Street for she felt that she too could write poetry if	 113.23666448658646
she could only express herself like that poem that appealed to her so	 38.79307787721552
deeply that she had copied out of the newspaper she found one evening	 74.17110023249154
round the potherbs. _Art thou real, my ideal?_ it was called by Louis J	 123.50929566079839
Walsh, Magherafelt, and after there was something about _twilight, wilt	 50.737894226696945
thou ever?_ and ofttimes the beauty of poetry, so sad in its transient	 140.27421523086477
loveliness, had misted her eyes with silent tears for she felt that the	 53.96029926156264
years were slipping by for her, one by one, and but for that one	 131.85150938391865
shortcoming she knew she need fear no competition and that was an	 61.880815632512146
accident coming down Dalkey hill and she always tried to conceal it.	 91.4951939106406
But it must end, she felt. If she saw that magic lure in his eyes there	 53.904644823707955
would be no holding back for her. Love laughs at locksmiths. She would	 73.70694767970147
make the great sacrifice. Her every effort would be to share his	 94.06752930189863
thoughts. Dearer than the whole world would she be to him and gild his	 78.54785227623931
days with happiness. There was the allimportant question and she was	 74.66449537031374
dying to know was he a married man or a widower who had lost his wife	 103.44979424162032
or some tragedy like the nobleman with the foreign name from the land	 84.47502743874608
of song had to have her put into a madhouse, cruel only to be kind. But	 131.0571084324694
even if—what then? Would it make a very great difference? From	 104.2802915161237
everything in the least indelicate her finebred nature instinctively	 64.90070185220304
recoiled. She loathed that sort of person, the fallen women off the	 77.41352773009407
accommodation walk beside the Dodder that went with the soldiers and	 48.016841920311755
coarse men with no respect for a girl’s honour, degrading the sex and	 93.27534842008893
being taken up to the police station. No, no: not that. They would be	 53.046124835956284
just good friends like a big brother and sister without all that other	 147.21000626580124
in spite of the conventions of Society with a big ess. Perhaps it was	 34.629203148036
an old flame he was in mourning for from the days beyond recall. She	 63.06590428403786
thought she understood. She would try to understand him because men	 116.43589432491497
were so different. The old love was waiting, waiting with little white	 195.90469571351255
hands stretched out, with blue appealing eyes. Heart of mine! She would	 106.96459598056335
follow, her dream of love, the dictates of her heart that told her he	 66.02564712336259
was her all in all, the only man in all the world for her for love was	 73.4630376224428
the master guide. Nothing else mattered. Come what might she would be	 128.98454315276257
wild, untrammelled, free.	 513.1950520571415
Canon O’Hanlon put the Blessed Sacrament back into the tabernacle and	 28.197834754224438
genuflected and the choir sang _Laudate Dominum omnes gentes_ and then	 22.890909800326256
he locked the tabernacle door because the benediction was over and	 61.40340578462246
Father Conroy handed him his hat to put on and crosscat Edy asked	 45.404864268832256
wasn’t she coming but Jacky Caffrey called out:	 88.03079489522581
—O, look, Cissy!	 163.15134447126462
And they all looked was it sheet lightning but Tommy saw it too over	 154.91707057385773
the trees beside the church, blue and then green and purple.	 107.10701302492319
—It’s fireworks, Cissy Caffrey said.	 26.30467195724058
And they all ran down the strand to see over the houses and the church,	 55.51325300684902
helterskelter, Edy with the pushcar with baby Boardman in it and Cissy	 88.01378984331295
holding Tommy and Jacky by the hand so they wouldn’t fall running.	 111.43674870964665
—Come on, Gerty, Cissy called. It’s the bazaar fireworks.	 150.62136734956965
But Gerty was adamant. She had no intention of being at their beck and	 61.39800311535869
call. If they could run like rossies she could sit so she said she	 109.16136490174787
could see from where she was. The eyes that were fastened upon her set	 112.32472799303426
her pulses tingling. She looked at him a moment, meeting his glance,	 55.3086966859164
and a light broke in upon her. Whitehot passion was in that face,	 138.4960208345934
passion silent as the grave, and it had made her his. At last they were	 92.56932615828114
left alone without the others to pry and pass remarks and she knew he	 111.540476068165
could be trusted to the death, steadfast, a sterling man, a man of	 48.106726669652474
inflexible honour to his fingertips. His hands and face were working	 153.70576512700816
and a tremour went over her. She leaned back far to look up where the	 39.96502522881358
fireworks were and she caught her knee in her hands so as not to fall	 122.76241610349835
back looking up and there was no-one to see only him and her when she	 77.3787262854856
revealed all her graceful beautifully shaped legs like that, supply	 83.98932052375096
soft and delicately rounded, and she seemed to hear the panting of his	 38.77702540524117
heart, his hoarse breathing, because she knew too about the passion of	 162.91512758734942
men like that, hotblooded, because Bertha Supple told her once in dead	 52.06003494935881
secret and made her swear she’d never about the gentleman lodger that	 113.70481209525423
was staying with them out of the Congested Districts Board that had	 30.50813607826243
pictures cut out of papers of those skirtdancers and highkickers and	 47.53097014373288
she said he used to do something not very nice that you could imagine	 54.48065646764005
sometimes in the bed. But this was altogether different from a thing	 101.05869676961812
like that because there was all the difference because she could almost	 46.28101912091607
feel him draw her face to his and the first quick hot touch of his	 112.44292911473578
handsome lips. Besides there was absolution so long as you didn’t do	 58.05964533057426
the other thing before being married and there ought to be women	 57.690394421718686
priests that would understand without your telling out and Cissy	 236.45673568995736
Caffrey too sometimes had that dreamy kind of dreamy look in her eyes	 127.45818683916619
so that she too, my dear, and Winny Rippingham so mad about actors’	 84.90632958959596
photographs and besides it was on account of that other thing coming on	 31.00953944337109
the way it did.	 79.37042897265901
And Jacky Caffrey shouted to look, there was another and she leaned	 38.1325952371554
back and the garters were blue to match on account of the transparent	 86.36580710700687
and they all saw it and they all shouted to look, look, there it was	 57.432083959137984
and she leaned back ever so far to see the fireworks and something	 49.97290777310736
queer was flying through the air, a soft thing, to and fro, dark. And	 93.01683794825051
she saw a long Roman candle going up over the trees, up, up, and, in	 106.12002315409482
the tense hush, they were all breathless with excitement as it went	 57.82359307606989
higher and higher and she had to lean back more and more to look up	 115.37143447723967
after it, high, high, almost out of sight, and her face was suffused	 88.13105214291934
with a divine, an entrancing blush from straining back and he could see	 43.02244051305332
her other things too, nainsook knickers, the fabric that caresses the	 36.96790387267092
skin, better than those other pettiwidth, the green, four and eleven,	 129.83615322882304
on account of being white and she let him and she saw that he saw and	 67.7462292257938
then it went so high it went out of sight a moment and she was	 74.26869326054195
trembling in every limb from being bent so far back that he had a full	 141.52350988630175
view high up above her knee where no-one ever not even on the swing or	 84.15732079850505
wading and she wasn’t ashamed and he wasn’t either to look in that	 59.2186590361609
immodest way like that because he couldn’t resist the sight of the	 45.46757982757595
wondrous revealment half offered like those skirtdancers behaving so	 177.09232658898839
immodest before gentlemen looking and he kept on looking, looking. She	 156.99577991530623
would fain have cried to him chokingly, held out her snowy slender arms	 136.36409053245114
to him to come, to feel his lips laid on her white brow, the cry of a	 55.139176568801346
young girl’s love, a little strangled cry, wrung from her, that cry	 112.3715278989036
that has rung through the ages. And then a rocket sprang and bang shot	 99.46203283773606
blind blank and O! then the Roman candle burst and it was like a sigh	 69.54295517232293
of O! and everyone cried O! O! in raptures and it gushed out of it a	 72.6901236622677
stream of rain gold hair threads and they shed and ah! they were all	 91.96871062841538
greeny dewy stars falling with golden, O so lovely, O, soft, sweet,	 136.48593190544702
soft!	 2303.703390164037
Then all melted away dewily in the grey air: all was silent. Ah! She	 84.14879555375555
glanced at him as she bent forward quickly, a pathetic little glance of	 62.90118961554874
piteous protest, of shy reproach under which he coloured like a girl.	 46.226519593668336
He was leaning back against the rock behind. Leopold Bloom (for it is	 64.81710748590541
he) stands silent, with bowed head before those young guileless eyes.	 128.49185842135694
What a brute he had been! At it again? A fair unsullied soul had called	 104.1073996046859
to him and, wretch that he was, how had he answered? An utter cad he	 58.45267015101233
had been! He of all men! But there was an infinite store of mercy in	 56.33989627897701
those eyes, for him too a word of pardon even though he had erred and	 67.23005267335122
sinned and wandered. Should a girl tell? No, a thousand times no. That	 234.2417388191515
was their secret, only theirs, alone in the hiding twilight and there	 66.93539081528462
was none to know or tell save the little bat that flew so softly	 86.161100540847
through the evening to and fro and little bats don’t tell.	 53.67869072072439
Cissy Caffrey whistled, imitating the boys in the football field to	 32.24577376158873
show what a great person she was: and then she cried:	 95.04036613855267
—Gerty! Gerty! We’re going. Come on. We can see from farther up.	 115.02403238140275
Gerty had an idea, one of love’s little ruses. She slipped a hand into	 94.81989839874235
her kerchief pocket and took out the wadding and waved in reply of	 40.81694132746491
course without letting him and then slipped it back. Wonder if he’s too	 61.7493646806215
far to. She rose. Was it goodbye? No. She had to go but they would meet	 114.03145885442859
again, there, and she would dream of that till then, tomorrow, of her	 74.7046475744296
dream of yester eve. She drew herself up to her full height. Their	 93.93322083515997
souls met in a last lingering glance and the eyes that reached her	 127.03686648515614
heart, full of a strange shining, hung enraptured on her sweet	 101.77926127452794
flowerlike face. She half smiled at him wanly, a sweet forgiving smile,	 80.10851426530337
a smile that verged on tears, and then they parted.	 69.57826868207293
Slowly, without looking back she went down the uneven strand to Cissy,	 84.53801466465059
to Edy to Jacky and Tommy Caffrey, to little baby Boardman. It was	 83.59344043320787
darker now and there were stones and bits of wood on the strand and	 73.55430688953659
slippy seaweed. She walked with a certain quiet dignity characteristic	 77.39186174729781
of her but with care and very slowly because—because Gerty MacDowell	 97.72120597160233
was...	 258.81000459233076
Tight boots? No. She’s lame! O!	 325.3479183864919
Mr Bloom watched her as she limped away. Poor girl! That’s why she’s	 53.602389710520846
left on the shelf and the others did a sprint. Thought something was	 75.13047685356072
wrong by the cut of her jib. Jilted beauty. A defect is ten times worse	 102.35757525841933
in a woman. But makes them polite. Glad I didn’t know it when she was	 51.99848832499902
on show. Hot little devil all the same. I wouldn’t mind. Curiosity like	 105.67490825682881
a nun or a negress or a girl with glasses. That squinty one is	 60.517495198130845
delicate. Near her monthlies, I expect, makes them feel ticklish. I	 107.32997951875574
have such a bad headache today. Where did I put the letter? Yes, all	 71.90604181944624
right. All kinds of crazy longings. Licking pennies. Girl in Tranquilla	 59.43332293889214
convent that nun told me liked to smell rock oil. Virgins go mad in the	 69.15918982997245
end I suppose. Sister? How many women in Dublin have it today? Martha,	 101.75946718108013
she. Something in the air. That’s the moon. But then why don’t all	 83.25328406997572
women menstruate at the same time with the same moon, I mean? Depends	 45.849416010229284
on the time they were born I suppose. Or all start scratch then get out	 56.13549286113975
of step. Sometimes Molly and Milly together. Anyhow I got the best of	 156.7096146023234
that. Damned glad I didn’t do it in the bath this morning over her	 50.367978720855945
silly I will punish you letter. Made up for that tramdriver this	 77.86955989027692
morning. That gouger M’Coy stopping me to say nothing. And his wife	 86.57983354620866
engagement in the country valise, voice like a pickaxe. Thankful for	 33.09697902679277
small mercies. Cheap too. Yours for the asking. Because they want it	 144.75748543442992
themselves. Their natural craving. Shoals of them every evening poured	 111.18051483700657
out of offices. Reserve better. Don’t want it they throw it at you.	 81.16904908849996
Catch em alive, O. Pity they can’t see themselves. A dream of	 67.18283708240727
wellfilled hose. Where was that? Ah, yes. Mutoscope pictures in Capel	 140.17317870131427
street: for men only. Peeping Tom. Willy’s hat and what the girls did	 181.1913801552902
with it. Do they snapshot those girls or is it all a fake? _Lingerie_	 55.68231506641282
does it. Felt for the curves inside her _déshabillé._ Excites them also	 55.724091314457986
when they’re. I’m all clean come and dirty me. And they like dressing	 156.98487210829427
one another for the sacrifice. Milly delighted with Molly’s new blouse.	 117.33082673780167
At first. Put them all on to take them all off. Molly. Why I bought her	 127.58142809918552
the violet garters. Us too: the tie he wore, his lovely socks and	 186.19682529072588
turnedup trousers. He wore a pair of gaiters the night that first we	 68.61299196910998
met. His lovely shirt was shining beneath his what? of jet. Say a woman	 285.33757062069475
loses a charm with every pin she takes out. Pinned together. O, Mairy	 103.23731086011088
lost the pin of her. Dressed up to the nines for somebody. Fashion part	 66.78727503711646
of their charm. Just changes when you’re on the track of the secret.	 45.837578660578075
Except the east: Mary, Martha: now as then. No reasonable offer	 245.8352022179607
refused. She wasn’t in a hurry either. Always off to a fellow when they	 59.08153523619899
are. They never forget an appointment. Out on spec probably. They	 101.30167887655553
believe in chance because like themselves. And the others inclined to	 109.1944101095218
give her an odd dig. Girl friends at school, arms round each other’s	 197.70094129070253
necks or with ten fingers locked, kissing and whispering secrets about	 119.24694568309488
nothing in the convent garden. Nuns with whitewashed faces, cool coifs	 35.65523488482657
and their rosaries going up and down, vindictive too for what they	 89.11169985630488
can’t get. Barbed wire. Be sure now and write to me. And I’ll write to	 99.13377057773751
you. Now won’t you? Molly and Josie Powell. Till Mr Right comes along,	 111.86126008235294
then meet once in a blue moon. _Tableau!_ O, look who it is for the	 108.97306595375758
love of God! How are you at all? What have you been doing with	 84.84557589567085
yourself? Kiss and delighted to, kiss, to see you. Picking holes in	 101.0374178060355
each other’s appearance. You’re looking splendid. Sister souls. Showing	 314.38437036242027
their teeth at one another. How many have you left? Wouldn’t lend each	 108.02582814172793
other a pinch of salt.	 75.57543864244924
Ah!	 892.5304701208863
Devils they are when that’s coming on them. Dark devilish appearance.	 100.91052087303628
Molly often told me feel things a ton weight. Scratch the sole of my	 74.16502865045676
foot. O that way! O, that’s exquisite! Feel it myself too. Good to rest	 92.54903925709488
once in a way. Wonder if it’s bad to go with them then. Safe in one	 84.9481170420477
way. Turns milk, makes fiddlestrings snap. Something about withering	 251.07916191232835
plants I read in a garden. Besides they say if the flower withers she	 70.66849743889559
wears she’s a flirt. All are. Daresay she felt I. When you feel like	 120.66914284451603
that you often meet what you feel. Liked me or what? Dress they look	 119.57599567343279
at. Always know a fellow courting: collars and cuffs. Well cocks and	 56.067584162640344
lions do the same and stags. Same time might prefer a tie undone or	 88.68226219746657
something. Trousers? Suppose I when I was? No. Gently does it. Dislike	 201.6399461617891
rough and tumble. Kiss in the dark and never tell. Saw something in me.	 112.87588296679925
Wonder what. Sooner have me as I am than some poet chap with	 132.5162015123543
bearsgrease plastery hair, lovelock over his dexter optic. To aid	 26.576803601436715
gentleman in literary. Ought to attend to my appearance my age. Didn’t	 117.30433820785305

Took off her hat to show her hair. Wide brim. Bought to hide her face,	 77.80725643346305
meeting someone might know her, bend down or carry a bunch of flowers	 116.86991168857647
to smell. Hair strong in rut. Ten bob I got for Molly’s combings when	 105.04769277780161

money. Why not? All a prejudice. She’s worth ten, fifteen, more, a	 186.8948297460499
pound. What? I think so. All that for nothing. Bold hand: Mrs Marion.	 136.4566501192246

another. Weighs on his mind. Funny my watch stopped at half past four.	 84.95257277180808
Dust. Shark liver oil they use to clean. Could do it myself. Save. Was	 278.7744554891774
that just when he, she?	 161.27138765803724
O, he did. Into her. She did. Done.	 137.14578877658144
Ah!	 892.5304701208863
Mr Bloom with careful hand recomposed his wet shirt. O Lord, that	 54.15860184558765
little limping devil. Begins to feel cold and clammy. Aftereffect not	 106.84212314069373
pleasant. Still you have to get rid of it someway. They don’t care.	 64.1654001240618

off there behind the wall coming out of Dignam’s. Cider that was.	 52.63957795448922

Parrots. Press the button and the bird will squeak. Wish she hadn’t	 152.90840174411588
called me sir. O, her mouth in the dark! And you a married man with a	 64.5082963448599
single girl! That’s what they enjoy. Taking a man from another woman.	 105.43358216197215
Or even hear of it. Different with me. Glad to get away from other	 109.21643079121523
chap’s wife. Eating off his cold plate. Chap in the Burton today	 148.90788011655337
spitting back gumchewed gristle. French letter still in my pocketbook.	 85.04362153189834
Cause of half the trouble. But might happen sometime, I don’t think.	 197.96937764802993
Come in, all is prepared. I dreamt. What? Worst is beginning. How they	 90.6019470756575
change the venue when it’s not what they like. Ask you do you like	 65.60798238745603
mushrooms because she once knew a gentleman who. Or ask you what	 102.27868081160925
someone was going to say when he changed his mind and stopped. Yet if I	 66.69017978333257
went the whole hog, say: I want to, something like that. Because I did.	 74.43608952846242
She too. Offend her. Then make it up. Pretend to want something	 106.72596210085747
awfully, then cry off for her sake. Flatters them. She must have been	 79.20024391367444
thinking of someone else all the time. What harm? Must since she came	 119.04354753003055
to the use of reason, he, he and he. First kiss does the trick. The	 110.30030049364336
propitious moment. Something inside them goes pop. Mushy like, tell by	 271.89271809686426
their eye, on the sly. First thoughts are best. Remember that till	 179.9732945499966
their dying day. Molly, lieutenant Mulvey that kissed her under the	 180.43472932891507
Moorish wall beside the gardens. Fifteen she told me. But her breasts	 122.80574639788072
were developed. Fell asleep then. After Glencree dinner that was when	 200.94069388860248
we drove home. Featherbed mountain. Gnashing her teeth in sleep. Lord	 183.70179578043115
mayor had his eye on her too. Val Dillon. Apoplectic.	 139.92926303422936
There she is with them down there for the fireworks. My fireworks. Up	 95.72639226845533
like a rocket, down like a stick. And the children, twins they must be,	 64.64819578705088
waiting for something to happen. Want to be grownups. Dressing in	 58.94260494637795
mother’s clothes. Time enough, understand all the ways of the world.	 75.43011306559458
And the dark one with the mop head and the nigger mouth. I knew she	 52.90739277184041
could whistle. Mouth made for that. Like Molly. Why that highclass	 285.40959721091065
whore in Jammet’s wore her veil only to her nose. Would you mind,	 167.31494758897483
please, telling me the right time? I’ll tell you the right time up a	 47.538023802938994
dark lane. Say prunes and prisms forty times every morning, cure for	 113.13407142203921
fat lips. Caressing the little boy too. Onlookers see most of the game.	 159.718239543386
Of course they understand birds, animals, babies. In their line.	 68.56679173157929
Didn’t look back when she was going down the strand. Wouldn’t give that	 65.1825404690517
satisfaction. Those girls, those girls, those lovely seaside girls.	 14.063227351093373
Fine eyes she had, clear. It’s the white of the eye brings that out not	 94.82575723187175
so much the pupil. Did she know what I? Course. Like a cat sitting	 92.93422112425377
beyond a dog’s jump. Women never meet one like that Wilkins in the high	 62.625901986585596
school drawing a picture of Venus with all his belongings on show. Call	 111.14887508925862

Never see them sit on a bench marked _Wet Paint_. Eyes all over them.	 90.12047525534473
Look under the bed for what’s not there. Longing to get the fright of	 64.54119032176948
their lives. Sharp as needles they are. When I said to Molly the man at	 83.19070539412559
the corner of Cuffe street was goodlooking, thought she might like,	 91.70638043345753
twigged at once he had a false arm. Had, too. Where do they get that?	 64.84199181953531
Typist going up Roger Greene’s stairs two at a time to show her	 111.34995838772366
understandings. Handed down from father to, mother to daughter, I mean.	 135.36906341764018
Bred in the bone. Milly for example drying her handkerchief on the	 31.07141094959268
mirror to save the ironing. Best place for an ad to catch a woman’s eye	 96.90011001574294
on a mirror. And when I sent her for Molly’s Paisley shawl to	 60.26495414536325

parcels too. Attract men, small thing like that. Holding up her hand,	 127.35836677841402
shaking it, to let the blood flow back when it was red. Who did you	 136.15252066693012
learn that from? Nobody. Something the nurse taught me. O, don’t they	 137.20494473846563
know! Three years old she was in front of Molly’s dressingtable, just	 78.63939996471174
before we left Lombard street west. Me have a nice pace. Mullingar. Who	 34.32075399978388
knows? Ways of the world. Young student. Straight on her pins anyway	 57.04646934436503
not like the other. Still she was game. Lord, I am wet. Devil you are.	 85.59387717114258

flew here, flew there. Far out over the sands the coming surf crept,	 82.7706972812241
grey. Howth settled for slumber, tired of long days, of yumyum	 87.54845155225425
rhododendrons (he was old) and felt gladly the night breeze lift,	 110.67315280650742
ruffle his fell of ferns. He lay but opened a red eye unsleeping, deep	 104.2038676719815
and slowly breathing, slumberous but awake. And far on Kish bank the	 82.06851830781294
anchored lightship twinkled, winked at Mr Bloom.	 17.49145009455963
Life those chaps out there must have, stuck in the same spot. Irish	 76.95912503728181
Lights board. Penance for their sins. Coastguards too. Rocket and	 99.48234395145228
breeches buoy and lifeboat. Day we went out for the pleasure cruise in	 70.17212950327043
the Erin’s King, throwing them the sack of old papers. Bears in the	 30.238401001907185
zoo. Filthy trip. Drunkards out to shake up their livers. Puking	 20.228642482873507
overboard to feed the herrings. Nausea. And the women, fear of God in	 51.284462892683145
their faces. Milly, no sign of funk. Her blue scarf loose, laughing.	 69.68439882823965
Don’t know what death is at that age. And then their stomachs clean.	 102.56294103979636
But being lost they fear. When we hid behind the tree at Crumlin. I	 118.99807408579379
didn’t want to. Mamma! Mamma! Babes in the wood. Frightening them with	 48.06211916250178
masks too. Throwing them up in the air to catch them. I’ll murder you.	 41.80703178347731
Is it only half fun? Or children playing battle. Whole earnest. How can	 144.24882846382275
people aim guns at each other. Sometimes they go off. Poor kids! Only	 65.88115158346052
troubles wildfire and nettlerash. Calomel purge I got her for that.	 37.840780585021356
After getting better asleep with Molly. Very same teeth she has. What	 232.65339623391068
do they love? Another themselves? But the morning she chased her with	 92.39175717501543
the umbrella. Perhaps so as not to hurt. I felt her pulse. Ticking.	 85.87558573934278
Little hand it was: now big. Dearest Papli. All that the hand says when	 133.06672016088854
you touch. Loved to count my waistcoat buttons. Her first stays I	 88.53238308885626
remember. Made me laugh to see. Little paps to begin with. Left one is	 202.1265298861904
more sensitive, I think. Mine too. Nearer the heart? Padding themselves	 139.74625140241983
out if fat is in fashion. Her growing pains at night, calling, wakening	 207.32225161837408
me. Frightened she was when her nature came on her first. Poor child!	 119.07028273204806
Strange moment for the mother too. Brings back her girlhood. Gibraltar.	 197.47894630750233
Looking from Buena Vista. O’Hara’s tower. The seabirds screaming. Old	 66.10547784599767
Barbary ape that gobbled all his family. Sundown, gunfire for the men	 62.43781668779871
to cross the lines. Looking out over the sea she told me. Evening like	 106.96915815026655
this, but clear, no clouds. I always thought I’d marry a lord or a rich	 114.39533243065773
gentleman coming with a private yacht. _Buenas noches, señorita. El	 36.93139485064778
hombre ama la muchacha hermosa_. Why me? Because you were so foreign	 47.846858733744504
from the others.	 85.85004015129027
Better not stick here all night like a limpet. This weather makes you	 74.05119569691175
dull. Must be getting on for nine by the light. Go home. Too late for	 126.4615861366175
_Leah, Lily of Killarney._ No. Might be still up. Call to the hospital	 88.93799958312538
to see. Hope she’s over. Long day I’ve had. Martha, the bath, funeral,	 163.984822173559
house of Keyes, museum with those goddesses, Dedalus’ song. Then that	 179.24090371602952
bawler in Barney Kiernan’s. Got my own back there. Drunken ranters what	 53.035818741817096
I said about his God made him wince. Mistake to hit back. Or? No. Ought	 179.40167196969998
to go home and laugh at themselves. Always want to be swilling in	 56.95882076104292
company. Afraid to be alone like a child of two. Suppose he hit me.	 79.94783337149612
Look at it other way round. Not so bad then. Perhaps not to hurt he	 71.88833691787731
meant. Three cheers for Israel. Three cheers for the sister-in-law he	 51.079111845169386
hawked about, three fangs in her mouth. Same style of beauty.	 67.6304101474374
Particularly nice old party for a cup of tea. The sister of the wife of	 49.32372497842627
the wild man of Borneo has just come to town. Imagine that in the early	 66.25610845904542
morning at close range. Everyone to his taste as Morris said when he	 173.55408155188468
kissed the cow. But Dignam’s put the boots on it. Houses of mourning so	 164.9762598936331
depressing because you never know. Anyhow she wants the money. Must	 77.77583353379686
call to those Scottish Widows as I promised. Strange name. Takes it for	 66.94421519348933
granted we’re going to pop off first. That widow on Monday was it	 60.35878661008046
outside Cramer’s that looked at me. Buried the poor husband but	 82.3426585773959
progressing favourably on the premium. Her widow’s mite. Well? What do	 19.925184376743736
you expect her to do? Must wheedle her way along. Widower I hate to	 83.8787804306311
see. Looks so forlorn. Poor man O’Connor wife and five children	 226.4959877124067
poisoned by mussels here. The sewage. Hopeless. Some good matronly	 151.46216885791347
woman in a porkpie hat to mother him. Take him in tow, platter face and	 64.91175304508023
a large apron. Ladies’ grey flannelette bloomers, three shillings a	 69.78199311120437
pair, astonishing bargain. Plain and loved, loved for ever, they say.	 302.77785554729536
Ugly: no woman thinks she is. Love, lie and be handsome for tomorrow we	 106.86481462425665
die. See him sometimes walking about trying to find out who played the	 115.84043213383306
trick. U. p: up. Fate that is. He, not me. Also a shop often noticed.	 106.19807349660012
Curse seems to dog it. Dreamt last night? Wait. Something confused. She	 117.16971308149475
had red slippers on. Turkish. Wore the breeches. Suppose she does?	 102.67521388871283
Would I like her in pyjamas? Damned hard to answer. Nannetti’s gone.	 164.54464352491874
Mailboat. Near Holyhead by now. Must nail that ad of Keyes’s. Work	 119.0254102247816
Hynes and Crawford. Petticoats for Molly. She has something to put in	 123.46781056465427
them. What’s that? Might be money.	 61.983425625771126
Mr Bloom stooped and turned over a piece of paper on the strand. He	 42.11622529968225
brought it near his eyes and peered. Letter? No. Can’t read. Better go.	 150.58231438823526
Better. I’m tired to move. Page of an old copybook. All those holes and	 70.29338378880446
pebbles. Who could count them? Never know what you find. Bottle with	 113.77266773560713
story of a treasure in it, thrown from a wreck. Parcels post. Children	 100.29498457232167
always want to throw things in the sea. Trust? Bread cast on the	 95.5205772359201
waters. What’s this? Bit of stick.	 285.11892763641333
O! Exhausted that female has me. Not so young now. Will she come here	 111.30616997686116
tomorrow? Wait for her somewhere for ever. Must come back. Murderers	 189.9636058872249
do. Will I?	 216.74669475226736
Mr Bloom with his stick gently vexed the thick sand at his foot. Write	 75.75181850889793
a message for her. Might remain. What?	 97.18437521399247
I.	 90.43075128797952
Some flatfoot tramp on it in the morning. Useless. Washed away. Tide	 87.42707118112627
comes here. Saw a pool near her foot. Bend, see my face there, dark	 119.62315260734665
mirror, breathe on it, stirs. All these rocks with lines and scars and	 72.93954175252075
letters. O, those transparent! Besides they don’t know. What is the	 63.55993081906644
meaning of that other world. I called you naughty boy because I do not	 37.68011014484525
like.	 487.1887436877667
AM. A.	 220.3442773799874
No room. Let it go.	 217.29490143477886
Mr Bloom effaced the letters with his slow boot. Hopeless thing sand.	 53.087908065579356
Nothing grows in it. All fades. No fear of big vessels coming up here.	 71.45663833514662
Except Guinness’s barges. Round the Kish in eighty days. Done half by	 191.24811272854987
design.	 19113.524753552
He flung his wooden pen away. The stick fell in silted sand, stuck. Now	 76.1827946291489
if you were trying to do that for a week on end you couldn’t. Chance.	 50.28897697194699
We’ll never meet again. But it was lovely. Goodbye, dear. Thanks. Made	 100.09301062153317
me feel so young.	 152.92832997549587
Short snooze now if I had. Must be near nine. Liverpool boat long gone.	 96.2744135343921
Not even the smoke. And she can do the other. Did too. And Belfast. I	 132.41034224223662
won’t go. Race there, race back to Ennis. Let him. Just close my eyes a	 93.70414382718552
moment. Won’t sleep, though. Half dream. It never comes the same. Bat	 201.23478468716584
again. No harm in him. Just a few.	 117.18487069309002

Hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa! Hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa! Hoopsa boyaboy hoopsa!	 64.39649857115685
Universally that person’s acumen is esteemed very little perceptive	 27.33033857122002
concerning whatsoever matters are being held as most profitably by	 69.0544425103533
mortals with sapience endowed to be studied who is ignorant of that	 26.96394766476494
which the most in doctrine erudite and certainly by reason of that in	 76.19054962240429
them high mind’s ornament deserving of veneration constantly maintain	 12.72849601971067
when by general consent they affirm that other circumstances being	 98.80817301899671
equal by no exterior splendour is the prosperity of a nation more	 62.05881650306106
efficaciously asserted than by the measure of how far forward may have	 61.37523581695479
progressed the tribute of its solicitude for that proliferent	 30.138753934291998
continuance which of evils the original if it be absent when	 90.8523057470494
fortunately present constitutes the certain sign of omnipollent	 46.07603430869379
nature’s incorrupted benefaction. For who is there who anything of some	 149.49841601648058
significance has apprehended but is conscious that that exterior	 70.87114651800833
splendour may be the surface of a downwardtending lutulent reality or	 12.7076424563862
on the contrary anyone so is there unilluminated as not to perceive	 106.1498521501588
that as no nature’s boon can contend against the bounty of increase so	 107.45662582688465
it behoves every most just citizen to become the exhortator and	 97.27878571883556
admonisher of his semblables and to tremble lest what had in the past	 34.31394612035427
been by the nation excellently commenced might be in the future not	 95.15109592903221
with similar excellence accomplished if an inverecund habit shall have	 68.78451535316401
gradually traduced the honourable by ancestors transmitted customs to	 18.907518404267943
that thither of profundity that that one was audacious excessively who	 41.69495209189106
would have the hardihood to rise affirming that no more odious offence	 53.730508014763224
can for anyone be than to oblivious neglect to consign that evangel	 88.15676976678793
simultaneously command and promise which on all mortals with prophecy	 31.832404724309995
of abundance or with diminution’s menace that exalted of reiteratedly	 20.600760787241477
procreating function ever irrevocably enjoined?	 20.158373633081712
It is not why therefore we shall wonder if, as the best historians	 72.77731172476818
relate, among the Celts, who nothing that was not in its nature	 62.44529900473835
admirable admired, the art of medicine shall have been highly honoured.	 40.43680237107804
Not to speak of hostels, leperyards, sweating chambers, plaguegraves,	 11.864227084563534
their greatest doctors, the O’Shiels, the O’Hickeys, the O’Lees, have	 40.507140679964095
sedulously set down the divers methods by which the sick and the	 46.23648251976111
relapsed found again health whether the malady had been the trembling	 96.43262263987411
withering or loose boyconnell flux. Certainly in every public work	 69.15392899824265
which in it anything of gravity contains preparation should be with	 65.97552109221985
importance commensurate and therefore a plan was by them adopted	 39.070720899960804
(whether by having preconsidered or as the maturation of experience it	 78.58611283627783
is difficult in being said which the discrepant opinions of subsequent	 36.437518019266854
